post_content: Big day in Nuremberg. üè≠We just laid the foundation stone for a major expansion of our Siemens Energy transformer factory ‚Äì a ‚Ç¨220 million investment that will create 350 new jobs and boost production capacity by 50%.The demand for large-scale transformers is surging globally ‚Äì and for good reason. These aren‚Äôt just heavy pieces of engineering. They quietly keep our energy systems running: by adjusting voltage levels, they allow electricity to travel efficiently across long distances, stabilize grids and support the resilience of increasingly flexible energy systems.A great example of how Germany stays competitive ‚Äì when business and politics take joint responsibility. ü§ù Thank you to Dr. Markus S√∂der and the Bayern.de | Bayerische Staatsregierung for backing this expansion and for joining us on site.

It is with extreme sadness that I must report that this young, enthusiastic colleague lost his life in a road accident. India‚Äôs road conditions are as deadly as any pandemic. It‚Äôs time to save precious lives by pushing agencies to prioritize safety rather than speed in our neighbourhoods.

Tungsten is one of the toughest materials on Earth. It‚Äôs denser than lead, resistant to extreme heat, and nearly impossible to bend or break. That makes it ideal for radiotherapy, where precision is critical. But shaping it into something as delicate as a treatment component? That‚Äôs no small feat.At our Kemnath site in Germany, our team developed a fully automated process to do just that‚Äîtransforming raw tungsten into ultra-thin, movable ‚Äúleafs‚Äù that help steer radiation beams directly at tumors while protecting healthy tissue. These leafs are a core part of Varian radiotherapy systems. Each one is only millimeters thick, but the precision they enable can make a life-saving difference.Since launching the new production line, output has tripled‚Äîwith no compromise in quality. Every component gets a digital fingerprint that tracks when and how it was made, down to the smallest detail. That kind of traceability ensures consistency, safety, and faster repairs when needed.It took smart engineering, close collaboration across disciplines, and a clear focus on what matters most: improving care for a world without fear of cancer.

Your most important AI tool? Without it, you don't stand a chance!From my point of view, curiosity is the most important tool in the age of Artificial Intelligence. Why?The best technology is of little use if we are not prepared to keep an open mind and constantly want to learn. The real key skill for dealing with AI is our own attitude.That's the reason why I was really looking forward to attending our Talanx AI Campus to have another dive deep into the world of AI. A great format to give free rein to your own curiosity. I know I'm still learning, so it was an inspiring workshop where internal and external speakers opened up new perspectives with exciting insights and best practices.From my perspective, AI is two things at once, most overhyped and underestimated. However, after 30 years in the profession, I see AI as a game changer in our professional life, if it can be scaled. And therefore a challenge for us all.Challenges are opportunities. Something new is a lever for constant further development. Old certainties do not help us when requirements and technologies are constantly changing.Curiosity is the force that changes everything.It is only through our curiosity and willingness to keep learning that we can seize opportunities. This attitude makes the difference - not just for the individual, but for the entire organisation.Thank you Jan Myszkowski & team for the excellent organisation of the AI Campus, which truly adds value to the organisation.What skills do you feel are crucial for the question of how to scale AI successfully?

Bei E.ON bieten wir Arbeitsbedingungen, die zum Leben unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter passen ‚Äì modern, flexibel und familienfreundlich.Darum f√ºhren wir zum 1. Januar 2026 die Familienstartzeit ein: 4 Wochen bezahlte Freistellung f√ºr V√§ter und gleichgestellte Elternteile.Das Besondere: Diese Regelung ist nicht nur ein Benefit, sondern Ausdruck unserer Haltung. Wir stehen f√ºr Mut, Verl√§sslichkeit, Fortschritt. Das gilt f√ºr unsere Kundinnen und Kundinnen genauso wie f√ºr unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter. Mit der Familienstartzeit, mit der wir Gleichstellung, partnerschaftliche Elternschaft und wichtige Lebensphasen unterst√ºtzen, setzen wir ein klares Zeichen.Mein Dank gilt der hervorragenden Zusammenarbeit zwischen E.ON HR Team und Mitbestimmung. Nur gemeinsam k√∂nnen wir solche attraktiven Arbeitsbedingungen m√∂glich machen und auch in der Personalpolitik Playmaker sein.

Telekom, Douze Points!Town Hall meetings are important to me. In this format, I regularly present topics to our 200,000 employees that matter to all of us‚Äîtransparent and open. I explain our strategy, our goals. I answer questions. So far, we‚Äôve streamed from Bonn, in English, with AI-generated translations into eight languages.In yesterday‚Äôs edition, we tried many new things. This time we didn‚Äôt stream from Bonn but from our Czech subsidiary in Prague. I wasn‚Äôt standing on stage alone, but together with our extended Board of Management. Questions were not only possible online, but also via live connections to Warsaw, Skopje, and Zagreb. Suddenly, it no longer felt like a typical Town Hall meeting, but like our very own ESC. The only things missing were the singing - and pyrotechnics shooting up from the floor. Telekom, douze points! üòäWhat I found exciting was seeing how the Board looks at a common goal from very different perspectives: we want to make the impossible possible. Always remain leading.To achieve that, a strong market position is crucial. And customer satisfaction must be the top priority. That we create synergies wherever possible. That modern AI tools are deployed across all areas. And that the people who make all this possible remain at the center.Thank you to Rodrigo Diehl, Dominique Leroy, Christian Illek, Abdu Mudesir, Birgit Bohle, Thorsten Langheim, Dr. Ferri Abolhassan, and Jose Perdomo Lorenzo for our teamwork. Thank you to Claudia Nemat, who after 14 years with Telekom was part of a Town Hall for the last time yesterday. And a special thanks to Melinda Szab√≥ for the warm hospitality.Na shledanou!

Telekom, Douze Points!Town Hall Meetings sind mir wichtig. In diesem Format stelle ich unseren 200.000 Mitarbeitenden regelm√§√üig Themen vor, die uns alle bewegen, transparent und offen. Ich erkl√§re unsere Strategie, unsere Ziele. Ich beantworte Fragen. Bisher von Bonn aus, auf Englisch, mit KI-erstellten √úbersetzungen in acht Sprachen. Bei der gestrigen Ausgabe haben wir viel Neues probiert. Wir haben nicht aus Bonn gestreamt, sondern aus der tschechischen Niederlassung in Prag. Ich stand nicht alleine auf der B√ºhne, sondern mit unserem erweiterten Vorstand. Fragen waren nicht nur online m√∂glich, sondern auch per Liveschalte nach Warschau, Skopje und Zagreb. Und pl√∂tzlich f√ºhlte es sich nicht mehr an wie ein typisches Town Hall Meeting, sondern wie unser eigener ESC. Es fehlte nur der Gesang. Und Pyrofont√§nen, die aus dem Boden schie√üen. Telekom, Douze Points! üòäSpannend fand ich, mit welch unterschiedlichen Blickwinkeln der Vorstand auf ein gemeinsames Ziel schaut: Wir wollen das Unm√∂gliche m√∂glich machen. Immer leading bleiben. Daf√ºr ist eine starke Marktposition entscheidend. Und dass Kundenzufriedenheit die h√∂chste Priorit√§t hat. Dass wir Synergien schaffen, wo immer es m√∂glich ist. Dass moderne KI-Tools in allen Bereichen zum Einsatz kommen. Und dass die Menschen, die all das m√∂glich machen, im Mittelpunkt stehen. Danke an Rodrigo Diehl, Dominique Leroy, Christian Illek, Abdu Mudesir, Birgit Bohle, Thorsten Langheim, Dr. Ferri Abolhassan und Jose Perdomo Lorenzo f√ºr unsere Teamarbeit. Danke an Claudia Nemat, die gestern nach 14 Telekom-Jahren zum letzten Mal Teil des Town Halls war. Und ein besonderer Dank an Melinda Szab√≥ f√ºr die herzliche Gastfreundschaft. Na shledanou!

Today marks a significant step forward in SAP's commitment to digital sovereignty as we expand our Sovereign Cloud portfolio with the launch of SAP Sovereign Cloud On-Site.SAP Sovereign Cloud On-Site offers SAP-operated infrastructure‚ÄØwithin a customer-owned or customer-selected data center. It can provide complete sovereignty while consistently maintaining SAP‚Äôs support and compliance standards, which is crucial for sectors such as education and public administration. As we see the demand grow for digital sovereignty from enterprises across all industries, SAP is ensuring our customers have the ultimate levels of security and control with the ability to access cloud-based innovations like AI. With today‚Äôs announcement, we reaffirm our commitment to help businesses in all industries run safely, securely, and on their own terms. https://lnkd.in/exfHgPZ9

Yesterday, we hosted the Munich Security Conference‚Äôs ‚ÄúZeitenwende on Tour‚Äù at our Siemens Energy factory in Berlin Huttenstrasse to discuss what it takes to build a resilient energy system in Germany. Energy resilience is not a slogan ‚Äì it‚Äôs how societies stay open for business even under attack. It‚Äôs a topic I‚Äôll explore here on LinkedIn in more detail over the coming weeks through a mini-series on what energy resilience requires. Stay tuned!The discussion in Berlin highlighted how many different factors determine the resilience of energy infrastructure. From supply chains and the protection of critical infrastructure to a deeper integration of the European energy market, there are many elements to tackle. Recognizing these dependencies is the first step toward defining effective mitigations.Thank you to Wolfgang Ischinger, Katherina Reiche, Kerstin Andreae, Markus Krebber, Michael Lewis, Karina Moessbauer and all our guests for joining us on the Berlin factory floor. Special thanks also to Ambassador Oleksii Makeiev for sharing insights from Ukraine.

A strong and competitive Hashtag#industry is the foundation of Europe‚Äôs prosperity and autonomy. But how do we secure this future when high energy prices, fragile supply chains and global uncertainties threaten our competitiveness? A key part of the solution: we need to accelerate the Hashtag#hydrogen economy with joint forces. In my keynote at the Hashtag#HySummitRheinRuhr 2025 in Duisburg, I showed why hydrogen is no luxury ‚Äì it is the backbone of industrial Hashtag#transformation. It enables heavy industry to decarbonize, renewable energy to be stored and transported, and Europe to reduce dependencies. Without hydrogen, there will be no clean and resilient energy system in Europe.  That means we need decisive action now:‚ñ∂Ô∏è Faster Hashtag#infrastructure build-up across Europe: Pipelines, import terminals, and ammonia crackers must move from planning to reality ‚Äì within years, not decades.‚ñ∂Ô∏è Competitive Hashtag#prices and volumes: Only through joint European demand, functioning markets, and clear frameworks will hydrogen become affordable. We must also strengthen production across Northern and Southern Europe ‚Äì from Scandinavian wind to Iberian sun ‚Äì to reduce dependencies and secure resilience.‚ñ∂Ô∏è Pragmatism in Hashtag#transition: CO‚ÇÇ-low hydrogen and gas must serve as bridging solutions until sufficient green capacity is available. At thyssenkrupp, we are both driver and enabler of this transformation. We understand ourselves as part of a strong European network that builds resilience through collaboration, innovation, and strategic alliances ‚Äì and we are ready to move forward together.‚ñ∂Ô∏è The Hashtag#directreduction plant at thyssenkrupp Steel in Duisburg will be one of the largest hydrogen consumers in Europe.‚ñ∂Ô∏è With thyssenkrupp rothe erde, we deliver large bearings for Hashtag#windturbines that generate the renewable power needed for hydrogen production.‚ñ∂Ô∏è With thyssenkrupp nucera, we deliver world-scale Hashtag#electrolyzers ‚Äì over 600 projects, more than 10 GW installed capacity.‚ñ∂Ô∏è With thyssenkrupp Uhde, we are shaping the future of global hydrogen transport through Hashtag#ammonia and cracker technologies. The summit has once again shown how important such platforms are ‚Äì they create momentum by bringing politics and industry together. My thanks go to Hy.Region.Rhein.Ruhr e.V. for fostering this dialogue and action. My takeaway from the insightful exchanges: If we act now, hydrogen will safeguard jobs, prosperity, and Europe‚Äôs technological leadership. But this transformation will only succeed if politics, business, and society pull together ‚Äì to meet the challenges and seize the opportunities of a Hashtag#climateneutral and competitive future. Let‚Äôs turn the key ‚Äì and make hydrogen the backbone of a resilient Hashtag#Europe.üì∏: Bernd Thissen

I never planned on a career in insurance. A chance encounter over 30 years ago with someone who inspired me changed that path. And I‚Äôm glad it did. A job in insurance is a dream job! Insurers help people and businesses in the moment of truth. Insurers provide innovation and growth. And hardly any two jobs are alike. Our job profiles are very diverse. We are home to over 100 professions, like risk engineers, lawyers, actuaries, sales professionals, psychologists, IT specialists, doctors, etc.As different as we may be, our purpose unites us all:üëâWe help people secure their homes, protect their health, retire without fear, help in case of an accident or the death of a loved one. üëâWe strengthen communities by speeding up recovery after crises.üëâWe empower businesses to innovate, grow, and take bold risks. In Germany alone, insurers are the largest institutional investors, with ‚Ç¨1.9 trillion in capital. As technology, climate, and global dynamics reshape our world, our role as stabilisers and enablers will matter more than ever, making us the backbone of our economy and society.Working in insurance isn‚Äôt ‚Äújust a job.‚Äù It‚Äôs purpose. At Talanx our purpose is ‚Äútogether we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship‚Äù. We are proud to be there for our customers as a partner in the moment of truth, to offer not only security but a future. What are your thoughts on this subject?

Bringing this next generation on board is essential ‚Äì which is why we‚Äôre focusing on training that fits how Gen Z and Gen Alpha learn: hands-on practice, early responsibility and flexible, modern pathways.To everyone starting today ‚Äì whether at Siemens Energy or elsewhere ‚Äì I wish you a great first day. ùó†ùòÜ ùó∂ùó∫ùóΩùóøùó≤ùòÄùòÄùó∂ùóºùóª ùóºùó≥ ùóºùòÇùóø ùòÄùó∂ùòÅùó≤ ùó∂ùóª ùó¶ùòÑùóºùóøùó±ùòÄ? It‚Äôs as sharp in engineering and pioneering as the name suggests. Visiting this remarkable campus in Ireland, one can immediately feel how the Atellica portfolio has become a success story because of the resourcefulness and skill of our hashtag#TeamHealthineers at this site. They are the hands and minds behind our flagship diagnostics instruments ‚Äì the Atellica Solutions and the CI analyzer ‚Äì that labs of all sizes across the world rely on each day. From manufacturing these systems to developing the Certified Atellica program that extends product life and reduces carbon footprint, our colleagues here are innovating with the simple goal: help lab professionals do less manual work so they can focus more on patient care.The R&D Center of Excellence is focused on unlocking engineering innovations in laboratory instruments used to detect infectious diseases, cancer, and neurodegenerative disorders. We‚Äôre grateful to have earned the support of this project from the Irish government through IDA Ireland ‚Äì and I was honored to express that appreciation directly to Michael Lohan, CEO of IDA. We also talked about opportunities to grow our capabilities, our pipeline of highly qualified talent, and our broader impact in the community.To Manus Rogan, Pat Grimes, Jeremy Padmos, and everyone at Swords: thank you for your time and great hospitality. It was exciting to see your work in action and how you‚Äôre shaping the future of diagnostics!---Sorcha Poole, Mark B., Kevin Cullivan, Niall Kinahan, Akshayaa Vaidyanathan, Simon Gormley

Das politische Berlin braucht einen Herbst der Einigkeit!Die Sommermonate haben gezeigt: Unsere Wirtschaft steht vor sp√ºrbaren Herausforderungen. Schw√§chere Produktion, steigende Insolvenzen, ged√§mpfte Erwartungen. Gleichzeitig er√∂ffnet der ‚ÄûHerbst der Reformen‚Äú eine Chance: Verl√§sslichkeit sichtbar machen ‚Äì nicht durch gro√üe Worte, sondern durch nachvollziehbare Fortschritte.Drei Hebel schaffen schnell Wirkung:üëâ Infrastruktur: Wirkung vor Symbolik ‚Äì Mittel dorthin lenken, wo Br√ºcken, Schienen und Netze Produktivit√§t heben. Projekte mit klaren Meilensteinen und digitalem Controlling umsetzen.üëâ B√ºrokratie: Genehmigungen vereinfachen und Verfahren digitalisieren. Zust√§ndigkeiten entflechten und Prozesse praxistauglich machen.üëâ Energie: Planbare Energiekosten und Netzausbau schaffen Kalkulationssicherheit. So entsteht Investitionsmut statt Standortwanderung.Deshalb w√ºnsche ich mir vor allem eins: Ergebnisse. Wer st√§ndig neue Gro√übaustellen er√∂ffnet, verliert Fokus und Wirkung. Wichtiger ist, die begonnenen Vorhaben konsequent zum Abschluss zu bringen ‚Äì und zu zeigen, dass unsere Politik handlungsf√§hig ist. Erst wenn zentrale Reformen sp√ºrbar wirken, entsteht neues Vertrauen und Raum f√ºr weitere Schritte.In meinem neuen Blogbeitrag erkl√§re ich, was ich mir von der Bundesregierung erhoffe. Der Link zum Blog ist in den Kommentaren zu finden.
Hier ein paar Impressionen aus meinem diesj√§hrigen Kletterurlaub und ein paar Erkenntnisse, die sich auch auf andere Bereiche √ºbertragen lassen‚Ä¶

Love it, change it, or leave it! I‚Äôve lived by this mantra in my career.The best teams I knew trusted each other and shared common values such as transparency, engagement, and collaboration. Above all, they loved their work. When people love their work, they go the extra mile and grow with their company. But just like in any relationship, love for your work takes effort, too: open communication and mutual commitment.üëâ Employees ‚Äì speak up about what helps you thrive, and which changes you wish for!üëâ Leaders ‚Äì ask, listen, and most importantly, act! If feedback leads to no change, people quit ‚Äì openly or silently.At Talanx Group, we‚Äôve just launched an engagement survey to learn what makes people thrive and what they want to change about their workplace.But surveys are only the start. A true feedback culture is an ongoing journey and essential to our hashtag#PerformanceCulture based on trust and on our values transparency, engagement, and collaboration. Let‚Äôs take this journey seriously! Now, I‚Äôm interested: What are your thoughts on the mantra love it, change it, or leave it? When have you felt most engaged at work? How did you change a situation you didn‚Äôt like?

Energy has always been central to the conversation in the U.S. ‚Äì but right now, it‚Äôs under heightened focus. As a foundation of infrastructure, security, economic strength ‚Äì and increasingly, as the base for powering the AI future.The question we ask ourselves at Siemens Energy is: How can we support that growing demand ‚Äì and help build more of the equipment needed, right here in the U.S.For nearly 140 years, we have been part of America‚Äôs energy expansion. Today, our hashtag#TeamPurple is more than 12,000 strong across 20+ states ‚Äì building reliable energy systems. Our equipment helps generate 25% of the electricity used in the U.S.We‚Äôre investing locally and building where it matters ‚Äì from the Carolinas to California. Just some examples: üìç In Charlotte, we‚Äôre expanding our site to build big power transformers and creating over 600 new jobs. üìç In Tampa, Florida, we‚Äôre expanding our manufacturing of high-performance blades and vanes ‚Äì critical components for efficient gas turbines, and currently in short supply across the U.S. üìç In the Midwest, we‚Äôre helping restart nuclear power plants and are upgrading turbines in Michigan and Illinois ‚Äì enough to power around 900,000 homes. üìç In Texas, our technology is helping to suck CO‚ÇÇ out of the air, and our natural gas-fired power plant adds flexible capacity when it‚Äôs needed most. üìç In Utah, we‚Äôre helping older coal plants switch to gas and stabilize the grid. üìç And in California, our steam turbines help turn the heat from sunlight into electricity.This work takes more than technology. It takes trust, long-term commitment ‚Äì and teams on the ground, working side by side with our customers to expand America‚Äôs energy future. Coast to coast. Step by step.

While many young people begin their journeys through university or apprenticeships, millions of girls are left behind every year. It‚Äôs not because these girls lack ability or ambition. They are simply denied the education necessary, and the education they deserve to reach their full potential. Education is the key that opens the door to opportunity. In T√ºrkiye, Allianz T√ºrkiye has partnered with the Koruncuk Foundation to help make a new girls‚Äô dormitory in Istanbul possible. This 2 million euros initiative will provide a safe, stable home for girls who might otherwise have to leave school; making the building a foundation for brighter futures and inclusion through meaningful action.  According to the United Nations, every dollar invested in a girl‚Äôs education returns an average of 2.40 euros in economic and social value. So the facts are clear. This is the right thing to do and one of the smartest investments we can make. When I visited T√ºrkiye after the 2023 earthquakes, I met students like the brave young people you see in the photo below, who lost so much, yet were determined to keep learning. Their resilience was truly inspiring. In the aftermath, we made a clear promise to stand by T√ºrkiye‚Äôs youth, support their education, and help them rebuild a stronger future. Thank you to everyone at Allianz T√ºrkiye and the Koruncuk Foundation for turning that promise into reality. Let‚Äôs keep pushing for access, inclusion, and opportunity. hashtag#Allianz

Wenig Zeitaufwand ‚Äì viel Freude! Von Umberto Eco kennt man sonst nur den Namen der Rose. Zu Unrecht! Wer ein so intelligentes Buch schreiben kann, der hat noch viel mehr Intelligentes zu sagen. Lesen Sie selbst eine Reihe seiner brillanten Reden in ‚ÄûDer ewige Faschismus‚Äú.‚ÄûThe World for Sale‚Äú der Investigativjournalisten Blas und Farchy ist eine wenig bekannte Geschichte der Commodity Trader und ihrer Rolle in der Entwicklung der Weltwirtschaft √ºber die letzten Jahrzehnte. Herausragend recherchiert und geschrieben!Uwe Timm ‚Äì Die Entdeckung der CurrywurstUmberto Eco ‚Äì Der ewige FaschismusJavier Blas & Jack Farchy ‚Äì The world for sale

Europe must prioritize code over concrete. While the European Union plans to invest ‚Ç¨20 billion in AI gigafactories and data centers, this hardware-focused approach is a misguided solution to the wrong problem. It will be the application of Al that creates demand for massive computing power, data centers, and advanced chips.  This is why instead of subsidizing cloud infrastructure, public investment should flow directly into applied AI and the software solutions that create tangible competitive advantages for European businesses. That is the critical challenge that Europe‚Äôs competitiveness and digital future depend on.  I shared more of my thoughts on this important topic in The Economist. Link below in the comments.

As summer winds down for some of us, perhaps we can enjoy a bit of breathing room to catch up on our reading lists and reflect ‚Äì not just personally, but also on the events and decisions shaping our world. Lately, and against the backdrop of the increasing deterioration of ethical standards and the rule of law in more and more parts of the world, I‚Äôve been drawn to real-life stories that explore how democracies evolve, what leaders do in tough situations, and how societies respond to change. I‚Äôd like to recommend three books* that offer valuable insight into the development of politics, and the ongoing struggles we face today. My greatest growth began with my greatest insecurities!I remember well how I said ‚Äòyes‚Äô to something that wasn‚Äôt the obvious choice: a new city I didn't know well, a company, where I didn‚Äôt know anyone, and a position with a lot of responsibility. I chose risk over safety, left my comfort zone to grow. Looking back, choosing a career at Talanx was the right decision!I recently shared this story at the launch of our International Management Development Programme. Over the next nine months, 18 leaders from 12 countries will participate in the programme to learn leadership skills and collaborate on projects across continents and time zones.My most important message: Your career will be shaped by a few decisive moments. Don't just ask yourself, ‚ÄòWhat is safe?‚Äô. Ask yourself, ‚ÄòWhich path will really take me further ‚Äì even if it scares me right now?‚Äô. Growth begins with leaving your comfort zone!I wish all participants every success for this year's programme ‚Äì I look forward to hearing your ideas and learning about your careers!üí° And to all readers: When was the last time you took the riskier path ‚Äì and how did it influence your development?

‚ÄúRoland, do you ever sleep? I can‚Äôt imagine your schedule"This question pops up surprisingly often in my comments. So, let me share my approach to sleep today üòâFirst things first: I'm a morning person.However, my workload doesn't always allow for that. That's why I would describe myself as a flexible morning person who ensures my body gets enough sleep. This also holds true when I am traveling. I am lucky that I can always sleep anywhere, including power naps on the way from one appointment to another. I kindly communicate my need for a few minutes of silence to any accompanying colleagues during these power naps üòÄMy Sleep Schedule:On a non-travel week, I usually go to bed between 10:00 pm and midnight. My alarm clock ‚Äì I use an app that wakes me up with my favorite songs ‚Äì starts playing (not ringing!) between 5:00 am and 6:00 am.When traveling, I try to adapt to the local time zone on the day of arrival, regardless of how long I‚Äôm staying in that particular time zone. I try to stay awake as long as possible so I get good sleep on the very first night. I avoid napping in between. And I don‚Äôt break my exercise routines while traveling. This helps me stay energized during the day and get good sleep at night.My Sleep Habits:I try to avoid checking my inbox just before I go to bed, because sometimes I cannot avoid letting open items linger in my mind, which prevents me from getting good sleep.All in all, I don‚Äôt aspire to be one of those "I only need 5 hours of sleep"-people. Sleep scientists say that every human needs a minimum of 7 hours of good sleep. Less sleep cannot be made up for with a single long night of sleep. Consistently getting less than 7 hours of sleep can cause health issues and negatively impact your performance and behavior.How do you ensure you get quality sleep, even with a busy schedule? I'd love to hear your approach in the comments! üëá

E.ON integriert mehr EE-Leistung als alle verbleibenden Netzbetreiber in Deutschland zusammen. Um das zu schaffen, investieren wir jedes Jahr Milliarden in Ausbau, Modernisierung und Digitalisierung unserer Verteilnetze. Gerade in den letzten Jahren hat die Summe der Anschlussanfragen massiv zugenommen. Auch meine hier in den vergangenen Wochen geteilten Standortbesuche haben mir gezeigt, wie sehr unsere Regionalversorger von Anschlussbegehren √ºberflutet werden. √úbrigens sowohl von Antr√§gen auf mehr Einspeisung als auch mehr Last ‚Äì je nach Region.Das ist erfreulich, hat mich aber auch nachdenklich gemacht: Leider treiben viele dieser neu zugebauten Erneuerbaren (v.a. Photovoltaik) die Kosten f√ºr alle Kunden in die H√∂he, ohne dass sie die Energiewende aktuell voranbringen. Denn ihnen stehen unverh√§ltnism√§√üig hohe Systemkosten durch die Netzintegration und/oder zu wenig regionale Nachfrage entgegen. Und leider belasten auch viele der Gro√übatterien das Netz zus√§tzlich, anstatt es zu entlasten, weil ihr Standort nach Rendite f√ºr den Investor und nicht nach Nutzen f√ºr das System gew√§hlt wurde. Auch das f√ºhrt letztlich zu mehr Kosten f√ºr alle Kunden.Daher mein Fazit und meine Botschaft an den Gesetzgeber: Wir brauchen die Flexibilit√§t, regional sinnvoll zu priorisieren, statt stumpf eine zuf√§llige Reihenfolge an Projekten abzuarbeiten! Wir m√ºssen bei der Energiewende auch politisch in Flexibilit√§t und Systemdienlichkeit denken und nicht nur in KWh!

Es muss sich was √§ndern ‚Äì und zwar bei uns vor der Haust√ºrManchmal sp√ºrt man es deutlich: Es muss sich was √§ndern. Wir alle sehen, wie schwer es geworden ist, in unserem Land Dinge wirklich zu bewegen. Alles ist eingesponnen in ein Netz aus Regulierung, B√ºrokratie und Gesetzen und einem Pluralismus an Stimmen. Das gibt zwar Sicherheit ‚Äì aber verhindert oft die dringend n√∂tigen Verbesserungen.Umso wichtiger ist es, wenn Menschen den Mut haben, sich einzubringen. Mein Bruder Jan Hoettges tut genau das: Er kandidiert als Oberb√ºrgermeister f√ºr Solingen. Ich finde es gro√üartig, wenn jemand Verantwortung √ºbernimmt und in einem schwierigen Umfeld etwas bewegen will. Kommunen sind das R√ºckgrat unseres Staates. In neun von zehn F√§llen, in denen B√ºrger vom Staat etwas brauchen, ist die Kommune zust√§ndig. Sie registriert Geburten, meldet nach Umz√ºgen um, pr√ºft Antr√§ge beim Hausbau oder zur Hilfe bei der Pflege, ber√§t bei Unternehmensgr√ºndungen und Weiterbildungen.Und trotzdem: Prozesse dauern oft l√§nger, als sie m√ºssten. Viele Kommunen sind noch l√§ngst nicht so digitalisiert, wie sie es sein k√∂nnten. Genau das ist der Punkt, √ºber den wir beide gesprochen haben: unsere Heimat Solingen, digitale Zwillinge ‚Äì und die Frage, wie Kommunen endlich digitaler werden.Vier Hebel k√∂nnen viel ver√§ndern:1. Konsequent digitalisieren. Alles, was digitalisiert werden kann, muss digitalisiert werden. Nicht nur dort, wo der B√ºrger es sieht, sondern durchg√§ngig im Verwaltungsprozess. Das spart Zeit, Arbeit und Geld.2. Standards schaffen. Ein Hund ist ein Hund. Hundesteuer, Ausweis, Ummeldung ‚Äì vieles ist √ºberall gleich. Einheitliche digitale L√∂sungen w√ºrden hier Entwicklungsarbeit sparen, Fehler reduzieren und Wartung vereinfachen.3. Digitale Zwillinge nutzen. Erst Verkehrsfl√ºsse digital simulieren, dann die Stra√üe bauen ‚Äì das vermeidet b√∂se √úberraschungen und spart Ressourcen.4. KI einsetzen. B√ºrger brauchen schnelle, verst√§ndliche Antworten. Chatbots k√∂nnen genau das leisten: 24 Stunden am Tag, sieben Tage die Woche.Glasfaser ist das Fundament. Beim Glasfaserausbau arbeitet die Deutsche Telekom bereits mit Kommunen in der ganzen Republik zusammen ‚Äì von Freiburg bis Flensburg, von Soest bis Solingen. In den allermeisten F√§llen gelingt das partnerschaftlich. Die Unterst√ºtzung der Kommunen ist dabei entscheidend, denn nur so k√∂nnen wir Tempo machen. Mehr als elf Millionen Haushalte k√∂nnen heute schon Gigabit-Geschwindigkeiten buchen.Wenn Kommunen digitaler und mutiger werden, profitieren wir alle ‚Äì B√ºrger, Unternehmen und die Gesellschaft insgesamt. Mein Bruder bringt alles mit, was es f√ºr Ver√§nderung braucht. Ich dr√ºcke ihm die Daumen.Das ganze Gespr√§ch gibt‚Äôs hier zum Nachh√∂ren: https://lnkd.in/eT4MMUKX

Have you ever seen sunglasses that adapt to sunlight? There's fascinating material science behind this everyday innovation - a perfect example of smart chemistry in action. üëâ Plastic photochromic lenses contain light-responsive organic dye molecules that act like tiny switches. Under ultraviolet (UV) light, they change shape ‚Äì a process called photoisomerization ‚Äì so they absorb more visible light and the lens darkens. When the UV exposure fades, the molecules return to their original form and the lens becomes clear again.üëâ Temperature matters: When it‚Äôs warm, the thermal back-reaction that undoes photoisomerization speeds up (Arrhenius behavior) and the plastic is more flexible, so molecules revert sooner ‚Äì lenses don‚Äôt get as dark and clear faster. In the cold, that back-reaction slows and the matrix stiffens, so more molecules stay in the dark form ‚Äì lenses reach a deeper tint and take longer to return to clear.üëâ While photochromic technology was first developed back in the 1960s, modern versions react faster and perform more reliably across different temperatures.This example is what drives my passion for materials science: not just the complexity behind it, but how it quietly improves life's simple pleasures. üôÇ

Warum wir mehr Gipfelgespr√§che und weniger Meetings brauchenAm Wochenende war ich mit Ren√© Obermann wandernd in den deutschen Alpen unterwegs. Wir haben zwei Zweitausender bestiegen. Beeindruckende Gipfel, ja. Aber das Entscheidende war nicht das Ziel; nicht mal der Weg, sondern die Zeit miteinander.Ren√© und ich haben 14 Jahre zusammengearbeitet. Was damals eine berufliche Partnerschaft war, ist heute eine tiefe Freundschaft. Auf den langen Wegen nach oben ‚Äì angeseilt, Schritt f√ºr Schritt ‚Äì haben wir stundenlang philosophiert: √ºber die Welt, √ºber Ver√§nderungen, √ºber das, was richtig und falsch lief und l√§uft - und dar√ºber, wie es weitergehen kann.Besonders spannend: Mitten in der Natur, fern vom Alltag, √ºber KI und Technologie zu sprechen. Dort, wo Algorithmen keine Rolle spielen, aber der Augenblick z√§hlt.Es ist wichtig, sich bewusst R√§ume zu schaffen, in denen man sich neu kalibrieren kann - mit Menschen, die einem Impulse geben und Inspiration schenken.Ich bin dankbar, dass Ren√© meine Arbeit in all den Jahren begleitet hat; kritisch und unterst√ºtzend. Und dass daraus etwas viel Wertvolleres entstanden ist: echte Freundschaft.Vielleicht liegt darin eine Idee f√ºr uns alle: Quality Time suchen. Abseits von Meetings, Terminen und Pr√§sentationen. Zeit, die nicht nur den Kopf frei macht, sondern auch den Blick f√ºr das Wesentliche sch√§rft.Die Gipfel bleiben ‚Äì aber das, was wir auf dem Weg besprechen, tr√§gt uns weiter.

Der Zugang zu geeignetem Personal ist erfolgskritisch, wenn wir den Umbau unserer Energieinfrastruktur schaffen wollen. Die Realit√§t: Gerade im Bereich der Elektronik fehlen schon heute Fachkr√§fte. Nicht nur bei uns im Netzbereich, sondern auch bei unseren Partnerunternehmen ‚Äì und das unabh√§ngig vom Tempo der Energiewende. Der demografische Wandel wirkt wie ein Brandbeschleuniger.Bei unserer saarl√§ndischen Regionalgesellschaft VSE AG habe ich ein tolles Projekt kennengelernt: Gemeinsam mit einem innovativen Start-up-Bildungspartner und Unterst√ºtzung der Agentur f√ºr Arbeit wurde als Pilotprojekt die VSE-Akademie gegr√ºndet. Hier werden Quereinsteigerinnen und Quereinsteiger innerhalb von sechs bis neun Monaten bedarfsgerecht qualifiziert. Mit dem erfolgreichen Abschluss der Ma√ünahme erwerben sie gem√§√ü den Richtlinien des Verbands der Elektrotechnik Elektronik Informationstechnik (VDE) die theoretischen Kenntnisse, um im Anschluss grunds√§tzlich als Arbeitsverantwortlicher eingesetzt werden zu k√∂nnen.Das ist nicht nur ein regionales Projekt ‚Äì sondern ein Test f√ºr den gesamten E.ON-Konzern. Und f√ºr Quereinsteiger er√∂ffnet sich hier die Chance das Transformationsprojekt Energiewende mitzugestalten ‚Äì in einer enorm spannenden Zeit f√ºr unsere Branche.

A week in China marked by high-level meetings, inspiring exchanges, and new opportunities for collaboration has come to an end. I was honored to meet Mr. Yin Li, Secretary of the Beijing Municipal Party Committee, for the first time. Our discussion was encouraging and forward-looking, reflecting our long-term commitment and investment in China. It was also great to reconnect with Dr. Lei Haichao, Minister of the National Health Commission of China, whom I last met in Berlin a year ago. His insights are instrumental in shaping the future of healthcare, and we explored ways to work together on meaningful progress.At the internationally renowned Beijing Fuwai Hospital, known for its excellence in cardiology, I had the pleasure of meeting Prof. Hu Sheng Shou (President) and Prof. Lv Bin (Head of the Imaging Department). Our collaboration already spans cardiac imaging training and the co-development of new MRI techniques, to name a few. Now, we are together advancing on a national project for cardiomyopathy clinical guidelines. Time after time, trips to Hashtag#China are a source of inspiration for me. Siemens Healthineers has developed deeper and deeper collaborations with leading clinical researchers and very innovative local start-ups to advance healthcare in China ‚Äì and globally. More and more, we focus these collaborations on optimizing entire treatment paths for diseases. That was also the spirit of a thought-provoking Customer Exchange in Shanghai, where we explored topics like aneurysm treatment, metabolic imaging, and the nascent field of BCI (brain computer interface) to help handicapped patients. Hearing directly from the experts from multiple hospitals like Fudan University, East Normal China University, and Shandong University was a real privilege. I was also excited to connect with Prof. Wang Jian‚Äôan and the team at Zhejiang University No.2 Hospital in Hangzhou. Their work exemplifies how digital solutions and AI are being pioneered in hospitals through collaborations with both large multi-national companies and local start-ups. It was great to see our local remote cath-lab solutions in action, as well. Prof. Wang is at the forefront of applying the newest technologies in the most challenging clinical scenarios. His national lab for cardiovascular devices offers many examples, including photon-counting CT, which is already benefiting cardiologists daily. Additionally, Prof. Wang is partnering with us on the first clinical application of our pioneering 4D ICE ultrasound catheter for multiple cardiac applications. I left Hangzhou impressed by what we have achieved together, and at the same time, convinced that we are just at the beginning of much more to come. This trip also marked what I hope is the first of many to come: a showcase of our Innovation Center activities with local start-ups. As part of our global innovation network‚Äîalongside hubs in Germany, India, and T√ºrkiye‚Äîthe Center connects experts to co-develop solutions that address both global and local healthcare challenges. Hearing updates on our joint projects in China and the impact they‚Äôre starting to make for providers and patients was very rewarding.Thank you to all my conversation partners for the lively exchanges so far! This was just part one of my visit here, and I look forward to more fruitful discussions in the days ahead.

Was es f√ºr eine funktionierende, bezahlbare Energiewende braucht.Heute ist die neue Bundesregierung 100 Tage im Amt. Es sind viele wichtige Themen adressiert. Positiv ist das klare Bekenntnis zu einer deutlich kostenbewussteren Energiewende, die uns auf dem Weg zur Klimaneutralit√§t h√§lt, und gleichzeitig bezahlbar ist. Denn zus√§tzlich zu Nachhaltigkeit geht es auch um Versorgungssicherheit, Kosteneffizienz und Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit. Dazu passt auch der neue Fokus auf eine bedarfsorientierte Energiesystemplanung und der erkennbare Versuch, mehr Pragmatismus zu wagen und wirklich B√ºrokratie abzubauen.Jetzt kommt es auf die Umsetzung an. Dem geduldigen Papier des Koalitionsvertrages m√ºssen jetzt konsequente Taten folgen:‚û°Ô∏è Es sollte nur gebaut werden, was gebraucht wird: Denn eine reine Ausrichtung an politischen Plan-Zielen treibt die Kosten der Energiewende unn√∂tig in die H√∂he.‚û°Ô∏è Das, was gebaut wird, sollte mit minimalen Systemkosten umgesetzt werden: Zum Beispiel d√ºrfen heute immer noch Erneuerbare wild zugebaut werden, auch dorthin, wo es gar keine Nachfrage gibt und die Netze schon am Limit sind.‚û°Ô∏è Subventionen k√∂nnen massiv gestrichen werden: Das gilt f√ºr viele Erneuerbare-Technologien, die l√§ngst wirtschaftlich sind und f√ºr alle Ma√ünahmen, die die Energiewende teurer machen.‚û°Ô∏è Und wir sollten auf Flexibilit√§t setzen: Denn das spart teuren Infrastruktur- und Kraftwerksausbau und steigert die Versorgungssicherheit.Taten braucht es auch auf der regulatorischen Seite. Denn die Energiewende braucht Milliarden an privatem Kapital. Das geht nur mit einem zukunftsf√§higen, regulatorischen Gesamtsystem. Und als zwingenden Teil davon eine Verzinsung, die den Erwartungen des Kapitalmarktes entspricht. Und genau hier sehen wir aktuell gro√üen Handlungsbedarf f√ºr die kommende Regulierungsperiode:- Bei der Verzinsung von Eigen- und Fremdkapital- Bei den methodischen √Ñnderungen im Effizienz-Benchmark -¬†Bei den Redispatch-Kosten-¬†Und beim InflationsausgleichWenn hier nicht dringend nachgebessert wird, wird es nicht mehr ausreichend privates Kapital geben, um weiter in gleicher Geschwindigkeit in die Energiewende in Deutschland zu investieren. Wir sind weiter optimistisch, dass es eine tragf√§hige L√∂sung geben kann. Denn letztendlich haben alle das gleiche Ziel: Die Energiewende zum Erfolg zu f√ºhren.

How do we restore prosperity and trust in our increasingly polarized society? Alarming statistics about the corrosive effects of partisanship undermine growth and further widen the polarization gap, a vicious cycle that damages the economic wellbeing of our customers and shareholders.Unity is the bridge to prosperity, creating fertile ground for trust and a foundation for economic and societal strength. It overcomes challenges with optimism and creates alliances that bring people together. And what better way to bring people together than through sport? The winners of our inaugural Unity Awards demonstrate the real-world impact of unity in action through sport to foster belonging, inclusion and meaningful change in our own communities: üèÖ In the UK, Anel van der Merwe creates inclusive sport sessions tailored to children with disabilities, establishing one of the few family-centered environments where ability is never a barrier to play.üèÖ In Spain, Rosa Sanchez built football teams for migrant youth, offering not just sport but valuable pathways to social integration, leadership, and trust in a new country.üèÖ In Egypt, Sara Moamen Abdelsamie and the Dreamers team (pictured) uniquely combined trauma-informed coaching with mentorship to help displaced youth heal and rebuild confidence through sport.I'm inspired by how the heroes recognized in our Unity Awards brought communities together by focusing on what unites us. Our winners will receive custom jerseys and monetary support for their club to build upon the powerful initiatives underway to strengthen inclusion and address local social challenges. I invite changemakers everywhere to learn from these stories and build inclusive solutions that bridge divides and solve the problems that matter most. Allianz Hashtag#AllianzUnityAwards Hashtag#PowerOfUnity Hashtag#Allianz

Looking at this picture from my first day of school, I can't help but smile. The oversized backpack, the traditional German "Schult√ºte" in my hands ‚Äì and most importantly, that sparkle of curiosity in my eyes. Every child deserves that sparkle, that excitement about learning.Today, on International Youth Day, this photo reminds me why I'm so passionate about education. That little boy couldn't have imagined becoming a CEO, but someone believed in his potential. This is what every young person needs: someone who believes in them.As Max Roser powerfully puts it: "Talent is everywhere, opportunity is not." When I look at today's youth, I see unlimited potential waiting to be unleashed. They're not just our future ‚Äì they're our present, bringing fresh perspectives and bold ideas to the table.Let's make sure we keep that sparkle of curiosity alive in every young person's eyes.

What can curiosity achieve? It drives us to take on new challenges and never be satisfied with the status quo.I am delighted by the curiosity and ingenuity of Frederic Jakobs and Sascha Geerke from Hannover Re. Their hashtag#GenAI solution "DocRob" just made it to 2nd place in our company's own GenAI award.Congratulations to the whole team!"DocRob" replaces the current rule-based readout technique of submissions. This enhancement enables extracting information from a wider range of submissions and significantly increases the volume of data they can automatically receive and encode into their systems.What convinced me above all: The solution docks onto existing processes and scales them. It therefore brings immediate added value.Imagine a world in which underwriters have more time for customer benefit and less for routine tasks. With this solution, we are one step closer to that goal!That is true entrepreneurship!A big thank you to all the dedicated team members for their valuable contribution. Let's stay curious together!

Europe regulates ‚Äì while others are already taking off. In the global AI revolution, four things matter: data, computing power, capital, and speed. The U.S. has hit the turbo button, China is stepping on the gas ‚Äì and Europe? Europe presents the world with a 144-page document, charmingly numbered 32024R1689. Since August 2, AI model providers are required to disclose the data used for training ‚Äì as mandated by Articles 53 and 55 of the handy companion document. The so-called AI Act aims to build trust, promote transparency, and steer innovation. But what is well-intentioned risks becoming a brake on innovation in practice.Because the spirit in which this regulation was born is not one of progress, but of caution ‚Äì shaped by mistrust towards technology, market players, and its own ability to lead. The obligation to disclose training data, the categorization into risk classes, the lack of international alignment ‚Äì all of it sends a clear signal: Europe doesn‚Äôt trust its own innovators. Of course, artificial intelligence needs clear guidelines. But they should be driven not by fear, but by curiosity, responsibility, and confidence in our ability to harness this technology for good. If we shape AI in Europe from a defensive position, we risk losing not only speed, but also talent, capital, and international relevance. Deutsche Telekom is, of course, implementing the AI Act ‚Äì with an interdisciplinary team of experts who have ensured security and data protection for years. But the trust we place in technology, responsibility, and progress is something we would also like to see coming from Brussels. Because the future is not born of fear ‚Äì but from a desire to shape it.hashtag#Telekom

Europa reguliert ‚Äì w√§hrend andere bereits durchstarten.In der globalen KI-Revolution z√§hlen vier Dinge: Daten, Rechenleistung, Kapital und Geschwindigkeit. Die USA haben den Turbo gez√ºndet, China dr√ºckt aufs Gaspedal ‚Äì und Europa? Europa reicht der Welt ein 144-seitiges Dokument mit der charmanten Nummer 32024R1689. Seit dem 2. August m√ºssen Anbieter von KI-Modellen offenlegen, mit welchen Daten sie trainieren, so wollen es Artikel 53 und 55 des handlichen Begleitdokuments. Der sogenannte AI Act will Vertrauen schaffen, Transparenz f√∂rdern und Innovation lenken. Doch was gut gemeint ist, droht in der Realit√§t zum Innovationshemmnis zu werden.Denn der Geist, aus dem dieses Regelwerk geboren wurde, ist nicht der des Fortschritts, sondern der Vorsicht ‚Äì gepr√§gt von Misstrauen gegen√ºber Technologie, Marktakteuren und dem eigenen Gestaltungswillen. Die Pflicht zur Offenlegung von Trainingsdaten, die Einordnung in Risikoklassen, die fehlende internationale Verbindlichkeit ‚Äì all das sendet ein klares Signal: Europa traut seinen Innovatoren nicht √ºber den Weg. Nat√ºrlich braucht K√ºnstliche Intelligenz Leitplanken. Aber sie sollten nicht von Angst geleitet sein, sondern von Neugier, Verantwortung und dem Vertrauen in unsere F√§higkeit, diese Technologie zum Guten zu nutzen. Today marks the beginning of a new chapter. With shareholder approval of the TKMS hashtag#spinoff, we‚Äôve reached a key milestone in the transformation of thyssenkrupp ‚Äì and set the stage for a new era for Europe‚Äôs leading naval defense company. TKMS brings together decades of hashtag#shipbuilding expertise and cutting-edge technology: from world-class submarines and surface vessels to integrated systems and advanced naval electronics. With an order backlog of over ‚Ç¨18 billion and a strong international customer base, TKMS is ideally positioned for sustainable growth. As an independent company, it now gains the freedom to drive innovation faster, invest with focus, and act more flexibly in a highly dynamic market environment. This increased agility, combined with improved visibility on the capital market, will help TKMS seize strategic opportunities ‚Äì including future partnerships and consolidation in the European hashtag#defense sector. For hashtag#thyssenkrupp, the spin-off strengthens our clear path forward: transforming into a focused group of independent, accountable businesses with strong market positions and entrepreneurial freedom. And you, our hashtag#shareholders, benefit directly:‚û°Ô∏è A stake in a high-growth, globally relevant defense company & direct participation in the value creation‚û°Ô∏è Greater transparency and value visibility through capital market listing‚û°Ô∏è A stronger, more focused thyssenkrupp portfolio with clear strategic direction My sincere thanks to my colleagues Volkmar Dinstuhl, Ilse Henne, Axel Hamann and Wilfried von Rath, to Siegfried Russwurm as Chairman of the Supervisory Board, and especially to our hashtag#GENERATIONTK whose commitment made this possible. And congratulations to Oliver Burkhard and the 8,300 employees at TKMS ‚Äì the journey starts now.

Enterprise applications have always been about building bridges within and between businesses. But when it comes to change, bridge building is also an essential task for every leader. You need to make sure everyone ‚Äì from your customers and colleagues to your partners and shareholders ‚Äì is excited, committed, and passionate about the future of your company. To move in the same direction, everyone needs to understand the strategy behind that journey.This was something I discussed in more detail as part of a recent conversation with TIME Magazine on¬†leadership, strategy, and the evolving role of technology in business.¬†Link in the comments.

Challenge accepted üí™ How a sporting challenge creates a real sense of togetherness.I recently mentioned here on LinkedIn that I regularly pick up a tennis racket. Our excellent results for the second quarter and for the first half of 2025 set a solid foundation for the remainder of the year. In the first six months, we sustained our growth momentum, and, with an operating profit of 8.6 billion euros and a core shareholders‚Äô net income of 5.5 billion euros, achieved our highest half-yearly profit levels ever. This strong performance demonstrates that we are delivering on the strategic ambitions and financial targets that we shared at our Capital Markets Day. We are progressing from being a world-class product provider to also winning on services that customers value and trust. The problems of our customers are Allianz‚Äôs problems ‚Äì and lessening the financial fears they feel lies at the heart of our purpose as a company. In light of the cost pressures they face, it is our responsibility to offer innovative and attractive solutions at prices people can afford. This means we have to be efficient, respectful of resources, and productive. Keeping our costs down is a critical lever of customer growth, and we must do so while maintaining the highest quality of service, particularly through digital, scalable solutions.  Our recently announced reinsurance joint venture partnership with Jio Financial Services in India and potential partnership in general and life insurance are fantastic examples of how we are looking to drive smart growth not only as an investor, but also as an operator. These partnerships between two trusted financial services brands combine Jio's local market knowledge and digital infrastructure with Allianz's global underwriting expertise, and I am excited that two companies distinguished for customer excellence will join forces to deliver innovative and holistic protection solutions to the people of India. The reinsurance joint venture will launch operations post receipt of statutory and regulatory approvals. Our priority for the months and years ahead is to decisively execute on our strategic ambitions and continue to create value for our customers, partners, and shareholders. hashtag#AllianzFinancialResults hashtag#Allianz

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre investing in our sites and in new colleagues around the world ‚Äì nearly ‚Ç¨2 billion this year.Another important milestone this quarter: We were able to terminate the guarantee facility backed by the German government earlier than expected ‚Äì and as a result, the dividend restriction was lifted. Sustainability can mean starting from scratch‚Äîbut more often, it‚Äôs about analyzing and reimagining what we already have.Take for example, our MRI systems where an upgraded cold head can mean using far less helium or a refurbished scanner can be carefully restored to serve patients for years to come. Another example is our lab diagnostic systems. These workhorses often run nonstop in busy hospital labs and, after years of heavy use, can be rigorously restored with the latest hardware and software to perform like new.These quieter forms of innovation are powerful. Not only do they extend the life of critical technology, they also reduce waste and preserve precious resources. It‚Äôs progress‚Äînot by replacement, but by renewal.Equally inspiring is the craftsmanship behind it: Engineers who design smarter ways to trap and reuse helium. Teams who recalibrate systems with precision and care. Their work isn‚Äôt always seen, but the impact is felt in every scan delivered without delay and in every patient diagnosis made possible.At Siemens Healthineers, we believe sustainability starts with design, but lives in the details. That sometimes, a system‚Äôs ‚Äúend of life‚Äù is really just the start of a better one.

A quarter of the gas turbines running around the world come from Siemens Energy ‚Äì many of them already hydrogen-ready. Developed and built by our teams, and delivered across the globe¬†üåç¬†to power cities, industries, homes.That‚Äôs the kind of impact strong industrial companies from Germany can have. But that strength needs backing. It‚Äôs why we are investing in Germany and creating new jobs here ‚Äì to reinforce Germany as an industrialized economy. For growth. For the future.Germany has what it takes: the people, the tech, the expertise. But too often, we spend more time talking than doing.What is needed now is straightforward: less bureaucracy, faster permits and planning security. Only then will companies be able to tackle today's transformation demands with confidence. And yes, we are willing to work hard to succeed in the global competition.Thank you, Katharina Reiche, for your visit today ‚Äì and for sending a clear signal: if we want to keep Germany strong, we need to reduce bureaucracy and start delivering ‚Äì for example with a clear and decisive power plant strategy.Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy

A significant milestone in the transition to climate-neutral hashtag#industry ‚Äì and we‚Äôre proud to be part of it! Today, thyssenkrupp Polysius celebrates a breakthrough: we are delivering the kiln system for the world‚Äôs first zero-emission hashtag#quicklime plant, developed by SMA Mineral and SaltX Technology in Norway. This plant is based on the Zero Emission Quicklime concept (ZEQL) developed by SaltX Technology. By fully electrifying the traditionally fossil-fueled hashtag#calcination process, it enables the production of quicklime without generating CO‚ÇÇ. With our innovative kiln system and engineering know-how, we‚Äôre making this groundbreaking technology ready for industrial scale. Together with our partners, we‚Äôre showing that sustainability and industrial performance can go hand in hand. This project sets a new benchmark for the hashtag#decarbonization of essential raw materials. We‚Äôre proud to contribute with our hashtag#engineering expertise and technology. Congrats to Christian Myland and our hashtag#GENERATIONTK on this outstanding achievement!

Am Wochenende habe ich wieder eine Analyse der Stiftung Marktwirtschaft studiert, diesmal eine l√§ngst bekannte, aber leider immer noch h√∂chst relevante. hashtag#StiftungMarktwirtschaftBild 1: Immer weniger Menschen zahlen in die Rentenversicherung ein (‚Äûdie Jungen‚Äú); immer mehr Menschen beziehen Rente (‚Äûdie Alten‚Äú).Bild 2: Die Dauer des Rentenbezugs wird immer l√§nger. Bild 3: Der Bundeshaushalt ‚Äì schon jetzt am Limit ‚Äì wird es nicht kompensieren k√∂nnen. Und st√§ndig steigende Beitr√§ge f√ºr die arbeitende Bev√∂lkerung √ºberlasten die Jungen und schw√§chen die Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit in Deutschland weiter. Vor diesem Hintergrund hat die neue Bundesregierung die Diskussion √ºber die Nachhaltigkeit der Rentensysteme zu Recht wiederbelebt. Es w√§re gut, wenn wir die Kraft f√ºr eine ehrliche Auseinandersetzung finden w√ºrden. Und es w√§re noch besser, wenn der Diskussion dann auch endlich eine langfristig tragbare Reform unseres Rentensystems folgen w√ºrde.

What if hashtag#CO‚ÇÇ weren‚Äôt just a problem ‚Äì but part of the solution?At thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies, we are turning that vision into reality. With thyssenkrupp Carbon2Chem¬Æ, we're transforming industrial emissions into valuable raw materials ‚Äì like methanol and ammonia ‚Äì that help power a sustainable future. CO‚ÇÇ becomes the starting point for a circular, climate-friendly hashtag#industry. Two of our impressive technologies are driving this transformation:1Ô∏è‚É£ thyssenkrupp Uhde purifies industrial waste gases with cutting-edge gas cleaning systems, creating the perfect base for further hashtag#chemical use.2Ô∏è‚É£ thyssenkrupp nucera supplies hashtag#greenhydrogen for this process, generated through high-efficiency electrolysis using renewable power ‚Äì an essential driver for sustainable production chains. This isn‚Äôt a distant vision ‚Äì it‚Äôs already happening. Together with strong partners like the Max Planck Society, Fraunhofer UMSICHT, Ruhr University Bochum, and University of Duisburg-Essen, and supported by the Bundesministerium f√ºr Bildung und Forschung, we're delivering real-world impact. And we‚Äôre scaling up: hashtag#Carbon2Chem is paving the way for sustainable fuels in shipping, aviation, and road transport ‚Äì helping shape the future of clean hashtag#mobility. Excited to see how Matthias Kammel and our hashtag#GENERATIONTK will continue driving the hashtag#greentransformation forward!

Covestro‚Äòs Q2 2025 reflects the current market reality: Amid significant headwinds, Group sales reached EUR 3.4 billion and EBITDA stood at EUR 270 million. Yet, we're staying firmly on our strategic course.The unexpected increase in US tariffs has disrupted global supply chains and led to significant market imbalances and a massive global decline in prices. While sale volumes remained largely stable, the decline in average selling prices and currency effects had a significant negative impact. Our response? We're doubling down on operational excellence and strategic initiatives within our control. Because that's what resilience means: staying focused on long-term value creation, even when short to mid-term conditions are tough.

Zwischen dynamischem Ausbau und der Modernisierung bestehender NetzeAls CEO bin ich oft unterwegs und treffe viele Leute innerhalb und au√üerhalb von E.ON. Dabei begegnen mir manchmal Menschen, die mit ihrem Engagement und ihrer Leidenschaft ganz besonders herausstechen. Personen, die echte Playmaker in ihrem Bereich sind, f√ºr Ver√§nderungen und Innovationen einstehen oder die Energiewende vorantreiben.¬†Deshalb m√∂chte ich von nun an gelegentlich meine Plattform hier nutzen, um ihnen Visibilit√§t zu bieten und andere zu motivieren. Anfangen m√∂chte ich heute mit dem ersten Playmaker.Bernd Baumann ist Leiter Planung und Bau Umspannwerke Nord in der Netztechnik und Netzentwicklung bei der Schleswig-Holstein Netz GmbH. Ich habe Bernd vor nicht allzu langer Zeit bei einem Besuch der SH Netz getroffen und war beeindruckt, mit wie viel Energie und Fachwissen er und seine Kollegen mir das Umspannwerk Bad Bramstedt gezeigt haben. Das Umspannwerk ist ein gro√ües Energiewende-Projekt, das Bernd unter anderem verantwortet.Gemeinsam mit seinem Team stellt Bernd sicher, dass unsere Umspannwerke und Schaltstationen im Netzgebiet jederzeit zuverl√§ssig und leistungsf√§hig bleiben. Routine? Nein! Denn wenn Sie wissen, wieviel Erneuerbare in Schleswig-Holstein bereits am Netz sind und vor allem tagt√§glich integriert werden m√ºssen, werden sie ahnen, wie wichtig und anspruchsvoll diese Aufgabe ist. Kollegen wie Bernd Baumann k√∂nnen also nicht mit dem immer gleichen Fahrplan fahren, sie m√ºssen flexibel sein und heute immer schon an morgen (besser noch √ºbermorgen) denken. Leider auch, weil die Ausbaulogik in Deutschland noch immer so ist, dass Erneuerbare zugebaut werden, ohne die bestehende Netzinfrastruktur schon im Vorhinein zu ber√ºcksichtigen.Das Ziel ist auf jeden Fall ganz klar: 30 Gigawatt Anschlussleistung aus Erneuerbaren Energien in Schleswig-Holstein.

Siemens Healthineers has made a strong start to the second half of the year. We had a very good quarter with high revenue growth, another increase in profitability, and strong free cash flow. Our revenue rose by 7.6% on a comparable basis to just under ‚Ç¨5.7 billion. The Imaging and Varian segments, in particular, contributed to this very strong revenue development. Equipment order intake clearly exceeded equipment revenue. The equipment book-to-bill ratio was good, at 1.09.While volatility in the geopolitical environment remains high, our performance shows the value of our healthcare innovations for more and more patients around the world. As a result of the latest geopolitical developments, in particular the agreements on trade tariffs, we narrow the ranges for comparable revenue growth and adjusted basic earnings per share in our outlook for fiscal year 2025. We also raise the midpoints of the ranges, mainly due to our performance year to date.We win as hashtag#TeamHealthineers together with our customers and partners. Jointly ‚Äì and often over years and decades ‚Äì we fight serious illnesses such as heart disease, stroke, cancer, and dementia. Over the past few weeks, I have had the opportunity to meet some of our partners to mark some special occasions. We strengthened our relationships further and are making good progress in the task of taking the fear out of the most threatening diseases: Firstly, by working tirelessly on new technologies and improving existing solutions. Secondly, by making these technologies and solutions accessible to more and more people.Because this is our purpose: pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare ‚Äì for everyone, everywhere, sustainably. Thank you, hashtag#TeamHealthineers, for bringing it to life every day!

Across Europe, we‚Äôre honored to work with some of the most respected and forward-looking hospitals and health systems. Many of these relationships go back decades, having been built on a shared commitment to advancing healthcare not just within national borders, but also on a global scale. With roots in Europe ourselves, we at Siemens Healthineers have appreciated how these close partnerships continue to inspire the breakthroughs we work on every day.That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm delighted to share that we‚Äôve signed a new research agreement with Gruppo San Donato (GSD), a long-standing partner and Italy‚Äôs largest healthcare provider. Our primary goal: to establish advanced imaging technologies, such as photon-counting CT, as an integral part of personalized medicine. Together with GSD‚Äôs Ospedale San Raffaele in Milan, we will develop post-processing software for the automated analysis of photon-counting CT images, with a special focus on lung and cardiovascular imaging. At the same time, we will explore the organizational and economic impacts of introducing such technology within hospital settings.This agreement not only strengthens our relationship and sets the stage for meaningful progress in healthcare delivery ‚Äî it also completes a major milestone. With this signing, we are now partnering with all members of the European University Hospital Alliance (EUHA) on scientific projects. Ospedale San Raffaele represents the final piece of the puzzle, and their trust in us underscores the depth of collaboration we‚Äôve built across the alliance.A big thank you to the GSD and GKSD leaders and their teams who joined us today for this special occasion: President Dr. Kamel Ghribi, Marco Centenari, Attilio Tulimiero, Masroor Haq, Francesco Galli, Prof. francesco maisano, and Prof. Antonio Esposito. Thank you also to Bernd Ohnesorge, Kleber Douvletis, Roberta Busticchi, and our many Hashtag#TeamHealthineers colleagues for making this ongoing collaboration possible.

Longevity is a rapidly growing megatrend with the power to shift perceptions, behaviors, and outcomes. The number of people aged 65 or older is expected to double from 806 million in 2023 to 1.6 billion by 2050. Those extra years should offer more than just time; they should be enjoyed in good health with a strong sense of purpose and productivity. This requires financial security, which is not the product of chance. It requires planning, guidance, and long-term support.According to Allianz research, only 24 percent of people globally understand the true financial impact of a longer life. This knowledge gap jeopardizes long-term well-being, not just for individuals but also for families, communities, and entire economies.At Allianz, we are working to close the longevity literacy gap through‚åõ financial education that empowers people to plan ahead with confidence,‚åõ cross-generational mentoring to share knowledge and build stronger connections, and ‚åõ insurance solutions designed for longer, more active lives.By working together and sharing knowledge across generations and sectors, we can turn longevity into a source of strength, purpose, and opportunity. hashtag#Allianz

Just wrapped up an intensive and inspiring week in the U.S., where I had the opportunity to meet with Hashtag#investors in New York, Chicago, and Boston. Der Staat muss Priorit√§ten setzen! Die wirtschaftliche Zukunft Deutschlands h√§ngt von einer starken, nachhaltigen und bezahlbaren Energieinfrastruktur ab.¬†Das 500 Mrd. Euro Sonderverm√∂gen der Bundesregierung spielt dabei eher nur eine unterst√ºtzende Rolle. F√ºr das Sonderverm√∂gen m√ºssen klare Priorit√§ten gesetzt werden, um den Ausbau effizient und wirkungsvoll voranzutreiben. F√ºr den Ifo Schnelldienst durfte ich einen Gastbeitrag zur Rolle des Sonderverm√∂gens schreiben. Ich m√∂chte hier einige Botschaften aus dem Artikel mit Ihnen teilen: ‚û°Ô∏è Bis 2045 sind in Deutschland √ºber 300 Mrd. Euro f√ºr Stromverteilnetze n√∂tig, europaweit steigen die Investitionen bis 2050 auf j√§hrlich 67 Mrd. Euro. Die Herausforderung liegt im Zusammenspiel von Erzeugung, Verbrauch und Infrastruktur in einem komplexen System. ‚û°Ô∏è E.ON plant bis 2028 Investitionen von 43 Mrd. Euro, mehr als doppelt so viel wie 2021, und verzeichnet steigende Netzanschl√ºsse, was den beschleunigten Ausbau best√§tigt. ‚û°Ô∏è Um die enormen Investitionen in die Stromnetze zu stemmen, brauchen Netzbetreiber vor allem einen Regulierungsrahmen, der Investitionen und Innovationen in die Energieinfrastruktur f√∂rdert und nicht abw√ºrgt. Die Verzinsung der Investitionen muss im internationalen Vergleich wettbewerbsf√§hig sein, sonst flie√üt das Kapital in andere M√§rkte. ‚û°Ô∏è Leider sehen wir momentan das Gegenteil: durch die aktuell im Raum stehenden √Ñnderungen der BNetzA im sogenannten NEST-Prozess drohen Netzbetreibern erhebliche zus√§tzliche Belastungen. Eine Entwicklung, die die entscheidende Rolle der Verteilnetze f√ºr Deutschland schlicht ignoriert. Von den 500 Mrd. Euro Sonderverm√∂gen flie√üen 100 Mrd. an L√§nder, und der Bund plant bis 2029 150 Mrd. Euro auszugeben, mit etwa 10 Mrd. Euro j√§hrlich f√ºr den Klima- und Transformationsfonds, was die Handlungsspielr√§ume einschr√§nkt. ‚û°Ô∏è Staatsgelder allein reichen nicht aus; sie sollen vor allem privates Kapital anziehen, um Innovationen und Ausbau zu f√∂rdern. Die Netzinvestitionen werden durch regulatorische Rahmenbedingungen und B√ºrokratieabbau unterst√ºtzt. Das Sonderverm√∂gen schafft Spielr√§ume, aber der Staat muss zus√§tzlich gezielt Impulse setzen, private Investitionen f√∂rdern und sich auch mal zur√ºckhalten, wenn er nicht gebraucht wird. Den gesamten Artikel k√∂nnen Sie hier lesen: https://lnkd.in/enEDFN8T ifo Institute ‚Äì Leibniz Institute for Economic Research

SAP is proud to be part of hashtag#MadeForGermany, a new initiative launched today¬†with¬†more than¬†60 other companies and investors to boost Germany‚Äôs future as a leading economic¬†and technology¬†hub. To unlock it, we have to focus on three main areas:‚ñ∂Ô∏è We must be careful not to overregulate at the expense of innovation. Wirtschaftsstandort Deutschland: Quo Vadis?Die Antwort kennt heute niemand. Zu einem starkem Wirtschaftsstandort geh√∂rt aber auch immer ein passender Investitionsrahmen ‚Äì gerade auch f√ºr Energieinfrastruktur. Wir brauchen aber eine Regulierung, die Milliarden-Investitionen in die Energiewende erm√∂glicht ‚Äì und nicht abw√ºrgt.Also: Weniger Z√∂gern, mehr Mut, mehr Reformen! Dann klappt es auch mit den Investitionen und dann bleibt Deutschland stark. hashtag#itsonus hashtag#MadeforGermany

Are you already a business virtuoso? Never heard of the term before? Find out why and how you can become one here.In our recent Executive Meeting in Istanbul, where I met up with over 100 of our top executives, keynote speaker Felipe Gomez brought up the term.In Felipe‚Äôs opinion, the concept of a virtuoso can easily be transferred from the world of music to the world of business, as it is all about inspiring people and giving them energy. These three aspects are important if you want to become a business virtuoso:üéØ Discipline Virtuosos work with great discipline and perseverance to reach operational excellence. No pain, no gain.üí¨ Value-based attitude Virtuosos are building bridges to people by having a value-based attitude. It‚Äôs this attitude that amplifies operational excellence. üî• Passion Virtuosos inspire people with their passionate engagement. Passion pushes us to leave our comfort zone, to innovate and to grow courageously but prudently. Felipe also spoke about work-life balance. He doesn't like this term because it implies that if you invest in one more, the other one loses. In reality, the two areas are not opposites, they can complement each other in very fruitful and fulfilling ways. That's why he's a fan of the term work-life harmony.Felipe‚Äôs speech received a lot of approval. Thanks, Felipe, for inspiring us! What‚Äôs your take on this subject?

hashtag#Cement is everywhere: in our homes, our cities, and the infrastructure that connects us. But its production is responsible for around 7% of global CO‚ÇÇ emissions. At thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies, we unite businesses that drive the hashtag#greentransformation with scalable, practical solutions to decarbonize industries. One of them is thyssenkrupp Polysius - our plant engineering expert for the cement sector, and a true pioneer in sustainable innovation.With polysius¬Æ activated clay, we offer cement producers a real breakthrough: a smart, scalable way to reduce the hashtag#CO‚ÇÇ footprint of cementwithout compromising on performance. The principle is simple: up to 50% of the CO‚ÇÇ-intensive hashtag#clinker is replaced by thermally activated clay, which requires far less energy and emits hardly any CO‚ÇÇ during processing.Why is polysius¬Æ activated clay such a game changer for cement producers? The advantages speak for themselves:‚ñ∂Ô∏è Energy savings: Lower temperatures mean reduced resource use.‚ñ∂Ô∏è Cost efficiency:¬†Less clinker and energy mean lower production costs.‚ñ∂Ô∏è Local sourcing: Clay is widely available, often right near the plant.‚ñ∂Ô∏è CO‚ÇÇ reduction: Fewer emissions from both process and materials.‚ñ∂Ô∏è Reliable performance: Same strength and durability as conventional cement.This is how we turn ambition into action in the hashtag#decarbonization of cement and making a tangible contribution to hashtag#sustainableconstruction. A big thank you to Christian Myland and the entire hashtag#GENERATIONTK at thyssenkrupp Polysius for their passion and innovation.¬†Let‚Äôs move from hashtag#grey2green ‚Äì by design, not by chance.

I regularly visit our regional subsidiaries. However, I have actually just been to Makedonski Telekom in Skopje for the first time.It may be a small market on the map, but it is a major player and technologically leading in the region. Makedonski Telekom AD was the first European network operator to fully switch to IP in 2014 and has been a pioneer in introducing mobile communications, fiber optics, and 5G in the national market. Even today, they remain market leaders with the best and largest fiber optic and 5G network. The customer satisfaction index here is the highest in our European network. We have been present in the country for more than two decades, building a strong infrastructure and a digital society. Together with Dominique Leroy, we met with several members of the government. Alongside Prime Minister Hristijan Mickoski, Minister of Digital Transformation Stefan Andonovski, Deputy Prime Minister Aleksandar Nikoloski, and with the German ambassador Petra Drexler present, we formalized a Memorandum of Understanding to advance the country's digital transformation. This encompasses ongoing investments in network infrastructure, the establishment of a high-security data center, enhancement of digital services, and initiatives designed to promote digital inclusion and provide benefits to both customers and society.During a town hall meeting, we discussed our strategy, growth, new tools, and trends in these rapidly changing times with our colleagues on site. A big thank you to our host, Goran Markovic, and his great team for the open discussion and warm hospitality.hashtag#Europe hashtag#connectingyourworld hashtag#infrastructure hashtag#datacenter hashtag#digitalization

Australia is staying the course of its energy transition. The power system here isn‚Äôt just big ‚Äì it‚Äôs one of the most complex in the world, linking remote generation to distant demand across more than 40,000 kilometers of transmission lines. And right now, it is undergoing a transformation as big as the grid itself. For decades, coal has done the heavy lifting. But that era is coming to a close. Most coal plants are set to retire by the mid-2030s ‚Äì and wind, solar, and also gas are stepping in fast to fill the gap. The challenge is not only generating clean energy ‚Äì but getting it where it needs to go. If the grid extension cannot keep up, there will be areas, where the majority of the available wind and solar power could go unused by the end of the decade. Not because the wind isn‚Äôt blowing or sun shining ‚Äì there is plenty of both here ‚Äì but because the grid cannot carry it. I have spent the past week in Sydney and Melbourne, meeting with partners, policymakers, and our own team to discuss how we at Siemens Energy can help strengthen the grid and the generation system reliably.  Thanks to everyone who took the time for forward-looking conversations ‚Äì and to our hashtag#TeamPurple, for making it a great week on the ground. Always inspiring to see the energy behind the energy.

I like playing tennis. And I also like watching the sport. Of course, I found myself once again glued to the Wimbledon broadcasts. For Wimbledon, he had studied his loss, refined his game, stayed mentally strong under pressure, and made the big points. What's more, competing against Carlos Alcaraz really brings out the best in him.Iga ≈öwiƒÖtek faced a weakness for grass courts. But she trained hard and adapted her game. Despite public doubts about her form, she tuned out the noise, and committed herself to growth instead. That‚Äôs mental strength! She didn‚Äôt just win her first Wimbledon title‚Äîshe turned her weakness into her biggest triumph.So, what‚Äôs the lesson for the office?üëâ Adopt a growth mindset. If you don‚Äôt know something yet‚Äîlearn it. Growth comes through reflection, constant learning, and discipline. Hard work pays off.  üëâ Stay mentally strong. Like in tennis, you‚Äôll lose points and face setbacks. What matters is how quickly you get up, learn, and focus on the next moves.What did you learn from Wimbledon? I look forward to your comments!

At Siemens Healthineers, it‚Äôs not always about uncovering the unknown. Often, it‚Äôs about making what we already see more precise‚Äîand more accessible to those who need it most.Take Cinematic Reality, portrayed in one of the background images on my profile. It marks a shift from flat, grayscale slices to vivid 3D visualizations where anatomy takes on depth, texture, and life-like detail. These immersive, interactive holograms are created directly from real patient data and allow clinicians to explore the human body in entirely new ways.They can rotate a heart in virtual space, trace the nervous system, or examine a tumor from every angle. It‚Äôs not just visually stunning; it‚Äôs clinically valuable and offers a lot of potential: Surgeons can plan more precisely. Students can learn more intuitively. Patients can receive care that‚Äôs more personalized, more informed. I find this so inspiring because when we see with greater clarity, we can care with greater confidence.Sometimes the most beautiful breakthroughs aren‚Äôt just what we see, but how we see.

hashtag#Run4Healthineers | It‚Äôs a summer tradition many of us look forward to. Each year, my colleagues in Germany and I enthusiastically lace up our sneakers, print out our race numbers, and get moving for a good cause.I wanted to make sure to join in even though business travels took me to Cleveland, Ohio, on the day of the event.
