Europe¬†stands at a defining moment: We have the chance to transform our industry and take the lead. As we step up to lead, and I'm confident we will, three imperatives stand before us. At yesterday's Hashtag#EUROPE2025 conference, I outlined what these imperatives are:First, Europe must lead the clean-tech revolution. To get there, we need a culture that embraces failure. And "Failing big time" must be allowed ‚Äì in fact, it's essential. Without the courage to fail, we won't achieve the breakthrough innovations our transformation demands.Second, we need a competitive framework that works. Stop micromanaging our industries and start enabling innovation. We need efficient energy systems, market-based solutions, and competitive electricity costs for energy-intensive sectors. The alternative is deindustrialization, and we cannot let that happen.Third, we must focus on what we, as businesses, can control. While external challenges persist, our focus must be our internal transformation. Digitalization and AI aren't buzzwords ‚Äì they're tools to revolutionize R&D, production, and customer engagement. Our people, empowered by the right corporate culture, will drive this change.The path forward is clear. Europe can be the global lighthouse for an innovative and prosperous industry ‚Äì but only if we make bold decisions and act decisively now. Who's in?Hildegard M√ºller Dr. Dominik von Achten Petra Pinzler Studio ZX | ZEIT Verlagsgruppe WirtschaftsWoche Handelsblatt Live Verlag Der Tagesspiegel

Electrification is the key to an affordable energy transition. Because electrons are the most cost efficient energy carriers. But electrification will not proceed with the necessary speed if there are no tangible benefits for consumers. Consumers would of course profit in general from lowering the transition costs by around ‚Ç¨1.5 trillion by 2050 and dropping the system costs when electrification picks up speed as I highlighted here some days ago. But they would as well directly benefit from electrification in their households.Due to higher efficiencies compared to fuel-based vehicles and gas boilers, the usage of electric vehicles and power driven heat pumps substantially reduces total energy bill of a household. In the face of increases in carbon prices over the next years and declines in electricity costs per kilowatt-hour, the price advantage of electrified assets over fossil-based technologies will further increase ‚Äì despite higher upfront investments for now. At the same time, electrification can empower consumers with greater control over their total energy consumption and expenses. Moreover, with potential self-produced solar PV electricity, designated heat pump tariffs, and demand side flexibility, there is significant upside cost saving potential for electrified households. When combined with digital metering systems, end users gain visibility, and to some extent, direct control over their energy consumption and costs.

So, what exactly does Altair do? Why is this acquisition so important? What happens next? I hope you‚Äôll check out the video for answers.  And a warm welcome to the Altair community of customers, partners, and colleagues. I‚Äôm excited about the impact we will create, together.

Thanks Western Sugar Cooperative for your trust in SAP ‚Äì we‚Äôre proud to be on this journey with you!

There‚Äôs one universal skill you can‚Äôt ignore. And it‚Äôs crucial for success. In a recent mentoring conversation with Jan Bluhm from Talanx, we explored the subject of working together in internationally diverse teams. For us, the universal skill for shaping our success is the way we manage different cultural backgrounds and mother tongues.Different languages often mean different ways of thinking. Communication isn‚Äôt just about what‚Äôs said but how it‚Äôs expressed and by whom in which cultural contexts. Jan and I addressed three success factors for teams working in international environments and speaking English, which is rarely everybody‚Äôs mother tongue: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Stay curiousUnderstanding the cultural context of the spoken word is important. Get to know the team members‚Äô culture and ask questions. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Practice active listeningListen actively beyond the words. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Build trustA foundation of trust ensures that differences become strengths, not roadblocks.Diversity takes effort, but when aligned with shared values of trust and a hashtag#PerformanceCulture, it unlocks incredible potential.How do you navigate language and cultural differences in your teams? I look forward to your insights!hashtag#TogetherTalanxhashtag#Diversityhashtag#Culture

Fellow-entrepreneur, friend and mentor, Carl Georg D√ºrschmidt, will soon leave the supervisory board of Nagarro. What a journey it has been! Die Diskussion zur Schuldenbremse war verlogen. Unser Problem war nicht, dass wir zu wenig Geld hatten, sondern dass wir unsere Spielr√§ume nicht f√ºr Investitionen genutzt haben. Die Graphik (Quelle: Die Zeit) ist ein Indikator, was wir stattdessen gemacht haben. Leider schaffen Sozialleistungen keinen nachhaltigen Wohlstand. Nachhaltiger Wohlstand entsteht durch h√∂here Produktivit√§t, Innovation und Wachstum.  Was ist zu tun? Die finanziellen Freir√§ume aus den massiven Schuldenpaketen m√ºssen investiert werden; in Sicherheit, Wachstum und Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit. Sie m√ºssen zus√§tzlich (!) zu den Investitionen sein, die jetzt schon im Haushalt stehen.  Was ist NICHT zu tun? Mit √∂ffentlichem Geld private Investitionen verdr√§ngen. Die Freir√§ume nutzen, um Reformen zu vermeiden. Den Staat noch weiter aufbl√§hen (unser Problem ist auch nicht, dass wir zu wenige Angestellte im √∂ffentlichen Dienst haben). Deutschland kann sich diesen einmaligen Boost erlauben. Nachhaltig aber wird er erst mit einem Wachstum √ºber 2%. Da liegt Friedrich Merz v√∂llig richtig. Und wenn wir den Boost nicht nutzen, um st√§rker zu werden, um zu reformieren, dann haben wir am Ende nur mehr Schulden f√ºr unsere Kinder produziert. Ich hoffe die Verhandlungspartner in Berlin werden auch dieser Verantwortung, eine mutige Reform- und Wachstumsagenda aufzustellen, gerecht. Zumindest einige Positionen, wie die CSU-Idee einer M√ºtterrente oder die SPD-Ideen zur doppelten Haltelinie bei der gesetzlichen Rente lassen mich nach dem, was aus Berlin zu h√∂ren ist, daran zweifeln. Was f√ºr die Verhandler in Berlin gilt, gilt auch f√ºr die Unternehmen der Wirtschaft. Es darf nicht darum gehen, sich jetzt einen m√∂glichst gro√üen Teil des Kuchens aus dem Infrastruktur-Paket zu sichern. Denn Subventionen schaffen genauso wenig Wohlstand wie ausufernde Sozialleistungen. Der Fokus muss auch bei den Unternehmen auf der Verbesserung der eigenen Produktivit√§t, Innovation und Wachstum liegen.

Ein bedeutender Tag f√ºr unseren Standort Hashtag#Dormagen: Hier wird das Schaumstoff-Vorprodukt TDI¬†k√ºnftig noch ein St√ºck nachhaltiger produziert. Dank eines modernen Reaktors, den wir in Betrieb genommen haben. So k√∂nnen wir Abw√§rme aus Produktionsprozessen f√ºr die Dampferzeugung nutzen ‚Äì und damit unsere CO2-Emissionen um bis zu 22.000 Tonnen j√§hrlich senken. Das ist konkrete Transformation, die sich messen l√§sst!Das Beispiel aus Dormagen tr√§gt zu unserem neuen Energie-Effizienz-Ziel bei, das wir heute bekannt gegeben haben: Bis 2030 m√∂chten wir den Energieverbrauch pro Tonne Produkt um 20 Prozent gegen√ºber 2020 senken. In Zahlen bedeutet das eine CO2-Einsparung von bis zu 550.000 Tonnen ‚Äì vergleichbar mit dem j√§hrlichen Aussto√ü einer Stadt von 70.000 Einwohnern. Diese Energie-Effizienz ist ein entscheidender Baustein auf unserem Weg zur klimaneutralen Produktion bis 2035.Besonders freut mich, dass heute auch NRW-Umweltminister Oliver Krischer und Julia Metz, Direktorin von Agora Industry, vor Ort mit meinen Kolleginnen und Kollegen √ºber die Transformation in Deutschland diskutiert haben. The energy industry is facing huge demand for new talents. Last time I highlighted here how we can save ‚Ç¨1.5 trillion costs for the energy transition to strengthen Europe economically and pave the way for its geopolitical emancipation. But beside the transformation costs we can also reduce the yearly costs of our energy system as a major burden for economic performance by 20 percent by 2050. And the key to a more affordable system and thus more affordable energy is large scale electrification.In the scenario of our Energy Playbook, energy system costs are set to increase at first glance. But with a doubling of electricity demand driven by electrification, the system costs would be distributed across a larger energy volume and therefore specific power system costs could decline by 20 percent by 2050. Despite record investments, the transition will not cause costs to rise but in fact system prices per kilowatt-hour of electricity decline as the transition progresses. This demonstrates that the energy transition can indeed deliver affordable prices.At the moment, this is just a scenario ‚Äì for this to happen in reality, electrification really needs to pick up speed, especially in the area of transport and heat!

Erstmal bin ich erleichtert. Der Bundestag hat gr√ºnes Licht f√ºr das historische Hashtag#Finanzpaket gegeben. Mittel und Wege: Das erste w√§re also da, sofern am Freitag auch der Bundesrat zustimmt. Aber auch das zweite? Jetzt gilt es unbedingt daf√ºr zu sorgen, dass die Gelder schnell richtig kanalisiert und wirklich dort effizient eingesetzt werden, wo man sie ganz konkret braucht ‚Äì gr√∂√ütenteils in den Kreisen, St√§dten und Gemeinden. Mit totem Kapital ist niemandem gedient. Something that truly excites me as a chemist: the transformative potential of chemical hashtag#recycling. Here shown using the example of polyurethane foam.To make this complex process more accessible, I engaged in a little experiment and asked hashtag#AI to be my chemistry translator. Here's how it explained the graphic in simple terms:***In the middle, stretched from left to right, you see a typical, yet simplified structure of polyurethanes. It consists of two building blocks:PE: The polyether with alcohol groups at both endsA: The aromatic diisocyanateIn between the building blocks, there are locks. They symbolize the chemical bond between the two building blocks: the urethane bond.The key, in chemical terms the "catalyst," precisely breaks the bond to release the main components: the amine and the polyether with alcohol groups¬†at both ends¬†(PE).After further chemical transformations, you recover the original building blocks: the polyether with alcohol groups at both ends (PE) and the¬†aromatic diisocyanate (A) resulting from the amine.***I‚Äôd say the AI did a pretty good job. What do you think?hashtag#GlobalRecyclingDay

Die Energiewende braucht einen Neustart! Das haben Markus Krebber und ich gestern in einem gemeinsamen Interview in der Frankfurter Allgemeinen Sonntagszeitung deutlich gemacht. In den aktuell laufenden Koalitionsverhandlungen werden die Weichen f√ºr die Zukunft der Energiewende gestellt. RWE und E.ON haben gemeinsam ein energiepolitisches Programm entwickelt, das aus der Perspektive des Gesamtsystems die wichtigsten Ver√§nderungen beschreibt, die die neue Bundesregierung schnell und mutig vornehmen sollte, um die Kosten der Energiewende sp√ºrbar zu senken. Denn nur, wenn wir die Systemkosten in den Griff bekommen, erf√§hrt die Energiewende die notwendige Akzeptanz der Menschen in unserem Land. Folgende Punkte stehen f√ºr uns dabei im Mittelpunkt:‚û°Ô∏è Die Planung des Ausbaus sollte sich am echten Bedarf orientieren und nicht auf politischen Zielmarken basieren, die vor Jahren beschlossen wurden. Wir brauchen realistische Szenarien, z.B. in Bezug auf die unterstellte Stromnachfrage. ‚û°Ô∏è Der Europ√§ische Emissionshandel (EU-ETS) ist das Steuerungsinstrument zur Dekarbonisierung. ‚û°Ô∏è Die einheitliche deutsche Strompreiszone muss erhalten bleiben. Eine Aufspaltung w√ºrde die Liquidit√§t in Markt erheblich beintr√§chtigen.‚û°Ô∏è Wir brauchen einen technologieoffenen, zentralen Kapazit√§tsmarkt bis 2028, der den Zubau von Gaskraftwerken unter Ber√ºcksichtigung von Netzkapazit√§ten anreizt. Und es macht auch keinen Sinn, diese nach acht Jahren unbedingt auf H2 umzustellen. ‚û°Ô∏è Die Erneuerbaren sind reif f√ºr den Markt und sollten in ihn entlassen werden. Der weitere Rollout kann durch Investitionsf√∂rderung angereizt werden. Einige Technologien brauchen gar keine F√∂rderung mehr. Erneuerbaren- und Netzausbau m√ºssen effizienter verschr√§nkt werden und bei der Standortwahl muss die Auslastungssituation der Netze vor Ort ber√ºcksichtigt werden. ‚û°Ô∏è Flexibilit√§t muss belohnt werden. Ein modernes Energiesystem muss Angebot und Nachfrage dynamisch ausgleichen. Der fl√§chendeckende Rollout eines simplen und kosteng√ºnstigen Smart Meters ist daf√ºr Voraussetzung. ‚û°Ô∏è Die europ√§ische Definition f√ºr gr√ºnen Wasserstoff ist zu eng und muss deutlich vereinfacht werden. Zudem braucht es einen pragmatischeren Ansatz f√ºr den Hochlauf von CCS.Der Klimawandel wartet nicht und die Energiewende muss ein Erfolg werden ‚Äì deshalb brauchen wir jetzt den Neustart. So wie wir Reformen √ºberall brauchen, um wieder wettbewerbsf√§hig zu werden und zu wachsen. Hier finden Sie unser gemeinsames Papier: https://lnkd.in/e9gJjbEW

Es war ein Paukenschlag, der Mut macht. Die Reform der Schuldenbremse und ein neues Sonderverm√∂gen sollen den Weg freimachen f√ºr dringend ben√∂tigte Investitionen ‚Äì f√ºr Sicherheit, Infrastruktur und nachhaltiges Wachstum. Das sorgte weltweit f√ºr Aufmerksamkeit: bei Regierungen, Unternehmen und an den Finanzm√§rkten.Zehn Tage sp√§ter liegt die Einigung von Union, SPD und Gr√ºnen auf dem Tisch. Sie bringt Klarheit, sie macht Mut. Es bleibt allerdings die Erkenntnis, dass dies nicht reichen wird, um die Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit Deutschlands zu st√§rken!Die versprochene Zus√§tzlichkeit entpuppt sich als Formelkompromiss. Im Kleingedruckten steht: Die Investitionsquote muss nur noch bei zehn Prozent des Bundeshaushalts liegen ‚Äì das liegt sehr deutlich unter dem Anteil an Investitionen in den letzten Jahren. Das nimmt den Druck, Investitionen aus dem laufenden Haushalt zu t√§tigen ‚Äì und l√§dt dazu ein, stattdessen mit dem Geld Haushaltsl√∂cher zu stopfen oder neue konsumtive Ausgaben zu beschlie√üen. Beides darf nicht passieren, unter anderem auch um die gerade zur√ºckgewonnene Glaubw√ºrdigkeit nicht zu besch√§digen. Was als Fortschritt verkauft wird, kann so am Ende doch zum Verschiebebahnhof werden. Die neue Koalition muss sich eine "Vorfahrt f√ºr Wachstum"-Regel geben: Die Investitionsquote muss mindestens stabil gehalten werden. Zus√§tzliche konsumtive Ausgaben d√ºrfen nur durch zus√§tzliches Wachstum finanziert werden. So k√∂nnen Investitionen in die Zukunft die h√∂here Schuldenlast wieder tilgen.Die schnelle Einigung macht aber auch Mut zu mehr. Denn Deutschland braucht dringend ein neues Betriebssystem, um zukunftsf√§hig zu werden. Daf√ºr habe ich einen 10-Punkte-Plan vorgeschlagen. Ambitionslosigkeit ist kein guter Ratgeber in den laufenden Verhandlungen. Das gilt besonders bei B√ºrokratieabbau und Strukturreformen ‚Äì von wettbewerbsf√§higen Energiepreisen √ºber Rahmenbedingungen f√ºr Startups und Innovationen bis zur Gewinnung von Fachkr√§ften und Beschleunigung von Bauma√ünahmen. L√∂sungsvorschl√§ge liegen auf dem Tisch. Jetzt braucht es Mut zur schnellen und konsequenten Umsetzung. Die kommende Regierung kann jetzt noch die richtigen Weichen stellen. Ich bin sicher: Schnelle Reformen, nachhaltige Investitionen, glaubw√ºrdige F√ºhrung ‚Äì das ist der Weg zur√ºck an die Weltspitze. Dabei kann die neue Koalition auf unsere Unterst√ºtzung z√§hlen.Friedrich Merz Dr. Markus S√∂der CDU Deutschlands Christlich-Soziale Union Lars Klingbeil Saskia Esken B√úNDNIS 90/DIE GR√úNEN

We must take collective action in cyber security. I am truly inspired by the insights shared at the Schwarz Digits Cyber Security Conference¬†yesterday. The core message is clear: cyber security transcends being merely an hashtag#IT issue; it has become a fundamental pillar of business strategy and national security. In our increasingly interconnected world, the robustness of our digital infrastructure will be a decisive factor in our future competitiveness and resilience. What resonated with me most yesterday was the consensus that digital sovereignty necessitates a unified approach. No single entity ‚Äì be it business or government ‚Äì can address these challenges in isolation. It is key that we, as industry leaders, share our expertise and foster collaboration across all sectors of society to collectively stay ahead of emerging threats. Special thanks to Schwarz Digits for facilitating this crucial dialogue. hashtag#CSC25

Fifteen years ago, I had the privilege of being a participant in the Baden-Badener Unternehmer Gespr√§che e.V. (BBUG), preparing for¬†increasingly¬†responsible roles alongside amazing peers from companies across various industries. Today, after more than 10 years as CEO of Siemens Healthineers, I had the honor and pleasure of speaking to those who are now preparing for their own future leadership roles, having been nominated by their companies.I always greatly enjoy moments like these‚Äîthey are enriching, offering fresh perspectives and thought-provoking questions. Plus, simply explaining one‚Äôs own work helps sharpen one‚Äôs own thinking.Of course, there was a lot to share at the beginning: about non-communicable diseases (cancer, cardiovascular disease, stroke, etc.), which we are dedicated to combating; about access to care for 8 billion people; and about the shortage of healthcare professionals among our customers. We also discussed our IPO, the combination with Varian, the central role of AI in our products, the path to groundbreaking innovations like Photon-Counting CT, and our Value Partnerships with leading customers.The discussion that followed was lively and engaging, conducted under Chatham House Rules‚Äîwhich is why I summarize the following seven key takeaways:1Ô∏è‚É£ We should not see healthcare spending as a cost but as an investment in a better life.2Ô∏è‚É£ The healthcare industry is a vital yet often underestimated part of a country's economic value creation.3Ô∏è‚É£ Medical technology is an exciting "dialogue discipline" where progress is only possible through deep mutual understanding between medical professionals and engineers.¬†This is fascinating‚Äîbut also teaches humility.4Ô∏è‚É£ Our IPO allowed us to create a much more focused company, entirely dedicated to our specific customer base, and to reinvent ourselves. I am deeply grateful for that. And only through the IPO the combination with Varian was possible, for example.5Ô∏è‚É£ Progress always moves in two directions: Improving what already exists and creating access where it was previously unaffordable.For example, digitalization initially digitizes what was analog, but "digital first" solutions bypass analog altogether, making things possible for the first time. Many medical breakthroughs follow the same principle.6Ô∏è‚É£ Right now, we talk a lot about managing change in the world. My advice: from time to time, consciously reflect on what¬†does NOT¬†change and what always holds true.7Ô∏è‚É£ And lastly: Take good care of your own health and your relationships.Thank you, Baden-Badener Unternehmer Gespr√§che e.V. (BBUG), for the invitation, and thank you to all the participants for the fantastic discussion! hashtag#BBUG

Die Gespr√§che zwischen den Parteien sind in vollem Gange. In den Sondierungsvereinbarungen stecken Vorschl√§ge, die Deutschland wieder fit machen sollen. Doch was braucht unsere Wirtschaft jetzt wirklich? Meine 2 Cents. üëá Wir m√ºssen jetzt entschlossen handeln ‚Äì auf zwei Ebenen gleichzeitig. Der Sprint (was sofort passieren muss): ‚Ä¢ Energiekosten senken: Netzentgelte auf 2023er-Niveau deckeln ‚Ä¢ Energieintensive Industrie entlasten: bestehende Ausnahmen fortf√ºhren ‚Ä¢ Versorgungssicherheit st√§rken: industrielle Kraft-W√§rme-Kopplungs (KWK) Anlagen als Backup-Kraftwerke nutzen ‚Ä¢ Steuerlast reduzieren: Strom- und Energiesteuer auf europ√§isches Mindestma√ü senken Der Marathon (was strukturell auf lange Sicht n√∂tig ist): ‚Ä¢ Energiewende neu denken: Kosteneffizienz und Technologieoffenheit priorisieren ‚Ä¢ Netzkosten optimieren: Standortentscheidungen f√ºr Erneuerbare an Netzkriterien ausrichten ‚Ä¢ Erneuerbare-Energien-Gesetz (EEG) reformieren: von fixer Einspeiseverg√ºtung zu marktbasierten Mechanismen ‚Ä¢ Erneuerbare st√§rken: Zubau √ºber Differenzvertr√§ge marktnah gestalten ‚Ä¢ Zukunft bauen: Verkehrs- und Digitalinfrastruktur beschleunigen Nur wenn wir Sofortma√ünahmen und Strukturreformen parallel angehen, k√∂nnen¬†wir den industriellen Abw√§rtstrend umkehren.Warum ist das so wichtig? Deutschland braucht eine starke industrielle Basis. Unsere Hashtag#Schl√ºsselindustrien ‚Äì von Chemie √ºber Automobil bis zum Maschinenbau ‚Äì sind das R√ºckgrat unserer Wirtschaft. Sie sichern Arbeitspl√§tze, treiben Innovationen voran und schaffen Wertsch√∂pfung weit √ºber ihre Branchen hinaus. Es geht um nichts weniger als die Zukunft des Wirtschaftsstandorts Deutschland. Packen wir's an!

Europe is facing unprecedented geopolitical and geo-economic challenges, which are putting additional pressure on public budgets. Against this backdrop, speeding up the energy transition and simultaneously flattening the steep investment curve could create further room for maneuver. Our Energy Playbook study shows that over ‚Ç¨1 trillion in energy-related investments can be saved until 2040. So, there is a perspective to realize the energy transition in Europe in an affordable way ‚Äì and meet the climate targets at the same time. Following the suggested measures in our study would accumulate the total energy system cost savings to around ‚Ç¨1.5 trillion by 2050. Business, households and public finances would benefit alike and this would really take pressure off them.With our Energy Playbook, we want to propose an energy transition update for Europe that allows us to achieve net zero 2050 at significant lower cost. An affordable energy transition can strengthen Europe economically and geopolitically and pave the way for successful and sustainable future. It‚Äôs on us. We have the levers in our hand!

Complexity vs. simplicity? In my opinion, a complex mindset never finds easy solutions.As leaders, problem-solvers, and innovators, we often believe that the more sophisticated our thinking, the better our solutions will be. But complexity can become a trap. When we overanalyse, we tend to get lost in detail. In search of a ‚Äúperfect‚Äù solution, we miss what‚Äôs often right in front of us and we lose valuable time. In my opinion, real problem-solving thrives on simplicity. The best solutions aren‚Äôt the most intricate‚Äîthey‚Äôre the clearest and most effective. Simplicity doesn‚Äôt mean being careless or shallow; it‚Äôs about focusing on what truly matters. It‚Äôs about sharpening focus, improving execution, and delivering real results. This applies to communication, too. A clear, focused language drives action, while complexity creates confusion. By the way, we are all customers, and we do like easy intuitive processes and solutions and a clear communication. When has a simple solution or clear communication made all the difference for you? I look forward to your comments.

Today marks a significant milestone in the hashtag#greentransformation of industry: hashtag#Carbon2Chem is entering its third phase, backed by an additional ‚Ç¨50 million in funding from the Bundesministerium f√ºr Bildung und Forschung (BMBF). This investment highlights the project‚Äôs success and its vital role in advancing sustainable industrial processes. Since 2016, Carbon2Chem has demonstrated that CO‚ÇÇ from hashtag#industrial process gases can be converted into valuable chemicals such as methanol, helping to reduce emissions from steel production and other high-emission industries. Now, in phase three, we will focus on the application-based verification of the solutions developed, adapt the process gases used in direct reduction in the steel sector, and conduct a comprehensive study of methanol and hydrogen. At thyssenkrupp, we are committed to driving industrial hashtag#decarbonization through innovative technologies. Our Decarbon Technologies segment plays a crucial role in this transformation, providing cutting-edge solutions in green hydrogen, carbon capture, sustainable chemical processes, and the energy transition. Carbon2Chem is a prime example of how engineering excellence and cross-industry collaboration can accelerate the path to climate neutrality. The unique strength of Carbon2Chem lies in its hashtag#partnerships across politics, science, and industry. Alongside esteemed collaborators, including the Max Planck Institute for Chemical Energy Conversion, Fraunhofer UMSICHT, BASF, EY, FernUniversit√§t in Hagen and the University of Duisburg-Essen, we are proving that industrial decarbonization is not just possible, but achievable at scale. This project serves as a blueprint for rethinking emissions as a resource and transforming the way industries operate ‚Äì and it showcases that hashtag#sustainability and competitiveness are not mutually exclusive but mutually reinforcing. We sincerely thank the BMBF and especially Dr. Karl Eugen Huthmacher for their continued support and funding. Last but not least: a heartfelt thank you to our hashtag#GENERATIONTK whose passion and expertise drive this project forward every day.

Ein neues Betriebssystem f√ºr Deutschland Deutschland braucht den Politikwechsel. Das haben inzwischen fast alle erkannt. Unsere Welt wandelt sich rasant. Im Zeitalter der Digitalisierung k√∂nnte man sagen: sie bekommt ein neues Betriebssystem. Neue Technologien ver√§ndern ganze Industrien. Die globalen Machtverh√§ltnisse verschieben sich, in der Politik und der Wirtschaft. Unsere Gesellschaft altert rasant. Der Klimawandel nimmt zu. Und Deutschland? L√§uft immer noch auf einer veralteten Version ‚Äì und zahlt den Preis daf√ºr. Die B√ºrokratie l√§hmt, die Wirtschaft stagniert, zentrale Industrien schrumpfen. Die Infrastruktur ist marode, und die Energiepreise sind nicht wettbewerbsf√§hig. Jetzt m√ºssen wir doppelt- und dreifach so hart arbeiten, um das Vers√§umte aufzuholen. Wir brauchen ein neues Betriebssystem f√ºr unser Land ‚Äì eines, das auf Wachstum, Technologie und Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit ausgelegt ist. Um das zu erreichen, m√ºssen wir zehn strategische Ziele verfolgen und dann Zug um Zug mit klaren Ma√ünahmen hinterlegen. Details? In meinem heutigen Gastbeitrag in der Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung.

Hi fromüìçTexas!  This week, Siemens is unveiling two state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities for electrical products in both Fort Worth, Texas, and Pomona, California. The $285 million investment is expected to create over 900 skilled manufacturing jobs ‚Äì and I had the honor to give the opening speech in Fort Worth.  The equipment produced there will support critical sectors such as the commercial, industrial and construction markets while powering AI data centers all over the country. With that Siemens is more than doubling its production capacity of electric equipment to power critical American infrastructure.  The U.S. is already the largest market for Siemens. This is why Siemens has invested over $90 billion in the country in the last 20 years. This year‚Äôs investment will boost this number to over $100 billion¬†with the planned acquisition of Altair Engineering. So, we are bringing more jobs, more technology and a boost to America‚Äôs AI capabilities.  All of this would not have been possible without the amazing people who work for us - thank you, hashtag#TeamSiemens!

How to save 1.5 trillion Euro on our way to net zero? The annual investments for the European energy transition need to more than double by 2030 to 6.6 trillion Euro. At the same time investments in the rearmament of the continent are urgently needed and will require another enormous amount of capital. In this context, it is essential that we drive the energy transition in Europe as efficiently as possible. Yesterday, we launched our Energy Playbook, a model study which shall help EU decision makers to save investments in the energy transition without giving up our climate targets.The study shows: ¬†Europe can become climate-neutral by 2050 whilst at the same time making significant cost savings of up to 1.5 trillion Euros.   To get there Europe should‚û°Ô∏è prioritize decarbonization strategies and start earlier with cheaper strategies in terms of CO2 reduction costs.‚û°Ô∏è focus on Electrification as the most cost-effective way to reduce emissions.‚û°Ô∏è synchronise the expansion of grids and renewables to reduce avoidable costs.‚û°Ô∏è ¬†foster digitalization and flexibilization of new energy to save customers‚Äô money.‚û°Ô∏è drive integration of Energy Union to make the energy system more efficient. Europe can be more than the sum of its parts. To put it together ‚Äì it‚Äôs on Europe! Find here our Energy Playbook: www.eon.com/energyplaybook

What is true leadership in uncertain times? In my last post, I asked this question, and your responses were inspiring. I often observe that in uncertain times leaders tend to revert to a ‚Äòcommand and control‚Äô leadership style. But, for most of you control isn‚Äôt the solution to address the challenges of a VUCA world. How we create trust is the solution. You also gave some great insights on how a true leader earns trust:üîπ Leading by example‚Äîactions over authority and control.üîπ Being transparent, honest, and fair.üîπ Listening, learning, and empowering people to grow.üîπ Fostering innovation by letting go of control.üîπ Taking ownership, especially in challenging times.üîπ Staying human‚Äîadmitting and learning from mistakes.üîπ Putting people first and believing in their potential.Thanks to Jasmin Glehn, Sonia Quickfall, Denise Barreto, Jan Myszkowski, Sel√ßuk Altuner, Judith McCartney, MaLM, Jonathan Romley üá∫üá¶, Mauricio Giuntini for sharing your insights.At Talanx Group culture is strategy. We strive to create a culture based on trust and by living our values hashtag#transparency, hashtag#engagement and hashtag#collaboration. This drives our success. I would love to hear your stories and experiences on leadership. Let‚Äôs keep the conversation going! üëá

Technology for All, Innovations, and AI at MWCThree days full of innovations and insights into the future of mobile hashtag#technology are behind us. The Mobile World Congress (MWC) is far more than a mobile communications exhibition ‚Äì it is the "showcase of the digital economy," as the press aptly describes it. Under the motto "Shaping Technology for All," we at Deutsche Telekom focused on AI technologies this year. We are particularly proud of our AI Phone, which attracted a lot of attention with Perplexity's digital assistant. Other exhibits at our stand included a drone as a flying mobile antenna, successfully used at the "Jizersk√° 50" ski race in the Czech Republic to provide coverage in hard-to-reach areas, and our AI honeypots, which mislead hackers and help us better understand their tactics. Of course, a visit to the 4YFN area ‚Äì the meeting place for start-ups whose solutions could be ubiquitous in four years ‚Äì was a must. There, we also visited our second stand with start-ups from hubraum. I was particularly impressed by the startup Matterway, which automates decision-making processes and is already in use at our DTSE. In the investor area, four start-ups pitched exclusively for us. Particularly exciting for me was terralayr, energy storage as a service. This is a solution that could help us at Telekom to manage our energy consumption more intelligently. The hashtag#MWC was once again a great opportunity to exchange ideas with colleagues, partners, and innovative minds. The largest telco fair is like a class reunion. You constantly run into someone you know. üòâ It is also important for shaping the future of mobile communicaitons technology. This includes the opportunity to once again highlight the necessity of making hashtag#Europe competitive again. hashtag#MWC25 hashtag#Innovation hashtag#AI hashtag#Startups hashtag#FutureTech

Dazu geh√∂rt auch die M√∂glichkeit erneut auf die Notwendigkeit hinzuweisen, hashtag#Europa wieder wettbewerbsf√§hig zu machen. hashtag#MWC25 hashtag#Innovation hashtag#KI hashtag#Startups hashtag#FutureTech hashtag#Technologie

In diesem alten R√∂hrenmonitor spiegeln sich meine ersten Schritte als Chemiker wider. Die Ger√§te waren damals klobig, das Hochfahren dauerte eine gef√ºhlte Ewigkeit. Heute schmunzle ich √ºber die alte Technik, aber sie erinnert mich daran, dass Entwicklung Zeit braucht ‚Äì bei Innovationen wie bei Menschen.An diesem Schreibtisch, zwischen Lehrb√ºchern, handgeschriebenen Notizen und dem flimmernden Bildschirm, habe ich mich auf meine Diplompr√ºfung vorbereitet. Eine wichtige Lektion aus dieser Zeit: Fortschritt verl√§uft nicht immer reibungslos. Mal dauert es, mal stockt es. Aber wer dranbleibt, findet neue Wege. Und manchmal entsteht genau daraus die gr√∂√üte Innovation.Eins gilt damals wie heute: Dranbleiben!

1.5 years ago, we at thyssenkrupp laid the foundation for our Decarbon Technologies segment, uniting four independent business units under one strategic vision. Last week, our team came together to reflect on our journey, celebrate our successes, and discuss how to navigate the challenges ahead. One thing is clear: we are making progress. Through strategic partnerships, such as our collaboration with the TITAN Group, pioneering projects like hashtag#greenhydrogen and hashtag#methanol, and the decarbonization of industrial plants, we are establishing Decarbonization Technologies as a key player in the market. We are proving that hashtag#decarbonization is not just a vision but a business model with real impact. At the same time, the market is evolving more slowly than expected. Customers hesitate, projects are delayed, and uncertainty affects decision-making. But standing still is not an option. We need to be agile, drive performance, and accelerate the hashtag#transformation. That means ensuring our business units are ready for the future - by adapting business models, optimizing execution, and delivering strong results today to secure success tomorrow. I would like to thank Juan Verde for his inspiring keynote on the global shift towards hashtag#sustainability. A big thank you to my colleagues Carolin Nadilo, Michael H√∂llermann, Winfried Schulte, Nadja H√•kansson, and Christian Myland for their valuable insights. And, of course, my deepest gratitude goes to the entire hashtag#GENERATIONTK: your dedication and energy are what drive this transformation forward. If there is one message I want to leave you with, it is this: We are all part of this journey. The hashtag#greentransformation is like a ship navigating through turbulent waters. We will only reach our destination if we all work together. Let‚Äôs not stop here - let‚Äôs turn this momentum into real impact. Together, we will reach new shores.

ùó¶ùó≤ùòÉùó≤ùóª ùó•ùó≤ùó≥ùóºùóøùó∫ùòÄ ùòÅùóº ùó¶ùó≤ùó∞ùòÇùóøùó≤ ùóòùòÇùóøùóºùóΩùó≤'ùòÄ ùóóùó∂ùó¥ùó∂ùòÅùóÆùóπ ùóôùòÇùòÅùòÇùóøùó≤The European telco industry is at a turning point that affects its competitiveness in the global market. I discussed this at Hashtag#MWC with Christel Heydemann from Orange, Margherita Della Valle from Vodafone, and Marc Murtra Millar from Telefonica, moderated by Shaun Collins.1Ô∏è. ùóñùóºùó∫ùóΩùó≤ùòÅùó∂ùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùó£ùóºùóπùó∂ùó∞ùòÜ: The telecom industry is capital-intensive. Markets with fewer providers see higher per capita investments, enabling better networks and services. EU merger regulations focus too much on short-term price effects rather than long-term benefits like Hashtag#innovation. These regulations need updating.2Ô∏è. ùó•ùó≤ùó±ùòÇùó∞ùó∂ùóªùó¥ ùóïùòÇùóøùó≤ùóÆùòÇùó∞ùóøùóÆùó∞ùòÜ: Telecom regulations are stuck in the past. We still regulate fiber optic networks like old copper infrastructures despite intense competition. In Germany, over 250 fiber providers are building networks. It's necessary to move away from cumbersome rules to foster innovation.3Ô∏è. ùóôùóøùó≤ùóæùòÇùó≤ùóªùó∞ùòÜ ùó£ùóºùóπùó∂ùó∞ùòÜ: Every euro spent on frequency fees is a euro not invested in infrastructure. Longer frequency licenses and more available frequencies, especially in the upper 6 GHz band, are crucial for developing 5G and future 6G networks.4Ô∏è. ùó¶ùó∂ùóªùó¥ùóπùó≤¬†ùó†ùóÆùóøùó∏ùó≤ùòÅ ùó≥ùóºùóø ùóßùó≤ùóπùó≤ùó∞ùóºùó∫: The telecom market in the EU is highly fragmented. National restrictions lead to inefficiencies. The telecommunications framework needs harmonization to avoid a patchwork of different regulations.5Ô∏è. 5ùóö ùóúùóªùóªùóºùòÉùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóªùòÄ: New services must be developed. We need clear guidance from the EU Commission.6Ô∏è. ùóôùóÆùó∂ùóøùóªùó≤ùòÄùòÄ ùó∂ùóª ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùóóùó∂ùó¥ùó∂ùòÅùóÆùóπ ùóòùó∞ùóºùòÄùòÜùòÄùòÅùó≤ùó∫: Consumers view telecom services and OTT platforms like WhatsApp equally, so they should be similarly regulated. Investments in its own cloud and AI capacities are essential to address strategic weaknesses.Time to act: Europe's telecom industry is crucial for digital transformation. L√§ngere Frequenzlizenzen und mehr verf√ºgbare Frequenzen, besonders im oberen 6-GHz-Band, sind entscheidend f√ºr den Ausbau von 5G- und zuk√ºnftigen 6G-Netzen.4Ô∏è. ùóïùó∂ùóªùóªùó≤ùóªùó∫ùóÆùóøùó∏ùòÅ ùó≥√ºùóø ùóßùó≤ùóπùó≤ùó∏ùóºùó∫ùó∫ùòÇùóªùó∂ùó∏ùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª: Der Telko-Markt in der EU ist stark fragmentiert. The future is now: Our AI phone & Magenta AI Artificial intelligence is here to stay and will continue to grow in importance. We are already using AI in around 400 Deutsche Telekom projects to improve quality, customer proximity and productivity. What was just an idea at the last hashtag#MWC is now a reality. We are presenting the AI phone. Because it is important to me that we give our customers access to the best AI technologies: simply and inexpensively. Our AI phone is an intuitive and interactive everyday companion. The digital assistant from Perplexity ensures this. It replaces the need to call up many apps, making many everyday activities easier. It also processes speech, text and images.  A few examples: - Provides me with the recipe or calorie information for a picture of a snack - Sets me a blocker for the next FC Bayern Munich match - Reserves me a table at my favorite  and immediately sets up a reminder- Summarizes and translates official or complicated letters - Plays my playlists via Spotify- Writes emails, makes phone calls and, of course, answers questions - including providing the source  We will be adding more and more services to our AI offering. Google's Cloud AI, ElevenLabs and Picsart will follow in the summer. I'm already looking forward to when the AI Phone is available later this year and bundles all these functions on one device. If you don't want to buy a new smartphone, you can also easily use Magenta AI via the MeinMagenta app. With the exception of the assistant, they will find our entire range of services there.hashtag#artificialintelligence hashtag#ai hashtag#technology hashtag#MagentaAI hashtag#telekom Jonathan Abrahamson Aravind Srinivas

In 2024, we once again delivered on our value proposition to be the trusted partner for protecting and growing our customers‚Äô most valuable assets. And while our performance was nothing short of exceptional - we achieved record financial results and strong growth across our segments ‚Äì it‚Äôs even more important to me that over the last decade, we have been consistently executing our strategy and consistently delivering results for our customers and shareholders, regardless of what the external environment looks like.Last year we witnessed a significant number of geopolitical and economic developments, with elections in over 70 countries and a global economic environment challenged by sluggish growth, particularly in Europe. We also experienced above-average levels of natural catastrophes, continued armed conflicts, and further polarization which has continued to add to considerable volatility. These conditions elevate the need for what Allianz works to bring to our customers and the world: a more secure future.Looking ahead, our three-year plan is centered on driving smart growth, reinforcing productivity, and strengthening our resilience. We will create value by continuing to transform Allianz into an organization that is centered on the customer relationship. We will continue to simplify and standardize our business processes, leveraging our global scale to enhance value for our customers and shareholders. And as I said on today‚Äôs media conference call, we have a holistic way of looking at resilience: We try to be build the most diversified model we can that is not exposed to any single shock.Growth is a consequence of successfully serving clients‚Äô needs. If we continue to offer products and services that people really need, and earn the trust of our customers in times of crisis, we will continue to be successful in the years to come.hashtag#4QFinancialResults hashtag#Allianz

I‚Äôm very happy that this recent trip to India gave me the chance to spend more time with our hashtag#TeamHealthineers in Bengaluru. Es ist gut, dass die Sondierungen f√ºr eine neue Regierungskoalition heute bereits starten. Denn wir haben keine Zeit zu verlieren und ein ‚ÄûWeiter so‚Äú wird es nicht geben k√∂nnen. Wir m√ºssen Rezession und Lethargie der vergangenen Jahre jetzt so schnell wie m√∂glich hinter uns lassen und neue St√§rke gewinnen. Und wir m√ºssen in Europa wieder zu einer gestaltenden Kraft werden. Denn nur mit einem starken Europa werden wir uns in einer immer unsicheren Welt behaupten k√∂nnen. Your title makes you a manager. Your behaviour makes you a leader.I agree with this quote by Eric Partaker. Too often, leadership is confused with a job title and the authority that comes with it. But leadership is not about the title, it‚Äôs about our behaviour; it‚Äôs about hashtag#trust.Authority as in exercising ‚Äòcommand and control‚Äô stifles creativity, slows progress and reduces motivation. If you trust your employees, they are empowered to take ownership, innovate, and grow. I often observe that in uncertain times leaders tend to revert to a ‚Äòcommand and control‚Äô leadership style. In my opinion, this is counterproductive. Especially in an uncertain VUCA world, trusting relationships are the guarantee for innovation, for real added value for customers and thus for impact.If you want to be a leader, don't rely on your title and the authority that comes with it. Act like a leader and place your trust in others. And earn their trust, too, with your behaviour. Great leaders listen, learn, are transparent and acknowledge when they‚Äôre wrong.üí° What‚Äôs true leadership in your opinion? How do you earn the trust of your employees? Share your experiences in the comments!

Heute sind es beeindruckende 26,5 Millionen Vertragskunden! üìû Telefonieren hie√ü damals noch, tats√§chlich zu telefonieren: 40,4 Millionen Telefonanschl√ºsse und 3 Millionen ISDN-Kan√§le waren in Betrieb. An heutigen √úbertragungsraten und IPTV war nicht zu denken. ‚ú®Ein nostalgischer Blick zur√ºck: 82.600 Telefonzellen pr√§gten das Bild, heute sind sie Geschichte. Doch eines bleibt: unser Engagement f√ºr unsere Kund*innen. Ich freue mich auf die Zukunft! Happy Birthday, Deutsche Telekom! üéÇhashtag#30JahreDTAG hashtag#30JahreTelekom hashtag#Digitalisierung hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Telekom

Yesterday, Ursula von der Leyen presented the Clean Industrial Deal and the Omnibus Package, a step toward strengthening Europe's competitiveness. It provides some much-needed clarity; now more fundamental action is required.Europe‚Äôs future must be built on a strong industrial base. But industry can only thrive if it is globally competitive. That means:‚û°Ô∏è Affordable energy through large-scale electrification and clean energy deployment.‚û°Ô∏è A policy framework that attracts investment to Europe, not drives it away.‚û°Ô∏è A commitment to fostering innovation, allowing new technologies to emerge rather than over-regulating before they can develop.‚û°Ô∏è A truly level playing field that promotes competitiveness, no matter the company size.The Clean Industrial Deal is a step in the right direction, but it must be backed by real change. European industry is ready to lead. We are ready to partner and to deliver with EU leaders to ensure that Europe is not just compliant, but competitive.

A year ago, Europe's industry gave input to policymakers on how to enhance competitiveness and ensure prosperity of the hashtag#EU. Now the response is here with the Clean Industrial Deal.¬†My impression: a collection of individual measures ‚Äì some of them quite promising ‚Äì but rather vague and not really the big hit we‚Äôd need. What the commission under Ursula von der Leyen presented is too little and comes too late. Of course, we must be happy that a course correction is underway at all. Lowering energy prices, accelerating the transition to renewables, boosting clean technologies are steps in the right direction. This way we could find our way back to growth and make climate neutrality a viable business case. However, what‚Äôs missing is a true policy shift, a turnaround towards more framework and less regulation. Some key measures will only have an impact in a few years, if at all. But I‚Äôd say the final chapter has not yet been written.¬†And fast as well as decisive measures will be key to strengthen European industry. In particular, we must ensure technology neutrality and avoid creating new bureaucratic hurdles. For this, it takes utmost¬†determination, goodwill, and an unideological approach on all sides. We in the chemical industry are ready to make our contribution. So, let‚Äôs roll up our sleeves and get to work as quickly as possible. And, by the way, a similar attitude should guide the upcoming coalition treaty negotiations in Germany where the next federal government has to take swift, pragmatic action as well.

Last week, I had the opportunity to speak with many of our early talents at SAP. I always leave these sessions feeling deeply impressed by the new ideas these colleagues bring to the table and their enthusiasm for new technologies, especially hashtag#AI. By evolving our approach to education and bringing theory and practice together as closely as possible, I believe we can truly give students the best start to their careers.In collaboration with top universities, SAP offers students hands-on experiences through gamified learning and detailed case studies based on real-life business software and AI tools. We have also been pioneering exciting new ways for SAP researchers, professors, students, industrial customers, and startups to collaborate. One great example is the work done at the Technical University of Munich, where SAP professionals and university researchers work in the same building, side by side. The University of Colorado Boulder - Leeds School of Business is another really strong example of how theory and practice can be brought together in the form of gamified learning focused on enterprise applications.These are just two examples of how organizations can work together for a world where everyone can benefit from the AI revolution ‚Äì and we‚Äôre very proud at SAP to be part of this collaboration. hashtag#UniversityAlliances

Today in Antwerp, I stood alongside 400 business leaders and worker representatives from across Europe to discuss the hashtag#CleanIndustrialDeal with Commission President Ursula von der Leyen. One year after the hashtag#AntwerpDeclaration, the message from industry could not be clearer: hashtag#Europe must move from ambition to action. At thyssenkrupp, we are committed to driving industrial hashtag#transformation, but we need the right conditions to invest, compete, and secure the future of European industry. For example, the hashtag#steel sector urgently needs significantly lower energy prices and vast amounts of clean hydrogen at competitive costs to meet hashtag#decarbonization goals. Every delay costs jobs, slows innovation, and weakens Europe‚Äôs position in the global market. To restore the business case for investment, the hashtag#EUGreenDeal must be implemented effectively, and competitiveness must be placed at the core of policymaking. This marks an important step towards translating the hashtag#Draghi Report‚Äôs recommendations into concrete action. However, real impact will depend on ambitious implementation: scaling up hashtag#circularity alongside decarbonization, securing financial support for hashtag#energy-intensive industries, simplifying hashtag#regulations to free up capacity for innovation, and fostering a risk-taking hashtag#investment culture to boost Europe's industrial competitiveness.Europe‚Äôs industries are ready to act. Now it‚Äôs time for EU leaders to hashtag#DeliverTheDeal and build a strong, sustainable, and competitive future for all!

During my trip to India last year, I was ‚Äì as always ‚Äì impressed by the rapid pace of progress unfolding in healthcare. It‚Äôs exciting to be back again and to see that growth continue, especially in cities like Mumbai, where some of the country‚Äôs most influential healthcare providers and thought leaders are driving meaningful change across the field. Siemens Healthineers is honored to work closely with such experts and pioneers. And this week, it has been a pleasure to have several of them as conversation partners around questions like: How can we truly make healthcare more accessible to all? How do we bring the latest medical technology to more communities? How will AI continue to transform healthcare delivery? And how do we make sure that all of this is achieved sustainably?Many of our partners I have personally known for 15 years and more, and it is impressive to see how their institutions flourish and their ideas scale while their personal passion and convictions remain unchanged.Thank you to Dr. Bhavin Jankharia of Picture This Imaging & Beyond; Dr. Anirudh Kohli, CEO of Breach Candy Hospital Trust; Dr. Santosh Shetty, Executive Director and CEO of Kokilaben Dhirubhai Ambani Hospital; @Dr. Tarang Gianchandani, Group CEO of Sir H.N. Reliance Foundation Hospital & Research Centre; and Dr. Ajay Thakker, Chairman and Managing Director of Jupiter Hospital for sharing your time and insights with me, and for your collective leadership in shaping the future of healthcare in India. I look forward to our continued collaborations and more inspiring conversations!Hariharan NS and Team India, thank you for being part of these encounters and for making them possible.

Our 2024 Financial Results in 90 Seconds We look back on the past 30 years with pride: the journey from public authority to Leading Digital Telco was long, but - as we see today - very successful. 2024 was another record year for Deutsche Telekom. We achieved and, in some cases, exceeded our financial targets.¬†We achieved the highest operating result in the company's history: Adjusted EBITDA AL amounted to 43 billion euros. We want to pay 90 cents per share, the highest dividend in Deutsche Telekom's history. Where does that come from? Because we are investing, turning customers into fans and becoming more efficient. This gives us financial figures that we can use to invest again. And that's what we've done: on both sides of the Atlantic, more than 16 billion euros last year. We are continuing to lay fiber optics for all it's worth: Over 20 million households in Germany and Europe can now book a fiber optic connection with us. And in the USA, T-Mobile has led the industry in customer growth for years.  The fact that Deutsche Telekom is where it is today - namely one of the most successful companies in the DAX and in our industry - has a lot to do with the people who work for this company. We have gone through ups and downs together. We have overcome crises. Endured storms. Perseverance has paid off: hashtag#Telekom has been an anchor of stability for years. We deliver. My thanks go to everyone who has supported us. I have also summarized the most important messages on the financial results in 90 seconds. hashtag#financials hashtag#financialresults hashtag#deutschetelekom

Transformation is the central theme of our time. Shaping change is our top priority at Siemens Energy. This objective guides our three strategic priorities as I presented at last week's Annual Shareholders' Meeting:‚û°Ô∏è¬†Resilience in a transforming world: by ensuring financial resilience, building resilient supply chains, and protecting ourselves against external threats.‚û°Ô∏è¬†Building the transforming energy world: by developing our production capacities for a fast-growing business, evolving the right business portfolio and building the right talent pool to deliver.‚û°Ô∏è¬†Transforming how we operate: by acting with frugality, leveraging data and digitalization, and being a decision-making organization.

The energy transition update goes far beyond installing renewable energy, it‚Äôs all about function. The new energy system must be safe and affordable at every time. Therefore, we are investing billions for expansion and digitalization of our grids, so we can build the right infrastructure for our customers.We bring everything together ‚Äì networks, customer solutions and the system itself ‚Äì to make the energy transition update happen. On Wednesday, we will present our Full Year Results. I want to take the opportunity to elaborate on this energy transition update we aim for.

thyssenkrupp steckt in der Transformation. Weil wir uns ver√§ndern und vorankommen wollen ‚Äì und weil wir m√ºssen. Ein Bereich, den das besonders betrifft, ist thyssenkrupp Steel. Die WAZ hat das zum Anlass genommen, einen Podcast √ºber unsere Stahlsparte zu produzieren und beleuchtet verschiedene Akteure und Hintergr√ºnde. Ich m√∂chte an dieser Stelle betonen: Wir wollen aus dem Stahlgesch√§ft ein gesundes, wettbewerbsf√§higes Unternehmen machen, dass sich der hashtag#Dekarbonisierung verpflichtet. Die daf√ºr notwendige Leistungsf√§higkeit wieder herzustellen, ist meine Aufgabe. Gemeinsam mit unserem entschlossenen Stahlvorstand rund um Dennis Grimm, dem Betriebsrat und der IG Metall m√ºssen wir L√∂sungen finden. Vielen Dank f√ºr die Einladung ins Podcast-Studio und das Gespr√§ch, lieber Ulf Meinke und Oliver Hollenstein!üì∏: Lars Heidrich f√ºr FUNKE

Deutschland hat gew√§hlt! Herzlichen Gl√ºckwunsch, Friedrich Merz zum Sieg bei der Bundestagswahl. Nun geht es darum, z√ºgig eine handlungsf√§hige Regierung zu bilden, die das Land im Herzen Europas stark h√§lt. Was die Energiepolitik betrifft, gibt es viel zu tun. Die neue Legislaturperiode braucht dringend neue Impulse, insbesondere in diesen f√ºnf Bereichen:1. Wettbewerbsfaktor Energie ‚Äì Energiepolitik st√§rker industriepolitisch ausrichten:Deutschland muss als Wirtschaftsstandort global mithalten k√∂nnen. Dazu geh√∂rt auch eine klare Exportunterst√ºtzung f√ºr die gesamte Bandbreite von Energietechnologien.2. Zubau neuer Kraftwerkskapazit√§ten ‚Äì R√ºckgrat eines nachhaltigen Energiesystems:Um aus Kohle vollst√§ndig aussteigen zu k√∂nnen, wird es Gaskraftwerke brauchen. Notwendig sind daher umgehend Ausschreibungen von mindestens 12 GW Gaskraftwerkskapazit√§ten und die Einf√ºhrung eines Kapazit√§tsmarkts.3. St√§rkung der Windenergie ‚Äì Basis f√ºr mehr Resilienz und Unabh√§ngigkeit:Windkraft ist ein starker Wirtschaftsfaktor und Schl√ºssel zur Energieunabh√§ngigkeit Deutschlands. Ausbau der Stromnetze ‚Äì Grundvoraussetzung f√ºr die Energiewende:Deutschlands Stromnetz geh√∂rt zu den besten weltweit. Sicherung von Lieferketten ‚Äì Rohstoffversorgung strategisch angehen:Die Abh√§ngigkeit unserer Wirtschaft beim Import seltener Erden und anderen wichtigen Rohstoffen von einzelnen L√§ndern muss verringert werden. Umsetzen!Rund 83 Prozent Wahlbeteiligung sind eine gute Nachricht und zeigen, dass unsere Demokratie lebendig ist. Ich habe in den vergangenen Wochen viel b√ºrgerliches Engagement erlebt. Zus√§tzliche Regulierung und Erleichterungen f√ºr solche, die selbst keine Netze bauen, brauchen wir gerade nicht und m√ºssen vom Tisch.Aber umgekehrt k√∂nnen und wollen auch wir helfen bei einem wirtschaftlich starken und erfolgreichen digitalen Deutschland und Europa.Dazu habe ich zehn Punkte vorgestellt, die wir nun gemeinsam angehen k√∂nnen. Gratulation an‚ÄØdie‚ÄØWahlsieger,‚ÄØdie Union und ihren Kanzlerkandidaten Friedrich Merz. Nun gilt es, das Ergebnis schnell in eine handlungsf√§hige Regierung zu √ºberf√ºhren. This Sunday, you will see the words ‚ÄúPower of Unity‚Äù broadcast around the field at Allianz Arena in Munich. It is an important day -- and a fitting global moment -- for Allianz to reassert this belief. And we are deliberately highlighting this message in the spirit of bringing people together, in a landmark space that bears our name.  ü§ù Because our company name is the word for ‚Äúalliance,‚Äù we know that a united world is a safer and more prosperous world ‚Äì for societies and for individual people.ü§ù Because our company is a leader in insurance and investing, we know well the role that trust plays in protecting, strengthening, and growing what matters most to our customers. ü§ù Because our company is 135 years old, we have seen our fair share of world and European history and know from direct experience that freedom is cherished and hard-earned. ü§ù Because our company is headquartered in Germany, we have an intimate perspective on the challenges, sensitivities, and opportunities faced by people living and working here.  And so, the Power of Unity is not just a slogan to Allianz. Unity emanates from the guiding compass of trust. If we trust in the foundations of our society, if we trust in the innate goodness and wisdom of our neighbors and fellow citizens, and if we trust in a hopeful vision for the future, we will have the power of unity on our side.  With unity, together we will have open, free, and democratic societies that are resilient to stress and social change. Most important, we will have the overwhelming antidote to the divisive forces of pessimism and fear that stand in the way of progress. Please join me, and the people of Allianz, in sharing and living the Power of Unity ‚Äì this Sunday, and every day.¬†Gemeinsam stark f√ºr das, was uns verbindet.hashtag#PowerOfUnity hashtag#Allianz

Seit einigen Jahren ist Berlin meine Wahlheimat ‚Äì neben einem zweiten Wohnsitz in der wundersch√∂nen Stadt Bamberg nahe dem Erlanger Medical Valley, einem der gr√∂√üten Standorte unserer Firma. An Berlin liebe ich sehr die Diversit√§t, die Lebendigkeit und die Energie ‚Äì vor allem und insbesondere aber, wie es uns die deutsche Geschichte bewusst macht und sowohl an die grauenvollsten Momente erinnert als auch an den Kampf f√ºr die starke Demokratie, die daraus hervorgegangen ist.Das Denkmal f√ºr die ermordeten Juden in der N√§he des Brandenburger Tors und die zerst√∂rte Kaiser-Wilhelm-Ged√§chtnis-Kirche mahnen, was Rassismus und extremistischer Nationalismus anrichten. Die Reste der Berliner Mauer zeigen, was linker Totalitarismus bedeutet. Die Tunnel an der Bernauer Stra√üe zeugen von der unb√§ndigen Sehnsucht nach Demokratie und Freiheit. Die gl√§serne Kuppel und die transparenten Geb√§ude des Regierungsviertels stehen f√ºr genau diese Freiheit und Demokratie im endlich geeinten Deutschland.Wenn ich am n√§chsten Sonntag w√§hle, dann mit einem Gef√ºhl der Dankbarkeit f√ºr diese Demokratie und der Verantwortung, sie zu sch√ºtzen und nicht selbstverst√§ndlich zu nehmen. Wenn ich am n√§chsten Sonntag w√§hle, dann mit der Frage im Kopf, wie ich der Generation meiner Gro√üeltern meine Wahl erkl√§ren w√ºrde, und wie ich sie der Generation meiner (noch nicht geborenen ;-)) Enkel und Enkelinnen erkl√§ren w√ºrde. Wenn ich am n√§chsten Sonntag w√§hle, dann mit der Freude, dass der Wahlkampf vorbei ist, und dass wir alle zusammen mit einer neuen Bundesregierung, welcher Couleur auch immer, die St√§rken unseres Landes und Europas bewahren und ausbauen k√∂nnen.

F√ºr mich ist W√§hlen ein essenzieller Akt der Demokratie, nicht nur eines der wichtigsten Rechte als B√ºrger, sondern gerade in schwierigen Zeiten wie diesen auch B√ºrgerpflicht. Die neue Regierung kann und muss hier dringend die Weichen stellen f√ºr mehr Investitionen in Energieinfrastruktur, mehr M√∂glichkeiten f√ºr Flexibilit√§t im Stromsystem und weniger B√ºrokratie in der Umsetzung.  Das Energiewende Update ist aber nur eine von vielen dringlichen Aufgaben der neuen Bundesregierung. Sie muss wieder mehr auf Markt, auf Eigenverantwortung und auf Leistung setzen, damit unser Wohlstand erhalten bleibt.  Also: Gehen Sie w√§hlen! Jede Stimme z√§hlt!

Manchmal sagen Bilder mehr als Worte. Diese Grafiken der Stiftung Marktwirtschaft sollte die neue Bundesregierung sich unbedingt ganz genau anschauen:- Die Regulierungsdichte w√§chst weiter ungebremst ‚Äì √ºber uns rollt ein Tsunami an Gesetzen und Verordnungen.- Die Wirtschaft gibt immer mehr Geld daf√ºr aus, unproduktive Regulierungen zu erf√ºllen und Berichte zu schreiben, anstatt in Wertsch√∂pfung und Innovation zu investieren. - Mehr B√ºrokraten lassen keine Trendwende erwarten: Die Zahl der Planstellen in den Ministerien w√§chst immer weiter. Our Annual Shareholders‚Äô Meeting 2025 has just concluded. We looked back on our successes in fiscal year 2024, where we once more achieved our ambitious targets despite the difficult economic environment. Thus, our shareholders approved a dividend of EUR 0.95 per share, as proposed by the Supervisory Board and the Managing Board. Our results of the first quarter of fiscal year 2025 show that our performance is consistently improving from a high base.The relevance of Siemens Healthineers is not solely reflected in financial metrics. It is also defined by the lives we impact. In 2024, patients around the world interacted with our products and solutions a total of 2.6 billion times ‚Äì a remarkable number, and each of these ‚ÄúPatient Touchpoints‚Äù involves a human story. Ambitious to do even more, we have set ourselves the target of increasing our Patient Touchpoints to 3.3 billion by 2030.At the same time, more and more customers are deciding to shape their future together with us: As of today, we have entered into Value Partnerships with around 200 institutions in more than 40 countries. The total value of orders on hand from these partnerships stands at approximately EUR 5 billion. Our Value Partnerships are not limited to private and public healthcare providers; we are also making agreements with more and more regional and national governments.Together with our customers and partners, we are fighting the most threatening illnesses: Non-communicable diseases such as cancer, cardiovascular disease, stroke, and dementia that are responsible for almost three quarters of all deaths. Our efforts revolve around fighting these diseases by utilizing our strengths in precision therapy, patient twinning, digitalization, data, and AI. The success of our business and the opportunity to work in a highly essential industry makes us a very attractive employer ‚Äì and we intend to remain one of the best in our sector.We appreciate the ongoing trust of our Supervisory Board, shareholders, customers, partners, and employees, whose commitment and passion are vital to our purpose of pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare for everyone, everywhere, sustainably. ‚Äì Thank you!

The Munich Security Conference was the final wake-up call that the geopolitical sea change or ‚ÄúZeitenwende‚Äù is a reality that we have to deal with. Europe must stand on its own feet.Part of this wake-up call was, that we Europeans must look at power from a security policy perspective. Under these circumstances it was no coincidence that the power sector participated in Munich the first time. Europe here must stand on its own feet as well, and we have a solution: Electrification. Our continent is not rich in fossil fuels and we still import 60% of our energy - in 2023 that was equivalent to 450bn EUR. But electrification allows the EU to get the import number down to 13% by taking control of our own energy supply. More electrification is the pragmatic, not dogmatic, choice for energy security. There is a long way to go, Europe‚Äôs electrification rate has been stagnant for some time at 23%. Time for an energy transition update to finally move forward with a stronger focus on cost and competitiveness and with less bureaucracy.So, great to lead the Eurelectric delegation at the Munich Security Conference to launch our latest flagship study, ‚ÄúRedefining Energy Security in the Age of Electricity‚Äù ‚Äì chapeau to the team who have made it happen!(Copyright photos: MSC Digital Team, Marc Beckmann)

Thomas, and myself. Please find the link to the broadcast in the comments.

Together with NVIDIA, we‚Äôre building the industrial metaverse. A place in the digital world for creating what we‚Äôll later build and operate in the real world. At or Siemens Annual Shareholders' Meeting last week, we shared what it looks like in practice. Take a look at this ship from our customer HD Hyundai Heavy Industries. It has seven¬†million parts. With our Teamcenter software, we can rotate the ship‚Äôs digital twin in all directions. We can look at it in layers, down to every single screw. With a single mouse click, we can also activate a photorealistic environment. And put the ship in the water. Or in dry dock. Razor-sharp. You‚Äôd think you were watching an animation but, in fact, we‚Äôre in the industrial metaverse. Our customers can now buy this application at the click of a mouse. We‚Äôre offering the industrial metaverse at the touch of a button, so to speak. Naturally via our Siemens¬†Xcelerator platform.

An insightful discussion at the panel "Between Giants: U.S.-China Relations and Europe‚Äôs Balancing Act" at the Munich Security Conference, hosted by Deloitte, made me reflect on Europe's strategic role in a dynamic world. It was a pleasure to exchange perspectives with Hui Zhang from NIO, Mike Froman from Council on Foreign Relations, and Angela Titzrath from HHLA Hamburger Hafen und Logistik AG, as well as our moderator Thomas Schiller. Thank you for the engaging conversation with enlightening moments, even with the challenging topic!One thing became abundantly clear: hashtag#Europe must step up to ensure its economic resilience, technological leadership, and its role in driving decarbonization. We have strong foundations ‚Äì a single market of 440 million consumers and a 17% share of global gross domestic product. But if we want to remain competitive, we need a focused industrial policy, to drive innovation, and to reduce dependencies on critical resources. With this in mind, hashtag#decarbonization is not just a challenge. It is an opportunity for Europe to lead the way in future technologies.At thyssenkrupp, we are fully committed to this transformation. Our electrolyzers from thyssenkrupp nucera are enabling large-scale hashtag#greenhydrogen production. Our pure oxyfuel technology from thyssenkrupp Polysius is setting new standards in the decarbonization of hashtag#cement production. Our slewing bearings from thyssenkrupp rothe erde contribute to more efficient hashtag#windenergy generation. And our hashtag#ammonia cracking technology from thyssenkrupp plays a key role in unlocking hydrogen‚Äôs potential as a clean energy carrier.These examples showcase Europe's innovation power. But we must ensure that we turn this technological edge into hashtag#economic growth. That means:  ‚úîÔ∏è Closing the innovation gap, particularly in future technologies.  ‚úîÔ∏è Strengthening Europe‚Äôs trade policy and reducing critical dependencies.  ‚úîÔ∏è Defending our technology leadership with an active European industrial strategy.  ‚úîÔ∏è Implementing trade protection mechanisms effectively.  ‚úîÔ∏è Driving the transition to a climate-neutral industry as a competitive advantage.The Draghi Report clearly outlines the path to a stronger, more competitive Europe. Now, it‚Äôs up to us to act. We must advocate for a European agenda that prioritizes economic strength ‚Äì because only a strong economy will allow us to achieve our ambitions in hashtag#industrial leadership, security and decarbonization. Today's exchange made it clear once again: the time to act is now!

Shock hangs over Munich after a car was intentionally run into a crowd of people yesterday. Our thoughts are with the victims and their families. And we hope for a speedy recovery for all those hospitalized. A terrible attack that also loomed over the start of the Munich Security Conference, where global security challenges are discussed.The world is changing rapidly: politically, economically, and socially. As Europe navigates geopolitical tensions, the urgency for innovative solutions grows. Something that was prominent in our Energy Resilience Leadership Group discussion today. The keyword being Resilience. With the ERLG, we have proven, on a small scale, that real change is possible and how clean technologies are vital to increase resilience and to strengthen long-term geopolitical and economic stability.To scale this up it will need better frameworks. The EU‚Äôs Clean Industrial Deal, to be presented on February 26th, must emphasize competitiveness, with drastic simplification being key. There is much that needs improving, and cosmetic fixes won't cut it. But it can be done. And we need to push forward with this mentality to foster a more resilient and secure Europe.hashtag#MSC2025 hashtag#energyresilience hashtag#europe

UNICEF‚Äôs motto ‚Äúfor every child‚Äù resonates very well with the purpose of Siemens Healthineers: ‚ÄúWe pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. With our planned Altair acquisition, we want to close a gap that we still had in our software portfolio: mechanical and electromagnetic simulation. I know, that sounds very abstract üòâ  My colleague Carlos from Krefeld, Germany, helped us with an explanation on stage of our Annual Shareholders' Meeting ‚Äì as Siemens in Krefeld is already using Altair‚Äôs software. With Altair, they can do things that weren‚Äôt yet covered by Siemens software. For example, ensuring that all the train‚Äôs components have the required stability. You know what it‚Äôs like when a train enters a tunnel or passes another train. You feel a pressure wave. The train has to withstand this force, day after day, for over 30 years. Millions of times. With the simulation, they can determine how stable the car body has to be without using excess materials. This is one example of how we at Siemens combine the real and the digital worlds.  In the future, hashtag#TeamSiemens in Krefeld and our customers will be able to get everything from a single source ‚Äì namely, from us. Regulatory approval is still pending. We already have the approval of Altair‚Äôs shareholders. We expect to close the acquisition in a couple of months. Exciting times ahead!

hashtag#AI offers so much potential, but even the best AI tools are only as good as the hashtag#data they‚Äôre trained with. If a Large Language Model (LLM) can‚Äôt access data, it can‚Äôt learn from it ‚Äì and this is a major challenge for enterprises. Today, it‚Äôs an obvious reality that LLMs can‚Äôt access critical business data, nor can they understand its context or assess its quality. As a result, businesses can‚Äôt use AI, and especially agentic AI, to its full potential ‚Äì but today, we‚Äôre changing that.With SAP Business Data Cloud, we‚Äôre giving businesses access to high-quality shared data based on one single source of truth. This exciting new offering breaks down data silos and unifies SAP and non-SAP, structured and unstructured data, to create one common semantical data layer that gives you a truly holistic understanding of your business ‚Äì from your customers and suppliers to your financials and your workforce, as well as the external trends that impact it.Our partnership with Databricks plays a key role in this offering. Embedded in SAP Business Data Cloud, Databricks leading data engineering capabilities help companies easily and seamlessly combine unstructured data from any source with the data products coming from SAP‚Äôs applications in one harmonized data model.With SAP Business Data Cloud, we‚Äôre laying the foundation to unlock completely new possibilities with SAP Business AI. Through our new data products and the additional data context they provide, we‚Äôre making the AI foundation even stronger and enabling even more powerful AI that can trigger more impactful action and analytics. Access to more diverse and richer data sets supercharges our copilot Joule, allowing it to surface deeper insights, solve more complex business problems, and make even smarter recommendations. And as we enter the age of agentic AI, Joule will now be able to orchestrate agents across your company to collect cash faster, better predict demand, optimize your supply chains, and help you attract and retain the best talents.Only SAP can offer this winning combination of powerful applications, mission-critical data, and AI embedded directly into our customers‚Äô business processes ‚Äì and we‚Äôre so excited to showcase this through today‚Äôs SAP Business Data Cloud launch.https://lnkd.in/eRWGf74m

We must love changes! Today prompts me to pause and reflect. The International Day of Women and Girls in Science should be a celebration of women who push boundaries, innovate, and inspire. But when I look at the current statistics, my mood shifts. According to the UNESCO Institute for Statistics, only about 30% of researchers worldwide are women. A number that has barely changed over the years, and yet, it remains far too low. Networking plays a crucial role in changing this. It opens doors to mentorship, knowledge-sharing, and opportunities that help women advance in their scientific careers. Strong networks foster support, amplify voices, and create pathways where barriers once existed. Here are some promising initiatives that empower women in science: ‚ñ™ Society of Women Engineers (SWE): SWE is dedicated to empowering women to achieve their full potential in engineering careers, offering professional development, networking, and advocacy for gender equality in engineering.‚ñ™ MINTvernetzt: MINTvernetzt connects STEM educators to foster innovation and support diverse, inclusive education, with a focus on inspiring young girls and women to pursue STEM careers.‚ñ™ Association for Women in Science (AWIS): AWIS champions gender equity by providing professional development, advocacy, and community-building opportunities for women in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics.‚ñ™ Komm, mach MINT: This German initiative aims to increase the participation of women in STEM fields by offering resources and programs that empower women to pursue studies and careers in these areas.‚ñ™ Girls'Day - M√§dchen-Zukunftstag: The Girls Day initiative provides young girls with the opportunity to explore STEM fields through hands-on activities and mentoring, encouraging them to pursue careers in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics. I encourage hashtag#WomenInScience to connect and exchange ideas in the comments, fostering mutual support.

Keine Likes f√ºr L√ºgen ‚Äì Gemeinsam gegen Desinformation  Das ‚ÄûNetz‚Äú - das Internet als sozialer Raum - sind wir alle. Es bedient unsere Erwartungen. Wenn wir also ein besseres Netz wollen, m√ºssten wir eigentlich dann nicht auch unsere Erwartungen √§ndern? Und unser Handeln? Sechs Mal¬†schneller breiten sich im Netz Fakes im Gegensatz zu Fakten aus. Sagt eine sieben Jahre alte Studie des MIT. Desinformation erreicht damit mehr Menschen als Information. Das ist auch ein Demokratieproblem. Die beruht u.a. darauf, dass wir als Gesellschaft auf Basis von Fakten aushandeln, wie wir uns entwickeln oder Probleme l√∂sen wollen. Wenn aber schon die Fakten, auf deren Basis wir aushandeln wollen, falsch sind, kann dann die L√∂sung passend sein? Das gilt √ºbrigens f√ºr klassische und die so genannten sozialen Medien gleicherma√üen. Und es gilt f√ºr alle Orte, an denen wir auf Basis von Informationen Entscheidungen treffen.  Die Deutsche Telekom unterst√ºtzt darum viele Initiativen, die aufkl√§ren und damit m√ºndig machen. Heute am Safer Internet Day (SID) mit dem Motto: Keine Likes f√ºr L√ºgen, aber auch an jedem anderen Tag des Jahres. Einen Beitrag dazu leistet unsere mehrfach ausgezeichnete Initiative ‚ÄûTeachtoday‚Äú. Sie f√∂rdert den sicheren und kompetenten Umgang von Kindern und Jugendlichen mit dem Internet. Die Initiative stellt Materialien und Ressourcen bereit, um Kinder und Jugendliche mit den Gefahren, aber auch mit den Chancen der digitalen Welt vertraut zu machen.  hashtag#SaferIntertedDay hashtag#SID hashtag#KeineLikesf√ºrL√ºgen hashtag#teachtoday hashtag#GegenHassimNetz klicksafe
