Yesterday, Christian Sewing, CEO of Deutsche Bank, Ola Kaellenius, CEO of Mercedes, and I presented an agenda for the economy, growth, and values. For the next federal government for Germany, and for Europe. We are facing major challenges in Germany ‚Äì concerns about the security in our country, stagnating economic growth, loss of competitiveness, the looming loss of jobs in several industries, as well as geopolitical tensions, protectionism, and the threat of tariff increases. We have reached or even surpassed a critical point. We need a stable democracy based on social-market principles. Because without a stable democracy, there is no growth and no prosperity. The federal election must therefore not be a protest election, but an election that sets a clear course.  On complex issues, such as immigration, and other questions that will have us preoccupied over multiple legislative periods, the center parties must find lasting solutions through democratic discourse. Christian, Ola, and I agree: We need a clear growth agenda for Germany and Europe ‚Äì we can only achieve this Economic Miracle 2.0 together. This also means: We stand up for values like diversity, openness, and tolerance, because they are part of the foundation of a successful economy. The following points are particularly important for us for the political agenda in the coming years: Top 10-point program for Germany: 1.¬†¬†¬†¬†Quickly reduce bureaucracy, digitize, and massively scale back regulation. A moratorium on certain laws would give us time to revise them.2.¬†¬†¬†¬†Competitive, non-subsidized energy prices through pragmatic, intelligent energy policy.3.¬†¬†¬†¬†Promotion of selected future technologies and support getting them to market.4.¬†¬†¬†¬†The sustainable transformation must be receptive to technology and pragmatic.5.¬†¬†¬†¬†Modernization of infrastructure with public and private capital.6.¬†¬†¬†¬†Increasing the labor force potential through more incentives for work, qualified immigration, and fast, smooth integration into the labor market.7.¬†¬†¬†¬†Significantly reduce corporate taxes.8.¬†¬†¬†¬†Sustainably increase the defense budget and coordinate it at the European level.9.¬†¬†¬†¬†Conclude pragmatic free-trade agreements now without overloading them.10. Creation and leveraging of one (!) European market for capital, goods, and competition.

Gestern haben Christian Sewing, CEO der Deutschen Bank, Ola Kaellenius, CEO Mercedes, und ich eine Agenda f√ºr Wirtschaft, Wachstum und Werte vorgestellt. F√ºr die n√§chste Bundesregierung, f√ºr Deutschland und f√ºr Europa.Wir stehen in Deutschland vor gro√üen Herausforderungen: √Ñngste um die Sicherheit in unserem Land, stagnierendes Wirtschaftswachstum, Verlust der Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit, drohender Verlust von Arbeitspl√§tzen in mehreren Branchen, dazu geopolitische Spannungen, Protektionismus und drohende Zollerh√∂hungen.Wir haben einen kritischen Punkt erreicht oder sogar √ºberschritten.Wir brauchen eine stabile, sozialmarktwirtschaftliche Demokratie. Denn ohne stabile Demokratie gibt es kein Wachstum und keinen Wohlstand. Die Bundestagswahl darf deswegen keine Protestwahl, sondern muss eine richtungsweisende Wahl sein. Bei komplexen Fragen, wie z.B. der Immigration, bei Fragen, die uns √ºber diese und viele weitere Legislaturperioden besch√§ftigen, m√ºssen die Parteien der Mitte in einem demokratischen Diskurs L√∂sungen finden, die Bestand haben. Christian, Ola und ich sagen: Wir brauchen eine klare Wachstumsagenda f√ºr Deutschland und Europa ‚Äì dieses Wirtschaftswunder 2.0 schaffen wir nur gemeinsam.Das hei√üt zugleich: Wir stehen ein f√ºr Werte wie Vielfalt, Offenheit und Toleranz, denn sie sind Teil des Fundaments einer erfolgreichen Wirtschaft. Die folgenden Punkte sind aus unserer Sicht wichtig f√ºr die politische Agenda der kommenden Jahre: Top 10 Punkteprogramm f√ºr Deutschland 1)¬†¬†¬†B√ºrokratie schnell abbauen, digitalisieren und massiv weniger regulieren. Ein Moratorium f√ºr bestimmte Gesetze w√ºrde uns Zeit kaufen, diese zu √ºberarbeiten. 2)¬†¬†¬†Wettbewerbsf√§hige, nicht subventionierte Energiepreise durch eine pragmatische, intelligente Energiepolitik3)¬†¬†¬†F√∂rderung von ausgew√§hlten Zukunftstechnologien sowie Unterst√ºtzung bei Markteinf√ºhrung 4)¬†¬†¬†Die nachhaltige Transformation muss technologieoffen und pragmatisch gestaltet werden 5)¬†¬†¬†Modernisierung der Infrastruktur mit √∂ffentlichem und privatem Kapital6)¬†¬†¬†Steigerung des Arbeitskr√§ftepotentials durch mehr Anreize f√ºr Arbeit, qualifizierte Zuwanderung und schnelle, reibungslose Integration in den Arbeitsmarkt7)¬†¬†¬†Unternehmenssteuern deutlich senken8)¬†¬†¬†Verteidigungsetat nachhaltig erh√∂hen und europ√§isch koordiniert allokieren9)¬†¬†¬†Jetzt pragmatische Freihandelsabkommen schlie√üen, ohne diese zu √ºberladen10) Erschaffung und Hebeln eines (!) europ√§ischen Marktes f√ºr Kapital, Waren und Wettbewerb.

10 Punkte zur Digitalpolitik Joe Kaeser hat hier auf LinkedIn einen Impuls zur Wirtschafts- und Energiepolitik gesetzt, den ich sehr begr√º√üe. Seiner Forderung nach einer Agenda 2030 schlie√üe ich mich an. Energie ist die Basis von allem: Netzen, Rechenzentren, Robotics‚Ä¶ Wir brauchen also g√ºnstige und verl√§ssliche Energie zur Sicherung und Modernisierung unserer industriellen Basis.Ebenso unterschreibe ich seinen Fokus auf Infrastruktur als R√ºckgrat der Wirtschaft. Wir m√ºssen Infrastruktur breit denken ‚Äì und vor allem erneuern und modernisieren. Es geht dabei nicht nur physische sondern auch im digitale Infrastruktur. Und es geht darum, was auf diesen Infrastrukturen passiert, z.B. in Sachen digitaler Verwaltung oder digitalen Unternehmen. Auch eine Verwaltungsapp, auch die Cloud, auch ein industrielles Metaverse sind in meinen Augen Infrastruktur.Wenn wir hier klug, gezielt, aber auch massiv privat und √∂ffentlich investieren, haben wir die Chance, die industrielle F√ºhrerschaft Deutschlands zu erhalten und Souver√§nit√§t zu erhalten. Der Staat als Ankerkunde ist daf√ºr wichtig. Ebenso wichtig sind ein Digitalministerium und eine Digitalagentur, die operativ die Digitalisierung der Verwaltung umsetzt.Anbei meine zehn Punkte, auf die auch Joe Kaeser in seinem Impuls hingewiesen hat.

Reality or digital illusion? The line is vanishing. I used to think I could easily tell the difference. Now, with each passing day, I'm less sure.The incredibly realistic clips currently circulating on social media highlight the immense power of Artificial Intelligence. Parents shouldn‚Äôt have to choose between a fulfilling career and a happy family life. At Allianz, we believe in making that balance easier. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm proud to share the opening of our new ‚ÄúBlaue Zwerge‚Äù daycare center in Munich ‚Äì another milestone in our long-standing commitment to supporting working parents.Since we first opened our doors to little ‚ÄúAllianzers‚Äù in 2011, our daycare centers have provided a nurturing environment for more than 400 children to grow and learn. Expanding this initiative isn‚Äôt just a business decision; it‚Äôs a deeply personal one. As a father, I understand the challenges of balancing work and family. No parent should have to choose between professional ambitions and family responsibilities. Every parent deserves the peace of mind that comes from knowing their children are in a safe, nurturing place to develop.The business case is equally strong: companies thrive when people thrive. Retaining top talent means creating an environment where employees can focus on their careers without sacrificing their personal lives. When we support parents, we create a stronger, more engaged workforce ‚Äì and a more resilient business. On a broader scale, access to affordable, high-quality childcare is key driver of social progress, helping to break down outdated gender roles and promote true equality.A special thank you to the dedicated childcare professionals ‚Äì our unsung heroes ‚Äì who invest their time and talents in shaping the next generation. Your work is invaluable, and we are grateful for everything you do.This is just one step of many. At Allianz, we remain committed to making work-life balance a reality for all. Let‚Äôs keep the conversation going ‚Äì how do you envision the future of workplace childcare?Renate Wagner Hashtag#Allianz

This year we celebrate and reflect upon the 135th anniversary of Allianz. Since our founding in 1890, Allianz has grown from a regional company to one of the world‚Äôs leading insurers and asset managers, trusted by 125 million private and corporate customers across nearly 70 countries. Being old and big, however, is not in and of itself cause for celebration. The art of longevity is the continuous ability to learn and stay strong, flexible, and relevant. From advertising motor insurance in the 1910s, when cars were still a novelty, to introducing computers to the insurance industry in the 1950s, Allianz has a history of learning and innovating with purpose, to secure people‚Äôs futures. Today, our human-centered approach to AI broadens our value proposition -- beyond paying claims after a crisis hits to consulting clients on protective measures they can take to avoid disaster and be resilient to emerging risks. For us, longevity is not just about standing the test of time. It is about staying true to our purpose and evolving for smart growth. Our evolution includes a willingness to reflect on even the more difficult chapters of our history. By learning from our successes and mistakes, we strive to lead with integrity and dependability.Today, with 157,000 employees and recognition as one of the Top 25 Best Workplaces globally, Allianz is stronger than ever. The best way to celebrate our 135 years is to learn from our heritage and honor our present and future role in our communities, by helping to build strong local economies and secure future generations. To our employees, customers, and partners: thank you for making this journey possible. Your trust is the foundation of everything we have achieved ‚Äì and everything we build together. What do you think is the secret to a business staying relevant over time? Share your thoughts in the comments.  Hashtag#Allianz

Ich habe in den vergangenen Tagen den Begriff der Hellbrise ‚Äì der eigentlich gar nicht von mir stammt ‚Äì in die Diskussion gebracht und werde darauf vielfach angesprochen. Ebenso auf das Gegenst√ºck, die Dunkelflauten, zu denen ich mich auch hier schon ge√§u√üert hatte. Beide sind besondere Ph√§nomene, die aber mit einer gewissen Regelm√§√üigkeit auftreten. Bruno Burger vom Fraunhofer ISE hat es treffend zusammengefasst: Den Dunkelflauten der vergangenen Monate stehen im vergangenen Jahr insgesamt 450 Stunden mit Strompreisen unter Null gegen√ºber!¬†[...]. Hier scheint mir manchmal eine verzerrte Wahrnehmung in der √∂ffentlichen Debatte vorzuherrschen. Unbestritten weisen beide Ph√§nomene aber auf ein grunds√§tzliches Problem hin, denn die Verf√ºgbarkeit von Strom aus EE ist volatil und auch auf Tagesbasis stark schwankend. Es stellt sich daher die Frage, wie wir die Auswirkungen dieser Ereignisse optimal im Sinne bezahlbarer Energie abfedern k√∂nnen. Und mehr noch: wir sollten daf√ºr sorgen, dass Kunden davon sogar profitieren. Eine Voraussetzung daf√ºr ist, dass Stromanbieter und Stromverbraucher ‚Äì bis hin zum Durchschnittshaushalt ‚Äì flexibel am Strommarkt teilnehmen k√∂nnen. E.ON arbeitet daher an flexiblen L√∂sungen wie Speichern und einer gut ausgebauten Netzinfrastruktur, und wir setzen auf eine Flexibilisierung der Tarife. Als Voraussetzung daf√ºr muss der Smart Meter Rollout aber endlich an Fahrt gewinnen und es braucht eine Anpassung des Marktdesigns. Wir brauchen einen technologieoffenen Kapazit√§tsmarkt, damit Kapazit√§ten f√ºr den Fall bereitgehalten werden, dass zu wenig Energie aus EE-Anlagen das System st√ºtzt. Dabei geht es nicht nur um Gro√üflexibilit√§ten (wie Kraftwerke), sondern auch um kleinste Erzeugungseinheiten und die Beteiligung von Verbrauch und Speichern.

Covestros √úbernahme durch ADNOC Group ist KEIN Zeichen von Schw√§che. Im Gegenteil. In meinem Interview mit der WELT erl√§uterte ich die Strategie hinter der ADNOC-√úbernahme, Covestros Zukunftsperspektiven und die Herausforderungen f√ºr die deutsche Industrie. Die Kernpunkte: - Die √úbernahme durch ADNOC ist kein Ausverkauf, sondern eine strategische Entscheidung, die uns erm√∂glicht, schneller zu wachsen und in Innovationen zu investieren. - Trotz externer Schocks wie der Corona- und Energiekrise haben wir unser Portfolio stetig optimiert und in vielen Bereichen die Kostenf√ºhrerschaft erreicht. - Wir reagieren auf die sinkende industrielle Nachfrage in Europa, indem wir uns anpassen und effizienter aufstellen. Alles liegt auf dem Tisch, und unser Ziel ist klar: Wir wollen in Europa der ‚Äûlast man standing‚Äú sein. - Die Chemieindustrie ist grunds√§tzlich gesund. Unternehmen treffen gute Entscheidungen und sind im Ausland profitabel. In Europa jedoch stimmen die Rahmenbedingungen nicht, weshalb diese Strategien hier nicht aufgehen. Ich sehe enormes Potential in Deutschland und Europa. Was wir jetzt brauchen, ist eine Neuauflage der Agenda 2010 ‚Äì und zwar schnell. Mein Appell an die k√ºnftige Regierung: Seid mutig!

Ich hatte es hier neulich schon geschrieben, wir brauchen in Deutschland einen pragmatischen und unideologischen Blick auf die Energiewende. Der Ausbau der Erneuerbaren ist in den vergangenen zehn Jahren deutlich vorangeschritten. 2024 stammte bereits mehr als 62 Prozent der Nettostromproduktion aus erneuerbaren Quellen. Das ist zun√§chst mal ein Erfolg, hei√üt aber auch: Die Erneuerbaren sind heute wettbewerbsf√§hig, sie sind die tragenden S√§ulen in dem Erzeugungsmix und sollten auch so in die Verantwortung genommen werden. Die Betreiber von EE-Anlagen m√ºssen sich effizient im Sinne des Systems zu verhalten. Es darf nicht sein, dass die Betreiber gesichert Einnahmen ernten, w√§hrend sie ihre Preis- und Mengenrisiken auf die Allgemeinheit abw√§lzen. Die am Freitag verabschiedete Novelle des Energiewirtschaftsgesetzes beinhaltet eine D√§mpfung von PV-Einspeisespitzen und einen Mechanismus, die F√∂rderung bei negativen Strompreisen auszusetzen.Das sind wichtige Schritte, denn grunds√§tzlich sollte klar sein: Wer ungesteuert ins Netz einspeist, wenn gerade ohnehin viel Strom im System ist, der im Zweifel sogar abgeregelt werden muss und zus√§tzliche Kosten verursacht, sollte nicht daf√ºr belohnt werden, dass er das Problem noch vergr√∂√üert.

Wochenende. Ich leere meine Email Inbox. Anbei ein anonymisierter Screenshot von einer ‚ÄûBewerbungsmail‚Äú. Ein gutes Beispiel, dass wir in Deutschland offensichtlich zu viel f√∂rdern und zu wenig fordern. So schlecht scheinen die Leistungen des Job-Centers nicht zu sein. Sonst w√ºrde sich die Dame mehr M√ºhe geben.

Your Turn ‚Äì Our Turn!We are ready for 2025! With momentum from our record year in 2024, with inspiration and a highly motivated leadership team, we are kicking off our anniversary year: 30 years of Deutsche Telekom. I am proud and excited to see how much energy we are bringing to new topics. We are in a strong position - but 2025 will also bring challenges. That‚Äôs why now it‚Äôs time for: "Your Turn."That was the motto of our Top Management Team Meeting ‚Äì our Hashtag#TMTM. Together with 800 Telekom leaders, I made one thing clear: Now is the time to step up and take leadership.In discussions with colleagues and inspiring guests, one thing became clear: The world order is shifting, Europe must leverage its strengths, AI is here to stay, and true synergies only emerge when we break down silos and learn from each other.A big thank you to:Masayoshi Son, Anne Applebaum, Agnes Heftberger, Omar TAZI, Elvira Gonz√°lez Sevilla, John Saw, Jonathan Abrahamson, Karine Peters, Aravind Srinivas, Jonas Dziadek, Uli Hoene√ü, and to Lena Drubel & Niklas Horstmann.We need more initiative. Therefore, I said to my managers: it‚Äôs Your Turn! Here are the six key principles I shared:1Ô∏è‚É£! Coziness is over! Step out of your comfort zone. Success requires going the extra mile. Standing still is not an option.2Ô∏è‚É£ Execute decisions instead of endless discussions! Collaboration is not about endless alignment but about acting together.3Ô∏è‚É£ Embrace radical transparency! Openness and honesty build trust and lead to better decisions.4Ô∏è‚É£ Combine performance with values! Success matters, but how we achieve it matters just as much. Respect and appreciation remain our foundation.5Ô∏è‚É£ Keep the customer at the center! Customer obsession means our innovation must always be driven by real value for our customers.6Ô∏è‚É£ Lifelong learning is a duty! ‚ÄúDuty to grow.‚Äù We must all keep developing, building new skills, and harnessing the potential of technologies like AI.What applies to my managers applies to all of us. These principles extend beyond business‚Äîto society and politics as well.That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs not just Your Turn ‚Äì it‚Äôs Our Turn!Srini Gopalan Christian Illek Birgit Bohle Claudia Nemat Dominique Leroy Dr. Ferri Abolhassan Thorsten Langheim Michaela Schwinge Kseniia (Xenia) Antonova Hashtag#Telekom

Data vs. Energy?You can only change what you can measure. That‚Äôs why I analyse, and act on data‚Äîwhether in business or personal life. But is data alone enough? I was discussing this question with Dr. Hadi Saleh, physician and CEO of CeramTec ‚Äì The Ceramic Experts in my video format Expect the Unexpected.My key insights are:üîπ Data provides direction ‚Äì Measuring metrics is essential for making educated decisions.üîπ Too much data can paralyze action ‚Äì The key is not collecting endless numbers but identifying the critical few to act upon. Smart data, not big data counts.üîπ People and energy matter ‚Äì Culture, leadership spirit, and weak signals‚Äîlike those from casual conversations‚Äîoften determine success beyond spreadsheets.Data is crucial to outperform, but in the end it's about leaders and employees having enough energy.How do you handle data-driven decision-making in your leadership? Let‚Äôs discuss!

Ich hatte geschrieben es gehe nicht darum, ob wir in Deutschland eine Energiewende vorantreiben, sondern darum, WIE wir das machen und Details versprochen. Hier ein erster Vorschlag als Teil der L√∂sung.Ich pl√§diere daf√ºr, die Verg√ºtung f√ºr Erzeuger von erneuerbaren Energien zu √§ndern. Statt einer Pauschalf√∂rderung m√ºssen sie Anreize haben, ihre Bauentscheidung auch von der verf√ºgbaren Netzinfrastruktur abh√§ngig zu machen. Ansonsten treiben sie v√∂llig unn√∂tig Systemkosten im Netz hoch, die den Strompreis belasten. Was das hei√üt, l√§sst sich zum Beispiel am Thema Abregelungskosten festmachen. Abregeln m√ºssen Netzbetreiber dann, wenn in bestimmten Regionen oder Leitungsabschnitten zu viel Strom im Netz ist. Das kostet Geld ‚Äì 2023 waren es bundesweit 3,1 Mrd. Euro f√ºr 34,3 TWh abgeregelten Strom (in etwa der Jahresverbrauch von D√§nemark!). Das ist nat√ºrlich ineffizient und f√ºr die Kunden √§rgerlich. Doch leider ist das beileibe keine Seltenheit, gerade wenn in l√§ndlichen Regionen, wo kaum Abnehmer sind, ungesteuert EE-Anlagen hinzugebaut werden. Aus systemischer Sicht sollten daher in Zukunft Erneuerbare vorrangig da gebaut werden, wo sie auch zu vertretbaren Kosten auf Basis einer bestehenden Netzinfrastruktur integriert werden k√∂nnen.¬†Und wer woanders baut, bekommt eben keine Kompensation bei Abregelung (Redispatchvorbehalt).

At thyssenkrupp, we are driving the Hashtag#greentransformation ‚Äì by decarbonizing our own processes and enabling our customers to achieve their sustainability goals. Our technology make industry greener, more efficient, and fit for the future.  As part of this effort, we are proud to announce that thyssenkrupp nucera and thyssenkrupp Steel are contributors to the European Industry Alliance supporting the Hashtag#H2Med Corridor. This partnership unites nearly 20 companies from across Europe to accelerate the Hashtag#hydrogen economy and strengthen a sustainable industry. The H2Med Corridor is a cornerstone project to connect hydrogen production, storage, and consumption across Europe ‚Äì from the Iberian Peninsula to Northern Europe ‚Äì by the early 2030s. With our leading water Hashtag#electrolysis technology and plans to use significant volumes of green hydrogen in our Hashtag#steel production, we are driving both innovation and adoption. Together, we are building a resilient and competitive hydrogen value chain that supports EU Hashtag#climategoals like the Green Deal. To achieve a scalable hydrogen market, we must address critical challenges: affordable green electricity and green molecules supported by a robust pipeline Hashtag#infrastructure. The H2Med Corridor tackles these priorities directly, bringing Europe closer to a climate-neutral future powered by renewable hydrogen. Just yesterday, my colleague Nadja H√•kansson joined a panel discussion at the 3rd Enag√°s Hydrogen Day, exchanging insights with industry leaders on how green hydrogen and its derivatives will accelerate the industrial Hashtag#decarbonization. Events like these are crucial for fostering innovation and tackling shared challenges, ensuring that we move forward together. The green transformation is a collective effort, and Hashtag#thyssenkrupp is proud to lead by example. Let‚Äôs shape a decarbonized tomorrow ‚Äì together.

Gestern Abend habe ich mich mit den Berliner Energiejournalisten getroffen und einen Blick auf die kommenden Monate geworfen. Meine Botschaft: Der Klimawandel ist nicht wegzudenken, die Notwendigkeit einer sicheren und bezahlbaren Energieversorgung aber ebenso wenig.¬†Es geht nicht darum, OB wir die Energiewende umsetzen, es geht um das WIE. An welchen Hebeln sollten wir ansetzen?1.¬†Die Herausforderungen der Energiewende lassen sich nur mit einer starken Wirtschaft bew√§ltigen. 2.¬†Bei der Umsetzung der Transformation muss das Ziel sein, die heimische Industrie zu st√§rken und gleichzeitig soziale Verwerfungen zu vermeiden. 3.¬†Daf√ºr muss die Energiepolitik neu justiert werden: Wir m√ºssen st√§rker priorisieren, pragmatischer und produktiver werden. 4.¬†Die √ºberbordende B√ºrokratie muss begrenzt werden.5.¬†Ein Klima f√ºr Innovationen und mehr Investitionen muss entstehen. 6.¬†Anreize f√ºr mehr Leistung m√ºssen geschaffen werden.Wenn es uns gesamtgesellschaftlich gelingt diese Punkte umsetzen, wird die Energiewende ein Erfolg und geht auch mit wirtschaftlichem Wachstum einher.

Deeply moved and shaken, from my yesterday's visit to the former Auschwitz concentration camp.¬†There, I participated in the commemoration of the 80th anniversary of its liberation. Encountering the victims of the criminal Nazi regime has once again made me aware of our special responsibility as Germans and the inhumanity of which humans are capable.The visit reminded me once more how important it is to live in a stable, democratic state. A state that has learned from its own history and feels particularly committed to human dignity. It also made me aware of how valuable it is that we have lived in peace and freedom in the European Union for 80 years, how fragile this peace is and how threatened our freedom. For this reason, it is important that we continue to stand up for these values. So that this terrible history never repeats itself. hashtag#WeRemember World Jewish Congress

Tief bewegt und ber√ºhrt komme ich zur√ºck von meinem gestrigen Besuch des ehemaligen Konzentrationslagers Auschwitz. Dort habe ich am Gedenken zum 80. Jahrestag der Befreiung teilgenommen. Die Begegnung mit den Opfern des verbrecherischen NS-Regimes hat mir erneut unsere besondere Verantwortung als Deutsche vor Augen gef√ºhrt. Und erneut gezeigt, zu welcher Unmenschlichkeit Menschen f√§hig sind. Der Besuch hat mir eindringlich verdeutlicht, wie wichtig es ist, in einem stabilen, demokratischen Staat zu leben. Ein Staat, der aus der eigenen Geschichte gelernt hat und sich der Menschenw√ºrde besonders verpflichtet f√ºhlt. Mir ist auch sehr bewusst geworden, was f√ºr ein hohes Gut es ist, dass wir in der Europ√§ischen Union seit 80 Jahren in Frieden und Freiheit leben. Und wie zerbrechlich dieser Frieden ist, wie bedroht unsere Freiheit. Daher ist es wichtig, dass wir weiter f√ºr diese Werte eintreten. Damit sich diese furchtbare Geschichte nie wiederholen wird. hashtag#WeRemember World Jewish Congress

I will remain CEO of Deutsche Telekom‚ÄúI was happy to comply with the Supervisory Board's request to extend my contract until the end of 2028.‚Äù This is the official statement. But behind it lies a long and intensive decision-making process. Even ‚Äì no, especially after eleven years as CEO ‚Äì I am convinced that I can take the company even further.Whether it's through state-of-the-art networks, new digital services or the use of innovative technologies such as artificial intelligence.  We will continue to ensure that Deutsche Telekom remains a reliable partner in a rapidly changing world and creates added value for customers and investors. I am highly motivated to do so and very much look forward to continuing my work as CEO of Deutsche Telekom.Deutsche Telekom faces major challenges. We are living in a time when many of the certainties of the past no longer apply. Europe is falling behind. And the telecommunications sector in this country has also been under enormous pressure for a long time.I am proud that Deutsche Telekom has managed to achieve a strong position in this environment over the past few years. With strong pillars on both sides of the Atlantic. Now it is important to continue to build on this position. We will not let up in our efforts to stay on the road to success.Deutsche Telekom's strength lies above all in its people, who put their hearts into their work. We will continue to write the success story by realigning our outstanding management team. Srini Gopalan is moving to T-Mobile US as Chief Operating Officer. I am very pleased about this, because he has done an excellent job in his previous positions at Deutsche Telekom as head of Germany and, before that, Europe. Together with Mike Sievert, he will provide important impetus for the continued success of TMUS and Deutsche Telekom.Rodrigo Diehl will rejuvenate our Board of Management and we will have a strong leader from the Deutsche Telekom team for our German business. His international successes in the time before Deutsche Telekom, but also with us in the Europe department and in Magenta Austria, clearly underscore this. Srini and Rodrigo stand for what drives us at Deutsche Telekom: growth, innovation and customer orientation.All of these decisions underscore one thing. We not only want to be leading in everything we do, but also take responsibility. I would like to thank Deutsche Telekom's Supervisory Board and especially Frank Appel. I am convinced that we are well positioned for Deutsche Telekom's future. Now it's time to get started. hashtag#wewonststop

Ich bleibe Chef der Deutschen Telekom‚ÄûDer Bitte des Aufsichtsrats, meinen Vertrag bis Ende 2028 zu verl√§ngern, habe ich gerne entsprochen.‚Äú So steht es in der offiziellen Stellungnahme. Aber dahinter steckt ein langer und intensiver Entscheidungsprozess. Auch - nein gerade nach elf Jahren als Vorstandsvorsitzender - bin ich davon √ºberzeugt, das Unternehmen noch weiter voranbringen zu k√∂nnen. Ob durch den Ausbau modernster Netze, neuer digitaler Dienstleistungen oder den Einsatz innovativer Technologien wie K√ºnstlicher Intelligenz.Wir werden auch in Zukunft daf√ºr sorgen, dass die Telekom ein verl√§sslicher Partner in einer sich schnell wandelnden Welt bleibt und Mehrwert f√ºr Kunden und Investoren schafft. Daf√ºr bin ich hochmotiviert und freue mich sehr, meine Arbeit als Vorstandsvorsitzender (CEO) der Deutschen Telekom fortzusetzen. Die Herausforderungen, vor denen die Telekom steht, sind gro√ü. Wir bewegen uns in einer Zeit, in der viele Gewissheiten von einst nicht mehr z√§hlen. Europa f√§llt zur√ºck. Und auch der Telekommunikationssektor steht hierzulande schon seit langem enorm unter Druck.Ich bin stolz, dass es die Telekom in den vergangenen Jahren geschafft hat, sich in diesem Umfeld eine Position der St√§rke zu erarbeiten. Mit starken S√§ulen auf beiden Seiten des Atlantiks. Nun wird es darauf ankommen, diese Position weiter zu nutzen. Wir werden nicht nachlassen, um in der Erfolgsspur zu bleiben.Die St√§rke der Telekom liegt vor allem in ihren Menschen, die mit Herzblut f√ºr Ihre Aufgaben einstehen. So werden wir die Erfolgsgeschichte durch die Neuaufstellung unseres gro√üartigen Management-Teams weiterschreiben. Srini Gopalan wechselt als Chief Operating Officer zur T-Mobile US. Dar√ºber freue ich mich sehr, denn er hat in seinen bisherigen Stationen bei der Telekom als Deutschland- und vorher Europachef hervorragende Arbeit geleistet. Er wird gemeinsam mit unserem USA-CEO Mike Sievert wichtige Impulse f√ºr den weiteren Erfolg der TMUS und der Deutschen Telekom setzen -¬†gerade auch wenn es um die Nutzung unserer Gr√∂√üenvorteile geht. Mit Rodrigo Diehl verj√ºngen wir den Vorstand und gewinnen eine starke F√ºhrungspers√∂nlichkeit aus dem Telekom-Team f√ºr unser Deutschland-Gesch√§ft. Seine internationalen Erfolge in der Zeit vor der Telekom, aber auch bei uns im Europabereich und in Magenta √ñsterreich, unterstreichen dies deutlich. Srini und Rodrigo stehen f√ºr das, was uns bei der Telekom antreibt: Wachstum, Innovation und Kundenorientierung.Alle diese Entscheidungen unterstreichen eins. Wir wollen nicht nur √ºberall f√ºhrend sein, sondern Verantwortung √ºbernehmen. Ich danke dem Aufsichtsrat der Deutschen Telekom und insbesondere Frank Appel. Ich bin √ºberzeugt, dass wir f√ºr die Zukunft der Telekom gut aufgestellt sind. Jetzt gilt: Machen. hashtag#wewonststophashtag#linkedindachnews

In der vergangenen Woche durfte ich zahlreiche Journalistinnen und Journalisten aus der Rhein-Ruhr Region zu unserem schon traditionellen energiewirtschaftlichen Jahresauftakt im Essener Museum Folkwang begr√º√üen. Wir haben √ºber die Themen gesprochen, die uns allen auf den N√§geln brennen: Energiewende und B√ºrokratie, Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit und Innovationskraft, Europa im neuen Spiel der M√§chte.¬†Ich habe deutlich gemacht, dass 2025 in meinen Augen ein entscheidendes Jahr sein wird ‚Äì f√ºr Deutschland und Europa. Der Energiewende kommt hierbei eine tragende Rolle zu. E.ON bekennt sich zur Energiewende. Denn dies ist sowohl √∂kologisch wie √∂konomisch der sinnvollste Weg. Wir m√ºssen uns aber Gedanken machen, WIE wir die Energiewende angehen.-¬†Erstens: Unsere Energiepolitik muss bedarfs- und marktorientierter sowie pragmatischer werden. Weg vom planwirtschaftlichen Ansatz mit Detailzielen. Dieses unflexible Vorgehen macht es am Ende f√ºr Kunden unverh√§ltnism√§√üig und unn√∂tig teuer.-¬†Zweitens: Erneuerbare sind heute marktf√§hig. Deshalb sollten wir schnell entscheiden, wie wir sie in den Markt ‚Äûentlassen‚Äú. Und nat√ºrlich geh√∂rt dazu auch, dass die Investoren in Erneuerbare selbst Verantwortung √ºbernehmen und ihre Mengen- und Preisrisiken tragen, statt die Folgen und Kosten ihres Handelns einfach √ºber das Netz zu sozialisieren. - Drittens: Die Digitalisierung der Energieinfrastruktur ist ein entscheidender Hebel f√ºr mehr Effizienz und Flexibilit√§t. Ein fl√§chendeckender Rollout von Smart Metern ist eine Grundvoraussetzung, um dynamische und flexible Tarife in jeden Haushalt zu bringen. Das hilft dem Netz und dem Portemonnaie der Menschen.-¬†Viertens: Die politischen Verantwortungstr√§ger verstehen, dass es insbesondere in der Energiepolitik weniger um Einzelma√ünahmen auf gesetzgeberischer Ebene geht. Was wir brauchen, ist eine allgemeine Kurskorrektur in Richtung weniger B√ºrokratie, weniger Dirigismus, und stattdessen mehr Innovation, damit die Energiewende eine Erfolgsgeschichte wird.Wir bei E.ON verstehen und als Playmaker der Energiewende und werden diese mit der Bereitstellung der Energieinfrastruktur und unseren Kundenl√∂sungen auch im Jahr 2025 voranbringen. hashtag#playmaker

Thanks, Hashtag#Davos ‚Äì grateful for many inspiring conversations and insights at Hashtag#WEF2025. After each World Economic Forum, everyone wants to know THE single takeaway that is going to define the year ahead. And usually, there is a consensus. That's less true this year. But for me, three things stood out above the rest:First, AI was everywhere, of course. And the technology has not yet reached it's full maturity. It's only getting started. I'm especially excited about the opportunities AI agents will create in the industrial world. The new U.S. government was another big topic. And so was the weakening competitiveness of the EU and the need to streamline regulations to catalyze growth.  Would love to hear what topics you think will define 2025.

What one small thing could I do today to improve safety?This is the question we need to ask ourselves all the time. We owe it to our people. And this is why the leadership team of E.ON plus the Health&Safety Leaders spend a day together in Essen yesterday at the start of the year. How can we achieve it, that all our people return home daily? What can we learn from each other? And what can everybody of us do? We also celebrated great examples. Like the outstanding project in Hungary represented by Henriett Dar√°zs and Bal√°zs Kocsis. This initiative exemplifies our commitment to creating a safer work environment through innovation and dedication. The team developed and implemented a customized contractor development program, achieving remarkable results with over 2,000 safety inspections carried out in 2024. As we the project moves to the next phase, the focus will be on sustaining these impressive results and involving new contractors to extend this culture of safety even further. Congratulations to the entire team! The team were presented with a donation check for 1,000 euros to be used for social purposes.Another personal highlight of the summit was the inspiring keynote by Dr Andrew Sharman, Chief Executive of IILSC, Founder & Chairman at One Percent Safer, who emphasized a fundamental truth: a strong Health & Safety culture starts with top leadership. When management shows genuine interest in the well-being of its employees, it lays the foundation for a positive cultural shift. It‚Äôs on us as leaders to set the direction for Health & Safety by demonstrating that we truly care, by serving as role models, by sharing personal experiences and by asking ourselves the question: What one small thing could I do today to improve safety?

Seit meiner Kindheit habe ich davon getr√§umt, Feuerwehrmann zu werden ‚Äì deswegen habe ich mich auch sehr √ºber den Helm gefreut, der mich direkt an meine Kindheitstr√§ume erinnert hat! üòâOTE ist bereits ein wichtiger Innovationstreiber und tr√§gt ma√ügeblich zu unserem EU-Segment ‚Äì und wird weiter wachsen, um die digitale Zukunft Griechenlands zu gestalten.In einer Town Hall mit dem Top-Management-Team haben wir √ºber Wachstum, Zusammenarbeit und F√ºhrung in diesen sich schnell ver√§ndernden Zeiten gesprochen. √úbrigens fand das Ganze an meinem griechischen Namenstag statt üòâ (der hier oft wichtiger als ein Geburtstag ist!). Daneben habe ich auch junge Talente bei OTE getroffen, um √ºber Karrierewege zu sprechen. Sie haben neue Impulse geben, wie wir die Zusammenarbeit weiter verbessern und ihre berufliche Entwicklung noch besser f√∂rdern k√∂nnen.Ein gro√ües Dankesch√∂n an Kostas Nebis und das gro√üartige Team von OTE f√ºr eure herzliche Gastfreundschaft, euren Optimismus und eure hervorragende Arbeit. January has been an especially busy month so far, but the last few days at the World Economic Forum in Hashtag#Davos have been a clear highlight for me. This year, the event‚Äôs taking place under the theme ‚Äúcollaboration for the intelligent age‚Äù and true to this spirit, it‚Äôs been a great opportunity to meet with customers, partners, government representatives, and media from around the world.  As we get ready to leave Davos, there‚Äôs a clear sense of excitement around the potential of Hashtag#AgenticAI, both for business and society as a whole. AI is a major lever to address the challenges facing the world today. Last year at SAP, we delivered over 130 Gen AI use cases for every business function, from Supply Chain to Finance. Now, with the emergence of agentic AI capabilities, we‚Äôre at the start of an exciting new chapter. AI Agents can support and mirror human collaboration, working together to combine their expertise and perform multi-step workflows across end-to-end business processes. Imagine, for example, sales agents that not only drive demand but communicate that increase to supply chain agents, which in turn collaborate with procurement agents to make sure the needed materials are delivered on time.  At the end of this week, it‚Äôs also very clear that there are still many questions we need to answer to ensure we have everything we need to best unleash this potential. To go back to the Hashtag#WEF25's motto, collaboration ‚Äì across departments, companies, and borders ‚Äì is absolutely key for the intelligent age. Especially here in Europe, this is the moment when the EU must join forces and fully focus on digitalization and technology. Overregulation and fragmented markets can only hinder our ability to innovate.  Finally, a huge thank you to the entire team who worked together across the company to make this such a great event for all our guests at the SAP House ‚Äì congratulations on a great job!

Skill-up! A united world is more prosperous, more resilient, and more prepared. At Allianz, fostering unity is foundational to creating the conditions for prosperity and resilience that in turn shape a better future.  To do this, we must address what people clearly tell us matters most to them and provide for their essential needs: safety, affordable healthcare and housing, jobs, and infrastructure. The collective ability to deliver on this social contract is increasingly being challenged, notably in light of more frequent and severe natural catastrophes, and new systems and solutions are required. These will demand courageous leadership that crosses party lines, bold and creative thinking, and cross-sector collaboration.  The World Economic Forum annual meeting in Davos presents an important platform for business and world leaders to address the underlying factors driving the trust gap and to explore collaborative solutions. I am here at Davos this week with my Allianz colleagues to strengthen the partnerships needed for a collective response to polarization and rebuilding social cohesion. I‚Äôm discussing these themes at Davos on a panel addressing ‚ÄúThe Rise of Economic Nationalism,‚Äù in a conversation with Karen Tso from CNBC and on Allianz.com in the article titled ‚ÄúWhy the power of unity is key to building a more prosperous world‚Äù. You can view all these materials via the links below. Thank you to Karen Tso for the opportunities to share my thinking on creating a more united and therefore a more prosperous future. We‚Äôre in this together. I welcome hearing your perspectives.  hashtag#WEF2025 hashtag#PowerOfUnity hashtag#Allianz

The Global Risks Report 2025 reveals that our world's most pressing concerns have shifted dramatically.¬†It reinforces my belief that¬†strategic foresight and adaptability will be crucial in navigating the challenges ahead.The world in darkness ‚Äì that is the conclusion of the document traditionally released ahead of the World Economic Forum. Which is understandable when we look at the geopolitical situation: State armed conflicts, which were not considered a major risk two years ago, have become the most immediate threat in 2025.It is also understandable that security and Hashtag#resilience are now increasingly coming into focus in the global discourse. And it is right that states, societies, and the economy prepare themselves accordingly. But this must not lead to further isolation and antagonistic behavior.And we certainly must not lose sight of what is still seen as the greatest long-term risk: preserving our natural resources. The repercussions of climate change¬†continue to be the greatest concerns for people over the next ten years.Fortunately, there are many good solutions here, also thanks to high-quality Hashtag#plastics. With this in mind, let's counter the risks report with a quantum of hope and work together to find more solutions ‚Äì¬†and implement them consistently.

I just set foot in Davos for the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting. And to be honest, I arrived with very mixed feelings. On the one hand, I am full of excitement about all the new technological advancements and optimism that we will utilize these advancements for the benefit of everyone, everywhere. On the other, I feel a deep concern in the face of a more and more polarizing world and continuously challenged trust in one another. This is the elephant in the room ‚Äì or better: the alpine village, and we must name it to make it disappear. Nevertheless, my optimism weighs heavier than any elephant. ;) This year‚Äôs theme at the WEF, ‚ÄúCollaboration for the Intelligent Age,‚Äù underpins and fits very well to the work we‚Äôve been doing with partners and governments across the globe to improve access to care and bring medical technology to patients in places where it was not possible before. For instance, Siemens Healthineers is proud to play an active role in the Global Alliance for Women's Health. We‚Äôve assembled a multi-sectoral breast and cervical cancer coalition in Kenya and Zambia that aims to empower communities to manage the growing burden of cancer. I‚Äôll have the chance to share more details about these efforts as part of the CEO plenary during the Healthcare Governors Meeting with Robert C. Garrett, Michel Demar√©, and Ms. Shobana Kamineni on Tuesday and then the following day on the Investing in Women‚Äôs Health panel with Dr. Muhammad Ali Pate, Catherine Russell, Anita Zaidi, and Fifi Peters.It‚Äôs an honor to represent our company at Davos again and embrace the opportunity to listen, learn, reinforce the importance of collaboration, and discover new ways to do so. Let's lift that elephant now.

Die Fakten zeigen deutlich: Der Industriestandort Deutschland kann nur zukunftsf√§hig sein, wenn wir jetzt handeln. Die Bundestagswahl 2025 muss ein Wendepunkt werden.In meinen Gespr√§chen mit Kollegen, Partnern und politischen Entscheidungstr√§gern wird eines immer wieder klar: Deutschland verliert an Boden. Die Grafik beleuchtet vier kritische Bereiche:1.¬†Wirtschaftliche Entwicklung: Seit zwei Jahren befinden wir uns in einer Rezession. Es wird erwartet, dass Deutschland 2025 so wenig wachsen wird wie keine andere Industrienation.2. Kostenbelastung: Die Energiekosten sind im internationalen Vergleich extrem hoch. Steigende Lohnnebenkosten und eine hohe Steuerlast belasten zus√§tzlich. Das macht Investitionen in den Standort unattraktiv.3. Standortqualit√§t: Die Infrastruktur hinkt hinterher. Wir kommen mit dem Ausbau unserer Stromnetze nicht nach und der Fachkr√§ftemangel wird zunehmend zur Achillesferse unserer Wirtschaft.4. Transformationsdynamik: Die Anpassung an globale Megatrends wie die Verkehrswende geht zu langsam voran. B√ºrokratie und langwierige Genehmigungsverfahren bremsen uns aus.Diese Herausforderungen sp√ºren wir in der deutschen Industrie jeden Tag. Wir sehen aber auch das enorme Potenzial, das Deutschland hat. Denn erfreulicherweise sind nach wie vor einige Kacheln in der Grafik gr√ºn ‚Äì eine Basis, auf die es sich zu Bauen lohnt.Die Bundestagswahl 2025 k√∂nnte ein entscheidender Moment sein, um die Weichen f√ºr die Zukunft zu stellen. Machen wir was draus!Quelle Grafik: BCG/IW-Studie "Transformationspfade f√ºr das Industrieland Deutschland", Sept. 2024, im Auftrag des BDI (https://lnkd.in/g6c8bdBh)

How long do you want to live? 120 years is the ambition, in good physical and mental health.So says Dr. Hadi Saleh, physician and CEO of CeramTec ‚Äì The Ceramic Experts. He has written a book about longevity in which he describes how he wants to become one of the oldest people in history. And why.The topic is socially exciting. Talking about longevity has become very present in these years. With Hadi I met somebody who touches this topic with a sense of pragmatism. I like that very much.But it also contains many things that companies can learn from. Purpose, ambition, transparency. That's why I invited Hadi to my video format "Expect the Unexpected". To kick things off, we talked about how we both ensure a healthy life in this first video. The same applies here as in many other areas: No pain, no gain.The conversation resulted in several videos, which I will publish in the coming weeks. Stay tuned.Thank you Hadi for the exciting talk and thank you Dr. Thomas Ramge for moderating. How long do you want to live?

In recent years, we in Europe have spent a lot of time thinking about ‚Äúhow‚Äù we want to live. In 2025, we need to find answers to the question of ‚Äúwhat‚Äù we want to live on. Because for Europe to continue to offer us protection and an intact living environment in the future, we need growth and a functioning business model. However, this requires us to face reality and sit down as a society. To achieve more growth, we need to work harder, invest more and finally become bolder - for example in the use of future technologies such as artificial intelligence. The positive thing is that the chances of a real new start are not so bad. The new European Commission wants to concentrate fully on increasing European competitiveness in its new term of office. In doing so, it will be important that it does not fall back into old patterns of dirigisme and planned economy. After a total of 13,000 legal acts adopted in the past four years, it will have to be reminded of this.In Germany, new elections could save us almost 8 months of paralyzing gridlock and superfluous election campaigns. Instead, a courageous government will then have the chance to implement real, perhaps painful, reforms so that Germany can relinquish the red lantern in terms of economic growth among the G7 countries and finally become a European economic engine.A secure, sustainable and affordable energy supply remains a pillar of a strong economy. And we must finally abandon the naive idea that it is enough to simply place wind turbines and PV systems in the landscape.‚ÄúWhy‚Äù was shown in a particularly drastic way by the Central European dark doldrums ‚Äì in German we call in Dunkelflauten ‚Äì in November and December 2024, which were unusual in their severity but not in their nature. Exchange electricity prices shot up within a few hours to around ten times the usual price. This has created a greater understanding of the fact that our energy system is still far from being equipped for the volatility of renewables ‚Äì not just in such extreme situations, but in general. The result is rising inefficiencies and system costs, which will increasingly become an economic burden if we do not take countermeasures. The willingness to invest in an energy transition 2.0 is there. E.ON alone is planning to drive forward the modernization and expansion of the energy infrastructure from 2024 to 2028 with investments of ‚Ç¨42 billion. However, we also have to earn our investments first. In a weakening economy, attractive regulatory and political framework conditions are therefore all the more important. The same applies here as for economic policy in general: if we want innovation and digitalization, we need economic incentives instead of bureaucratic hurdles and small-scale targets.In other words: We need to work together, especially now in this difficult environment, to ensure that new energy works. That would be at least a partial answer to the question of how we want to live in the future.
Another year of memorable moments is coming to an end. I'm looking forward to what #2025 will bring! Wishing everyone a happy and successful start to the Hashtag#NewYear!

2024 was largely marked by bad news and devastating headlines. But instead of dwelling on what has gone wrong, let's look at the successes that can give us confidence for the new year. Here are a few that stuck with me.Mobility: Global electric car sales surged in the first quarter of 2024, increasing by 25% compared to the same period in 2023. If this trend continues as predicted, there could be 17 million EVs bought in 2024, more than double the 2021 figures.Medicine: The drug Lenacapavir can protect people effectively against new infections with HIV, marking a potential game-changer in the fight against the virus.Renewable Energy: Global renewable capacity is expected to exceed 4,500 GW by the end of 2024, equating to the combined power capacity of China and the United States.Artificial Intelligence: AI significantly impacted the breakthroughs in chemistry and physics honoured with the 2024 Nobel Prizes, exemplifying its revolutionary power in science.Politics: Voter turnout in the European Union‚Äôs 2024 elections increased for the second consecutive time, obviously reflecting a growing interest in becoming an active part in shaping our future instead of a being a pure bystander.A few examples from many that show: Progress is feasible, and it happens ‚Äì step by step. Thanks to our ingenuity and the power of collaboration and willingness to engage. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm convinced: A better, truly sustainable world does not have to remain a utopia.Which ‚Äúgood news‚Äù from 2024 will you remember most?

Hier ein paar Buchempfehlungen von mir zum Abschluss des Jahres:- Die ‚ÄûApologie des Sokrates‚Äú von Plato: Zeitloser Gewinn f√ºr den Geist. Habe ich neulich statt der letzten Fassung der EnWG Novelle gelesen und mich dann besser gef√ºhlt. - ‚ÄûMetro 2033‚Äú von Dimitry Glukhovsky: Liest sich wie ein d√ºsterer Science-Fiction Roman von Dostojewski vermengt mit bei√üender Gesellschaftskritik und l√§sst den Leser am Ende komplett sprachlos zur√ºck. - ‚ÄûThe World for Sale‚Äú der Investigativjournalisten Blas und Farchy: Die wenig bekannte Geschichte der Commoditytrader und ihrer Rolle in der Entwicklung der Weltwirtschaft √ºber die letzten Jahrzehnte. Dieses Buch schlie√üt die Verst√§ndnisl√ºcke. Faszinierend!

Business leaders like Allianz have a dual responsibility: first, to look over the horizon to shape and secure the future of society and those we serve, and second, to look inward at how our values align with our actions.  The disciplines of sustainability and diversity demonstrate how these principles work together, integrating our values with actions in support of our long-term business strategy. For this reason, both topics were part of my presentation to the capital markets this month. Since then, we have received further recognition for not just promises, but results.  The Dow Jones Sustainability Index once again selected our company as one of the top sustainable companies in the insurance industry. Further, with a score of 89 out of 100 in the 2024 S&P Global Corporate Sustainability Assessment, investors can gauge how deeply sustainability is embedded in our strategy and operations. Similarly, a diverse workforce, balanced leadership, and an inclusive talent strategy are also seen as a strong signal of management quality. This is because a wide range of perspectives in our workforce enable us to innovate, judge wisely, and address complex global challenges in a holistic way. Diversity by design has been a priority of my tenure as CEO, and it was a moment of great pride when this month, four of my colleagues on the Allianz SE Board of Management were recognized among the 100 most influential women in German business by manager magazin and Boston Consulting Group (BCG). Most special to me, they were recognized as a team. Congratulations to Sirma Boshnakova, Claire-Marie Coste-Lepoutre, Barbara Karuth-Zelle, and particularly to Renate Wagner, who is the Board Member who has People & Culture as part of her portfolio of responsibilities, for being named "Prima Inter Pares" on this esteemed list! Such success stories don‚Äôt come by chance. They are the result of a long-term strategy to encourage and develop female leadership, supported by measures such as monitoring targets or growing mentoring and sponsorship networks. 44% of Allianz SE Board members are women ‚Äì the highest ratio among DAX-40 companies. Women constitute 52% of our staff¬†and 34% of our top managers. These are results shaped by ‚Äúinclusive meritocracy‚Äù ‚Äì we create opportunities for more people, but to get to the top, you have to deliver.  Our convictions motivate us, but our actions define us. This month showed that our efforts in sustainability and diversity, and self-reinforcing, and an intelligent approach to both helps us create meaningful value for our customer and shareholders. ¬†We see diversity, also encompassing dimensions by generation, religion, sexual orientation, nationality and ethnic backgrounds, not only as a moral imperative, but as a practical one that underpins our sustainability efforts and helps us drive meaningful outcomes for our customers while building a more resilient, and secure future.  Hashtag#Allianz

As we close out 2024, I want to reflect on what we have achieved together at thyssenkrupp. It has been a year of challenges, but also one of remarkable progress that highlights our strength, resilience, and ability to shape the future.We are driving the Hashtag#decarbonization of industries with groundbreaking solutions from thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies. Our achievements? To name just a few: thyssenkrupp Uhde is enabling Fertiberia to decarbonize an ammonia plant, thyssenkrupp rothe erde is setting new standards for wind turbines with the PBU, thyssenkrupp Polysius is delivering technology for one of the first CO2-neutral cement plants, & thyssenkrupp nucera has been selected as preferred supplier for Cepsa‚Äôs 300 MW electrolyzer. At thyssenkrupp Automotive, we are driving the Hashtag#mobility of tomorrow with products like the climate compressor ‚Äì clear proof of our ability to meet the needs of the automotive sector, even in challenging times. thyssenkrupp Materials Services strengthened its presence in North America & Mexico while advancing its "Materials-as-a-Service" strategy with Hashtag#digital innovations & tailored solutions for our customers. And thyssenkrupp Marine Systems achieved big milestones, such as the order expansion in the 212CD program, & is progressing strongly with its strategic standalone positioning. thyssenkrupp Steel remains in the midst of transformation, and I understand the uncertainty this creates. We are committed to finding the best solution, for example, through secured financial backing for the next two years.  The time ahead remain challenging, but challenges always bring opportunities. We are absolutely certain that the market ramp-up for green technologies will come ‚Äì even if it takes longer than we had hoped. To seize these opportunities, we must work together. Collaboration, dialogue, and determination are key to finding solutions. Hashtag#thyssenkrupp is full of potential, and we are just getting started. Across all segments, we are building the solutions of tomorrow, ensuring we remain a leader in innovation, sustainability, and performance. Together, we will move forward toward a stronger, more sustainable future.  To our leadership team and to our outstanding Hashtag#GENERATIONTK: thank you. Your hard work, dedication, and creativity drive us forward every single day. You are the reason for our success. Wishing you and your loved ones a joyful holiday season and a happy, healthy start to 2025. Together, we have achieved so much ‚Äì and I know we will accomplish even more. For a future worth living, for us and for next generations. In short: engineering. tomorrow. together.

The power of we.When it comes to growth, the ‚Äòwe‚Äô is stronger than the ‚Äòme‚Äô. Mutual support within teams is crucial for personal and corporate growth.As a CEO, I see myself as part of the team. Recently, some colleagues asked me for advice on some issues. During our dialogue, we made short videos to share with you ‚Äì true to the motto ‚Äògrowing together‚Äô. In the first video, I talked to Janina Tarnowski from HDI in Germany about hashtag#transparency.Here are our key messages:üëâ Transparency is not about control, micromanagement nor shaming. It's about building trust, accepting failure as part of a learning process, and growing together!üëâ Team reviews can be very helpful, but personal feedback is even more effective.üëâ Before feedback sessions, both the feedback giver and feedback receiver should prepare a specific question to ensure valuable dialogue and mutual growth.Remember: transparency is a journey, not a destination. Through transparency, we can build trust, drive progress, and grow together.How do you promote transparency at work? How do you grow together?Share your thoughts in the comments below! üëá

Vor 75 Jahren wurde das Grundgesetz verabschiedet. Es ist die DNA unserer Demokratie. F√ºr mich ist das Grundgesetz zudem unser im Alltag oft ‚Äûunsichtbarer Superheld‚Äú, der unsere Freiheit erm√∂glicht und unsere Demokratie gut ‚Äûim Griff‚Äú h√§lt. Um unser Grundgesetz sichtbarer zu machen und Impulse f√ºr unser Zusammenleben zu setzen, hat die Initiative Hashtag#DNAofDemocracy u.a. ein besonderes Buchprojekt gestartet. Die Tinte f√ºr dieses Buch hat ‚Äûes‚Äú in sich. N√§mlich das Grundgesetz - als DNA-Micropartikel. Auch ich war eingeladen, mich an dem Buch zu beteiligen und den Satz ‚ÄûDemokratie muss‚Ä¶‚Äú zu erg√§nzen.Mein erster Impuls war - im Sinne von Lessings Nathan dem Weisen (‚ÄûKein Mensch muss m√ºssen‚Äú) ‚Äì zu schreiben: Demokratie muss gar nichts. Sie ist erfolgreiches Mittel zum Zweck. Und dieser Zweck ist es unter anderem, Freiheit, pers√∂nliche Entfaltung, Gemeinschaft und vieles mehr m√∂glich zu machen. Ihr Zweck ist, jedem eine Stimme zu geben. Auch Minderheiten zu sch√ºtzen. Konsens zu finden f√ºr eine Gesellschaft, die gemeinschaftlich entscheidet, wie wir Gemeinwohl gestalten.Und doch bin ich √ºberzeugt: Demokratie muss Wohlstand schaffen. Etwa, weil ohne materielle Absicherung freiheitliche Entfaltung schwer denkbar ist. Aber wohl vor allem, weil Demokratie ohne Wohlstand die Anh√§nger verliert, die sie zum Selbsterhalt braucht. Wohlstand sichert somit nicht nur pers√∂nliche Bed√ºrfnisse. Sondern Wohlstand sichert ein Gemeinwesen, das Rechtsstaatlichkeit, Freiheit, Menschenw√ºrde, Teilhabe aber auch Schutz vor staatlicher Willk√ºr garantiert. Also all das, was wir in unserem Grundgesetz gemeinsam verfasst haben. Gute Wirtschaftspolitik ist darum immer auch gute Demokratiepolitik.Gutes Wirtschaften ‚Äì und das ist ein Auftrag an Unternehmen ‚Äì kann so gesehen ein Beitrag zu Demokratie sein. The business of business ist also nicht nur business. Sondern immer: business mit purpose. Es geht einher mit sozialer, ja sogar demokratischer Verantwortung. Darum engagiert sich die Deutsche Telekom stets √ºber den Shareholder Value, der √ºbrigens Wohlstand schafft, hinaus.Dazu z√§hlt Artikel 1 unseres Grundgesetzes. Denn auch die ‚Äûdigitale W√ºrde des Menschen‚Äú muss unantastbar sein und vor staatlichen und privaten Akteuren gesch√ºtzt werden.¬†Auch die virtuelle Welt muss entlang der Werte organisiert sein, die wir in unserem Grundgesetz verfasst haben. Daf√ºr setzen wir als Telekom uns ein und setzen darum Zeichen etwa gegen ‚ÄûHass im Netz‚Äú oder mit der Kampagne ‚ÄûNachricht von Ella‚Äú zum Schutz von Pers√∂nlichkeitsrechten unserer Kinder.Demokratie muss nicht. Aber sie kann und leistet so vieles. Darum m√ºssen wir! Uns f√ºr sie einsetzen. Uns engagieren. Nicht nur kritisieren, sondern: Machen!Ein Hoch auf unser Grundgesetz, unseren verl√§sslichen H√ºter.Hashtag#demokratiemuss

2024 reminded us that resilience isn‚Äôt built in calm waters ‚Äì it‚Äôs forged in the face of challenges. Whether through supporting our customers with compassion, speed, and impact, through disaster relief efforts or through matching employee donations to aid recovery, we worked to make a meaningful difference when people needed it most.But 2024 was about more than weathering challenges. This year showcased the power of trust, connection, and customer focus as our greatest strengths. Securing the future starts by building communities and strengthening the bonds that unite us. Our financial performance as well as our records in customer satisfaction and employee engagement demonstrated what we know to be true: putting people first drives sustainable growth.As we turn to 2025, we‚Äôre carrying this spirit forward. We plan to expand programs like‚ÄØthe Power of Unity‚ÄØaimed at advancing sustainability, digital literacy and community-building, while continuing to tackle global challenges like climate change and cyber risks with innovative solutions that deliver value for our customers and communities. All of these efforts reflect our belief that a brighter future is possible when we face it with purpose, unity and innovative solutions.To our Allianz team: Thank you for an exceptional 2024. And to our customers, partners and friends: Thank you for trusting us to be part of your life. Wishing everyone a joyful holiday season and a Merry Christmas. Hashtag#Allianz

Wohlstand von morgen entsteht durch mehr Arbeit und mehr Produktivit√§tDer sprichw√∂rtliche ‚ÄûFlei√ü der Deutschen‚Äú hat uns nicht nur in aller Welt viel Anerkennung, sondern auch unseren heutigen Wohlstand gebracht. Fakt ist aber: Wir Deutschen arbeiten heute im OECD-Vergleich am wenigsten! Und das, obwohl wir gleichzeitig zum Beispiel gegen√ºber den USA seit den 90er Jahren Jahr f√ºr Jahr an Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit verlieren. Das hei√üt im Klartext: Das Arbeitsangebot in Deutschland wird immer knapper, weil wir immer weniger Stunden arbeiten. Und das, was wir mit der geleisteten Arbeitsstunde erreichen, erzielt im Vergleich zu anderen L√§ndern immer weniger Wertsch√∂pfung. Beides k√∂nnen wir uns schlicht und einfach nicht mehr leisten. Solange wir nicht produktiver werden, kann Deutschland seine Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit nur steigern, wenn wir wieder deutlich mehr arbeiten. Die geringe Arbeitszeit ist das Ergebnis im internationalen Vergleich geringer Wochenarbeitszeiten, hoher Urlaubsanspr√ºche, hoher Krankenst√§nde und hoher Teilzeitquote. Das sind alles keine gottgegebenen Gr√ºnde. Zum Beispiel zur Teilzeitquote: Selbst da, wo Vollzeit famili√§r m√∂glich ist, kommen viele Paare zu dem Ergebnis, dass sich Vollzeitarbeit f√ºr beide Partner gar nicht lohnt. Weil am Ende von dem Mehr an Brutto Netto praktisch kaum etwas √ºbrigbleibt. Wir m√ºssen umsteuern. Arbeit muss sich lohnen. Das ist in Deutschland Ende 2024 leider keine Plattit√ºde, sondern ein Handlungsauftrag an eine k√ºnftige Bundesregierung. Mit dem Ausscheiden der Babyboomer sinkt das Angebot potenzieller Arbeitskr√§fte noch weiter. Auch deshalb muss die Pro-Kopf-Arbeitszeit wieder steigen, wenn wir vom Fleck kommen wollen. Denn der Wohlstand von morgen entsteht nur durch mehr Arbeit heute und nicht durch die Umverteilung des Reichtums von gestern.

Bei der Bundestagswahl im Februar muss es um die besten Konzepte f√ºr mehr Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit von Deutschland und auch Europa gehen. Wenn wir nicht deutlich umsteuern, werden wir unseren Wohlstand nicht erhalten k√∂nnen und schon gar nicht in der Lage sein zus√§tzliche Wohltaten zu verteilen. Das deutsche Wirtschaftswachstum stagniert, w√§hrend die Wirtschaft in anderen Industrienationen w√§chst. Nicht erst seit der Corona-Pandemie und dem Ausbruch des Ukraine-Kriegs steht unsere Wirtschaft vor gro√üen strukturellen Herausforderungen: - Der Demografische Wandel senkt das Erwerbspersonenpotential und versch√§rft die Fachkr√§fteknappheit.- Der fortschreitende Klimawandel erfordert Investitionen f√ºr Energiewende und Dekarbonisierung von Industrie und Mobilit√§tssektor.- Der technologische Wandel und Digitalisierung ver√§ndern Arbeitswelt und Gesch√§ftsmodelle grundlegend.- Die Globalisierung mit neuen geopolitischen Strukturen stellt internationale Unternehmen vor Herausforderungen.Reformen fallen leichter, wenn der Handlungsdruck gro√ü ist. Deswegen ist die momentane Krise auch eine Chance. Was wir jetzt brauchen, sind st√§rkere Potenzialnutzung, mehr Mut, mehr Chancenorientierung, und mehr Konsequenz. Auf diese Stichworte m√∂chte ich in den kommenden Tagen n√§her eingehen ‚Äì auf Basis spannender Daten, die das Ifo-Institut erhoben hat.

Europe‚Äôs power sector and industries are in the midst of titanic transitions, disrupted by geopolitical challenges that are hampering our competitiveness. Yesterday‚Äôs Eurelectric roundtable made clear that the power sector needs a business case to invest at scale in generation, grids and storage whilst industrial consumers need a business case to electrify - the potential for electrification is huge and undisputed! And flexibility is the holy grail: too many negative hours are not good for power developers and make it difficult for industry to hedge. We need to think about the system and make sure price signals are in place for everyone to electrify, avoid shifting costs between consumers and leverage heating and mobility flexibility to lower system costs for everyone. Chapeau to Eurelectric for organising and thanks to all our partners who participated. If there is political will, there is a way to make electricity the main pillar of Europe‚Äôs energy security.

For the insurance industry, the idea of being a customer-centric organization is actually a radical idea. Historically, insurers designed a product and carried the risk, leaving distribution to others. It was long thought that insurance was ‚Äúsold, not bought.‚Äù But today, in our uncertain world, customers want protection and retirement solutions more than ever. They are seeking out partners they can trust. Yesterday‚Äôs Capital Markets Day was a chance for Allianz to show how we are prepared for this moment. Our track record shows that we keep our promises, we have developed service capabilities, built the digital access, increased the strength of our brand and financials, and designed solutions that have created significant value for our stakeholders. These achievements give us the ability to grow. Meanwhile, our strong financial and business resilience earns us the right to grow. We have delivered growth at scale. We have created significant value for our stakeholders. We must now lift our ambitions to a new level and we will deliver on them by focusing on three key levers: üí° First, we will drive smart growth. We will win new customers, increase cross-sell, and reduce churn. üß±¬†Second, we will reinforce our productivity. We will deliver on our productivity agenda and leverage the latest generative AI solutions. üí™¬†Third, we will strengthen our operational and financial resilience. This will be done through a refined capital management framework. Most important, trust ‚Äì earned through consistent execution, service, and relevance ‚Äì remains our competitive advantage. Our resilient value creation is built on this strong foundation. This, and the customer-centric culture that we have built over the past years, underpins our confidence that our growth targets are not just ambitious, but also achievable. Hashtag#Allianz

Last week we finally saw white smoke from Brussels. New Commission, new faces, and new impetus to act on the challenges standing before us. Now it‚Äôs time to turn words into action. What does that mean concretely? Firstly, we need to unlock the huge amounts of investments required for our energy transition. Evolving the Capital Markets Union into a complete Savings & Investments Union, bolstering the mandates of the EIB & ECB and de-risking investments across the board are essential. Failure to do so will simply make Europe less competitive and less able to invest.We also need more implementation on the ground: much, much more. The targets are in place and there should be no excuse for not getting the job done. At E.ON we‚Äôre taking up that challenge. We have to make 8 million connections at the DSO level, 1 every 7 seconds between now and 2030, to meet targets. The numbers are high but not unique to E.ON and it‚Äôs on all of us to use these years to implement our promises.Distribution grid infrastructure is at risk of becoming the bottleneck of the transition if we don‚Äôt build quick enough. Sometimes there seems to be a preference to rather build less than too much ‚Äì let‚Äôs be clear it will not be possible to build too much given how much electrification is coming our way. Cut the permitting time and let‚Äôs get building!One final word on bureaucracy. The EU has been fond of regulating for decades. As pointed out by Mario Draghi in his report, since 2019 the EU had passed around 13,000 pieces of legislation, compared to 3,000 in the United States. The United States has meanwhile taken the lead in the digital sector, while Europe lags behind. I really like President Von der Leyen‚Äôs watchword of ‚Äúmaking Europe simpler and faster‚Äù. Well, we cannot wait any longer! Congratulations and good work to the new European Commission!

We must find ways to do more with less. And that includes less water. My colleague Anja Eimer shared with the World Economic Forum how using digital twins for water system management can enable the resilient, sustainable, efficient water supply we all need ‚Äî a water supply that keeps pace with increasing environmental and population demands. Hashtag#Climate action cannot wait. The urgent global shift toward sustainable energy demands innovation, and at thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies, we‚Äôre proud to be leading advancements that accelerate this transformation. One standout innovation in our portfolio is the Pitch Bearing Unit (PBU) by thyssenkrupp rothe erde. This cutting-edge technology transforms Hashtag#windindustry: the PBU combines blade bearing and pitch drive in one ready-to-install unit. Its modular, plug-and-play design allows seamless integration across various turbine models, simplifying both installation and maintenance. Thanks to its conical shape, the PBU makes it possible to increase the energy yield of wind turbines with larger rotor blades without the need for the hub to increase in size as well. Furthermore, it itself acts as a stiffening element and increases structural stability of the hub. By minimizing logistical challenges and maximizing adaptability, the PBU is set to play a pivotal role in scaling up Hashtag#windenergy worldwide. This breakthrough has fueled a strategic partnership with HAWE Hydraulik SE to elevate the PBU‚Äôs capabilities further. HAWE‚Äôs expertise in hydraulic systems aligns seamlessly with our mission to advance wind technology, offering a resilient, adaptable solution that supports Hashtag#renewableenergy expansion with enhanced reliability and performance. Looking ahead, the future of energy lies in affordable, large-scale green production. Regions like Scandinavia and the Iberian Peninsula have shown that renewable energy can power economies on a massive scale. Europe‚Äôs infrastructure must be equipped to support this shift, channeling cost-competitive green power efficiently across borders. Only with abundant, affordable green electricity can we meet rising demand and sustainably power the industries driving our Hashtag#economy forward. As Hashtag#GENERATIONTK, we are committed to creating a cleaner, more resilient future. Let‚Äôs work together to turn innovative ideas into real, scalable solutions!
Dear hashtag#Lufthansa team, thanks!

The European wind industry stands as an example for many industries in the EU where we have to decide, what we want to fight for. I believe it is worth fighting for the European wind industry as it can create hundreds of thousands of jobs, strengthen our industrial base, and make us less dependent on energy imports. Yesterday, we met with members of the new European Commission and representatives of the European Wind Value Chain. Here we discussed key actions Europe needs to take on wind to enhance competitiveness and economic resilience.Four points I want to highlight:‚è© Drive fair Competition: We need criteria that reflect local value creation, R&D work in Europe, resilience, and cybersecurity in the evaluation of tender processes. A pure price-driven competition will not sustain a European wind industry. ‚è© A balanced business model for Wind: Europe must increase wind power capacity to 425 GW by 2030, adding 200 GW in six years and requiring investment of up to ‚Ç¨400 billion. Such an investment will only materialize if there is a profitable business model for both investors and supply chain companies. This, in turn, will require competitive financing costs and derisking elements such as counter guarantees. ‚è© We need innovation and implementation: The close interlink between innovating and manufacturing is essential to be resilient. Innovation is the entry ticket into a market, but it needs a manufacturing base in Europe to be successful.‚è© General boundary conditions for industry: A reduction of complexity and bureaucracy also helps the wind industry. A key focus needs to be on the productivity of doing business in Europe. We will not get a second shot at this. Initiatives like the Clean Industrial Deal and the Competitiveness Compass that President von der Leyen announced last week need to be delivered so that wind can prosper in Europe.Hashtag#Europe Hashtag#WindIndustry Hashtag#CleanIndustrialDeal

"Paris is not a city, it's a world." That sentiment felt very fitting during my visit there last week, when I met with Nicolas Revel and his team at AP-HP, Assistance Publique - H√¥pitaux de Paris and learned more about their vision to transform healthcare on a global scale.Regarded as one of Europe's top university hospitals, they are boldly on missions to: care for the millions of patients that come through their doors, train today's and shape tomorrow‚Äôs clinical workforce, and drive healthcare research and innovation. These goals are very much resonating with our purpose ‚ÄúWe pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.‚ÄùTherefore, it was a pleasure and honor to sign a global framework agreement to explore collaborations in improving patient care. This agreement will particularly focus on the co-development of systemic solutions in neurology, cardiology, and oncology care pathways, thus having a holistic approach towards patients, from prevention to aftercare. At the same time, it opens doors to creating a stronger dynamic among other members of the European University Hospital Alliance (EUHA), with many of whom we are already collaborating on scientific projects.I'm grateful for the trust that the AP-HP team has placed in us and inspired by what we can achieve together! The industry's twofold role in climate change is not talked about enough. Let me break it down using this graphic. It's well-known that the industrial sector is the world's largest greenhouse gas emitter, responsible for over 1/3 of global emissions in 2019. A significant portion of these emissions comes from using electricity and heat. This is particularly true for energy-intensive industries like chemicals and metals, which contribute considerably to indirect emissions. However, what‚Äôs often overlooked is the industry's critical role in reducing emissions across various sectors, not just its own. Let's take the chemical and plastics industry as an example: In transportation, plastics are pivotal in the development of electric vehicles. Lightweight polycarbonate components help conserve battery life, increasing the range. This accelerates the transition from combustion engines to alternative drives, significantly cutting greenhouse gas emissions in mobility.In the construction sector, plastics contribute to making housing more climate-friendly and affordable. Rigid polyurethane foam serves as an excellent insulator, drastically reducing energy consumption for heating and cooling in buildings.Plastics also drive the energy transformation. Coatings for rotor blades or submarine cable sheathing help make wind turbines more robust against environmental influences, enhancing their durability and extending maintenance intervals.So, we find ourselves at a turning point, with the power to both impact and resolve climate challenge. By continuing our focus on innovation and a circular economy, we can transform the industrial sector into a beacon of climate solutions and further reduce our own emissions. Our path forward is clear: with determination and cross-sectoral collaboration, we can turn climate change around.Hashtag#CircularEconomy Hashtag#FullyCircular

At SAP, we‚Äôre helping these customers do exactly that with sovereign offerings in the US (SAP NS2), Germany (Delos Cloud GmbH and¬†SAP Cloud Infrastructure), Australia, Canada, and the United Kingdom. And for 2025, we‚Äôre planning further extensions of SAP sovereign cloud. The cloud is key to higher performance, competitiveness, and modern innovation.
