My suitcase is packed, and I‚Äôm braced for Chicago‚Äôs icy winds as I head to my 23rd Hashtag#RSNA. Despite the chill, this year feels different‚Äîhere‚Äôs what‚Äôs making it memorable already. No grudges.

Die Telekom hat eine neue Strategie. Das ist unser Schwungrad. Und dem geben wir jetzt noch mehr Schwung. Wie das geht? Dar√ºber habe ich heute mit den Mitarbeitenden der Telekom beim Town Hall gesprochen. Und es war ein besonderes Town Hall. Denn Telekom-Mitarbeitende rund um die Welt waren eingeladen. Und wir haben nicht nur √ºber KI gesprochen. Sondern auch eingesetzt: Mitarbeitende der Telekom haben ein √úbersetzungstool entwickelt. Damit haben wir das Event aus dem Englischen in acht Sprachen gleichzeitig √ºbersetzt: Polnisch, Deutsch, Mazedonisch, Ungarisch, Rum√§nisch, Griechisch, Tschechisch, Kroatisch. Wir sind rund 200.000 Mitarbeitende weltweit. Unsere Zusammenarbeit ist entscheidend. Und wird in Zukunft noch wichtiger sein. Als One Global Company verfolgen wir gemeinsam unsere Strategie: Leading Digital Telco. üåéUnd diese Strategie verdeutlichen wir mit unserem Schwungrad. Das dreht sich weiter, weil wir investieren, Kunden zu Fans machen und effizienter werden. Das beschert uns Finanzzahlen, mit denen wir wieder investieren k√∂nnen. üåÄAber unser Schwungrad darf nicht stillstehen. Deshalb beschleunigen wir es mit zwei neuen Elementen: Daten & KI und globale Skalierung. Wir sind stark positioniert als Telekommunikationsanbieter der westlichen Welt, mit starken S√§ulen in Europa und den USA. Jetzt ist es an uns allen, dass sich das Schwungrad schneller dreht. Daran kann jede und jeder mitwirken. Wenn das ganze Teams den Anspruch hat, Hashtag#leading zu sein, dann verleihen wir unserem Schwungrad noch mehr Schwung. Deshalb ist mein Impuls: Now it‚Äôs your turn!Gemeinsam gestalten wir die Zukunft der Telekom. Und gemeinsam werden wir noch erfolgreicher und besser. Darum habe ich heute auch gesagt: ‚ÄûDas Beste liegt noch vor uns‚Äú. üöÄHashtag#OneGlobalTeam Hashtag#Strategy Hashtag#Telekom

Telekom has a new strategy: our Flywheel. And now, we‚Äôre giving it even more momentum. How? That‚Äôs what I discussed with our employees during today‚Äôs Town Hall. It wasn‚Äôt just any Town Hall: Telekom employees from all around the world were invited. And we didn‚Äôt just talk about AI. We put AI into action: Telekom colleagues developed a translation tool that enabled us to translate the event from English into eight languages simultaneously: Polish, German, Macedonian, Hungarian, Romanian, Greek, Czech, and Croatian. With around 200,000 employees worldwide, collaboration is critical‚Äîand it will only become more important in the future. As One Global Company, we are united in pursuing our strategy: Leading Digital Telco. üåé Our Flywheel illustrates this strategy: it keeps turning because we invest, turn customers into fans, and increase efficiency. This drives financial success, allowing us to reinvest. üåÄ But our Flywheel cannot stand still. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre accelerating it with two new elements: Data & AI and global scaling. We‚Äôre strongly positioned as a telecommunications leader in the Western world, with solid foundations in both Europe and the United States. Now it‚Äôs up to all of us to make the Flywheel spin even faster. Everyone can contribute. When entire teams embrace the goal of being Hashtag#leading, we‚Äôll give our Flywheel even more power. That‚Äôs why my message is clear: Now it‚Äôs your turn! Together, we‚Äôre shaping Telekom‚Äôs future. And together, we‚Äôll become even more successful. That‚Äôs why I said today: ‚ÄúThe best is yet to come.‚Äù üöÄHashtag#OneGlobalTeam Hashtag#Strategy Hashtag#Telekom

It was a pleasure to take the Eurelectric Grids for Speed study on tour, this time to the Czech Republic and to policymakers in Prague. It's on us, the incoming Commission who have just been confirmed and industry to support the energy transition from the ground, in EU countries where it actually happens. The investment need for expanding our distribution grid infrastructure is apparent across Europe and the Czech Republic is no different. In Prague as well, finances are tight, industry is in a competitiveness battle and affordability is top of the domestic agenda. The Grids for Speed study concludes we need to almost double annual investments across the EU in distribution grids: but this is an investment that will pay off and help bring in the enormous amount of electrification that must, and is, coming our way.My takeaway from Prague is positive: there was a strong recognition of the importance distribution grid infrastructure plays and its role in supporting the Czech industrial base. The political priorities are many, but the transition is happening and happening fast. Thanks to Eurelectric for organising, Claudia Viohl, Pavel Cyrani and Kristian Ruby for their participation and dƒõkuji ti ƒåesk√° republiko for playing host!

The need for investment in energy infrastructure is huge, as the opportunities offered by the energy transition are too ‚Äì provided we get it right. Flexibility and affordability of energy are two sides of the same coin. The meeting of our top executives in Essen focused on what this means for E.ON as a playmaker in the energy transition and our billion-euro investments in the transformation. Being a playmaker in this respect also means being open. That's why our guest speaker was the CEO of 1Komma5¬∞, who not only challenged us, but with whom we also share many common concerns. Thank you Philipp Schr√∂der for your exciting impulse on New Energy! Thank you as well to our managers for this energetic exchange! And last but not least: Many thanks to the organizers: Lars A. RosumekSigrid ZickelLuisa HombergOliver HilleAndreas Kaulfu√üCynthia SchmidtMarzena WoltersLeif Erichsen Eva Marisa MalandaFlorian VolmerEmmy Richardsson Dr. Christian DrepperHashtag#MakeNewEnergyWork Hashtag#Itsonus

When I went to school, I wanted to work in the advertising industry. I had no intention of becoming an insurance manager.My path was not straightforward. I started with a banking apprenticeship. Then I studied economics and did several internships in different countries. I learnt how important inspiring leaders are. That's how I found my way into insurance, which is people driven.You sometimes hear: Whoever wants to get to the top starts early. Really?My opinion is that many roads lead to success.Some people discover their talent early on. Many others do it later and are also successful. There are many examples of this in sports: Jannik Sinner, currently the best tennis player in the world, who first celebrated success as a skier.What all successful people have in common:1) The basis is right‚Ü≥Mental and physical health always form the foundation for a successful career.2) Discipline‚Ü≥Talent is important, but the key is to work hard to achieve your goals. Every single day.3) Intrinsic motivation‚Ü≥It is a question of who wants success more. Those who are more willing to go the extra mile.4) Humility‚Ü≥Success is rarely an individual achievement. Humility leads to an appreciation of the strengths of others and helps you to keep learning and developing.5) Luck‚Ü≥The decisive moment can hardly be planned. You need to meet an inspiring person at the right time.What experiences have you had in your career?

Plastic waste is a pressing issue, with 22 million tons ending up in nature annually. However, the current Hashtag#INC5 negotiations in Busan risk going too far, potentially leading to a ban on many essential plastics. This would be a grave mistake.Because plastics are indispensable for making key sectors like energy, industry, agriculture, transport, and buildings more sustainable and climate neutral. So, instead of marginalizing them, we must focus on closing the loop for plastics ‚Äì through recycling and the use of renewable raw materials. A journey our industry has already embarked on.As for INC-5 it remains to say: it's high time for more pragmatism and willingness to compromise on all sides. This is the only way we can get what we really need: a global agreement against plastic pollution that does not deprive plastics of their raison d'√™tre.More on the topic in my latest blog post (link in comments).

‚ÄúTrust is built between people.‚ÄùToday, I had the privilege of engaging in an open dialogue with top agencies from HDI Group ‚Äî an inspiring exchange about the entrepreneurial perspective of agency operations. Many thanks to Thomas L√ºer and Norbert Eickermann for the invitation to this insightful meeting. Because I started my career in sales, I‚Äôm especially happy to have been part of this! Great energy, everybody! An open dialogue allows us to align on current market dynamics, such as integrating digitalization into customer consulting and service.Although we believe that innovative technologies can help us enhancing our services, we also believe that the human touch counts. We are a people business. Trust is built between people - not just through shared successes but also by tackling challenges together. I am proud that we are living up to the expectations of our customers and fulfilling our purpose: ‚ÄòTogether we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship‚Äô.We strongly believe in the future of personal distribution. We aim to strengthen and expand our exclusive sales organisation and thus our relationships with our customers.Let‚Äôs continue shaping the future, together!

Triggered by a very emotional colleague I just skipped through the upcoming EU Due Diligence Directive, starting with article 22. Do it yourself! ‚ÄûMember States shall ensure that companies referred to in [‚Ä¶] adopt and put into effect a transition plan for climate change mitigation [‚Ä¶] The design of the transition plan for climate change mitigation [‚Ä¶] shall contain: (a) time-bound targets related to climate change for 2030 and in five-year steps up to 2050 based on conclusive scientific evidence and, where appropriate, absolute emission reduction targets for greenhouse gas for scope 1, scope 2 and scope 3 greenhouse gas emissions for each significant category; ‚Ä¶.‚Äù Sounds familiar? The last 5-year plans in Europe did all not work.  ‚Äû‚Ä¶ (b) a description of decarbonisation levers identified and key actions planned to reach the targets referred to in point (a), including, where appropriate, changes in the product and service portfolio of the company and the adoption of new technologies; (c) an explanation and quantification of the investments and funding supporting the implementation [‚Ä¶]; ‚Ä¶.‚Äù  Whoever wrote this did never run a company. I am happy if I can meaningfully plan until 2030.  ‚Äû‚Ä¶ and (d) a description of the role of the administrative, management and supervisory bodies with regard to the transition plan for climate change mitigation.‚Äù [Directive (EU) 2024/1760 (CSDDD), Article 22] And just in case any individual can challenge any company on their plans. Certainly, there will be an NGO making this their business.  I must confess: Directives like these kill my believe in simplification of regulation and bureaucracy reduction. Instead, they remind me on historic examples of planned economy which all hopelessly failed. The technocratic aim to micromanage Europe towards sustainability and growth will inevitably lead to the opposite. So, we don‚Äôt need to make such overregulation more practical, we need to drop it. Then we can concentrate on advancing the economy and sustainability in Europe instead of dealing with more reports.

Are COP29‚Äôs results everything we hoped for? No. Is the UN climate summit still important? Yes! Driving change on a global level ‚Äì especially in times of geopolitical tension ‚Äì is fraught with difficulties and imperfections. Over its nearly 30-year history, COP has shown us the necessity of maintaining dialogue and building bridges, even when the path is difficult. Because climate change knows no borders and requires collective action.It is often the small steps made along the way that are more significant than the main announcements made at the gatherings themselves. Looking ahead to future COPs in Brazil and Australia, a much stronger united effort from politics, industry, and finance is needed to harness momentum for a sustainable future. Hashtag#COP29

This chart may look promising to some, but as an industry leader with great circularity ambitions it worries me.Here's why üëáA deeper look into the data from Plastics Europe reveals an alarming 8.3% decline in EU plastic production and a 7.8% drop in mechanically recycled plastics. This contrasts with a global increase in plastic production by 3.4%, reducing Europe's market share to 12%.A development that threatens the European plastics industry, which secures over 1.5 million jobs and generated more than ‚Ç¨365 billion in revenue in 2023. Without a competitive environment, Europe risks losing its leadership in circular plastic innovations, which would have tremendous consequences for the downstream value chain.Plastics play a crucial role in key areas such as energy, mobility, and construction. Some examples: Plastics in wind turbines increase speed and therefore productivity. Lightweight polycarbonate components in electric cars conserve batteries and increase range. Innovative building materials made from plastics save energy and thus reduce CO2¬†emissions.That's why I continue to advocate for a hashtag#CircularEconomy for plastics. Because it is not just an environmental necessity for our own industry but also a strategic imperative for other sectors to reach their own sustainability goals.

‚ÄúAtoms move slower than electrons.‚Äù In other words, when we work digitally instead of mechanically, we can move a whole lot faster. And that‚Äôs one reason the industrial metaverse is so important. A few weeks ago, I enjoyed a great conversation with Jensen Huang about how combining the real and digital worlds enables our customers to keep up with the speed of innovation. One recent example: Our joint customer Foxconn digitally designed a new factory in Mexico ‚Äî and built it in just six months. Six months! A more united world is a more prosperous world. As we come to the close of a year where elections will have been held in more than 70 nations, Allianz has launched this week a multi-year Power of Unity program in conjunction with the 2024 Social Resilience Index.Polarization slows economic growth and threatens our customers‚Äô sense of security and optimism. Our customers and shareholders tells us that they see polarization as damaging to their economic prosperity and their personal wealth. Thus, it is clear to us that Allianz has a responsibility to strengthen common ground. We will do by addressing people‚Äôs fears and solving the problems that matter most to them. We can alleviate their concerns through our products and advice, we can empower them with financial literacy, and we can them together through sport.The objectives of the ‚ÄúPower of Unity‚Äù program are to inform, inspire, and involve all Allianz stakeholders ‚Äî citizens, organizations, customers, shareholders, agents and employees ‚Äì by providing education, skills, tools, events, and initiatives that bridge divides and bring people together. Allianz will support people with guidance on how to identify and act on fake news, defuse tension through respectful listening and debate, and maintain confidence during uncertainty. Our approach is supported by research and insight. The 2024 Allianz Social Resilience Index explores in depth the global state of polarization and serves to quantify the impact of various socio-economic factors on societies, from the immediate costs of social unrest to how it stifles global growth and consumer confidence.Experience and history are also part of the solution. On Allianz‚Äôs website, thought leaders from business, politics, science, and society share their perspective on polarization and how to overcome it, and I‚Äôm grateful for the contributions of our thought leaders including Holocaust survivor Margot Friedl√§nder, former Vice Chancellor of Germany and president of Atlantik-Br√ºcke Sigmar Gabriel, and FC Bayern Munich footballer and global Allianz brand ambassador Harry Kane. It is time to show that democracies deliver. Through Power of Unity, we will counter the erosion of trust in societal institutions and strengthen confidence in a better economic future.I invite you to join us and learn more about the Allianz Social Resilience Index 2024 and the Power of Unity here: https://lnkd.in/dfW3NPUEhashtag#PowerOfUnity hashtag#Allianz hashtag#democraciesdeliver

We are living in a time of immense unprecedented challenges. Geopolitical tensions are reshaping the global order, economic uncertainty is disrupting industries worldwide, and the urgent need to combat climate change is forcing industries to rethink operations at every level. The call for Hashtag#transformation across industries and borders has never been louder. For us at thyssenkrupp, this is not only a necessity but an opportunity to redefine what we stand for and what we can achieve together.  Today, at our Hashtag#AnnualPressConference 2024, we reflected on the progress we have made in the fiscal year 2023/24 and outlined the path forward.  Despite weaker market demand, we met sales (‚Ç¨35 billion) and adjusted EBIT (‚Ç¨567 million) targets, exceeding Free Cash Flow before M&A (‚Ç¨110 million). We will propose an unchanged dividend of ‚Ç¨0.15 per share. But that is not enough for us; we aim higher. Our APEX 2.0 initiative continues to drive efficiency across the company, helping us focus on what matters most: delivering value to our shareholders and building a resilient future. Hashtag#performance A key focus the past fiscal year was the realignment of our portfolio to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global economy. Hashtag#portfoliothyssenkrupp Steel: Aiming for CO2-reduced steel production with a 20% stake already acquired by Hashtag#EPCG, progressing towards a 50/50 joint venture.thyssenkrupp Marine Systems: Strong order books and strategic standalone positioning opportunities are progressing. The focus remains on a spin-off, with ongoing discussions regarding potential state involvement.thyssenkrupp Automotive & thyssenkrupp Materials Services: Embracing innovation and partnerships, including development collaboration with the Chinese BWI group and our ‚ÄúMaterials as a Service‚Äù strategy. The green transformation is not just a goal for us ‚Äì it is our responsibility. In steel, our sustainable solutions will set new standards for emission-free production, while automotive products like rotor shafts and new refrigerative compressor using natural refrigerants shape tomorrow's mobility. Green supply chains are at the heart of our digital solutions from thyssenkrupp Materials Services. And, thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies transforms industrial green transformation with modular products and service expansion in the fields of carbon capture solutions, green ammonia & methanol, cost-efficient wind power systems, and thyssenkrupp nucera's scalable green hydrogen technologies. One point of pride: we invested ‚Ç¨690 million in R&D last fiscal year, solidifying our place as one of Germany's top research-driven tech companies. Hashtag#greentransformation Fiscal year 2024/25 will focus on steady growth, green transformation, and crucial portfolio decisions. This would not be possible without the dedication of our Hashtag#GENERATIONTK, and trust of our Hashtag#shareholders. Together, we are building a future that not only honors thyssenkrupp‚Äôs legacy but embraces the limitless opportunities ahead.

hashtag#COP29 brings a central question to the table: How do we finance climate protection measures? Climate protection must be seen as a strategic business opportunity. If we do not act, the costs will be significantly higher in the future. In this context, the economy should make it even clearer how well advanced green technologies are and why it is worth investing in them. And they should work together more intensively. Because none of the major areas that are fueling climate change can achieve the transformation alone ‚Äì neither the energy industry, as the largest emitter of greenhouse gases, nor agriculture, transport, and the building sector. In my latest LinkedIn Article, I shared my thoughts and ideas in more detail. Also, I'm curious: What do you expect from COP29?

Einige DAX-Unternehmen wie Covestro, RWE oder Beiersdorf ‚Äû√ºberzeugen [bei den Klimazielen] nicht nur durch Ambitionen, sondern auch durch Reduktion."Dieses Zitat aus einem aktuellen manager magazin Artikel bringt es auf den Punkt: Es geht nicht nur um gro√üe Pl√§ne, sondern um konkrete Ergebnisse.Eine aktuelle Studie der Union Investment zeigt einen bemerkenswerten Fortschritt: 29 von 40 DAX-Unternehmen haben sich umfassende Klimaziele gesetzt. Das ist nicht nur ein deutlicher Anstieg im Vergleich zum Vorjahr, sondern auch ein klares Signal, dass die Erwartungen an Unternehmen steigen ‚Äì und wir diesen gerecht werden m√ºssen. Weniger Worte, mehr Taten. Eine Entwicklung, die ich sehr begr√º√üe. Besonders stolz bin ich¬†auf die Fortschritte in der Chemieindustrie, denn die Herausforderungen in unserer Branche sind enorm. Energieintensive Prozesse, vielf√§ltige Rohstoffe, strenge Sicherheitsvorschriften und komplexe globale Wertsch√∂pfungsketten machen Nachhaltigkeitsinitiativen besonders anspruchsvoll. Und trotzdem¬†zeigen¬†Unternehmen¬†wie Beiersdorf und Covestro¬†ihre Entschlossenheit, den eingeschlagenen Weg der Transformation konsequent weiterzuverfolgen. Bei Covestro setzen wir auf den √∂konomisch besten Pfad, bis 2035 in Scope 1 und 2 klimaneutral zu werden.¬†Durch Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) haben wir beispielsweise 2023 bereits 16 Prozent unseres weltweiten Strombedarfs aus erneuerbaren Energien gedeckt. Das ist ein signifikanter Schritt, aber bei weitem nicht das Ende unserer Bem√ºhungen. Die Studie der Union Investment zeigt, dass selbst in wirtschaftlich herausfordernden Zeiten erhebliche Fortschritte im Klimaschutz m√∂glich sind. F√ºr mich ist das eine Best√§tigung unseres Kurses und ein Motivationsschub, gemeinsam noch entschlossener voranzugehen ‚Äì immer im Optimum zwischen √ñkonomie und √ñkologie und mit viel Pragmatismus.

Wir bewegen uns in politisch turbulenten Zeiten. Die Transformation des Energiesystems aber muss und wird in den kommenden Jahren weiter voranschreiten ‚Äì und dies unabh√§ngig von Regierungskonstellationen und einzelnen Wahlergebnissen. Ein zentraler Erfolgsfaktor f√ºr ihr Gelingen ist Flexibilit√§t, d.h. die Bef√§higung von Nutzern unterschiedlicher Technologien, Bezug und Einspeisung an volatile Rahmenbedingungen anzupassen. Dies als neue Normalit√§t zu begreifen ‚Äì darum ging es gestern Abend bei unserem E.ON Spitzengespr√§ch in Berlin, zu dem es mich sehr gefreut hat, Herrn Staatssekret√§r Dr. Philipp Nimmermann und Digitalexperte Sascha Lobo zu begr√º√üen. Wie motiviert man Verbraucherinnen und Verbraucher zur Nutzung von Flexibilit√§tsl√∂sungen? Welche Anreize brauchen Mittelstand und Gro√üindustrie? Was sind die gesellschaftspolitischen Herausforderungen? Welche politischen Weichen m√ºssen wir jetzt stellen? Folgende Punkte stehen f√ºr mich in Vordergrund: 1. Flexibilit√§t braucht passgenaue Anreize und einen gut moderierten TransformationsprozessFlexibilit√§t ist kein Nice-to-have, sondern ein absolutes Must-have. Je schneller wir Flexibilit√§t implementieren, desto fr√ºher erreichen wir auch unsere Klimaziele.  Dazu braucht es Stringenz in den Anreizen f√ºr Industrie und Haushalte. N√∂tig ist ein Transformationsprozess, der Entscheidungs- und Investitionszyklen von Unternehmen ber√ºcksichtigt. Die geplante Flex-Agenda 2025 des BMWK sollte dazu schnellstm√∂glich mit Leben gef√ºllt werden. 2.¬†Wir brauchen mehr Mut bei InnovationMit einer Null-Risiko-Politik kommen wir nicht voran. Wir brauchen einen flexiblen Regulierungsansatz, der Chancen erkennt und R√§ume f√ºr Entwicklungen zul√§sst. Keinen statischen, der sich auf Risiken fokussiert und Argwohn vor Innovationen ausdr√ºckt.3.¬†Komplexit√§ten m√ºssen reduziert werdenWir brauchen mehr Transparenz und Verst√§ndlichkeit in den Prozessen und mehr Pragmatismus in der Umsetzung. Die Kundinnen und Kunden k√∂nnen wir nur mit passgenauen L√∂sungen √ºberzeugen, die den monet√§ren Nutzen klar erkennbar machen, Risiken √ºberschaubar halten und trotzdem Preissignale durchlassen.Vielen Dank an alle Teilnehmenden des Abends f√ºr den ausf√ºhrlichen Austausch und wertvollen Perspektivwechsel. Ebenfalls gilt mein herzlicher Dank allen Mitwirkenden der gesamten Dialogreihe, die mit dem E.ON Spitzenpapier die inhaltliche Basis des Abends erarbeitet haben. In den kommenden Monaten m√ºssen nun ‚Äì sowohl von Seiten der Politik als auch Unternehmen - konkrete Ma√ünahmen folgen. Das E.ON Spitzenpapier und weitere Infos zum Prozess finden Sie hier: https://lnkd.in/e3bU226B

Compressed air specialist KAESER KOMPRESSOREN is a fantastic example of how hashtag#AI is changing the way companies run. What started as a standard data project has transformed into an hashtag#innovative journey that is using AI to unlock entirely new use cases and accelerate business processes.  To tackle growing system complexity and a large data volume, Kaeser implemented a new AI-enabled data strategy that has helped automate 80% of¬†key¬†data maintenance tasks, improved their data accuracy, and resulted in significant productivity gains. Kaeser‚Äôs service teams¬†can now also quickly identify spare parts with the help of an AI service that uses image recognition. Another major AI-enabled benefit is smarter product recommendations, allowing Kaeser‚Äôs sales teams to analyze customer requirements in real-time, providing personalized solutions with unmatched precision. These processes showcase how hashtag#BusinessAI is driving real-world results and we‚Äôre excited to support Kaeser on this journey.

This morning, we published our financial figures for the fourth quarter and fiscal year 2024. First things first my thanks go to our employees at Siemens Energy, who have gone above and beyond in recent years. Day in, day out, I see a level of commitment and passion, which is truly incredible and makes me personally very proud.  Proud, because we can overall look back on a successful fiscal year. Following a challenging 2023, we defined three primary objectives for 2024: deliver on profitable growth, fix the wind business, and maintain our solid financial foundation. This strategic focus has proven to be the right one. We have met our financial targets and even surpassed them in several areas. Workflows have been improved, and capacity utilization in our factories has been boosted. In regard to our wind business we still have a way to go but are moving in the right direction step by step.¬†For more specifics on the overall numbers, see the post of our CFO Maria Ferraro: https://lnkd.in/ebvev6Qu In addition to our financial results, we showcased four real-world technologies this morning:¬†1. An industry-first recyclable wind turbine blade. 2. A gas turbine burner that has successfully operated on 100% hydrogen. 3. A bottle of e-fuel derived from green hydrogen. And 4. A vacuum interrupter for switchgears that eliminates the use of SF6, the greenhouse gas with the highest global warming potential. These are all innovations that exemplify our commitment to using innovative technologies to serve our customers, drive the energy transition forward, and energize society.

Natural disasters - most recently in Spain, Central Europe, and the United States ‚Äì have again caused significant destruction, economic loss, and human suffering. These events profoundly affected many of our customers, but they also presented us with another opportunity to demonstrate our purpose and deliver the security of being insured by Allianz. Following the floods in Spain, Allianz was proud to donate up to 1 million euros to local relief and resilience. Our claims adjusters, agents, and brokers provided on-site support to customers, making both technical and human resources available to enable immediate assistance and support for those affected.The increasing severity and frequency of these events also test the financial and operational resilience of our industry. Allianz continues to pass these tests comfortably, and this is evident in the results that we announced today. Allianz continued our strong performance in the third quarter, reaching 3.9 billion euros operating profit and achieving double-digit growth in business volume, operating profit, and net income, while reinforcing our financial strength. Our ability to succeed in changing and challenging circumstances gives us the confidence to expect that we will achieve an operating profit in the upper half of our target range for the year. The successful execution of our strategy is not just visible in our strong business performance. Last month, Allianz was again recognized as the world‚Äôs #1 Insurance Brand in Interbrand‚Äôs Best Global Brands and entered the Top 30 Global Brands for the first time with a brand value of $ 23.5 billion, supporting our ability to drive customer growth. And, Allianz is an increasingly attractive investment for our people. Today, around 75% of our employees are shareholders of Allianz. And for our shareholders, on December 10, my Board colleagues and I look forward to Capital Markets Day, where we will lay out a vision for Allianz Group to sustain and build upon our growth momentum over the next three years. hashtag#AllianzFinancialResults hashtag#Allianz

Reducing carbon emissions requires teamwork.At ADIPEC Exhibition and Conference 2024, I had the opportunity to join an insightful panel discussion with Jennifer Holmgren, Ichiro Takahara, Mansoor Mohamed Al Hamed, and Montri Rawanchaikul on the topic of cross-sector partnerships ‚Äì a forward-looking approach to climate protection and circularity. Yet, why are partnerships the key to success?In the panel, I highlighted that a successful transformation requires‚Ä¶ ‚Ä¶ all sectors to share a sense of urgency for sustainable change.‚Ä¶ the transformation to be profitable for all involved.‚Ä¶ more favorable and stable framework conditions to support it.‚Ä¶ to maintain momentum, despite other challenges.‚Ä¶ the circular economy as a global guiding principle and roadmap. Let's continue to work together across sectors to build a sustainable economic system for generations to come. Mubadala Energy, PTTEP, LanzaTech

Tuesday was another ‚Äúelectrifying‚Äù day with Eurelectric as we presented our Grids for Speed study in Brussels! We showed DSOs must double investments to deploy the robust power grid which Europe needs to get a firm grasp of our energy security. At the exact same time, the Commissioner-designate for Energy Dan J√∏rgensen was laying out similar priorities in the parliamentary hearings.  I made 3 key points. Firstly the growth of electrification is key, for Europe‚Äôs decarbonisation, security and our economy. The electrification rate has stagnated across the continent, around 23% for the last decade or so, and its growth is intimately linked to Europe‚Äôs competitiveness. I welcome the early indications of the incoming Commission that this will be a focus of their work. How we finance this expansion will also be crucial. We have to find the balance between the expectations of capital markets and the ability of consumers to pay. Access to private capital is key, so regulation has to allow us to compete for investors and win. If we get this right then the role of public funding should only be complementary. Finally I would have a simple message: the responsibility is on us, as a sector, to deliver this. We do not shy away from our role to secure the necessary equipment, attract talent and investors. Society expects us to deliver and we must do so. Thanks once again to the fantastic Eurelectric team for the event, and my fellow panellists Christian Pilgaard Zinglersen Walburga Hemetsberger Greg Jackson Krzysztof (Chris) Bolesta for a lively and interesting conversation!(Picture credits: Eurelectric)

How do I lead in the era of hashtag#AI?As always ‚Äì by fostering an empowering culture.This was my key message at a panel discussion at the Microsoft AI tour in Berlin ‚Äì together with Birgit Bohle, Sven Sch√ºtt, Barbara Wittmann, Hanna Hennig. Thanks for the invitation Satya Nadella and Agnes Heftberger. There was indeed a great energy in the room!Our approach at Talanx Group is to show-up, skill-up and scale-up GenAI.1. Show-up: ‚Ü≥ We foster a culture of transparency. We share best practices and failures. Innovation doesn‚Äôt happen in the headquarters or in silos. As a learning organization, we grow through collaboration. 2. Skill-up: ‚Ü≥ AI is like learning a new language. Trial and error are important to develop a deeper understanding through continuous learning. No pain, no gain. üí™3. Scale-up:‚Ü≥ Leaders always ask the question ‚ÄûSo what‚Äú. The true value of AI only becomes apparent when the technology is scaled. It‚Äôs great that there are already many business cases where scale-up works. As a leader, curiosity and communication are important to reduce fears and empower people. I believe, it‚Äô important to lead by example and gain experience with GenAI ourselves. You won't get fit by just watching others train in the gym. You also must train yourself. üòâWhat are your thoughts on leadership in the era of AI? I‚Äôm happy to read your comments!hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#PerformanceCulture

It was a privilege to join visionary leaders at the FII Institute 2024. Under the theme ‚ÄúInfinite Horizons: Investing Today, Shaping Tomorrow‚Äù, the event served as a platform to drive meaningful discussions on building a sustainable future. One of the highlights was the panel discussion, "Who Can Take Green Hydrogen to New Heights?" alongside Jorgo Chatzimarkakis and Wataru Ikushima. Together, we explored the potential of Hashtag#greenhydrogen as a key pillar for the future of clean energy and a critical enabler for industrial decarbonization. Here are our key insights:1Ô∏è‚É£ Developing a global hydrogen Hashtag#infrastructure:While the green hydrogen sector has made significant strides, high production costs and a lack of robust global infrastructure remain substantial challenges. Ongoing investment in pipelines, storage solutions, and transport infrastructure is essential for a thriving hydrogen economy. Technological innovations and R&D must persist in reducing the cost of electrolyzers and enhancing production efficiency, aiming to close the price gap between green and conventional hydrogen. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Fostering strategic Hashtag#partnerships for progress:Public-private collaboration is a vital driver in overcoming these challenges. Strategic partnerships help bridge funding gaps and enable the infrastructure development necessary for scalable and cost-effective solutions. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Hashtag#Regulatory frameworks to drive acceleration:Comprehensive regulatory frameworks and government policies are essential to accelerate the adoption of green hydrogen. Leading nations like Japan have set benchmarks through their national hydrogen strategies, emphasizing clear production targets and financial incentives. Unified international policy alignment is critical to ensure global standards and sustainable market growth. 4Ô∏è‚É£ Hashtag#Ammonia as a catalyst for hydrogen transport:As a hydrogen carrier, ammonia plays a pivotal role in facilitating transport and storage, offering solutions to current infrastructure limitations. Innovations in ammonia cracking, including those from thyssenkrupp Uhde, and enhancements in reconversion efficiency are underway, with the potential to significantly reduce costs and energy losses. At thyssenkrupp, particularly within our Decarbon Technologies segment, we are committed to pioneering solutions and expanding strategic partnerships. The path forward requires unified action across sectors and geographies to create lasting impacts on our global Hashtag#energy landscape. Now is the time to harness this potential through reinforced regulatory frameworks, targeted funding, and collaborative innovation. Let‚Äôs build an ecosystem that not only drives Hashtag#decarbonization but also secures a cleaner, sustainable future for all. A heartfelt thank you to my co-panelists and to our moderator, Eithne Treanor, for an engaging discussion. Your perspectives are invaluable as we work toward these infinite horizons!

This week, I spoke in the FOCUS Magazin about the challenges and strategic goals we face at thyssenkrupp. Our company is at a turning point. Now, we need to focus on our strengths and establish a Hashtag#performancedriven culture that enables sustainable success. Our steel division is at the heart of this Hashtag#transformation. Over the past five years, we have incurred over ‚Ç¨3.2 billion in negative cash flow in the Hashtag#steel sector. Despite this, I firmly believe that steel has a future in Germany - but only if it becomes both competitive and sustainable. Our goal is to produce climate-neutral steel as quickly as possible. However, we need the right conditions: more affordable Hashtag#energy prices and a reliable infrastructure for Hashtag#hydrogen transport. This is where the government and the EU must take decisive action. While I see subsidies as essential to support the transition phase, they shouldn‚Äôt be a permanent measure. Companies must become independently competitive once established. Additionally, I advocate for a unified European energy policy focused on affordable, green electricity and robust grid Hashtag#infrastructure. Germany must enhance its competitiveness overall by cutting bureaucracy and creating incentives for companies and skilled workers. Only with adaptive policies and strong infrastructure can we maintain the country‚Äôs long-term attractiveness. Our mission is clear: to achieve financial targets, effectively restructure our portfolio, and complete the Hashtag#greentransformation. Now is the time to look ahead with determination and take actionable steps forward. Special thanks to Matthias Jauch and Georg Meck for the interview and the opportunity to highlight these important issues.

Faith can move mountains.High performance and success are a question of hashtag#mindset and being guided by a good story. A firm belief in achieving your goal gives people the extra motivation they need to work even harder for success.There is an interesting study on this from the German University of T√ºbingen in cooperation with the German Football Association DFB: young footballers who dreamed very strongly of a successful career were more likely to end up in a professional club's youth development center than young people with a less pronounced desire.The stronger the desire for success, the greater the willingness to go the extra mile.What can we learn from this for business?üèÜ With the right mindset of focus, determination and discipline, the prospects of outstanding performance increase.üèÜ Everyone should set themselves clear goals and do everything they can to achieve them. In order to be successful together in business, these goals must be aligned with the company's objectives and action must be taken in line with the purpose.üèÜ Relative performance counts: The will to be better than the competition motivates top performance.üèÜ With the prospect of success, people are willing to become the best version of themselves and take their skills to the highest level.How does a positive mindset influence your motivation and success in achieving high goals?

Endstation? Museum.Deutschland ist ein Land der Ingenieurkunst und Erfinder. Doch immer wieder sehen wir Projekte und Ideen, die vielversprechend beginnen, aber auf dem Weg zur Umsetzung steckenbleiben. Oft mangelt es nicht an Innovationskraft, sondern an einem dynamischen Umfeld, das mutige Entscheidungen zul√§sst und Chancen erm√∂glicht.Ein Beispiel ist die Magnetschwebebahntechnologie. Bereits in den 1920er Jahren hier entwickelt, h√§tte sie im globalen Ma√üstab eine Vorreiterrolle spielen k√∂nnen. W√§hrend sie heute in anderen L√§ndern wie China und Japan zumindest experimentell zum Einsatz kommt, blieb sie in Deutschland aufgrund b√ºrokratischer H√ºrden und endloser Debatten ein ‚ÄûWas-w√§re-wenn‚Äú-Projekt. So landen zu viele innovative Projekte in den Archiven oder als Prototypen im Museum.Was lernen wir daraus? Deutschland muss seine Innovationskultur √ºberdenken. Wir ben√∂tigen¬†eine Politik, die mutige Entscheidungen trifft und innovative Projekte nicht durch endlose Debatten ausbremst. Der Schl√ºssel liegt in der F√∂rderung von F&E, der Reduzierung von B√ºrokratie und der Schaffung eines dynamischen Innovations√∂kosystems, das Talente anzieht und h√§lt. Dabei ist Technologieoffenheit essenziell ‚Äì statt auf wenige einzelne Projekte zu setzen, sollte eine breite F√∂rderung Innovationen langfristig erm√∂glichen und verschiedene Technologien voranbringen.Welche konkreten Schritte sollten wir unternehmen, um Deutschland wieder an die Spitze des technologischen Fortschritts zu bringen? Ich bin gespannt auf Ihre/Eure Meinungen.

Last week at the 18th Asia-Pacific Conference of German Business (APK) focusing on current economic developments in Europe and the Asia-Pacific region, I joined Alexander von zur Muehlen and Tanuj Kapilashrami in a dynamic panel discussion on Sustainable Finance in Times of Geopolitical Change. Here are my key takeaways on what it will take to push forward the Hashtag#greentransformation: 1Ô∏è‚É£ The role of governments, industry, and financial institutions: Achieving net-zero emissions is an urgent, shared responsibility. Governments play a crucial role by implementing supportive frameworks and incentives, for example, by developing transportation infrastructure like pipelines and storage systems. Success requires Hashtag#collaboration with industry and the financial sector to bridge the funding gap. This helps to create blueprints for large-scale rollouts needed to demonstrate the business case and enhance the bankability of subsequent projects. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Leveraging partnerships in the Asia-Pacific region: Germany‚Äôs strength in green hydrogen technology opens doors for impactful partnerships in the Asia-Pacific region. By providing cutting-edge solutions for the entire value chain and fostering long-term local partnerships, thyssenkrupp supports the region‚Äôs Hashtag#decarbonization in hard-to-abate sectors. Our engineering expertise, combined with procurement and construction from the Asia-Pacific region, has created integrated supply chains that serve both local goals and global ambitions for Hashtag#sustainability. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Sustainable financing mechanisms: Asia-Pacific nations are advancing initiatives like the ‚ÄúJust Energy Transition Partnership‚Äù in Indonesia & Vietnam and India‚Äôs ‚ÄúNational Green Hydrogen Mission‚Äù that emphasize governmental commitment to decarbonization. Germany can support cross-border investments through its financial institutions, while they help achieve emission targets via carbon credits. In general, financing costs need to be lowered in all three phases of Hashtag#greenhydrogen (feedstock, production, and distribution) to help the first projects take off. Therefore, sustainable Hashtag#finance has evolved beyond traditional models. Green bonds, blended finance, and cross-border carbon accounting mechanisms are key to success.  4Ô∏è‚É£ Navigating global supply chains amid geopolitical forces: As regulations tighten, decarbonizing Hashtag#supplychains becomes essential. Through our knowledge, we can support Asia-Pacific economies in establishing parallel, sustainable supply chains that align with international standards, ensuring resilience and market access. Innovative financing and technology transfer will be critical here. Thank you for the great exchange, and Isabelle K√∂rner for the outstanding moderation. The momentum is there. Now it‚Äôs time for all stakeholders to work together to turn ambition into action.üì∏: The Indo-German Chamber of Commerce

The fight against Hashtag#climatechange is one of the greatest challenges of our time. To make real progress, industries worldwide must transform how they operate and adopt sustainable technologies. With our segment thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies, we are at the forefront of this Hashtag#transformation, developing innovative solutions that help us and our partners to reduce carbon emissions and pave the way for a more sustainable future.thyssenkrupp Uhde, as part of Decarbon Technologies, is not only an expert for Hashtag#ammonia cracking, which enables the efficient transport of green hydrogen. They offer a range of technology to support the Hashtag#decarbonization of industries, one of the most promising is Hashtag#greenmethanol. With thyssenkrupp Uhde's methanol technology, we can now produce clean methanol using Hashtag#greenhydrogen from renewable energy sources plus captured Hashtag#CO2, and this way removing or keeping greenhouse gas from the atmosphere. Saudi Arabia is aiming to have 75 percent of its energy sector localized by 2030. A complex endeavor, as localization goes beyond meeting contractual agreements or obligations. It involves building a sustainable supply chain that supports the development of local talent and fosters innovation within the country.I had the opportunity to discuss this in Riyadh yesterday at the invitation of the Ministry of Energy. Our Dammam Hub in the region serves as a prime example of our Siemens Energy localization strategy. In 2016, we manufactured the first-ever gas turbine made in Saudi Arabia. Since then, it has undergone significant transformation, servicing the entire energy value chain under one roof and providing advanced skills training for young Saudis in collaboration with our customers. Very grateful to be a strong local partner in delivering the energy system of the future. hashtag#energytransition hashtag#innovation hashtag#energyresilience

Innovation flourishes when politics and industry join hands.In April, Olaf Scholz visited our Asia-Pacific Innovation Center in Shanghai, providing an excellent opportunity to discuss the profound trust in the German-Chinese partnership and its future significance.My recent trip to Shanghai reaffirmed the critical importance of collaboration between our two economic powerhouses. However, I also recognized that successful international collaboration requires two equally strong partners.In recent years, China has made substantial headway in innovation, setting global benchmarks in areas like electric mobility and digitalization. Meanwhile, Germany holds immense untapped potential, but much of it remains constrained. To stay competitive and secure a sustainable future, we must unlock this potential and close the innovation gap that currently holds us back.To advance this, let's continue working together with China to:- Cultivate a market that appreciates advanced technologies- Guarantee a robust and adaptable supply chain- Foster an environment that encourages collaborative innovationIn a world increasingly characterized by resource scarcity and environmental challenges, finding sustainable solutions is imperative. This can only be achieved through joint efforts ‚Äì with China and globally.

Ein zukunftsf√§higes Energiesystem ist digital und flexibel. Bidirektionales Laden von Elektroautos wird hierbei eine wichtige Rolle spielen. Warum? Weil Elektroautos dann k√ºnftig nicht nur Strom verbrauchen, sondern dank dieser Technologie auch ins Stromnetz zur√ºckspeisen k√∂nnen. Das hilft dabei, die Elektromobilit√§t attraktiver zu machen, denn die Kunden k√∂nnen mit der zur√ºckgespeisten Energie Geld sparen. Zus√§tzlich wird die Energiewende unterst√ºtzt, und mit den richtigen Rahmenbedingungen k√∂nnen die Netze effizient genutzt und die Systemkosten verringert werden. Damit das bidirektionale Laden ein Erfolg wird, m√ºssen wir branchen√ºbergreifend zusammenarbeiten. Daher habe ich mich heute mit Vertreterinnen und Vertretern der Automobilindustrie und der Energiewirtschaft zu einem Roundtable auf Einladung von Bundeswirtschaftsminister Robert Habeck in Berlin getroffen. Gemeinsam hat die Industrie dem Bundeswirtschaftsministerium einen Abschlussbericht mit Handlungsempfehlungen √ºbergeben, damit bidirektionales Laden in den n√§chsten Jahren seine Potenziale entfalten kann. Wir sind uns einig, dass jetzt die Rahmenbedingungen gesetzt werden m√ºssen. Das umfasst unter anderem die folgenden Punkte: - Netzdienlichkeit gew√§hrleisten, d. h. das bidirektionale Laden muss die Kosten im Verteilnetz senken. - Standardisierung der Technik und branchen√ºbergreifender Datenaustausch. - Wirtschaftlichkeit erm√∂glichen: Doppelbelastung durch Steuern, Abgaben und Umlagen abschaffen. Mit dem bidirektionalen Laden l√∂sen sich die Grenzen zwischen den Sektoren Energie und Mobilit√§t auf. Wenn wir es richtig machen, k√∂nnen Elektroautos ein integraler Bestandteil des Stromnetzes werden.

(VCI) hat ergeben, dass Unternehmen im Durchschnitt rund 5 % ihrer Ums√§tze f√ºr b√ºrokratische Erfordernisse aufwenden ‚Äì totes Kapital, das nicht in Forschung, Innovationen und Fortschritt flie√üen kann. Today‚Äôs newly published IEA World Energy Outlook ‚Äì a cornerstone report for the world of energy ‚Äì highlights one critical fact: global electricity demand is soaring. To meet this challenge, we need significantly greater investment in new energy systems, particularly in electricity grids and energy storage. Currently, for every dollar spent on renewable power, only 60 cents goes toward grids and storage. Addressing this requires two pivotal elements: leadership and collaboration; among governments, corporates, the financial community, and entrepreneurs. The Energy Resilience Leadership Group is a showcase example of bringing these diverse stakeholders to one table under a common goal and a strong commitment. Here, we are demonstrating with tangible examples what needs to happen on a larger scale in Europe ‚Äì bringing energy projects from lab to life.Thank you Bill Gates and J√∂rg Kukies for participating in this week's discussion on actionable steps moving forward in Europe. Thank you to Ann Mettler for facilitating.Siemens Energy Cleantech for Europe Tech for Net ZeroHashtag#WEO2024 Hashtag#energytransition

üèÜ Big points count. Because they create momentum.I like playing tennis. And I also like watching the sport. Lately, my family and I watched ten hours of tennis straight.Several matches were played that day, but it got me thinking about who comes out on top. And what we can learn from them for business.In every single match, there comes a moment of truth. The decisive break. The long rally that someone wins in the end. That creates momentum in sport and decide entire matches.Roger Federer has won 80 percent of the matches in his career, but only 54 percent of the points in each match. The once best player in the world has therefore only won a little more than every second point.He says: "When you play a point, it must be the most important thing you do in life. But when it is behind you, then it is behind you.‚ÄùSo, what does it take to win the big points?üëâTalent: A special talent can take you to an above-average level of performance. But that won't happen on its own.üëâDiscipline for hard work, utilising your potential that enables you to make the difference.üëâMental health to focus on the big points. In tennis and in life, you will lose many times. It's about getting up and fully focus on the next point.üí° What do you think it takes to decide the big points?I'm looking forward to your thoughts!

In recent years, the World Health Summit in Berlin has become one of the most important meetings for representatives of UN organizations, NGOs, civil society, governments, international financing institutions, and the private sector. I'm always honored to represent Siemens Healthineers and meet old friends and new contacts there. What brings us together is improving the health of all people worldwide.This year, we met under the hashtag#WHS2024 motto "Building Trust for a Healthier World". Trust is a topic that is crucial for us as a company in the healthcare industry: the trust of our customers and their patients in our technologies, the trust of our investors in our performance, and last but not least, the trust of entire societies in our values and responsibility.Trust also grows from honest evaluation of benefits and risks, especially when it comes to new technologies in such a sensitive area as health. I had the opportunity to talk about this in the panel discussion "Artificial Intelligence in Health: From Promise to Practice". As AI is rapidly transforming healthcare, we will not win trust with an isolated discussion about safety. We also need to talk about the opportunities and benefits of AI. At Siemens Healthineers, we are convinced that digital innovation can help tackle some of the key challenges of the healthcare sector, e.g., by easing the pressure of the workforce shortage. Thus, digital literacy and cybersecurity must become integral parts of any professional training. It is up to us healthcare experts to ensure AI's reliability in medicine, utilize it, and discuss it publicly. We should all be working towards AI becoming a powerful tool in beating cancer and other life-threatening diseases ‚Äì and in that sense, I would be happy if five years from now a panel topic such as ours yesterday would be an antiquity. Many thanks to my co-panelists: Karen DeSalvo, Jo√´lle Barral, Amani Abou-Zeid ÿ£ŸÖÿßŸÜŸä ÿ£ÿ®Ÿàÿ≤ŸäÿØ, and Maximilian Alber.

New speed for the Future!Today is Capital Markets Day at Deutsche Telekom. We are presenting our plans up to 2027. And it‚Äôs all about the wheel! More specifically, our flywheel. It forms the foundation of our strategy. In summary: more growth, more networks (FTTH and 5G), more AI, and a higher dividend. We plan to propose 90 cents for 2024.How do we achieve this? How does our flywheel work?We invest more than our competitors. This allows us to gain more customers. As a result, we achieve economies of scale. We become more efficient‚Äîand more profitable. This enables us to continue investing. And the wheel keeps turning. üîÑDeutsche Telekom gains additional momentum through data and artificial intelligence, as well as our position as a leading provider in the Western world with strong foundations in Europe and the USA.We constantly measure success with our customers to better understand their needs and, based on that, offer new products and better services. They are at the core of our strategy. We work for them‚Äîand we want to keep getting better. To achieve this, we are also implementing artificial intelligence across the company. For example, together with other companies, we are developing AI that can independently resolve many of our customers' service requests and provide the right answers to their concerns.And we want to keep growing. We aim to increase our service revenues by an average of around 4 percent annually through 2027. Our earnings will grow by an average of 4 to 6 percent per year. This will also benefit our shareholders‚Äîsee our dividend.Our flywheel keeps spinning. And it‚Äôs gaining speed. We won‚Äôt stop üîùPS. Die Ideen, die wir zum Wachstum brauchen, stecken oft in der Welt da drau√üen. Und von Startups k√∂nnen wir dabei alle viel lernen. Innovation doesn‚Äôt happen in isolation No company can do everything on its own. And innovations don‚Äôt always come from within. We know that at Deutsche Telekom, and so do startups. That‚Äôs why we complement each other and collaborate. Telekom is more than just a telco. We keep a close eye on what‚Äôs happening in the world of technology and make targeted investments in the areas that will shape our future. This week at Bits & Pretzels, I talked about the transfer of innovation between the startup scene and Telekom: 1Ô∏è‚É£ With our TechBoost Program, we give promising startups the support they need to grow. üöÄ Over 1,000 startups have already benefited from our cloud resources, marketing and sales support, and access to our broad customer base. We provide the platform where they can fully unleash their innovative potential. 2Ô∏è‚É£ T.Capital is our strategic investment arm. From venture capital to tech acquisitions, we invest strategically in the competencies and technologies that drive growth. With over ‚Ç¨3 billion under management and a new Tech Fund with an additional ‚Ç¨2 billion, we are focused on the technologies of the future: AI, IoT, and secure networks. These investments are the key to enabling innovation and taking digital transformation to the next level. üîë Often, the biggest challenge for a company is to look beyond its own borders. The ideas we need for growth are often out there in the world. And there‚Äôs so much we can learn from startups in this regard. For example, the determination and courage to build something even under tough circumstances. To work hard, create value, and foster innovation. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs important that we continue to improve the conditions for them ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs access to talent, digital administration, or financing opportunities. At Telekom, we do our part by supporting startups with targeted partnerships and investments, ensuring they can innovate and grow. In doing so, we not only drive our own growth but also shape the future of the entire industry. Because scale‚Äôs the game! hashtag#Techboost hashtag#Startups hashtag#AI hashtag#IoT # hashtag#DeutscheTelekom

A high performing, sustainable and decentralized energy system must be digital. As a key player in the energy transition in Germany and Europe, E.ON is therefore committed to digitizing the energy infrastructure and breaking new, innovative ground. This also implies collaborating with strong partners from the tech sector. To deepen our view on technology state-of-the-art the E.ON SE Board of Management met with a number of these partners [Microsoft, Amazon Web Services (AWS), Salesforce, New Relic and Google] on a trip to Seattle, San Francisco and Silicon Valley. There was no scarcity of discussion topics. What is the future of the cloud? What is the impact of (Gen) AI? What about cyber? How do such developments reinforce each other? What could it mean for our business? How can it translate into benefits for our customers?  Such a trip is always insightful. I took away many thoughts. But if I need to name only one then it would be: Innovation will happen at an unprecedented scale. We would be well advised in Europe to accept that and focus on the opportunities rather than the risks. Otherwise, Europe will be left behind.

Siemens Xcelerator was named the most innovative story at InnoTrans, the world‚Äôs largest fair for transport tech.  And now, we‚Äôre making even bigger strides. Our new Signaling X brings streamlined rail operations to the cloud for the first time. This means rail operators everywhere can integrate their systems across borders and networks, realize significant gains in flexibility and efficiency, and maintain the highest levels of security and reliability.  To learn more about this innovation in transportation technology, you can listen to my short conversation with colleagues Sara Elkady and Sonja Steffens.  Siemens hashtag#InnoTrans2024 hashtag#FutureOfMobility

üìö hashtag#BookRecommendation  As Germany celebrates its Unity Day and reflects on a pivotal moment in our country‚Äôs past, I‚Äôm reminded of how hearing different perspectives of any history can make it surprisingly exciting and show how much it can still impact us today. That was the case when I listened to the audiobook ‚ÄúTunnel 29‚Äù by Helena Merriman, a riveting true story of how 29 people escaped to freedom beneath the Berlin Wall and its implications for the Cold War. Ms. Merriman originally produced ‚ÄúTunnel 29‚Äù as a podcast series during her time with BBC News. Compiling extraordinary details from firsthand interviews with survivors, thousands of Stasi files, as well as maps and news reports, she weaves a thrilling account of post-war Germany including: the construction of both the Berlin Wall and the 135-meter-long Tunnel 29, the constant dangers faced by the tunnellers, the interesting involvement of American TV, and the subsequent daring escape of men, women, and children from East Berlin, and how their lives unfolded afterwards. I was completely drawn into the story. I also appreciated learning about a facet of German history from an outsider's perspective, especially what the great city of hashtag#Berlin has endured over time. Most importantly, I respected how Ms. Merriman portrays the people of ‚ÄúTunnel 29‚Äù, their resourcefulness in the quest for freedom, and their perseverance. It serves as an important reminder of the tremendous sacrifices made by those before us, so that we can live as we do today. We should honor and defend this priceless gift.

Yesterday, I had the pleasure of joining Larry Fink, CEO of BlackRock, and moderator Francine Lacqua of Bloomberg for a thought-provoking session at Berlin Global Dialogue 2024 where we explored the causes of current challenges and the role of leaders in addressing them, from growing polarization to lagging economic growth.We discussed the inconvenient truth of rising risks and how managing them requires a willingness to adapt, transform, and build resilience. To succeed, however, the concerns and desires of customers and electorates must be at the forefront of decision-makers‚Äô minds. Larry and I agree that we also need to focus on the future, not on the past. There is no room for nostalgia or to rest on past achievements. Instead, if we view our current challenges as opportunities, with a healthy dose of pragmatism, they can become the foundation of a better economic future. We already see the potential. As risks increase, technical excellence will continue to deliver competitive insurance solutions. And, as Larry pointed out, the development of wider and deeper capital markets will contribute to risk mitigation by defusing risks and reducing price volatility.Yesterday‚Äôs frank discussion also addressed what leaders can do to rebuild trust and fight the polarization caused by what I call ‚Äúchange fatigue.‚Äù Change, while inevitable and often necessary, has to connect to the real needs of citizens. Delivering on basic quality of life issues, like healthcare, education, and affordable housing, is the most effective way to counter populist rhetoric and empty promises. Now is the time for serious dialogue and pragmatic solutions that work to restore stability, encourage optimism, and re-ignite global growth. We cannot expect governments alone to solve all these issues. Business can be part of the solution. That‚Äôs why Larry and I both emphasized the willingness and necessity of business to contribute to public-private partnerships. In our experience, such partnerships have been effective in finding pragmatic common ground, whether at the local, national, or international level. Thank you Larry Fink for your insights, Francine Lacqua for guiding our meaningful discussion, and Berlin Global Dialogue organizers for creating this opportunity. I look forward to continuing the conversation and exploring how businesses can work together with governments to help navigate rising risks and drive sustainable, inclusive growth. hashtag#BGD2024 hashtag#Allianz

It is official: the UK has become the first G7 nation to exit coal-fired power completely. An achievement, considering that around 80% of Britain‚Äôs power demand in 1990 was covered by coal. In this regard, the UK is a frontrunner in what many countries around the world are transitioning towards: net-zero. The energy void left by coal is being filled by greener alternatives such as wind, solar, and gas ‚Ä¶ yes, that is correct, gas.When discussing decarbonization today, gas plays a crucial role in reducing CO2 emissions. Since 2010, the switch from coal to gas has saved around 500 million tons of CO2 globally ‚Äì the equivalent of putting 200 million electric vehicles running on zero-carbon electricity on the road during that same time frame. Today, gas turbines are becoming more and more fuel-flexible, which means they can be operated not only with natural gas but also with co-firing green hydrogen once sufficient infrastructure and supply chains are in place. Gas, therefore, is and will remain an important piece of the puzzle to meet growing energy demand and be an element of a sustainable energy system.hashtag#energytransition hashtag#coaltogasshift hashtag#uk

Today we have signed an Investment Agreement with ADNOC Group International. This Investment Agreement provides, among other things, that ADNOC will make a public takeover offer to all of our shareholders. This marks an important day for all of us at Covestro.¬†We regard ADNOC as a strong and long-term oriented partner. Together, we will further drive our successful ‚ÄòSustainable Future‚Äô strategy even under the continued challenging market conditions. Here are the key points of our strategic partnership at a glance:- ADNOC¬†fully supports our ‚ÄòSustainable Future‚Äô growth strategy.- In this context, ADNOC International Germany Holding AG shall subscribe to new Covestro shares at the offer price of ‚Ç¨62.00 via a capital increase of ‚Ç¨1.17 billion. The proceeds will enable Covestro to further foster the implementation of its strategy.- Covestro's Board of Management in its current composition will, therefore, continue to be responsible for the operational management and strategic direction of the Company.- ADNOC is committed to recognizing¬†the German governance regulations and to retaining the co-determined Supervisory Board as well as the¬†existing general works agreements, collective bargaining agreements and the rights of the works councils in Germany. This was and is non-negotiable for us. Covestro has a clear growth strategy and is already making significant progress on its strategic transformation.¬†With ADNOC‚Äôs support, we will have an even stronger foundation for our sustainable growth in highly attractive sectors. After thorough consideration, we, the Board of Management and the Supervisory Board of Covestro, welcome and support ADNOC‚Äôs announced takeover offer. We are convinced that the agreement reached with ADNOC is in the best interest of Covestro, our employees, shareholders and all other stakeholders. The offer document is expected to be made available within the next six weeks. We will carefully review it and provide our reasoned statements on the offer in due course. Subject to the review of the offer document, we, the Board of Management, together with the Supervisory Board, expect to recommend¬†to Covestro‚Äôs shareholders to accept the offer. More details on the agreement can be found in our press release: https://lnkd.in/e-RcVuCD

We are truly traditionally different üì£In today's fast-paced world, it's sometimes tempting to follow the crowd. It‚Äôs hashtag#ClimateWeekNYC and I‚Äôm excited that SAP is leading concrete action to redefine the way businesses run via an ERP-centric, cloud-based, AI-powered approach. Sustainability lies at the core of our business and plays a central role in our portfolio and strategy. We're enabling businesses to accurately measure and manage carbon emissions and accelerate the move towards a net-zero future. SAP is also advancing sustainability through initiatives such as social procurement, education, and employment programs, using technology, innovation, and policy to create opportunities and resilience in communities globally. And together with our global network of sustainability experts, we're providing businesses with the insights and tools they need to reduce their environmental footprint. A great example of this is the work we're doing together with customer Ambipar, a global leader in environmental solutions. We've combined our ERP-centric and AI-enabled sustainability solutions with Ambipar's decarbonization expertise to create ‚ÄúNet Zero as a Service,‚Äù helping customers measure and offset their carbon emissions. Net Zero as a Service streamlines sustainability management by collecting company management data ‚Äì such as water consumption, social impact and employee metrics ‚Äì and then organizing and consolidating it in SAP Sustainability Control Tower. This allows customers to set and act on their sustainability goals with the insights and accurate forecasts they need to offset carbon emissions. I couldn't be more excited about this announcement and I look forward to seeing Net Zero as a Service scale after the initial pilot phase at Ambipar. Together, we'll enable our customers to establish a common data foundation, accurately measure emissions, and make decisions that are both financially and environmentally sound. hashtag#SAPSustainability

I‚Äôm grateful to Ludovic Subran and the Allianz Economic Research team for their work on the annual Allianz Global Wealth Report, a detailed analysis of the latest wealth trends and how they are shaped by saving behaviors, geopolitics, and environmental risks.Notable in this year‚Äôs report is evidence of a rising global middle class, with members in this wealth group rising sharply by 78% to around 850 million over the past two decades. ¬†Despite this good news, wealth inequality remains a significant issue, with the top 10% of the world‚Äôs population with the greatest wealth still controlling 85.7% of total net financial assets.Also notable is how savings behavior is a decisive key to asset growth. In markets with a strong bias toward capital markets, like the U.S., we see significantly higher long-term asset growth. While financial assets in Western Europe have doubled in the last two decades (+104%), for instance, the increase in the USA is a whopping 178%, bolstered by favorable market developments. The report‚Äôs analysis of the diversity in saving behaviors across markets and generations provides important insight into potential future trends.Despite an encouraging uptick in global net financial assets growth, we‚Äôre reminded that crisis and political uncertainty continue to create volatility that threatens to drag down savings growth potential for millions of people ‚Äì a fact that reinforces the need for reports like this one that go beyond the headlines and help us understand the long-term data trends and underlying factors impacting wealth formation. Check out the full report here: https://lnkd.in/ewujdB2e hashtag#AllianzResearch hashtag#GlobalWealthReport hashtag#FinancialLiteracy hashtag#Economics hashtag#Allianz

Technological innovation, transparent communication and close teamwork across industries and borders are essential to pave the way for the hashtag#greentransformation. Visits to hashtag#China are always a highlight for me ‚Äì with inspiring opportunities to engage with our customers, to experience the rapid evolution of the country, and last but for sure not least: to feel the special spirit of hashtag#TeamHealthineers in China.Highlight No. 1 on the customer (better said, partner) side was the exchange with Peking Union Medical College Hospital (PUMCH). We have a long history of introducing "firsts‚Äú with this very prestigious institution, the last one being Photon Counting CT ‚Äì and we work together in all of our segments, from Diagnostics to Varian. Now, we discuss how we can move to the next level, and collaborate on a PUMCH level across departments and optimize entire clinical pathways.Highlight No. 2: Seeing the great work of the private hashtag#JinshazhouHospital in Guangzhou which stands out in cancer care and discussing how we can further team up to leverage our strength in imaging, radiation oncology and more.  My interactions with government officials have been very insightful and reassuring. In Shanghai, where we have been developing and producing medical technology for more than 30 years and which is now one of our key innovation hubs, it was an honor to speak with Mr. Chen Jining, Party Secretary of Shanghai. It was very clear how much he appreciates our activities and also how much medtech and healthcare are in the center of his agenda for this vibrant city. In Guangzhou, I had the privilege to meet with Mr. Wang Wei Zhong, Governor of Guangdong Province, as well as his team, who are big supporters of our research and production site for MR in Shenzhen and who are as excited about the expansion of this site as we are. A very special thanks goes to hashtag#TeamHealthineers in China who made all this possible!

Yesterday President Ursula von der Leyen unveiled her new team of Commissioners to help Europe navigate through the next five years of global challenges. Sei der Wandel!Die hashtag#DigitalX ist "ready for impact". Auf der gr√∂√üten Digitalisierungsmesse Europas wollen wir in K√∂ln L√∂sungen aufzeigen, Netzwerke erm√∂glichen und gemeinsam mit vielen Partnern Anregungen f√ºr Digitalisierung in unseren Unternehmen geben. Danke an Klaus Werner und Teams, f√ºr dieses gro√üartige Programm.In meiner Keynote habe ich heute √ºber "Golf" als Symbol f√ºr mehrere Themen gesprochen:1. Ich bin passionierter Golfspieler. Und lerne: Wenn ich mein Spiel verbessern will, muss ich meinen Schwung ver√§ndern. Kurzfristig spiele ich dadurch schlechter; aber langfristig zahlt es sich aus. Das ist die ber√ºhmte Haltung. Wir m√ºssen den Anspruch haben, f√ºhrend zu sein in allem, was wir tun. Dann wird aus der Summe der f√ºhrenden Teile ein f√ºhrendes Ganzes. Dabei muss jeder bei sich selbst anfangen. Wir m√ºssen nicht darauf warten, dass die Welt sich √§ndert. Sondern wir k√∂nnen sie ver√§ndern. Und uns selbst.2. Der VW-Golf ein Symbol der deutschen Wirtschaft. Seit 50 Jahren rollt er erfolgreich vom Band. Aber auch der "Golf" - besser: Deutschland - muss sich neu erfinden. Und ich bin sicher, das wird gelingen.Deutschland ist die drittgr√∂√üte Volkswirtschaft der Welt. Wir haben mehr Absolventen in naturwissenschaftlichen oder mathematischen F√§chern als andere L√§nder. Hier steckt enormes technologisches Potenzial, das wir nutzen k√∂nnen.Ja, es gibt auch H√ºrden. Unsere Produktivit√§t sinkt; also m√ºssen wir "in die H√§nde spucken" - und wir brauchen z.B. qualifizierte Zuwanderung. Ja, die Energiepreise sind hoch. Darum muss die Energiewende gelingen. Unternehmen k√∂nnen das unterst√ºtzen, indem sie - wie die Telekom - Direktvertr√§ge mit den Produzenten von Erneuerbaren abschlie√üen. Im Gespr√§ch mit Leo Birnbaum von E.ON haben wir das Thema Energiewende noch tiefer beleuchtet - und auch er ist optimistisch, dass wir sie innerhalb der n√§chsten zehn Jahre hinbekommen k√∂nnen.Und ja, unsere Verwaltungen m√ºssen sicher auch digitaler werden. Das hilft bei vielen Themen, unter anderem dem Ausbau von Netzen.3. Der "Golf von Aden" als Symbol f√ºr weltweite Lieferketten.Aufgrund der politischen Spannungen steigen die Container-Preise. Das treibt Inflation. Es ist keine hausgemachte. In diesem Risiko liegt aber auch die Chance auf Industriearbeitspl√§tze hier bei uns und die heimische Produktion.Die Telekom hat sich ver√§ndert. Sie ist sicher nicht perfekt. Aber sie ist heute besser als vor zehn Jahren. Und soll in zehn Jahr nochmal besser sein. Daf√ºr holen wir neuen Schwung. Wir setzen an vielen Stellen im Unternehmen KI ein. Und k√∂nnen unseren Kundinnen und Kunden dadurch noch besseren Service bieten. √úber 500 Projekte haben wir in der Pipeline. Manche werden scheitern. Aber Scheitern ist ein Schritt zum Gelingen. Ich hoffe, die DigitalX leistet einen Beitrag zu diesem Gelingen. Wir sollten uns nicht anstecken lassen von negativer Stimmung um uns herum. Sondern in den Fokus gehen. Die Technologie ist da. Sie ist "ready for impact".

Commitment to sustainable and recyclable materials:¬†we are continuing our partnership with RWTH Aachen University at the CAT Catalytic Center until 2031, investing 12 million euros. It was a special honor for me to accompany Federal Chancellor Olaf Scholz on his recent trip to Central Asia¬†together with other business representatives from Germany. During many encounters in Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan, Siemens Healthineers deepened existing relationships and established new contacts to improve medical care in Central Asia.hashtag#TeamHealthineers feels valued and honored that the Uzbek government has placed its trust in us and that we were able to establish a strategic partnership with its Ministry of Health. Training, service, and maintenance are highlights of the project. We look forward to equipping the country with our high-end CT and MR scanners. I‚Äôm impressed by the pace of healthcare development in Uzbekistan and the high priority given to improving access to healthcare and the quality of diagnosis and treatment throughout the country. Digitalization and Artificial Intelligence will bring further value to its healthcare system, and I‚Äôm pleased that we were recently able to engage in discussions with UZTelecom.In Kazakhstan, we have now been active for 30 years. During this period, we participated in various state healthcare development programs, where equipment for oncology, women's health, cardiology, and COVID-19 treatment was delivered. One of the fastest-growing healthcare challenges in Kazakhstan is cancer. We are pleased that the government is supporting the oncology program, to which we would like to make further contributions.Together with Chancellor Scholz and other representatives from politics and business, I was also able to take part in the so-called Z5+1 summit. In addition to Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan, the Z5 countries also include Tajikistan, Kyrgyzstan and Turkmenistan.

I have just returned from Central Asia as part of a business delegation. Here, I had the pleasure to accompany German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and met with the presidents of Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Turkmenistan, Kyrgyzstan, and Tajikistan. The many discussions I had made one thing clear: the energy transition in the five Central Asian states is in full swing. Here are my key takeaways:‚û°Ô∏è Reduce emissions: Coal-fired power generation is a major source of greenhouse gas emissions in the region. Renewables are already growing and natural gas helps to improve the air quality. Furthermore, green hydrogen will help decarbonize industries. ‚û°Ô∏è Develop grid infrastructure: An energy system that relies on diverse sources of electricity requires more and smarter grids. This will lead to a massive expansion and modernization of grid infrastructure in Central Asia.‚û°Ô∏èTap into the local talent pool: Central Asian societies are young ‚Äì targeted training can support the availability of skilled labor. As a result, the region can advance with trained technicians and engineers ‚Äì a prerequisite for the success of the energy transition.The political will is there to make the region's energy transition a success. And we at Siemens Energy are ready to provide active support with our expertise ‚Äì for both technology and training. The energy transition in Central Asia is on the right track.  hashtag#energytransition hashtag#decarbonization hashtag#centralasia
