‚ÄúThe truth is on the playing field.‚ÄùIt's the same in sport and in business.I often talk to colleagues about high hashtag#performance and I am asked how to achieve it.In my view, sport and business competition are closely related: you can feel good in training, you can be convinced that you are on the right track in a project. But you shouldn't become overconfident as a result. In sport, the decisive factor is the game at the weekend: Do you win or do you lose?So let's take a look at high performance in sport. What leads people to the top and what can we learn from this in business?üëâ Talent: The ability to perform exceptionally well lays the foundation for success. But talent alone will not get you to the top.üëâ Focus: In sport and in business, focusing on the goal is crucial. What do I want to achieve and what measures can I take to get there? Concentrate on that.üëâ Discipline: If you work towards your goal every day and don't get tired, you'll get there. No pain, no gain.üëâ Mental strength: Boundaries are a matter of mind. And that's where they need to be broken first. Performance develops from the unconditional will to win the game. Success is also an answer to the question: who wanted it more in the end and who was prepared to give it their all?What success factors for performance can you think of? And which of them is the most important?

Das umfasst auch, dass nicht jeder Anwendungsfall gleich die maximale Power braucht. Sondern im Zweifel reichen auch kleinere, ressourcenschonendere KI-Produkte. Und wir achten darauf, dass wir dieselben oder √§hnliche Modelle nicht an verschiedenen Stellen im Unternehmen entwickeln, sondern koordinieren Nutzung und Zusammenarbeit.hashtag#Nachhaltigkeit hashtag#K√ºnstlicheIntelligenz hashtag#GreenTech hashtag#Telekom hashtag#Umweltschutz hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Energieeffizienz hashtag#LinkedInDachNews

But¬†it also clearly shows that Europe can quickly catch up by adopting proven, state-of-the-art solutions ‚Äì and that's where Europe should be heading now. Thoroughly adopting cloud solutions in the private and public sector would go a long way already to hashtag#modernizing our companies, societies, and governments. We'll get there much faster when we unify fragmented digital markets (across the¬†EU27,¬†as well as inside key countries such as Germany) and by putting digitalization at the top of the political agenda. This will lay an important foundation for our ambitions to catch the next big opportunity for Europe and become a world leader in hashtag#AI for industrial applications. The Draghi Report offers a blueprint for the future ‚Äì now it‚Äôs up to us to take its findings seriously and implement the best recommendations at speed and at scale. https://lnkd.in/epJaDJQk

‚ÄòThe early bird catches the worm‚Äô.This saying is on everyone's lips when it comes to the introduction of technologies. But it is only half the truth. Here‚Äôs why:On the one hand, several studies show that companies that are early adopters of digital technologies, including hashtag#GenAI, outperform their competitors. They gain efficiency, improve the customer experience, see faster revenue growth and thus gain a stronger competitive position. So, it's important to stay curious, follow industry trends and tech updates and experiment with them.On the other hand, it is also important to be pragmatic. Not everything that is new will work for us. But if you find something that works well, then you should implement it quickly.And it's not just about being the early bird; it's about leveraging the potential of GenAI to transform our business:üëâShowing up: create transparency about solutions, tools and capabilities.üëâSkilling up: Empower employees with the knowledge and skills to use GenAI tools effectively.üëâScaling up: Ensure that value is created for our core business.Especially the last aspect is important.So, let's catch that worm and scale it up together.hashtag#TogetherTalanxhashtag#Innovation

Our team was honored to welcome renowned hepatologist Dr. Arun Sanyal to our Innovation Center in Erlangen last week. Addressing an audience of innovators, Dr. Sanyal described the challenges and opportunities in combating the growing burden of metabolic disorders.Dr. Sanyal spoke about the work of the VCU Stravitz-Sanyal Institute for Liver Disease and Metabolic Health, which is bridging the gap between research and clinical application to ultimately improve patient care. Innovations from Siemens Healthineers are being used by experts at the Institute to translate groundbreaking research into improved patient outcomes.I had the pleasure of personally meeting Dr. Sanyal after his talk, and the conversation was as inspiring as it made clear that we are just at the beginning as a healthcare community to manage non-communicable diseases in an appropriate way. For example:‚ñ™ How do we detect alarming trends (not one-time measurements) in a person‚Äôs data over time?‚ñ™ Lab tests, ultrasound, CT, MR, biopsies: Which role does which test play? What is feasible? What is cost-efficient?‚ñ™ How do we combine the strength of academic medicine and primary care to establish new paradigms in preventative healthcare?It was truly an honor as Dr. Sanyal confirmed our endeavor to think more and more in terms of clinical conditions, which gave an additional boost to hashtag#TeamHealthineers.

Produktion an schwankende erneuerbare Energien anpassen: Warum die geplante hashtag#Netzentgeltreform f√ºr die chemische Industrie so nicht umsetzbar ist Die chemische Industrie zeichnet sich durch hochkomplexe Prozesse und eng vernetzte Wertsch√∂pfungsketten aus. Produktionsanlagen laufen oft rund um die Uhr und sind auf eine konstante Energieversorgung angewiesen. So k√∂nnen wir Sicherheit, Effizienz, Produktqualit√§t und nicht zuletzt den Erhalt der Supply Chain gew√§hrleisten. Die geplante Entgeltreform der Bundesnetzagentur zielt auf kurzfristige Verbrauchs√§nderungen ab. Sie ignoriert die technischen und wirtschaftlichen Realit√§ten unserer Branche, die sich √ºber Jahre etabliert haben. Ein abruptes Anpassen des Stromverbrauchs w√ºrde nicht nur die Produktionsprozesse und Energieeffizienzma√ünahmen st√∂ren, denn eine flexible Anlagenfahrweise wirkt sich negativ auf die Energieeffizienz aus. Sie w√ºrde auch unsere Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit gef√§hrden, da eine Umstellung der Prozesse auf schwankende Energiezufuhr √§u√üerst kostspielig und zeitaufwendig ist ‚Äì es m√ºssen Investitionen get√§tigt und Zielkonflikte aufgel√∂st werden. Die Vergr√∂√üerung von Produktlagern h√§tte dar√ºber hinaus negative Auswirkungen auf das Working Capital und ist nur bedingt umsetzbar. Bei der Chloralkali-Elektrolyse, zum Beispiel, ist Chlor in gro√üen Mengen kaum lagerbar und bedarf einer schnellen Weiterverarbeitung. Wie also k√∂nnen wir die Reform so gestalten, dass sie in der Praxis umsetzbar ist? Einige Vorschl√§ge:‚ñ™ Langfristige √úbergangsregelungen: Die √úbergangsregelungen m√ºssen √ºber 2030 hinausgehen, um den betroffenen Unternehmen ausreichend Zeit zur Anpassung zu geben.‚ñ™¬†Praxistaugliche Entlastungsregelungen: Es sollten angemessene Toleranzschwellen und ausreichende Reaktionszeiten eingef√ºhrt werden, um eine realistische Umsetzung zu erm√∂glichen.‚ñ™¬†Ber√ºcksichtigung der Energiewendekompetenz: Die Entlastungsregelungen sollten nicht nur auf kurzfristige Verbrauchs√§nderungen fokussieren, sondern auch die langfristigen Beitr√§ge der Unternehmen zur Energiewende w√ºrdigen. Wenn wir diese Punkte ber√ºcksichtigen, kann die Entgeltreform gelingen und wir k√∂nnen die dringend notwendige hashtag#Energiewende weiter vorantreiben ‚Äì ohne dabei die Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit und hashtag#Transformation einer wichtigen Schl√ºsselbranche zu gef√§hrden.

Heute haben 1.800 Azubis und dual Studierende bei der Deutsche Telekom angefangen. Ich freue mich, dass ihr jetzt hashtag#dabei seid! Bei uns wird Bildung Wirklichkeit. Aber zwischen Wunsch und Wirklichkeit klafft leider oft eine L√ºcke. Auch in unserem Bildungssystem. Und die Bev√∂lkerung hat ein gutes Gesp√ºr daf√ºr, was schiefl√§uft. Stichworte Lehrermangel, Sanierung, Ausstattung, Digitalisierung. Das zeigt auch eine Studie unserer Deutsche Telekom Stiftung. Zusammen mit dem Institut f√ºr Demoskopie hashtag#Allensbach hat sie Ideal und Realit√§t gegen√ºbergestellt. Die gr√∂√üte Diskrepanz sehen die Befragten bei der digitalen Ausstattung an Schulen. 79 Prozent sagen, dass es die unbedingt braucht. Aber nur 11 Prozent sagen, dass es sie schon gibt.  Das Thema Bildung besch√§ftigt mich. F√ºr mich ist klar ‚Äì und darin f√ºhle ich mich durch die Studie best√§tigt: Bildung ist nichts f√ºr kurzfristige Ma√ünahmen. Investitionen wirken langfristig. Wir investieren also auch langfristig in Bildung. Aktuell arbeiten 5.400 Azubis und dual Studierende bei der hashtag#Telekom. √úber unsere Neuzug√§nge in diesem Jahr freuen wir uns sehr ‚Äì herzlich willkommen!

Die sichere Energiezukunft braucht flexible Akteure und Strukturen. Genau dies wollen wir mit unserer Flexibilit√§ts-Kampagne in den n√§chsten Monaten herausstellen. Wir brauchen Flexibilit√§t, um beide Seiten in Einklang zu bringen. Nur so k√∂nnen wir unsere Klimaziele erreichen und die Energiewende vorantreiben. The excitement at Allianz is building for the upcoming Paralympic Games, which are a shining example of how sport, especially Para sport, can contribute to a more inclusive and innovative society.  ‚Ä¢ First, this innovation is largely driven by the Para athletes themselves, who transform their sports by pushing the boundaries of the status quo. All athletes, especially Paralympians, inspire us with their resilience, determination, and human spirit. ‚Ä¢ Second, the venues play an important role. Paris 2024 emphasized accessibility and equality. Since winning the bid to host the Games in 2017, the city has transformed its transportation infrastructure, making for example 100% of its bus routes and tram lines now wheelchair accessible. There is still more to do. These improvements enable the flow of talent and economic growth in the Paris metro region and leave a legacy of mobility that will benefit all people in the region for years to come. At hashtag#Allianz, inclusivity is a fundamental part of our culture and values. Our partnerships with the International Paralympic Committee and the Valuable 500 help us take meaningful steps toward greater inclusion for people with disabilities. As the Worldwide Insurance Partner of the Olympic and Paralympic Movements since 2021, we have the incredible opportunity of supporting over 160 athletes globally, assisting them not only in their sporting ambitions but also in preparing for careers beyond athletic competition, through various insurance solutions, mentoring, and health initiatives. Perhaps more than any other global event, the Olympic and Paralympic Games have a unique ability to unite people from diverse backgrounds and cultures. In a world that often feels divided, the Olympic and Paralympic Games embrace differences and act as a bridge connecting us to one another.  I am very proud of my Allianz colleagues whose collaborative work over many months has helped to bring the world together at the Olympic and Paralympic Games hashtag#Paris2024.¬†And thank you to all the athletes for showing us how peaceful competition transforms our world for the better.  International Paralympic Committee International Olympic Committee ‚Äì IOC

I‚Äôm currently at the 50th Offshore Northern Seas Conference here in Norway ‚Äì an important platform for connecting the energy industry, government, and society. These are the points that have stuck out for me over the last two days:‚û°Ô∏è Geopolitical dynamics continue to shape the energy landscape and therefore also the discussions here at ONS. This year‚Äôs conference is themed ‚ÄúImagine‚Äù, emphasizing the importance of security and scalability besides the sustainability, affordability and availability aspect in the energy industry.‚û°Ô∏è Cooperation remains essential. We are forefronting this with our Energy Resilience Leadership Group forming a "coalition of the willing" from politics, industry, and finance. Policymakers must provide clear incentives and guarantees to scale future technologies.‚û°Ô∏è Norway plays a crucial role in the energy transition. Following the attack on Ukraine, Norway promptly increased its gas supply to Europe by 10% in 2022, showcasing Norway‚Äôs international connectivity and pragmatic, goal-oriented solutions. It was a privilege to host H.E. Crown Prince Haakon of Norway at our booth and showcase our Siemens Energy solutions available now to advance the energy transition.Many thanks to our Team Purple for coordinating everything here at ONS. Special congratulations to Siemens Gamesa and Jonas Pagh Jensen for winning the ONS Innovation Award today. Our team has developed a way of recycling wind turbine blades after their lifecycle to be used in new applications ¬†‚Äì a first in the industry and a major step towards achieving 100% recyclability of our wind turbines.hashtag#ONS50 hashtag#energytransition hashtag#offshore

For me, engagement in the workplace has a lot to do with the 5Fs ‚Äì being fast, focused, flexible, friendly and fun. Furthermore, it's very important to me to know WHY I'm engaged. Ask not what your company can do for you ‚Äì ask what you can do for your company!This engaged and giving attitude has been part of my work ethos since the beginning of my professional career.Here‚Äôs why considering an engaged and giving attitude is a good idea:üåü Studies show that giving makes you a happier, more fulfilled person. Especially if you follow a purpose. üåü Research shows too, that givers‚Äîthose who help others without expecting anything in return‚Äîachieve the highest levels of success. Stepping on everybody‚Äôs feet while climbing the career ladder is thankfully out-dated. Team players are needed instead. üåü With an engaged and giving attitude we can help our colleagues and clients in the moment of truth, fostering trust.If I look at our TEC values hashtag#transparency, hashtag#engagement, hashtag#collaboration and our purpose ¬¥together we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship`, I feel that an engaged and giving attitude is deeply rooted within the DNA of Talanx Group. Because this topic is so important to us, we regularly involve colleagues and ask for their feedback on how we can embed engagement even better within the Group and which environment they need to thrive and to shape the future of our company. We have just launched a survey today to find out what our colleagues think about these topics.I‚Äôm also curious to hear your personal stories in the comments on the power of giving and engagement in the workplace. hashtag#TogetherTalanx

Nachdem ich im Juli meine Sommertour in unseren Konzerngesellschaften in Mittel- und Osteuropa gestartet habe, hatte ich letzte Woche die Freude, gemeinsam mit unserer neuen CFO Nadia Jakobi einige deutsche Konzerneinheiten zu besuchen. √úber Quickborn (HanseWerk-Gruppe), Hamburg (E.ON Grid Solutions), Hannover/Sarstedt (Avacon Gruppe), Magdeburg/Halle/Markkleeberg (enviaM-Gruppe) und Regensburg/Pfaffenhofen (Bayernwerk) ging es final nach Augsburg (Lechwerke AG). Die hat mir ihre Beteiligung an der Nebelhorn-Bergbahn gezeigt inkl. des mit Unterst√ºtzung von LEW gebauten Hindelanger Klettersteigs. Was ich von meiner Reise und aus den Gespr√§chen besonders mitnehme:(1)¬†¬†Die operativen Herausforderungen sind gewaltig. Sowohl bei Strom als auch bei W√§rme. Die Dimension des erforderlichen Umbaus wird einem erst so richtig klar, wenn man sie aus verschiedenen Perspektiven jeden Tag wieder dargestellt bekommt. Zuversicht haben mir da aber die vielen kompetenten Kollegen gegeben. Echte hashtag#playmaker der Energiewende!(2)¬†¬†Bezahlbarkeit wird ein massives Thema werden ‚Äì vor allem in der √úbergangsphase der n√§chsten 10 Jahre. Die Mietpreise in Neubaugebieten, in denen wir die W√§rme dekarbonisieren, waren f√ºr mich erschreckend. Und den NAP k√∂nnen und wollen wir nicht einfach 1:1 wie von der Politik gew√ºnscht umsetzen und unseren Kunden in Rechnung stellen. ¬†Wir werden schlauere Wege finden m√ºssen. (3)¬†¬†Wir werden mehr Innovationen sehen, als gemeinhin vermutet ‚Äì digitale und nicht digitale. Das macht Hoffnung. Aber es wird die gesamte Branche unter Hochspannung halten.(4)¬†¬†Wir werden massiv in Aus- und Weiterbildung investieren m√ºssen. Bei enviaM-Gruppe und Bayernwerk habe ich die Ausbildungsst√§tten gesehen. E.ON braucht sich wahrlich nicht zu verstecken. Aber auch wir schaffen es noch nicht, genug Frauen in technische Berufe zu ziehen. hashtag#itsonus

In Solingen bin ich geboren und aufgewachsen. Freunde und Familie leben dort. Das Attentat auf dem Stadtfest zum Stadtjubil√§um geht mir darum pers√∂nlich besonders nahe. Ich bin geschockt, fassungslos und tieftraurig. Ich denke an die Menschen, die nur friedlich und ausgelassen  feiern wollten und Opfer einer  hinterh√§ltigen Gewalttat wurden.Meine Gedanken sind auch bei ihren Angeh√∂rigen sowie allen Menschen, die von dieser Tat betroffen sind. Und sie gelten denen, die anderswo unschuldig von Gewalt und Krieg betroffen sind.Manchmal f√ºhle ich mich ohnm√§chtig und bin entt√§uscht. Was sollen wir all dem Hass, der Gewalt und radikalen Ideologien entgegen halten? Und mir f√§llt wenig ein. Au√üer, dass wir zusammenhalten. Dass wir Gemeinsinn √ºben. Dass wir da sind f√ºr andere. Dass wir konsequent gegen Hass, Hetze und Gewalt vorgehen. Und dass wir uns im Humanismus √ºben und unsere Kinder in diesem Geist erziehen. hashtag#Solingen hashtag#Gemeinschaft hashtag#Zusammenhalt hashtag#Mitgef√ºhl

Schwarz sehen - Macher treffenTreffen mit Gerd Chrzanowski (CEO), Christian M√ºller M√ºller (Co-CEO Schwarz Digits), Rolf Schumann (Co-CEO Schwarz Digits) und Walter Wolf (Vorstand Infrastruktur) von der Schwarz-Gruppe. Thema: Die Souver√§nit√§t am Standort Deutschland durch die Entwicklung eigener Kompetenzen. Schwarz ist als Gruppe Nummer 1 im deutschen Einzelhandel und wir sind die Nummer 1 in der Telekommunikation. Wir beide wissen: Skalierung macht den Unterschied! Dar√ºber hinaus eint uns das Bed√ºrfnis, den Standort Deutschland zu verbessern, was die Digitalisierung betrifft. Beide Unternehmen treiben dabei die gleichen Themen voran:1. Souver√§ne Cloud: DSGVO konform und souver√§n von den US-Plattformen2. Nutzung der Chancen von KI3. Schutz und Sicherheit unserer Daten und digitalen Infrastruktur4. Nachhaltigkeit, insb. Recycling & Circularity5. KundInnen mit Qualit√§t gewinnen und halten Wenn die Schwarzgruppe etwas macht, dann konsequent. Lidl in Germany war unser erster Gro√ükunde, der sich fl√§chendeckig f√ºr Glasfaser entschieden hat. Bis 2030 werden wir fast jede Lidl-Filiale in Deutschland ans Glasfasernetz angeschlossen haben. Und zwar redundant. Und wenn n√∂tig, schaffen wir auch eine Anbindung √ºber Satellit. Gleichzeitig hat mich die Umsetzungsst√§rke der Schwarz Gruppe beeindruckt. Hier wird nicht lang gefackelt, um eine passende IT f√ºr das Unternehmen und seine Filialen bereitstellen zu k√∂nnen. Und zwar auf so einem hohen Niveau, dass sie auch am externen Markt verkauft werden kann. PeZero, StackIT und XM Cyber beweisen das.Ich bin ein gro√üer Fan dieses Ansatzes. Sell what you use, sell what you built.  Genauso ist unser Telekom Security-Gesch√§ft entstanden, welches uns einerseits intern sch√ºtzt und andererseits bald 300 Millionen Umsatz generiert. Und noch eine Sache haben wir gemein: unsere Verbundenheit zum Sport. Einerseits sind wir beide stolze Partner des FC Bayern M√ºnchen . Andererseits ist Schwarz-Gruppe ein wichtiger Partner des Deutschen Radsports. Da musste ich schon schmunzeln, dass wir oben in den Meeting-R√§umen √ºber Internet in Lichtgeschwindigkeit sprachen, w√§hrend unten die Radprofis der Deutschland-Tour vorbeigezischt sind.  PS. Das Eigenmarken-Eis ‚ÄûGelato‚Äú von Lidl¬†unbedingt probieren. Ist mindestens so lecker wie das ‚ÄûGro√üe‚Äú Eis ;-) Warum sollte das bei digitalen Diensten nicht auch gelingen? Dr. Ferri Abolhassan Klaus Werner Christine Knackfuss-Nikolic

Just found an article I wrote around the year 2000! Some of the insights are bold, even for today. Excerpts below, 2+ decades old, comments in brackets are new.- Even though almost all large companies today have some sort of electronic "backbone" which carries at least all operational data, these companies are still far from being pictures of humming efficiency and continuous improvement.- All in all, there is a general under-performance in the formal workplace that disappoints first-time recruits within days of their joining. (!)- It is tedious to enter data, hence individuals choose not to enter it.- Where updates are to be change-triggered, it is often not obvious when the change takes place.... Many changes occur gradually, imperceptibly and continuously, frequently with a substantial ambiguity during the process. Information on these changes is never updated...- The mode of input of a lot of data and information is still the humble keyboard, which requires specially dedicated and considerable effort to transfer information from individual brains to the system.... At any time the information on the system is but a small subset of what is carried around by individuals in their brains.- There is the perception that light conjecture should not be permitted on the system... The system is not used so much for discussions as for posting results.- Hard data is not enough for managers. Research shows that managers strongly favour the verbal media and look for what is known as "soft" information... There is significant information content of a non-data kind in a face to face, or even a telephone, conversation. What is more, the human brain is of such construction that it finds this information content easy to latch on to. This information content is often referred to as "soft", although just because computers cannot process it does not mean it is in any way less significant than "hard" data. One is not a substitute for the other. Thus current... information systems, ERP packages for example, that focus on "what information is needed where" in a divide-and-conquer or command-and-control mode, serve only a limited purpose. No one is predicting that these systems will solve the majority of managerial problems. (!)- People are loathe to part with privileged information. The mere fact that information can be shared does not mean it will be shared.- The fact is that although basic operations are extremely vital to the success of a company, they are important not only in the sense that they must occur in an error-free way, but also in the sense that they need to be continuously improved and optimised. (!)(I love it all! It goes on to discuss how audio and video storage and processing  will develop, predicts the emergence of "Omniscient Anonymous Manager" systems that, paradoxically, should enable some free market dynamics in organisations instead of command and control ones. The last few pages of the paper are, sadly, missing.)

And if everyone in the team shows this engagement and collaboration is perfectly organized, then together we move things for the best. I sensed a lot of this positive energy and engagement when talking to my colleagues. This spirit within our company makes me very optimistic about our future.  hashtag#Transparency hashtag#Engagement hashtag#Collaboration

Raus aus dem B√ºro und unterwegs bei unseren Kundinnen und Kunden. Das ist f√ºr jeden im Telekom-Management Pflicht, aber vor allem auch Vergn√ºgen. I'm excited to announce our recent collaboration with Carlisle Construction Materials. When Dorin Comaniciu gifted me "Outlive" by Dr. Peter Attia , I was skeptical of what I initially thought was ‚Äúanother longevity book," but within a few pages, it proved me wrong.The book provides an exceptionally detailed and yet accessible overview of non-communicable diseases, such as heart disease, cancer, Alzheimer‚Äôs (plus related neurodegenerative diseases), and metabolic dysfunction (insulin resistance, Type 2 diabetes). Many of these are the very diseases we at Siemens Healthineers strive to combat through innovative technologies. Dr. Attia, as a physician, comes from a different angle. In "Outlive," he emphasizes the significant impact that individual choices have on these conditions, including exercise, nutrition, sleep, and taking mental health seriously. The practical tips offered are as valuable as the theoretical insights.What struck me most was Dr. Attia‚Äôs self-critical journey towards a healthier lifestyle. He argues convincingly that modern medicine still sees itself too much as a "break/fix," often waiting for an intervention to become necessary rather than focusing on prevention, coaching, and early detection. This perspective resonates deeply with our work at hashtag#SiemensHealthineers. We work every day on innovations and their global distribution to combat these diseases better, earlier, and more efficiently ‚Äì but at the same time, "Outlive" highlights what is needed in conjunction with technology.To effectively address the challenges posed by workforce shortages, an increasing population, and the growing threat to public health from climate change, it is essential to consider both together: individual efforts for a healthier life and high-quality technologies for early prevention and treatment. This comprehensive approach will help manage the impact of these challenges.As you reflect on your health journey, consider this: How can you incorporate prevention into your daily life? What small changes can you make today to ensure a healthier tomorrow?hashtag#BookRecommendation

Rising travel costs and financial constraints are top of mind this summer, but people‚Äôs intention to travel remain sky high, according to the 2024 Allianz Partners International Vacation Confidence Index. 83% of the survey participants in Europe plan to travel between June and September. It‚Äôs good to see that travel during the traditional summer holiday season remains popular for disconnecting, recharging, and seeking inspiration ‚Äî whether through exposure to new cultures, exploring creative pursuits, or spending time with family and friends. Travelers are also creating demand for sustainable innovations, which is exciting to see.  Departing from our daily routines refreshes our spirits. Travel expands our minds through exposure to new places, people, and cultures. While smooth travels are usually the norm; unfortunately, our travel can include uncertainties like medical emergencies, flight disruptions, or lost luggage, which can be costly. Proper preparation helps protect much-deserved holidays from unnecessary stress and financial worry. With travel insurance, Allianz plays an important role in helping millions of people around the world enjoy worry-free holidays.  Allianz Partners travel solution, the Allyz Platform, provides real-time safety alerts, access to telehealth services, automated flight claims, and a handy travel wallet ‚Äì all designed to simplify trip management and ensure peace of mind.  By preparing for the unexpected, we can truly relax, reflect and refresh. Wishing everyone safe and enjoyable travels this summer.  hashtag#AllianzTravel hashtag#TravelInsurance hashtag#Allianz

Remembering Tagore‚Äôs immortal words on India‚Äôs hashtag#IndependenceDay:Where the mind is without fear and the head is held high;Where knowledge is free;Where the world has not been broken up into fragments by narrow domestic walls;Where words come out from the depth of truth;Where tireless striving stretches its arms towards perfection;Where the clear stream of reason has not lost its way into the dreary desert sand of dead habit;Where the mind is led forward by thee into ever-widening thought and action‚ÄîInto that heaven of freedom, my Father, let my country awake.

Today, we published our financial results for the first half of fiscal year 2024. We are looking back at six months with an operating performance in line with our expectations, and we are fully on track to reach our Group forecast for fiscal year 2024. Our adjusted Group EBITDA came in at ‚Ç¨4.9 billion, around ‚Ç¨800 million below prior-year level. This decline was anticipated because our EBITDA is masked by positive one-off effects in the prior-year period. As Europe's largest distribution grid operator, supplier to 47 million customers, and provider of intelligent energy solutions, we want to be the company that makes new energy work in Europe. We accept this challenge, and we deliver. Basis for this is our strong operating performance and our strong balance sheet, which is also reflected in our numbers. With our ambitious investment program, we make our contribution. In the first half of 2024 alone, we invested a total of ‚Ç¨2.9 billion into the energy transition, a plus of more than 20% year-over-year. And we will continue to deliver. More information on our financial figures: https://lnkd.in/en_zJijk

How can you shape your career? I shared four experiences with our new trainees.I spoke to our ten talents who are taking part in our newly launched TalanXPlore trainee programme. Wenn man so will, ist die Deutsche Telekom ein Museum. Aber unser Museum ist mehr Ausblick als R√ºckblick. Und manches erkennt man vielleicht nicht auf den ersten Blick als Kunstwerk. Kunst steht f√ºr sich. Und wirkt durch sich. So auch in unserer Zentrale in hashtag#Bonn. Um jede Ecke, um die ich hier gehe, finde ich Kunst. Da hei√üt es dann: Gedanken schweifen lassen und sch√§rfen, um die Ecke denken. Denn bei neu denken und kritisch reflektieren hilft ‚Äì auch ‚Äì Kunst. Ein kleiner Beitrag, aber einer, der uns bei der hashtag#Telekom wichtig ist. Darum hat die Telekom eine Kunstsammlung.F√ºr mich ist jede Investition dabei immer eine Frage des Mehrwerts. Oder ‚Äì ganz klassisch ‚Äì der Rendite. Dabei hat Kunst f√ºr mich eine ‚ÄûRendite‚Äú jenseits der m√∂glichen Wertsteigerung einzelner Objekte. Denn: Kunst inspiriert. Kunst trainiert das Denken. Kunst stellt den Status Quo infrage.All das braucht es in Unternehmen.

Fakten statt FakesVorgestern war ich auf der Pioneer2. Dort stand ein Zitat von Hannah Arendt: ‚ÄûWahrheit gibt es nur zu zweien.‚ÄúDas Zitat sagt aus meiner Sicht zwei Dinge. N√§mlich erstens, dass es wichtig ist, dass wir in den Dialog treten. Denn ansonsten f√ºhren wir letztlich Selbstgespr√§che und unsere ‚ÄûWahrheiten‚Äú werden zur Borniertheit.Zweitens sagt das Zitat aber auch, dass Wahrheit immer auch jemanden braucht, der sie einem ‚Äûabkauft‚Äú. Wahrheit ist so betrachtet das, worauf man sich ‚Äûeinigt‚Äú. Und wir merken schon daran: Hier wird es kompliziert mit der ‚ÄûWahrheit‚Äú. Denn sie existiert - als geteiltes Konstrukt betrachtet - ganz offensichtlich auch jenseits der Fakten und der Wirklichkeit (die wiederum ja immer nur durch die Filter unserer Wahrnehmung erlebt wird).Solche ‚Äûgeteilten Konstrukte‚Äú geben Anlass zur Sorge. Denn wir sehen, dass sie sich oft von Fakten entfernen. Da kann ich sogar bei der Telekom bleiben. 5G macht Corona? Das wurde tats√§chlich behauptet. Und wurde die Telekom-Gr√ºndung nicht 1994 beschlossen? Quersumme 23? Die Zahl der Illuminaten? So schnell habe ich mal eben eine Verschw√∂rung aufgedeckt üòâKrude Thesen gab es immer. Aber heute verbreiten sie sich noch leichter √ºber das Netz. Jedoch: Das Netz sind wir. Und das Netz bietet das, was wir von ihm erwarten und was wir daraus machen. Umso wichtiger ist, dass wir damit noch m√ºndiger und verantwortungsvoller umgehen. Dass wir unsere Erwartungen reflektieren. (Muss es immer ein Trigger sein?) Dass wir nicht dazu beitragen, Fakes zu verbreiten, die wiederum ‚Äûfalsche Wahrheiten‚Äú entstehen lassen.Darauf wollen wir mit unserem aktuellen Spot hinweisen. Ich sehe ihn als Impuls an uns alle. √úbrigens auch hier auf LinkedIn. Wir sollten aufpassen, was wir teilen. Danke an unsere Partner und Ulrich Klenke und Team f√ºr die wie ich finde eindringliche Umsetzung. hashtag#gegenhassimnetz # goodmagenta

Gutes Interview heute Abend auf der Pioneer 2 mit Gabor Steingart. Morgen mehr dazu im Morgenbriefing. Ich bin selbst gespannt! Das Gespr√§ch war ein Parforceritt durch die Geschichte der Telekom, unseren Erfolg auf beiden Seiten des Atlantiks, die wirtschaftlichen Herausforderungen Deutschlands und Europas sowie der Zukunftsthemen der Telekom. Geplant hatten wir 45 Minuten, ich glaube es sind dann 90 geworden, aber gef√ºhlt waren es nur 15. ‚ÄûMit vollen Hosen ist gut stinken‚Äú - sagt der Rheinl√§nder. Und da waren unsere Quartalsergebnisse nat√ºrlich eine gute Vorlage. Aber wie immer gab es nat√ºrlich auch kritische Fragen. Und so manche pers√∂nliche. Danke, f√ºr die Einladung und das Gespr√§ch mit Gabor Steingart, aber auch vielen LeserInnen auf dem Boot.

The Olympic and Paralympic Games draw thousands of athletes from more than 200 countries, including our medal-winning Allianz athletes. They are a reminder of what can be achieved when you are armed with a clear purpose, a deep commitment to excellence, and resilience in the face of adversity. These ingredients of performance are also reflected within Allianz. Our ability to deliver excellent results comes down to our purpose as a company: our focus on customers. In June, when I visited our customers in southern Germany following the severe floods, I was incredibly proud of the response of our people, who worked tirelessly together to support our customers with compassion, speed, and expertise ‚Äì which in turn delivered outstanding service and limited damages.  These core strengths translate into the type of smart growth and resilience that our shareholders value:  For the first half of the year:¬∑¬†our total business volume reached 91.0 billion euros, representing solid growth of 6.4%¬∑¬†our operating profit increased by 5.3% to 7.9 billion euros¬∑¬†the core net income to shareholders surged to 5.0 billion euros, an increase of 7.7%. This gives us confidence in our ability to achieve our full year outlook of 14.8 billion euros, +/- 1 billion euros. Thank you to our Allianz colleagues for your extraordinary efforts on behalf of the Allianz community and your contributions to this success. hashtag#Q2 hashtag#FinancialResults hashtag#AllianzFinancialResults hashtag#Olympics hashtag#Allianz

Creating a hashtag#sustainable world requires proactive and joint efforts! At hashtag#thyssenkrupp, we are dedicated to leading the industrial transformation necessary to combat hashtag#climatechange. And we can achieve this only by combining our strengths. We are eager to engage in discussions with others, including customers and partners, to jointly address these global issues. Today was another great step forward on our mission to advance the hashtag#greentransformation! I had the honor of connecting with industry leaders in India at an exclusive CEO roundtable on advancing industrial decarbonization, excellently moderated by Nishaanth Balashanmugam, Director of GH2 India. During the session, I highlighted three crucial levers for the energy transition in India:1Ô∏è‚É£ Decarbonizing the industrial sector in India requires Gigawatt scale solutions. 2Ô∏è‚É£ A combination of blue and green pathways can accelerate carbon neutrality in hard-to-abate sectors.3Ô∏è‚É£ India has the potential to become a green ammonia powerhouse by tripling its capacity.This mindset is vital for industry leaders as we navigate and enable the energy transition. Following this, Sanmit Ahuja from hashtag#CETFi led a discussion on financing decarbonization, emphasizing the need for a host of first-of-a-kind (FOAK) projects that evolve into Nth-of-a-kind (NOAK) portfolios. Furthermore, we explored India's hashtag#biomass availability and potential, discussing synergies with thyssenkrupp's biomass gasification technology, which holds immense promise for the country.  The Council on Energy, Environment and Water (CEEW) provided valuable insights from a policy perspective, reiterating the necessity of a collaborative approach. Additionally, India's substantial basalt availability was showcased, positioning the country well for carbon capture and storage initiatives. The consensus at the roundtable is clear: All stakeholders in the value chain must move closer together to make the hashtag#energytransition feasible for both the hashtag#industry and the hashtag#world! Cetin Nazikkol Rajesh Kamath Vaidyanathan Nagarajan Prana Tharthiharan Natarajan Raj  Kumar Jha

hashtag#Climate change affects us all. We need to join forces to combat it. At thyssenkrupp, we are committed to pioneering the transformation of industry. It's an ambitious task, but a realistic one, thanks to our outstanding hashtag#GENERATIONTK. To leverage the tremendous opportunities of the hashtag#greentransformation, we have bundled some of our most cutting-edge technologies in our Decarbon Technologies segment.  hashtag#Greenhydrogen will play a central role in energy-intensive industries, including steel and the chemical industry. A reliable hashtag#infrastructure is crucial for a smooth ramp-up. There is no doubt that we will have to import a proportion of hydrogen from other countries where green energy is more affordable. In addition to pipelines, transportation by ship will be crucial. hashtag#Ammonia is ideal for shipping clean hydrogen around the globe. Why? Firstly, ammonia has a higher energy density than liquid hydrogen. Secondly, ammonia is already transported in large quantities worldwide; there are global standards for safe handling and an established infrastructure. At its destination after shipping, the hydrogen must be recovered using a process called hashtag#ammoniacracking. Ammonia is a molecule that consists of only two components: nitrogen and hydrogen, NH3. The cracker decomposes NH3 back into nitrogen (N) and hydrogen (H). Our talented team at thyssenkrupp Uhde has been experts in ammonia technologies for 100 years and reliably deliver the expertise for this important technology.  Through solutions like this, we demonstrate the power of hashtag#thyssenkrupp. We're proud to transition from being part of the climate change problem to being an integral part of the solution. We are absolutely thrilled to be part of this transformative journey!

What Siemens Energy does today from our Huttenstra√üe location all began in 1904 with the production of steam turbines and generators at the AEG factory in Berlin. üè≠ This factory has survived two world wars and witnessed the construction and fall of the Berlin Wall. Most importantly, however, it has created a backbone for a sustainable energy system for 120 years.Nowadays, it is much more than just a turbine factory. It is an EnergySphere that also houses electrolyzer production, additive manufacturing, an Innovation Center, and not to forget our Corporate Center right here in the heart of Berlin. All made possible by amazing people who continue to put their hearts, minds, and passion into energizing society.120 years is reason enough to celebrate the past, but it is even more reason to look ahead to a future of leading the global energy transition with profitable, customer-driven solutions.hashtag#energytransition hashtag#berlin hashtag#flashbackfriday

Tonight, I have the honor to represent Allianz at the opening ceremony of the Olympic Games in Paris. From the Place de la Concorde to the Eiffel Tower and along the Seine, Paris is a historic and beautiful setting in which to celebrate athletes from around the world and see them reunited with fans, friends, and family. Over 19 thrilling days, 10,500 world-class athletes from over 200 National Olympic and Paralympic Committees and the IOC Refugee Olympic Team will compete across 32 different sports in the spirit of unity and peaceful competition.At hashtag#Allianz we are proud to be the Worldwide Olympic and Paralympic Insurance Partner. About 90 Team Allianz athletes will compete in Paris, cheered on by over 2,000 Allianz colleagues and supported by hundreds of Allianz volunteers who are working behind the scenes and on the ground to help ensure the Games‚Äô success.The ingenuity and determination leading to this monumental event is inspiring, and I would like to highlight three areas that have earned my admiration:ü•á The athletes. Talent alone does not make an Olympian. The athletes are here in Paris because of their tireless training, optimism, and perseverance, often in the face of great adversity. ü•á The democratic spirit of Paris 2024 is an inspiration to us all, with venues designed to encourage public accessibility and participation. For the first time in Olympic history, the Opening Ceremony will take place in the heart of a city, not in a remote stadium. The River Seine will be the public stage for welcoming the athletes. In an age of rising social polarization, the symbolism of these planning efforts is especially meaningful. ü•á These Games have set a new standard for environmental progress. With a goal of halving carbon emissions compared to previous games, the Olympic Games Paris 2024 will be the first to align with the Paris Climate Agreement, showcasing environmental responsibility and encouraging sustainable practices that benefit us all, including, for example, the use of 100% renewable energy. Events that bring the world together, like hashtag#Paris2024, are made possible through strong public-private partnerships. At Allianz, we believe in the power of sports to elevate and unite, and to transcend social and cultural barriers, which is why we‚Äôve been the Worldwide Insurance Partner of the Olympic and Paralympic Movements since 2021. Through our partnership, we manage risks, provide protection for events, organizers, participants and spectators, and support athletes through mentoring and career opportunities. We also mobilize health initiatives to help the next generation stay active. Allianz‚Äôs history in supporting the Olympics dates back to 1972 and we became the official Olympics and Paralympic partner in 2021. A special thank you to my Allianz colleagues whose work over many months has helped to enable this momentous, unifying event.¬†Let¬†the Games begin!International Olympic Committee ‚Äì IOC International Paralympic Committee

Die Debatte um die Gebotszonenteilung f√ºr Strom in Deutschland nimmt Fahrt auf. Meine 2 Cents aus Industrieperspektive:Die potenziell bevorstehende Aufteilung Deutschlands in mehrere Stromgebotszonen ist ein kontroverses Thema. Auf den ersten Blick mag ein Split sinnvoll erscheinen, haupts√§chlich, weil er strukturellen Engp√§ssen entgegenwirkten soll. Bei genauerem Hinsehen ergeben sich jedoch einige Nachteile, z.B.:- F√ºr bestehende Industriestandorte, die sich nicht einfach verlagern k√∂nnen, w√ºrde eine Gebotszonenteilung einen unkalkulierbaren Wettbewerbsnachteil bedeuten. Planungs- und Genehmigungsh√ºrden machen Standortverlagerungen langwierig und oft unm√∂glich.- Es besteht das Risiko, dass der Ansatz dezentraler Preiszonen den dringend ben√∂tigten Netzausbau weiter verz√∂gert.- Investitionsanreize f√ºr erneuerbare Energien im S√ºden w√ºrden durch Preisunterschiede konterkariert. Der Ausbau lie√üe sich nur noch mit massiver staatlicher F√∂rderung finanzieren.- Der Strommarkt w√ºrde durch eine Aufteilung in Gebotszonen deutlich an Liquidit√§t verlieren, da gesicherte Lieferungen nur noch regional m√∂glich w√§ren.- Studien zeigen: Die Gebotszonenteilung verringert zwar Eingriffe der √úbertragungsnetzbetreiber, beseitigt die Netzengp√§sse aber keineswegs. Der dringend n√∂tige Netzausbau bleibt unerl√§sslich.- Die Einf√ºhrung von Gebotszonen w√ºrde enorme B√ºrokratie und Unsicherheit f√ºr Netzbetreiber, Marktteilnehmer, Industrie und Beh√∂rden bedeuten ‚Äì in einer ohnehin sensiblen Transformationsphase.- Ein Gebotszonensplit k√∂nnte zudem das im Grundgesetz und auch im aktuellen Koalitionsvertrag verankerte Prinzip gleichwertiger Lebensverh√§ltnisse in Deutschland gef√§hrden.Ganzheitlich betrachtet, erscheint eine einheitliche bundesweite Gebotszone mit liquiden Stromm√§rkten, Investitionssicherheit und Wettbewerbsgleichheit der deutlich bessere Weg. Der konsequente Ausbau der √úbertragungsnetze zur Beseitigung der Engp√§sse muss dabei oberste Priorit√§t haben.Mehr dazu in der Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung (Link in den Kommentaren). Ich bin gespannt auf eure/Ihre Meinungen zum Thema.hashtag#Strompreise hashtag#EnergieWende hashtag#Industrie

During my visit to Singapore and Malaysia this week, I had the chance to catch up with government officials, customers and our Team Purple to explore sustainable energy initiatives that suit local requirements and market demand. Natural gas plays a crucial role in the power generation of both countries, underscoring gas power as pivotal in the transition to a net-zero energy world. For example, over the last 25 years alone, Singapore has transitioned its electricity generation from predominantly oil-based to 94% reliant on natural gas ‚Äì in turn saving tonnes of CO2.  Electricity demand is surging ‚Äì here and across the world ‚Äì and we can‚Äôt meet that demand without gas.  hashtag#decarbonization hashtag#naturalgas hashtag#asiapacfic

Wie steht es um den Wirtschaftsstandort Deutschland? Heute fr√ºh durfte ich das aus der Sicht von Siemens Healthineers im ARD-Morgenmagazin beleuchten. Unsere Branche, die industrielle Gesundheitswirtschaft, besch√§ftigt eine Million Menschen im Land ‚Äì ein Fakt, der manchmal etwas zu kurz kommt. Umso mehr hat es mich gefreut, ein Schlaglicht darauf werfen zu k√∂nnen und eine etwas positivere Sichtweise beizusteuern, die wir momentan aus der deutschen Wirtschaft leider zu selten h√∂ren. hashtag#SiemensHealthineers hat seit dem B√∂rsengang 650 Millionen Euro in Deutschland investiert ‚Äì weil wir von diesem Standort √ºberzeugt sind. Hier ist eines unserer globalen Zentren f√ºr Forschung und Entwicklung, viele Produktionsstandorte und auch unsere Unternehmenszentrale. Die Gesundheitswirtschaft ist eine Schl√ºsselindustrie des 21. Jahrhunderts, die gut zu unserem Land passt: Es geht um Qualit√§t, Pr√§zision, Forschung, Globalit√§t und nicht zuletzt um Vertrauen ‚Äì Werte also, die gut passen zum Siegel "Made in Germany", das nach wie vor ein hohes internationales Ansehen genie√üt, wie mir Kunden aus aller Welt immer wieder best√§tigen. Das sollten wir uns h√§ufiger vor Augen halten und uns auf unsere Chancen und St√§rken fokussieren, statt zu sehr auf die Dinge zu schauen, die manchmal nicht so gut funktionieren. Unser hashtag#TeamHealthineers hat diesen positiven Blick: Mehr als 70.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter ‚Äì davon etwa 16.000 in Deutschland ‚Äì leisten hier einen Beitrag, dass Menschen √ºberall auf der Welt gesund bleiben oder gesund werden. Das ist eine starke Motivation f√ºr unser Team und f√ºr viele (junge) Menschen, die ihr Berufsleben in unserem Unternehmen starten wollen.Herzlichen Dank an das MoMa-Team f√ºr die Einladung und an Anna Planken f√ºr das Gespr√§ch.

I am proud of the innovative solutions developed every day by our teams all over the world. That's why I want to show you what our hashtag#GENERATIONTK is achieving. One of the key challenges we are tackling is hashtag#climatechange, whose consequences will be felt by us all. At thyssenkrupp, we are committed to leading the hashtag#greentransformation of the entire industry. To this end, we have consolidated some of our most cutting-edge technologies within our Decarbon Technologies segment. This enables us to fully leverage the potential of our innovative products and services to achieve hashtag#climate targets ‚Äì for us, our partners, and society at large. Today, I want to share with you the achievements of the motivated team at thyssenkrupp rothe erde. They are one of the world's leading manufacturers of hashtag#slewingbearings, which are essential for the expansion of renewable energies at competitive costs. Slewing bearings are installed at various points in wind turbines, whether on land or at sea. They align the giants in the direction of the hashtag#wind and absorb the wind's hashtag#energy, converting it into mechanical energy. Smooth movement of the entire system is key here and only works thanks to years of research and development. The forces exerted are enormous: a typical land-based hashtag#windturbine with three rotor blades, each 63 meters long and weighing 20 tons, generates an output of 6.1 megawatts at a wind speed of 14 meters per second. That's the power of around 60 cars. And what do you get if such a wind turbine generates energy for one hour? Green hashtag#electricity for three two-person households for a whole year! Through solutions like this, we demonstrate our hashtag#power and commitment: thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies is dedicated to driving change. We're proud to transition from being part of the climate change problem to being an integral part of the solution. Without innovative solutions like this, the world would literally stand still. That‚Äôs impressive!

Was nicht zusammenpasst sind: Hohe Energiekosten, starke Regulierung und gro√üe Transformationsvorhaben. Trotzdem glaube ich an die Zukunft des Industriestandorts Deutschland, auch f√ºr die hashtag#Chemie. Mit Michael Vassiliadis (Industriegewerkschaft IGBCE) diskutierte ich letzte Woche √ºber die fortw√§hrenden Herausforderungen der Chemieindustrie in Deutschland und m√∂gliche L√∂sungswege.In einem Punkt waren wir uns besonders einig: In unserer komplexen Situation ist es unerl√§sslich, Priorit√§ten zu setzen und einen klaren Fahrplan zu haben. Denn beim Versuch, alles gleichzeitig anzugehen, kommen wir schnell ins Straucheln, und laufen Gefahr, dass nichts davon funktioniert.Danke Michael und Regina Karsch f√ºr das gute Gespr√§ch im Rahmen der ‚ÄûIGBCE Kompass‚Äú Reihe (Link zur kompletten Folge in den Kommentaren).German Chemical Industry Association VCI Covestro

We're missing out on countless potential Einsteins and Curies  In half the world, brilliant minds slumber, unable to bring their inventive spirit to the table. As the researcher Max Roser powerfully argues, "Talent is everywhere, but opportunity is not." This means we are all losing out on ideas and innovations that could help solve humanity's greatest challenges. Tapping into the world's full innovation potential requires empowering people everywhere, especially younger generations, with access to quality education. hashtag#WorldYouthSkillsDay reminds us of the need for this, but also of the many challenges the way towards quality education for all is paved with. Without further steps, only one in six countries will achieve the United Nations hashtag#SDG education targets by 2030. Developed countries like Germany have a head start. Now we must lead the way in using that advantage to uplift others and act as a role model and catalyst. At the same time, we can't take our eye off continually strengthening education at home to ensure everyone has the opportunity to develop a fact-based world view and become an innovator. In particular, it takes greater efforts to foster science education. According to experts, only 25% of OECD first-year students take STEM subjects. On the other hand, there could be 50 million job openings for STEM positions worldwide by 2030. What can we do to make sure the map turns more and more purple? I believe we all must find our particular contribution within our scope. üëâ Scientists must be courageous enough to leave the beaten track.üëâ Businesses must demonstrate that knowledge, perseverance, and collaboration lead to innovation and progress.üëâ Governments and society must acknowledge the value of education and help make the education systems more accessible and future oriented. Kudos to Our World in Data for the graphic.

What do the world's biggest technology companies and the most successful football teams have in common? They reflect on problems and lessons learned rather than on successful moves.Here's why this is a crucial success factor:üëâ In a VUCA world, it's important to develop innovative solutions in an agile way, knowing that some will work, and some won't. Trial and error is part of innovation.üëâ Talking about lessons learned is not about assigning blame, but about reflecting on our actions and about growing together. Courage in the matter and humbleness in the person are important. üëâ Avoid sunk cost fallacy. Don‚Äôt continue with an unbeneficial endeavour just because you have already invested much. üëâ Don‚Äôt forget: Relative performance counts. üëâ For all this to happen, we also need leaders who treat team members as equals, encourage them to try out new things and to learn. Trust is the key! In the next meeting, let‚Äôs not talk about best practices, but let‚Äôs talk about what didn‚Äôt work and help each other with challenges.Today's lessons are tomorrow's opportunities.So, let's grow together! üí™What do you think on this topic? I'm looking forward to your comments.hashtag#ErrorCulture hashtag#Leadership hashtag#GrowthMindset hashtag#Innovation

As the new EU legislature kicks into gear, it‚Äôs time to get to work! Yesterday, alongside Kristian Ruby, I attended the Informal Energy Council to outline Eurelectric‚Äôs Grids for Speed study and what we need to supercharge Europe‚Äôs grid growth.  You know the numbers by now: Europe needs to almost double its annual investments in distribution grids to 67bn EUR a year between now and 2050 ‚Äì this can be reduced to 55bn EUR a year if we pull the right levers. Why? Because speed is of the essence. Take E.ON: it took almost 15 years for 1 million RES plants to feed into our networks, it will take only 3 years to connect the second million.  The other part of the equation is turning electrification in Europe into hyperdrive. Over the past decade the rate has stagnated, a little over 20% and that‚Äôs not good enough: we need to speed up the electrification of Europe‚Äôs society and economy by a factor of 4 between now and 2050.¬†¬†I was impressed to see a strong commitment by EU countries to deliver RePowerEU goals by 2030 and the central role of electricity in the quest for energy autonomy.  And one final message: whilst electricity will fuel our economy, we have to fuel electricity with capital. Our energy costs are shifting and we have to make a big down payment in the next decade to invest in heat pumps, EVs, RES and grid infrastructure. Energy Ministers, Finance Ministers, industry and central banks must come together to leverage the massive amounts of capital we need. Let‚Äôs get on with the job! More here: https://lnkd.in/diCNXd4a hashtag#energytransition

Vier Wochen Fu√üball-Fieber liegen hinter uns, Spanien ist Europameister und das deutsche Team kann stolz darauf sein, diese Mannschaft im Viertelfinale ordentlich in Schwierigkeiten gebracht zu haben. Was mir jetzt bleibt? Dem Telekom-Team Danke sagen! Ihr habt gemeinsam daf√ºr gesorgt, dass die TV-Bilder in den Wohnzimmern, Kneipen und Hashtag#Fanzones auf die Bildschirme gekommen sind. Dass die Fans in den Stadien √ºber unser Hashtag#Mobilfunknetz alle ihre Fu√üball-Momente teilen konnten. F√ºnf Milliarden Menschen weltweit haben √ºber unsere Hashtag#Glasfaser die TV-Bilder gesehen.  Im Interview mit Johannes B. Kerner ziehe ich vor dem Finale eine kurze Bilanz. Die Zahlen haben unsere Erwartungen √ºbertroffen: Mehr als 70 Millionen Zuschauer*innen haben die Spiele bei Hashtag#MagentaTV gesehen. Das sind doppelt so viele wie bei der Weltmeisterschaft 2022. Mehr als 6 Millionen Besucher*innen haben die Spiele in den Fanzones verfolgt. Insgesamt wurden rund 260 Millionen Gigabyte Daten transportiert. Einen Datenrekord hatten wir nach dem umstrittenen Ball an der Hand des Spaniers Cucurella.  Der Erfolg in den Zahlen ist das eine. Doch es gibt aus meiner Sicht noch einen weiteren zu feiern: In den vergangenen Wochen wehte durch unser Land wieder ein L√ºftchen von Leichtigkeit. Das sollten wir uns erhalten, denn es tut uns gut. Wir alle hatten eine gro√üartige Zeit. Gemeinsam. Und diesen Zusammenhalt und Teamgeist sollten wir in der Gesellschaft beibehalten. "Work hard, play hard".This saying seems to be outdated these days. In our fast-paced world, people feel sometimes overwhelmed and exhausted rather than eager to take on new challenges.Recent studies show that our perception of challenges in work and private life has a significant impact on how we experience them. People with a balanced growth mindset see them as opportunities to learn and grow, leading to less exhaustion and better overall wellbeing. So, it‚Äôs about mindset and the skill to balance work and private life in a way that we profit in a fulfilling and healthy way.In my opinion, "Work hard, play hard" in the sense of a balanced growth mindset and hashtag#mindfulness are important to improve the quality of life. üëâ Hard work teaches us valuable lessons and thus promotes personal growth. The satisfaction that comes from achieving hard-earned goals is unrivalled.üëâ Purposeful work gives us even more satisfaction and can make us feel proud. At Talanx Group, for example, our purpose is: "Together we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship". With our hard work, we are there for our customers at the moment of truth.üëâ Play hard in the form of hobbies, sports, social engagement and spending quality time with family and friends can balance our energy level. With a balanced growth mindset, we can lead an intense, fulfilling, and healthy life.Let's make every moment count! What do you think about this topic? I look forward to reading your comments.

What an energizing night on Wednesday at the North Rhine-Westphalia representation in Brussels!¬†¬†It has been a pleasure to kick-off the new EU legislative term and discuss the future trajectories of the energy sector together with top-notch players such as Enrico Letta and Ann Mettler during our ‚ÄúRewiring Europe‚Äù E.ON in Dialogue event.  We need to drive the single market forward for Europe to keep any relevance in the world of tomorrow. And the energy transition needs a Capital Market Union¬†as well as a truly European Digital Market to be successful. Exactly what Enrico Letta is asking for in his report and I was pleased that he joined our E.ON event to make his case again.  But Europe needs to do more. It needs to focus and prioritize. Get a few important things done as those suggested in the Letta report. And refrain from doing everything in parallel. We can‚Äôt cope with another avalanche of new EU regulation and stay competitive. We need to have a political strategy. Ann Mettler was impressive in making this request.  Clearly pleasing every NGO on every topic and dying in bureaucracy is not the solution. If everything is important, nothing is really important. But no matter what happens in Brussels: We at E.ON will make our contribution to make new energy work in Europe. Hashtag#itsonus

Today, I would like to share some powerful insights from our global UNITE Network, Covestro's LGBTQ+ employee resource group. Their commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion resonates deeply with our mission to foster an open, fair, and pluralistic society not just during hashtag#PrideMonth, but year-round.Katie Marseilles, UNITE Lead U.S., Covestro LLC (t.l.)"True workplace inclusion for the LGBTQ+ community requires ongoing education, inclusive language and policies, visible allyship, and an environment where LGBTQ+ employees can be their authentic selves without fear. It is on all of us - through actions like attending trainings, joining ERGs (employee resource groups) like UNITE, advocating for equal benefits, calling out discrimination, mentoring LGBTQ+ colleagues, and proudly celebrating identities - to create an equitable culture of belonging." Ron Debiec, UNITE Lead U.S., Covestro LLC (t.r.)"True LGBTQ+ equity begins with active allyship and LGBTQ+ visibility. Let others know you are inclusive by sharing your pronouns and using gender neutral language. Use trainings and ERG resources to learn about LGBTQ+ history, experiences, and statistics so you can relate to your LGBTQ+ friends, family, and colleagues. If you‚Äôre openly LGBTQ+, embrace your identity and be a guide for those who are not quite ready to do so. The more we do to value and respect the LGBTQ+ community, the more inclusive and equitable our spaces become for everyone." Julie Tian, UNITE China, Covestro China (b.l.)"Happiness for all of us comes from staying fluid and open to change. Open to being more than just who you thought you were, or more than what other people assume you are." Kai Stellmacher, UNITE Germany, Covestro Deutschland (b.r.)"Equity does not only benefit the LGBTIQ+ community. It is the basic building block for peaceful cooperation at all levels of social life. The sentiment in society is tipping. We are more dependent than ever on the support of our allies. Let's take a stand together." As scientists, we understand that progress stems from open inquiry, challenging assumptions, and harnessing a diversity of perspectives. That same spirit must extend to our corporate culture. By fostering an equitable environment where ALL employees can thrive without fear, we unlock vast reservoirs of talent and insight that will propel us forward. And send a positive signal beyond our company to support societal change.So, it‚Äôs¬†on all of us ‚Äì employees, leaders, and stakeholders ‚Äì to take an active stand. Educate yourselves, be visible allies, and advocate for policies that create a truly inclusive world.

Congratulations to all winning teams, and thank you to everyone who participated in the event ‚Äì despite the German summer not necessarily playing along! hashtag#LifeAtSAP

Again, great meeting of the CEO Alliance. This time Ericsson hosted us in their Stockholm HQ and shared its industry perspective how real 5G connectivity does transform the world. A wake-up call showing Europe is 10 years behind in mobile infrastructure. This means innovative business models and transformations happen elsewhere but not in Europe. Lots of food for thought! hashtag#ceoalliance

"Teamwork makes the dream work!"I'll tell you something you might not yet know about me: When I was young, I was a footballer. At some point I found another passion and turned it into a profession. But football still fascinates me.Like millions of people around the world, I have been following the 2024 European Football Championship over the past few weeks.Many people have asked me who I am cheering for. I'll reveal it here: I'm a fan of all those teams that play passionate football together as a team. This kind of hashtag#PerformanceCulture and hashtag#TOGETHER is like magic.‚ú®In my opinion, we can learn many inspiring things from football for our work:üëâ The focus on a common purpose.üëâ The will to win the game. If you don‚Äôt want to win, you lose the game before it has even started. üëâ The game is not over until it's over. Always be vigilant and fight together to the end.üëâ To learn from mistakes and losses ‚Äì these learnings will lead you to your legacy. üëâ To play together as a star team and not as a team of stars.I cannot emphasise enough how important the "togetherness" factor is in this context. Teamwork makes the dream work! This is my message to all teams still in the game.To everybody else: Have fun watching the remaining matches!If you have any other analogies from football for the corporate world, I look forward to your comments üôèhashtag#EURO2024

Last week, I did not only visit our colleagues in Romania and Slovakia, but also in Poland, which is another very interesting market for E.ON. As well here I want to raise some highlights. Together with Marc Spieker and Attila Kiss, I visited our heat business in Szczecin and discussed with the local team how to decarbonize our future heat supply. I believe this to be the most difficult challenge of the hashtag#energytransition in the next years. Part of the solution in Szczecin will be innovation like our innovative ectogrid‚Ñ¢ project, which combines a smart low-temperature heating system with locally generated waste heat, heat pumps and renewable sources. I also had the opportunity to meet the Mayor of Szczecin to talk about our collaboration and get an impression of the city from him personally. I am impressed how he has driven the development of his city over the last 18 years and how many ideas he still has. Real leadership!Afterwards, I had a great and fruitful exchange with our Polish colleagues in Warsaw. Again, I walk away amazed by the talent we have in our E.ON. Thank you very much for this superb day.

We had the pleasure to welcome German Federal Chancellor Olaf Scholz to our headquarters in hashtag#Erlangen today. As one of the largest medical technology companies in Germany and Europe, we feel honored by his visit, as it underlines the rising relevance that politicians award to our industry in general and to Siemens Healthineers as a global player. It was a privilege to have him take the time to address our team, engage in Q&As, and open a dialogue with us about the globality and value creation of the industrial hashtag#healthcare sector. This topic is something in which we take great pride, especially with our contributions from hashtag#Germany, where we have invested more than ‚Ç¨650 million in recent years to expand our sites and bolster our workforce.Today's special visit also gave us the chance to highlight how, through hashtag#innovation and hashtag#technology, our team of 70,000 Healthineers globally are working passionately and cohesively to achieve better healthcare for the world's 8 billion people. R&D, digitalization, data, and AI play a vital role in addressing the growing burden of non-communicable diseases like cancer, heart disease, stroke, and in the future, neurodegenerative diseases. We are committed to continuing our leading role in accelerating innovations as effectively and efficiently as possible, which I believe goes hand in hand with Chancellor Scholz‚Äôs vision for Germany to become more agile in making critical policy decisions.Thank you, Chancellor, for the great opportunity. Nach zwei Jahren Talfahrt geht es ganz langsam bergauf ‚Äì √ºber die Lage der Chemie- und Pharmaindustrie in Deutschland sprach ich heute auf der Halbjahrespressekonferenz des German Chemical Industry Association VCI.Die Situation¬†in Deutschlands drittgr√∂√üter Branche bessert sich, doch vom "gro√üen Durchatmen" kann nicht die Rede sein. Rechtssicherheit, Korruptionsbek√§mpfung, ein relativ¬†hohes Bildungsniveau und vieles mehr¬†zeichnen uns aus ‚Äì¬†und wir sind weiterhin Erfindernation. Darauf k√∂nnen und m√ºssen wir aufbauen.Um durchstarten zu k√∂nnen, m√ºssen aber die Leitplanken begradigt werden.¬†Wir brauchen endlich konkrete Ma√ünahmen der Politik: Wettbewerbsf√§hige Strompreise, weniger B√ºrokratie und gezielte Investitionen in Bildung und Infrastruktur m√ºssen vom Papier in die Tat umgesetzt werden.Dann kann unsere Branche ihre Innovationskraft endlich voll entfalten und die dringend notwendige Transformation zu einer nachhaltigen und digitalen Zukunft tatkr√§ftig vorantreiben.hashtag#Nachhaltigkeit hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Kreislaufwirtschaft hashtag#Klimaneutralit√§t hashtag#ChemischeIndustrie

I‚Äôm generally a bit wary of generational assumptions. People, in my experience, are complex and shaped by their unique individual experience, not the year in which they were born. At the same time, mindsets are influenced by the geopolitics, economics, and technology of one‚Äôs environment, especially in childhood and early adulthood.  For me, it‚Äôs exciting to meet and observe young Gen Z adults who are entering the workforce and helping to shape our sociopolitical discourse, in many ways provoking us to rethink old approaches. I appreciate, for instance, how digital natives are advancing expectations for how to access quality information and conduct business online.  But Gen Z adults are entering the workforce amidst economic uncertainty, with rising costs of living eating away at their paychecks. For Gen Z, developing smart money habits and making informed financial decisions early on is especially important. That‚Äôs why I‚Äôm excited that at Allianz we‚Äôre launching a Financial Literacy Hub dedicated to Gen Z. The new hub offers financial tools and information tailored to the needs of young people, helping them budget realistically, create an emergency fund, and learn how insurance and investing can bring stability to their financial lives.  Explore the hub here: https://lnkd.in/deeKqZyR Hashtag#GenZ Hashtag#FinancialLiteracy Hashtag#Allianz

Impuls f√ºr eine Hashtag#Wasserstoffwirtschaft: Gemeinsam mit elf Unternehmen zeigt Covestro auf, wie der Markthochlauf f√ºr Wasserstoff an Rhein und Ruhr gelingen kann.Wasserstoff ist ein Schl√ºssel, um die deutsche Industrie klimaneutral und unabh√§ngig von fossilen Rohstoffen zu machen. Mit folgendem Plan k√∂nnte es gelingen:‚ñ™ Bekenntnis zu CO2-armem Wasserstoff und dessen Anerkennung f√∂rdern‚ñ™ Wasserstoffstrategie f√ºr Deutschlands Industrie pr√§zisieren‚ñ™ Fahrplan f√ºr mehr Engagement in der Wasserstoffwirtschaft erstellen‚ñ™ Internationale Wasserstoffbeschaffung strategisch ausrichten‚ñ™ Infrastruktur f√ºr Wasserstofftransport und -speicherung sowie Importterminals und Ammoniak-Cracker planen‚ñ™ Markthochlaufkosten effizient √ºberbr√ºcken, ohne permanente SubventionenCovestro bringt jahrzehntelange Erfahrung im Bereich der zur Produktion von Wasserstoff n√∂tigen Elektrolyse ein und ist aktiv an der Gestaltung einer Wasserstoffwirtschaft beteiligt ‚Äì in Deutschland und global. Wir sind z.B. Teil der Initiative Zukunft Wasserstoff.NRW (KlimaDiskurs.NRW) und der H2Global Stiftung und f√∂rdern zudem die Wasserstoffforschung. Unser Ziel ist es, durch Partnerschaften und Investitionen einen Teil dazu beizutragen, die (gr√ºne) Wasserstoffkapazit√§t langfristig zu steigern.Iqony Dr.-Ing. Dirk Schettler Thyssengas Lhoist Mineraloelraffinerie Oberrhein GmbH & Co. KG (MiRO) Currenta GmbH & Co. OHG SHS - Stahl-Holding-Saar GmbH & Co. KGaA

My visit to Hashtag#India this week culminated with time in Hashtag#Tamilnadu ‚Äì a state that is home to many pioneers of Indian healthcare. As different as they are, they have one goal in common: To bring high-quality care to as many people as possible ‚Äì without compromises. That goal resonates very well with our purpose at Siemens Healthineers to pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere. Sustainably.It was inspiring to see how access to comprehensive cancer care is truly at the heart of the not-for-profit Adyar Cancer Institute (Cancer Institute (WIA), where I enjoyed speaking with Executive Vice Chairman Dr. E. Hemanth Raj and Director Dr. Kalpana Balakrishnan about ways we can collaborate.Chairman and Founder Dr. Prathap C.Reddy of Apollo Hospitals shared his perspectives on how technology was, and always is, at the center of bringing the highest medical standards to more and more patients in need. It was an honor to listen to his memories when visiting our headquarters in Hashtag#Germany in the 1980s and 1990s and I am proud to be now an owner of a signed copy of his book "Healer" ‚Äì  which provides very nice personal remarks of a legendary thought leader. The team of Aarthi Scans & Labs, led by Founder and Managing Director Govindarajan V, impressed me with their relentless focus on ensuring quality and the best patient experience while lowering costs. How? By bringing scale to the game: Their use of a hub-and-spoke model for imaging and lab diagnostics is truly exemplary. I am proud to have known their team from the early beginnings and that we continue to be partners to this day. The visit to Christian Medical College Vellore was equally rewarding and humbling: Through the introduction of Dr. Vikram Mathews, I ‚Äì once again ‚Äì learned about the greatness of the task of caring for those who need our help most and, at the same time, that despite all of the fantastic progress in technology, healthcare is about human skills, knowledge, and compassion. I am thankful for these encounters and meaningful conversations and am excited to watch the progress of such noble efforts.  Of course, no visit to India would be complete without spending time with our dedicated Hashtag#TeamHealthineers. Their energy, creativity, and commitment to supporting our customers never cease to amaze me. I am grateful for their active role in improving patients' access to care by enabling healthcare providers to seize meaningful and impactful opportunities that underscore India's emergence as a global force in healthcare, MedTech, and innovation.---ùòõùò©ùò¢ùòØùò¨ùò¥, Vy Tran, Hariharan NS, and all Healthineers who joined us and helped make these encounters possible!

"GenAI or bye bye?"In recent years, many technologies have been hugely hyped - often wrongly. hashtag#GenAI is different. Nobody should underestimate the technology. Both increase productivity and added value.But companies need the right culture for this:üëâ Striving for high performance: Companies that use GenAI smartly are a threat to companies that don't use the technology. It's about speed.üëâ Focus pays off: Individual lighthouses do not move companies forward. Scalability is what counts.üëâ In order to utilise the full potential of GenAI, companies need a culture in which trial & error is understood as part of high performance.üëâ We are fast because our culture makes us fast. We live hashtag#Transparency, hashtag#Engagement, hashtag#Collaboration based on trust. Our experts are given a lot of responsibility and repay it with engagement.üëâ Culture is therefore one decisive competitive factor in scaling GenAI. If the culture is not right, it's a quick bye-bye. After the hype, GenAI will gradually change our way of working for good.What‚Äôs your perspective: How important is culture when adapting new technologies? hashtag#Transparencyhashtag#Engagementhashtag#Collaborationhashtag#Trust

This week, I had the pleasure of attending one of the most important events in the German hashtag#economy: the so called ‚ÄúTag der Industrie‚Äù (Day of Industry) of the BDI - Bundesverband der Deutschen Industrie e.V. with this year's motto "Cohesion in Polarized Worlds." Efficiency is no longer the only decisive factor; hashtag#resilience is also becoming key. We all need to broaden our horizons. For us at thyssenkrupp, such a resilient foundation is a top priority. For Germany and for Europe. It is not only the prerequisite for secure employment, prosperity, and stability, but also offers the opportunity to secure and further develop business. This also applies to the ecosystem required for green growth. As a pioneer, we are not only shaping our own path but also helping our customers in their transformation towards greater hashtag#sustainability. For us, it is crucial that the state develops mechanisms to compensate for the disadvantages compared to global competitors who are slower in making their processes more sustainable. At the same time, we offer hashtag#supplychain resilience with our leading global mill-independent materials distributor and service provider thyssenkrupp Materials Services. With our multi-source strategy, we ensure that there are no supply bottlenecks ‚Äî even in difficult times such as the coronavirus pandemic or when the Suez Canal was blocked by the Ever Given. Many thanks for the inspiring exchange, and especially to Isabelle K√∂rner for the great moderation. Looking forward to the next time! hashtag#TDI24üì∑: Christian Kruppa & Jana Legler

Mit dem Handelsblatt habe ich ausf√ºhrlich √ºber die m√∂gliche √úbernahme von Covestro durch ADNOC Group sowie unser Transformationsprogramm "STRONG" gesprochen. Ich habe noch einmal deutlich gemacht, dass diese beiden Themen nicht in Zusammenhang stehen. Die Kernaussagen des Interviews zusammengefasst:Die Gespr√§che mit¬†Adnoc √ºber eine m√∂gliche √úbernahme von Covestro sind in eine¬†n√§chste¬†Phase eingetreten. Adnoc erh√§lt nun Zugang zu einer vertieften Buchpr√ºfung, einer¬†sogenannten¬†"Confirmatory Due Diligence",¬†und es starten¬†konkrete Verhandlungen √ºber eine m√∂gliche Transaktion und den m√∂glichen Abschluss einer Investitionsvereinbarung.Zum jetzigen Zeitpunkt besteht keine Gewissheit, dass die anstehenden Verhandlungen zu einer Vereinbarung f√ºhren.F√ºr Covestro sind drei Punkte entscheidend:‚ñ™ Unterst√ºtzung unserer Strategie "Sustainable Future" und unserer Vision "Fully Circular".‚ñ™ Die M√∂glichkeit, unsere Wachstumsstrategie durch Investitionszusagen zu beschleunigen.‚ñ™ Anerkennung der Besch√§ftigungssicherung sowie¬†der¬†deutschen¬†Mitbestimmung.Das globale Transformationsprogramm¬†"STRONG" soll Covestro unabh√§ngig von der Eigent√ºmerfrage st√§rken und noch wettbewerbsf√§higer machen. Dabei setzen wir auf Digitalisierung, K√ºnstliche Intelligenz und Effizienzsteigerungen. Aber auch Sach- und Personalkosten m√ºssen reduziert werden.Wichtig zu betonen: Wir geben ein klares Bekenntnis zum Standort Deutschland.‚ñ™ Die Besch√§ftigungssicherung in Deutschland ist bis 2032 verl√§ngert worden.‚ñ™ Wir haben derzeit keinerlei Planungen f√ºr Anlageschlie√üungen.

Over recent years, the importance of #sustainability to businesses and their stakeholders has risen significantly. Accurately recording ESG metrics has become key to improving both the top and the bottom line and winning and retaining customers, employees, and investors. ¬†But as new and updated regional and national regulations are introduced, businesses must continuously adapt if they want to remain compliant. In the coming weeks, for example, EU member states are required to reflect the EU Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive in their national regulations to help standardize sustainability reporting. And later this year, the Regulation on Deforestation-free products will require transparency and traceability across global supply chains to guarantee the products EU citizens consume do not contribute to deforestation worldwide.¬†Meeting these obligations requires a reliable foundation for ESG data management and reporting to help collect, share, and integrate ESG data both within individual companies and across supply chains. The Sustainability team at SAP are leading the way with data-driven solutions that are ERP centric, cloud based, and AI enabled, a fact that has most recently been reflected in the naming of SAP as a leader in the first-ever IDC MarketScape: Worldwide Carbon Accounting and Management Applications 2024 Vendor Assessment. Congratulations to the entire team for this latest recognition and on your work to enable a future with zero emissions, zero waste, and zero inequality.

Die zu gro√üe L√§hmung im Lande wird auch von vielen ‚ÄûNicht-Politikern‚Äú herbeigef√ºhrt. Kompliment an Minister Madsen, der das sch√∂n auf den Punkt gebracht hat!
