What‚Äôs your legacy? And are you ready to take all decisive steps to achieve it?  These questions are especially crucial in a polarized world with massive challenges. The Federation of German Industries (BDI - Bundesverband der Deutschen Industrie e.V.) organised a congress ‚Äì hashtag#TDI24 ‚Äì in Berlin on the state of the German and European industry and its options for action. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz among other politicians and many business leaders shared their perspectives on this subject. I had the honour to participate today on a panel discussion, hosted by Isabelle K√∂rner on how to spark a resilient new era of economic growth together with Christian Lindner and Anne-Marie Gro√ümann.My key messages were:üëâ We need to ask ourselves which legacy we want to leave behind. üëâ We not only need hashtag#innovation but also implementation capabilities and an absolute can-do-attitude. Economics is half psychology and faith can move mountains.üëâ To turn great ideas into reality, massive investments are needed. üëâ As an insurance industry, we can promote future technologies such as hashtag#GenAI through our insurance solutions and investments. With an investment capital of over 1,9 billion EUR, insurers are the biggest institutional investors in Germany.üëâ However, we need more public private partnership projects with a long-term secure framework and arm‚Äôs length conditions to be able to invest in the interest of our shareholders. üëâ Last but not least, there‚Äôs a big sense of urgency. And only by working hashtag#together can we bring about the necessary decisions for a hashtag#transformation towards the future.Thank you for the open dialogue between industry, politics, and insurers!What‚Äôs your legacy? I‚Äôm happy to hear your thoughts in the comments.

Progress needs innovative ideas and bright minds. We have both in the joint project hashtag#Carbon2Chem¬Æ. In addition to thyssenkrupp Steel, thyssenkrupp Uhde, and thyssenkrupp nucera, the Max-Planck-Institut f√ºr Chemische Energiekonversion and the Fraunhofer-Institut f√ºr Umwelt-, Sicherheits- und Energietechnik UMSICHT are also involved. Our common aim is to turn industrial process gases like smelting gases from hashtag#steel production into a valuable source of carbon for the hashtag#chemical industry. This way, we are driving the hashtag#greentransformation of industry and fighting climate change. Last week, Dr. Marie Jaroni and I had the chance to meet with the outstanding team behind Carbon2Chem¬Æ and get an update on the current status and development of the project. Fabian Bienen, Boris Kohnen, Nina Kolbe, Fitore Reka, Hendrik Walter, and G√∂rge Deerberg. The exchange was very inspiring. I wish you all the best for the start of the third funding phase!

Wie gewinnt der Industriestandort Deutschland das Rennen um die Zukunft? Und welche Rolle spielt dabei die industrielle Gesundheitswirtschaft, zu der auch Siemens Healthineers geh√∂rt? Dar√ºber durfte ich mit Bundeswirtschaftsminister Robert Habeck, Sami Atiya von ABB und Barbara Frei-Spreiter von Schneider Electric beim #TDI24 diskutieren.W√§hrend Maschinenbau, Elektrotechnik, Automobil- und Chemieindustrie bekannte deutsche Schl√ºsselindustrien sind, ist die industrielle Gesundheitswirtschaft ‚Äì also Medizintechnik, Pharmaindustrie und Biotechnik ‚Äì trotz ihrer zunehmenden Bedeutung noch wenig prominent in der √∂ffentlichen Wahrnehmung. Dabei hat diese Branche ihre Rolle in den vergangenen Jahren deutlich ausbauen k√∂nnen ‚Äì dank sehr innovativer Unternehmen vor Ort und aufgrund der global steigenden Relevanz funktionierender Gesundheitswesen als kritische Infrastruktur. Mit mehr als einer Million Besch√§ftigten ist die industrielle Gesundheitswirtschaft l√§ngst ein Jobmotor f√ºr Deutschland.Die Medizintechnik tr√§gt dazu bei, die Folgen des Fachkr√§ftemangels im Gesundheitswesen abzufedern und die Kostenentwicklung im Griff zu behalten. Unsere KI-gest√ºtzten Technologien entlasten √Ñrztinnen und √Ñrzte bei Routineaufgaben, machen Diagnosen pr√§ziser und Therapien individueller. Gleichzeitig arbeiten wir daran, mit energie- und ressourcenschonenden Innovationen den Aussto√ü klimasch√§dlicher Treibhausgase im Gesundheitssektor zu senken.Die industrielle Gesundheitswirtschaft f√∂rdert die Gesundheitsversorgung und die Wertsch√∂pfung in Deutschland ‚Äì und damit den Wohlstand. Sie ist eine wirtschaftliche St√§rke unseres Landes, f√ºr die sich mehr und mehr Perspektiven √∂ffnen. Das zeigt auch die Entwicklung von #SiemensHealthineers: Seit dem B√∂rsengang 2018 h√§lt unser Unternehmen eine starke Position im Deutschen Aktienindex, aktuell auf Platz 10 im DAX 40. Als ein Weltmarktf√ºhrer und gr√∂√ütes MedTech-Unternehmen in Deutschland und Europa sehen wir es als unsere Aufgabe und Verantwortung, die Bedeutung unserer Branche st√§rker ins √∂ffentliche Bewusstsein zu r√ºcken. Die Tatsache, dass wir derzeit 650 Millionen Euro in Deutschland investieren, unterstreicht, dass wir von der Zukunft des Standorts nicht nur √ºberzeugt sind, sondern sie mitgestalten.Vielen Dank an Ina Karabasz vom Handelsblatt f√ºr die Moderation.BDI - Bundesverband der Deutschen Industrie e.V.

Spannende Zeiten f√ºr die deutsche ChemieindustrieDie Transformation hin zu einer gr√ºnen und klimaneutralen Chemie ist in vollem Gange, und ich bin √ºberzeugt, dass Deutschland hier eine Schl√ºsselrolle spielen kann. Die ‚Äûgute‚Äú RedeHauptversammlungen sind bei der Telekom kein Pflichttermin, sondern Chance. Chance, unser Gesch√§ft zu erkl√§ren. Chance, auf Erfolge und Misserfolge einzugehen. Und Chance f√ºr den Dialog mit unseren Aktion√§rinnen und Aktion√§ren. Daf√ºr strengen wir uns an.Umso mehr freut mich, dass das Team von Rhetorikcheck uns in diesem Jahr wieder auf Platz 1 der besten Hauptversammlungsrede gesetzt hat. Danke f√ºr dieses tolle Feedback. Das nehmen wir auf und schauen, dass wir uns weiter verbessern. Danke auch an das gesamte HV-Team der Deutsche Telekom. Was macht eine gute Rede aus? So banal wie richtig ist: Sie muss zum Redner und zum Publikum passen. Mir sind immer drei Punkte wichtig:1. Klare Sprache. Kurze S√§tze, die auf den Punkt kommen. Auch bei Dingen, die schlecht laufen. 2. Praktische Beispiele. Graue Theorie langweilt.3. Erkl√§ren. Nichts ist unbefriedigender als eine unbelegte Behauptung. Dar√ºber hinaus hilft: Kill your Darlings. Also: K√ºrzen, k√ºrzen, k√ºrzen. Wie das Video von unserer Probe zeigt. ;-)

Free and open societies thrive when the rights of all people are respected and protected with equal purpose and conviction. The workplace is central for realizing these values. This Pride Month, we are excited to share that we are sponsoring the Pride House during the Olympic and Paralympic Games Paris 2024, with the Allianz Global Pride Board members serving as volunteers. The Pride House is a celebration of LGBTQ+ inclusion in sports and a symbol of a caring space for all. LGBTQ+ inclusion is a cornerstone of our culture at Allianz. It plays a crucial role in raising awareness of LGBTQ+ issues, providing support, and advocating for change. We‚Äôve made a lot of progress toward LGBTQ+ inclusion in the workplace, in the world of sports, and in our wider communities ‚Äì but there is still work to be done. How is your organization championing LGBTQ+ inclusion? Share your thoughts in the comments. #InclusionAtAllianz #AllianzPride #Allianz

In one week, EU leaders will soon lay out the Strategic Agenda for the next institutional cycle in Brussels. Our call: prioritize electrification and stay on the course chartered by the Green Deal. Our energy security, transition and affordability depends on a steady pathway.Society must trust that expanding our domestic power system will keep individual costs manageable. This is only possible if we have a strong and sustainable economic growth that is increasingly powered by electricity. We must overcome today‚Äôs electrification plateau of 23% and reach anywhere between 50 and 60% in 2050.

Therefore, thanks to Edgar Puls for your input on hashtag#mobility, to Jean-Jacques Henchoz for your deep dive on hashtag#climatechange, to Jens Warkentin for your insights on hashtag#GenAI. We should be a partner for our customers in their transformation, take opportunities and scale up ideas to valuable business models. üëâ It‚Äôs all about hashtag#people: Our engaged people living our TEC-values transparency, engagement and collaboration, and our hashtag#purpose‚Äòtogether we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship‚Äò are crucial for outperforming our peers. Was wir daf√ºr brauchen, ist ein gesamtheitlicher regulatorischer Rahmen. Mit der Kampagne "Flex to the max" m√∂chten wir Aufmerksamkeit f√ºr diesen wichtigen Baustein der #Energiewende schaffen. Gemeinsam mit weiteren Akteuren der Energiewirtschaft entwickeln wir L√∂sungsans√§tze daf√ºr, wie die Integration von Flexibilit√§t ins Energiesystem erfolgreich gelingen kann.‚ö°Ô∏èüöÄHier gibt es ab sofort mehr Infos zu unserer Kampagne: www.eon.com/flex #itsonus #flextothemax #Flexibilit√§t #Klimaschutz #Energiewende #Nachhaltigkeit

During my trip to Vietnam last week, I had a profoundly special and unexpected experience at the University Medical Center of Ho Chi Minh City. It was wonderful to witness their 18-year-old MAGNETOM Avanto still in action, diagnosing 40 patients per day at this prestigious and busy institution.Reflecting on the launch of the MAGNETOM Avanto and Tim Technology at RSNA 2003, I‚Äôm reminded of one of the most intense and fulfilling periods of my career at Siemens Healthineers. The dedication and hard work of our team back then laid the foundation for our now undisputed market leadership in MRI.Seeing MAGNETOM Avanto continue to make a significant impact on patient care, nearly two decades later, is truly gratifying. It is a testament to the enduring quality and innovation of our products and the exceptional work of #TeamHealthineers.Thank you, Vy Tran, for capturing this memorable moment!

Over the past year, progress has been made in laying the foundations for hashtag#MoreWindNow in Europe. The European Wind Power Action Plan, the European Wind Charter, and the Net Zero Industry Act signify the understanding that wind energy is of strategic importance for Europe‚Äôs energy sovereignty.  Now, we must focus on implementation. In particular, we need to accelerate permitting, improve auction designs to include and put more weight on qualitative non-price criteria in tenders, ensure a level playing field, remove financial burdens on the wind industry, provide access to public funding, and expand grid infrastructure.  Only then can we achieve the scale required to meet wind expansion targets and hashtag#NetZero.  We at Siemens Gamesa are committed to the energy transition. And with continued commitment from policymakers, industry, and partners, we can harness the power of wind to build a secure and sustainable future. hashtag#GlobalWindDay

Siemens Healthineers has been present in Vietnam for over 30 years. We currently provide support to over 1,000 healthcare organizations in the country. One of these organizations is the Stroke International Services Hospital (SIS), which I was pleased to visit a few days ago ‚Äì an impressive experience, not just because of the ride on their ambulance speed boat on the Mekong River, expanding access to stroke and cardiac care in the region. We agreed to extend our existing strategic partnership, jointly pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare with advanced technology such as the NAEOTOM Alpha and ARTIS Icono. Additionally, we will improve patient experience and care for stroke and heart disease and provide a platform for knowledge sharing between Vietnamese and international experts.Furthermore, we are deepening our partnership with the University Medical Center (UMC) of Ho Chi Minh City, one of the biggest and most prestigious public hospitals in Vietnam. We have agreed to collaborate on scientific research and strengthen UMC's capacity to better serve its patients. Also, our strategic partnership with B·ªÜNH VI·ªÜN GIA AN 115 serves the purpose of improving healthcare for patients in Vietnam. We have agreed to intensify our collaboration.I also had the honor of meeting Professor Pham Minh Thong, President of the Vietnamese Society of Radiology and Nuclear Medicine, and Associate Professor Ho Thuong Dung, Vice President of the Ho Chi Minh City Interventional Cardiology Association. We had an inspiring talk about global healthcare challenges and trends in radiology and cardiology.Overall, I was deeply impressed by how our customers and partners combine a deep passion for improving healthcare with an entrepreneurial spirit ‚Äì and by the pioneering work done, from world-class stroke care to novel concepts for holistic preventive medicine.Once again, many thanks to all my conversation partners for their time, and to #TeamHealthineers in Vietnam for all their dedication and great work.

When our customers need us, we show up for them. We do so with the full power of Allianz, combining local human touch with the expertise and resources of a leading global company. This week, I visited our customers and our claims teams in Nordendorf, one of several towns in Germany recovering from recent floods that have devastated homes, small businesses, and personal property across the region.Natural catastrophes like floods inflict profound physical damage, but also a special kind of trauma, displacing people from their homes, upending their lives and disrupting their livelihoods. I met with our customers affected by the deluge, and I could see the effects of loss through their eyes ¬≠ not only in their perspective, but also in the fatigue that was evident in their expressions.I also spent time with the claims teams who have been working around the clock to support our customers with compassion, speed, and impact. We met in a mobile operations center provided by Allianz France.Journalists from the German newspaper S√ºddeutsche Zeitung have accompanied our Allianz colleague Andreas Stoye and captured how our people help our customers in the moments that matter: https://lnkd.in/dfjEu5FqI observed an impressive community spirit and collective strength in the face of adversity. In addition to our business and human outreach, Allianz has donated one million euros to local fire departments, rescue organizations and technical relief services, in addition to doubling employee donations up to ‚Ç¨500,000, which will be directed to the Red Cross. This contribution underscores our belief in the importance of public-private cooperation to tackle societal issues, which are felt at the individual level, but can only be solved with a macro approach.Insurers like Allianz are evolving their business models to address climate risk. As a global insurer operating in over 70 markets, Allianz is on the front lines of helping people and businesses prepare for, recover from, and adapt to increasingly extreme weather events caused by climate change. The EU suffered more than ‚Ç¨50bn in economic losses from natural catastrophes in both 2021 and 2022, according to EIOPA data. That was more than three times the annual average in the previous decade.Our risk knowhow and advanced data-driven technology serve our customers on both the local and macro level, because we do more than pay our claims after disaster strikes. Our customers value the fact that we can predict climate risks and support resilience measures, including by partnering with local and national authorities to promote smart infrastructure planning that can reduce physical damage and prevent loss of life.I thank our customers for continuing to place your trust in Allianz and for partnering with us. We‚Äôre here for you not only when disaster strikes, but also to support you as you build resiliency for the future.

Europe has voted.¬†And affordable energy, security, and competitiveness have been amongst the most hotly contested issues of this electoral campaign. Aspects that have not been in central focus¬†back in 2019 when Ursula von der Leyen‚Äôs incumbent Commission formulated the Green Deal. So now the first priority must be to regain the societal buy in for the Green Deal by making European businesses and citizens more directly profit from the transition. We need a growth plan based on a sound pan-European industrial strategy.¬†And the new European leadership has to refocus its attention ‚Äì from the formulation of ambitious targets to delivering on the Green Deal pledges. For this, three elements are key: fixing the financial and regulatory fundamentals, increase security of supply supported by Europe‚Äôs market design and the development of a flexibility market, and expanding and transforming Europe‚Äôs grids.‚ÄØ As for us, at E.ON we will take responsibility for ensuring that this new energy world works for both customers and society. ‚ÄØ Check out our E.ON EU Manifesto here: https://lnkd.in/eTx7V3bC #energytransition #greendeal

Green hashtag#hydrogen is crucial for the decarbonization of industrial production. By using it, fossil resources become superfluous, making traditional processes more sustainable. As pioneers, we at thyssenkrupp aim to shape the national and international hydrogen economy and pave the way for a hashtag#greentransformation. Teamwork is essential here, involving politics, the financial sector, science, and business. This requires active exchange, such as at the Handelsblatt Wasserstoffgipfel in Essen and the Financial Times Hydrogen Summit in London. Our ambition goes beyond decarbonizing our own operations. We aim to enable our customers to achieve their climate targets with our innovative, green solutions. To this end, we have consolidated our expertise in our hashtag#DecarbonTechnologies segment. For the industrial-scale production of green hydrogen, electrolysers like those from thyssenkrupp nucera are essential, along with the accelerated expansion of renewable energies. The slewing bearings from thyssenkrupp rothe erde play a decisive role here. Moreover, it is clear that hydrogen will primarily be produced where green electricity is affordable, such as in South Africa, Australia, Chile, Iberian Peninsula, and the MENA region. Ammonia is needed as a transport medium to deliver hydrogen to where it is required. thyssenkrupp Uhde is a global technology leader in ammonia cracking and the construction of plants for green ammonia. One of the future uses of green hydrogen will be in the direct reduction plant at thyssenkrupp Steel in Duisburg to produce green steel. By operating purely with hydrogen, we can save up to 3.5 million tons of CO2, while simultaneously accelerating the hydrogen ramp-up with our substantial demand. This effort is significant for North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, and Europe. Cooperation, especially with politicians, is essential to ensure the development of infrastructure, technological progress through targeted funding, and energy security at economic prices. Thank you very much for the exchange and the exciting insights at the Handelsblatt Wasserstoffgipfel in Essen and the Financial Times Hydrogen Summit in London. We are ready to tackle the opportunities of the green transformation together! hashtag#FTHydrogen hashtag#HBWasserstoff

How can an idea be turned into money? How can an idea be scaled?That are the crucial questions we always have to ask ourselves. I asked them of the managers who have just successfully completed our Talanx Management Development Programme after nine months of intensive work.At the end of the programme, each group presents an idea with business impact. Exciting ideas came from people with enormous potential.But what does it take to turn exciting ideas into money? Here's what I told the graduates:- Outstanding leaders are characterised by the fact that they keep their focus.- Even if the idea is good, you always look at the figures and targets. If it doesn't work, stop it, even if you have taken the idea to heart. The important thing is to learn your lessons fast.- Make sure you are always growing personally. This is important for you and for the company. Skill up is followed by scale up in business. - Always ask yourself the question: So, what? Be innovative. Stay hungry for success. Be ambitious to do better than others. So, what for? For our customers. We at Siemens Gamesa have a clear vision: breaking even in fiscal year 2026. We understand our path forward, the foundation it is built on, and the programs that are in place to accomplish our break-even target. Now, what we need to do is rigorously implement our Masterplan, and deliver together. This was the core message of our Siemens Gamesa Leadership Conference 2024, which took place over the past two days near Madrid. More than 270 leaders and talents from Siemens Gamesa came together to discuss how to deliver together as one, and what it takes to lead in times of change. And to visualize our unity, connection, and dedication in delivering the turnaround together, we built our Siemens Gamesa value chain. Each of us contributed a chain link to symbolize that we are stronger connected and that, together, we are more than the sum of our individual strengths. I‚Äôd also like to thank our guest speaker Anja-Isabel Dotzenrath from bp for sharing bp‚Äôs perspective on the energy transition, her insights into effective leadership, and why it is so important to rigorously focus.As hashtag#TeamPurple we are committed to shaping the energy transition. And with our sights set firmly on the future, it‚Äôs now time to roll up our sleeves and continue driving Siemens Gamesa forward together.

In einer gespaltenen Welt ist gute F√ºhrung wichtiger denn je. Wie kann die aussehen? Auf dem deutschen #F√ºhrungskr√§ftetag haben wir genau das aus verschiedenen Perspektiven diskutiert. Sie muss gelebt werden, und zwar in zwei Richtungen: Nach innen durch F√ºhrungskr√§fte in Richtung Belegschaft. We wrapped up the first day of #SAPSapphire in Barcelona, and in all my meetings with customers, partners, investors, and media, it‚Äôs clearer than ever that #AI is top of mind for everyone. That‚Äôs why we also offer our customers and partners the option to create customized AI use cases through SAP‚Äôs GenAI Hub. ¬†¬†There‚Äôs no doubt that AI is a very powerful technology with huge opportunities for businesses and their¬†employees and we are excited to be on this journey with our customers. ¬†¬†A big #ThankYou to everyone joining us in Barcelona, all of our guest speakers, and to the entire team who have put this incredible event together.

In his speech at yesterday‚Äôs Ukraine Recovery Conference, Volodymyr Zelenskyy highlighted why the topic of energy is at the forefront of the agenda. With Ukraine's energy infrastructure facing nearly daily attacks ‚Äì which have already resulted in the destruction of 9 GW of capacity ‚Äì the discussions at the conference not only addressed short-term challenges but also focused on mid-term opportunities to rebuild the Ukrainian economy. As a result, various governments have established a Business Advisory Council (BAC) to provide advice on supporting and rebuilding Ukraine from a private business perspective. This task is difficult in peace times. It is even more challenging in war times. That‚Äôs why we have brought together business representatives from various countries and segments to share their expertise and networks. It is an honor to chair this group of committed individuals and I look forward to the work ahead of us.Thanks to everyone who joined our kick-off session and for framing first objectives.#Ukraine #URC2024

Buy 2, get 1 free ‚Äì the Telekom share makes us #werkstolz Entrepreneurial action. That is what we encourage among from all our employees. Therefore, we want as many of them as possible to also be co-owners of Deutsche Telekom. For this purpose, we created the Shares2You program, which we are expanding this year. Not only in Germany but also in numerous subsidiaries, employees can participate in our shares program: in Romania, Slovakia, Czech Republic, Hungary, France, India, Croatia, the Netherlands, Austria, Switzerland, Singapore, Spain, Portugal, and the United Kingdom. We listen first. We learn passionately. These are two of the key values of Siemens Healthineers. Over the past two days, I have listened to many experts and learned a lot about #healthcare in #Indonesia ‚Äì thanks to the many inspiring partners, customers, stakeholders, and decision makers who welcomed me with great hospitality in Jakarta.#SiemensHealthineers is a long-term and close partner of healthcare providers in Indonesia. As the world's largest island country, it faces unique challenges in healthcare, but has made impressive progress in recent years. Almost 280 million people living on over 6,000 different islands need to be covered. We support healthcare providers in Indonesia in their fight against the most threatening diseases, in building a collaborative ecosystem in the healthcare sector and in its #digitalization.Therefore, I'm particularly pleased that we have now entered into a strategic partnership with the Hermina Hospital Group. With this new partnership, we are supporting the group in the development of a national #oncology center of excellence and their plan to build a smart hospital in Nusantara, the new capital of Indonesia. Additionally, we agreed with the National Cardiovascular Center Harapan Kita to set up a flagship #cardiology training and education center, which is the appointed national center for cardiovascular training in Indonesia.Many thanks to everyone who has dedicated their time to me over the past few days: Siloam Hospitals Group, PT Pertamina Bina Medika IHC, EMC Healthcare, Rumah Sakit Jantung Jakarta, and RS Abdi Waluyo.Last not least, kudos to #TeamHealthineers in Jakarta! Now, I'm writing these lines on my way to Vietnam, the second stop of my trip, which I'm very much looking forward to.

Nachhaltigkeit mehrdimensionalIch m√∂chte keine seelenlose Telekom. Milton Friedmans Diktum ‚ÄûThe business of business is business‚Äú m√∂chte ich erg√§nzen: ‚ÄûThe business of business is business WITH PURPOSE‚Äú. Denn es kann nicht nur um den Profit gehen. Es geht auch darum, Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen. Deshalb habe ich heute im Town Hall mit den Mitarbeitenden der Telekom das Thema Nachhaltigkeit in den Mittelpunkt ger√ºckt.Nachhaltigkeit ist nicht nur ein Buzzword. Die aktuelle Hochwasserlage zeigt, wie wichtig es ist, Verantwortung zu √ºbernehmen. Deshalb bringen wir als Unternehmen die Dimensionen der Nachhaltigkeit in die Balance: √∂konomische, √∂kologische und gesellschaftliche Verantwortung.Dimension √ñkonomie: √ñkonomisch stehen wir gut da. Zum Beispiel sind wir in allen M√§rkten, in denen die Telekom agiert, die Nummer 1 bei den Netzen. Wir haben Kunden dazugewonnen und wachsen st√§rker als der Wettbewerb. Aber abseits der Unternehmenszahlen bewegen wir uns in einem Umfeld, das uns alle angeht: Wir handeln als Unternehmen in Umwelt und Gesellschaft.Dimension √ñkologie: Wir haben wir uns ehrgeizige Ziele gesetzt und bereits viel erreicht, denn die Telekom √ºbernimmt Verantwortung f√ºr die Umwelt. Zum Beispiel beziehen wir bereits 100 Prozent unserer Energie aus erneuerbaren Quellen, um die CO2-Emissionen weiter zu reduzieren ‚Äì bis 2040 wollen wir bei Netto-Null sein. Und der Anteil an nachhaltigen Produkten steigt kontinuierlich an.Dimension Gesellschaft: Die Telekom nimmt auch ihre soziale Verantwortung wahr. Wir bieten z.B. spezielle Tarife f√ºr benachteiligte Bev√∂lkerungsgruppen an. Und setzen uns aktiv gegen Hass und Hetze im Netz ein. Die Telekom f√∂rdert die Vielfalt in der Belegschaft genauso wie die Inklusion von Menschen mit Behinderungen. Ein Beispiel daf√ºr ist unsere Beteiligung an den Special Olympics und die Bereitstellung von Informationen in leichter Sprache.Dimension Europa: Nachhaltigkeit braucht aber auch den richtigen Rahmen. Und dieser Rahmen ist f√ºr uns Europa. Denn Europa teilt die Werte, f√ºr die wir auch als Telekom einstehen: Gegen Diskriminierung, gegen Hass und Hetze, aber f√ºr Vielfalt und f√ºr sozialen Verantwortung. Wir k√∂nnen alle etwas tun. Und es gibt dieses Wochenende direkt einen Anlass: Die Europawahlen stehen bevor. Deshalb habe ich an die Mitarbeitenden appelliert und tue es auch hier: Gehen Sie w√§hlen!Michael Hagspihl #nachhaltigkeit #esg #europa

Several years ago, I was offered the opportunity to work as a member of the Talanx Group's Board of Management.Here‚Äôs why I accepted. The Talanx Group has a unique culture based on trust. This is why it is crucial that we all walk the talk.What are your thoughts on this subject?I am eager to hear them in the comments.Thanks to for the valuable dialogue Quentin Guffens, Jascha Preikschas, Nicole Schmidt, Janike Ahlvers, Stephan-Alexander Kuhnow, Andre Wolpers, Marie Schrader, Isabelle Erke, Tina H., Angelina Samochwalow, Janina Blickle.

Innovationskraft durch Technologieoffenheit und klare Rahmenbedingungen entfesseln.3. Politikstil und Gesetzgebung hinsichtlich Effizienz und Effektivit√§t optimieren.Indem wir diese drei Punkte umsetzen, k√∂nnen wir die Industrie als Treiber der gr√ºnen Transformation st√§rken und sicherstellen, dass die Erfolgsgeschichte EU weiter geht.#AntwerpDeclaration #Europa #EUelections Plastics Europe Verband der Chemischen Industrie e.V. (VCI)

These are exciting times in Molecular Imaging (MI) and for our dedicated colleagues driving this field forward. Unsere sichere #Energieversorgung ist eine europ√§ische Gemeinschaftsaufgabe! Dazu habe ich gestern auf dem #BDEW-Kongress mit Bundesau√üenministerin Annalena Baerbock diskutiert. Mir war es dabei wichtig, die Bundesregierung und die Bundesministerin in die Pflicht zu nehmen. Wir m√ºssen Au√üen-, Wirtschafts-, Energie und Handelspolitik zusammendenken und konsequent handeln! Hier drei Baustellen aus meiner Sicht:¬†¬†¬†1.¬†Klimadiplomatie: Ziel muss ein globaler Rahmen sein, in dem Marktmechanismen ‚Äì nicht national ausgerichtete Planwirtschaft ‚Äì zur Klimaneutralit√§t f√ºhren. Alles andere dauert zu lange und wird viel zu teuer, weil Skaleneffekte nicht realisierbar sind. Es ist Europas Aufgabe, darauf hinzuwirken und dieses dicke Brett zu bohren. Andernfalls wird die Klimapolitik Europas scheitern. 2.¬†Energiepartnerschaften als starke Antwort auf geopolitische Risiken verankern! √úber Energiepartnerschaften wird viel geredet, aber in der europ√§ischen Gesamtschau sind sie noch l√§ngst nicht stabil genug, um eine Investitionsbasis zu bilden ‚Äì und das gilt vor allem aus einer deutschen Perspektive. 3.¬†Anstatt vieler Einzeldiskussionen m√ºssen wir st√§rker an einheitlichen L√∂sungen arbeiten. Die energiepolitische Landschaft Europas gleicht noch immer einem Flickenteppich. Das neue Marktdesign beinhaltet in der Theorie viele gute Ans√§tze, die es nun in die Praxis zu √ºberf√ºhren und zu spezifizieren gilt. Aber die Wahrheit ist auch: Es sind im Gro√üen und Ganzen gemeinsame Regeln f√ºr die nationalen Energiem√§rkte, von einem integrierten europ√§ischen Binnenmarkt sind wir noch weit entfernt.¬†Drei Baustellen, und an der Stelle darf es nicht aufh√∂ren. Wir als #Energiewirtschaft m√ºssen ein klares Signal senden: nur Realpolitik an der Au√üenkante hilft uns im Inneren weiter! #bdewk24 Copyright Foto: BDEW

Trotz globaler Probleme und Meinungsverschiedenheiten ist klar: Ohne #China wird es nicht gehen.√úber das "Warum" sprach ich gestern vor der Deutsch-Chinesischen Wirtschaftsvereinigung. üëáChina ist in relativ kurzer Zeit zu einem Schwergewicht in unserer Welt geworden ‚Äì erst politisch, dann wirtschaftlich und nun auch zunehmend in Sachen Nachhaltigkeit.Zum einen ist das Land als gr√∂√üter CO2-Emittent auf dem Globus Teil des Problems. Und zum anderen ‚Äì mit seinen ehrgeizigen Klimazielen sowie als weltgr√∂√üter Markt f√ºr erneuerbare Energien und Elektromobilit√§t ‚Äì ist China Teil der L√∂sung.An China f√ºhrt mithin kein Weg vorbei. Daher gilt es, Dialog und Zusammenarbeit zu f√∂rdern und gemeinsam an nachhaltigen L√∂sungen zu arbeiten, auch mithilfe zukunftsweisender Materialien wie hochwertiger Kunststoffe.Konfrontation und Abschottung bringen die Welt nicht weiter. Gleichzeitig darf China nicht das Ma√ü aller Dinge sein. Insbesondere Europa sollte seine wirtschaftlichen Beziehungen st√§rker diversifizieren. Wir m√ºssen Kleinstaaterei in Geschlossenheit verwandeln und die eigene Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit und Innovationskraft st√§rken.Wir brauchen China und China braucht uns. Eine Partnerschaft auf Augenh√∂he ist das A und O. Danke, dass wir gestern genau da ankn√ºpfen konnten.#Europa #Kreislaufwirtschaft

Joie de vivreThere are currently many reasons to worry. There are many developments that are saddening. But despite this - or precisely because of this? - we must not allow lightness, exuberance and joy to be neglected in our lives. Not as escapism. But rather as unifying community experiences that radiate optimism. Young people in particular deserve this, as their lives have been shaped by the pandemic, climate change and political conflicts.That's why Deutsche Telekom is launching the ‚ÄúSummer to Remember‚Äù. With Telekom Electronic Beats, we will create up to 10,000 special music events where young people in particular can experience extraordinary things together. It started yesterday. With a gig by the Sugababes in a ‚ÄúSp√§ti‚Äù in Berlin. In addition to Germany, we are planning gigs in Croatia, Montenegro, North Macedonia, Austria, Poland, Romania, Slovakia, the Czech Republic and Hungary. We hope to create some positive memories of summer 2024 for Europe's next generation. Thanks to Ulrich Klenke and his team for making this possible.#electronicbeats #summertoremember #genz Telekom HU Hrvatski Telekom Crnogorski Telekom T-Mobile Polska T-Mobile Czech Republic a.s. Slovak Telekom Makedonski Telekom AD Magenta Telekom

It was a pleasure to record the latest European Round Table for Industry - ERT podcast, 21st century industrialists, and to discuss all things #energytransition: where Europe is now, where we need to get to and how we do it.¬†It‚Äôs clear that our energy transition is now entering a new phase and the conversation has shifted from the ‚Äúshould we‚Äù to rather ‚Äúhow can we‚Äù. Here there are two points I would make. Firstly we must drive the active participation of the European citizens and secondly we have to make good energy work also with regard to systemic costs and industry prices to remain competitive in a decarbonising world.¬†Well-made electrification will provide greater security, lower emissions and a lever for lowering prices. The quicker the progress, the bigger the win wins. So, let‚Äôs get on with delivering that, scaling up our grid infrastructure and electrifying Europe. Thanks to Robert O‚ÄôMeara for the lively conversation! You can listen to the podcast episode here: https://lnkd.in/eNScCqZW

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be complacent, disrupt yourself.‚ÄùDuring my recent visit to Silicon Valley, I heard this phrase several times, and I couldn't agree more. Especially in the face of a VUCA world, disrupting ourselves at both an individual and organisational level is the key to outperform our peers. Here are some learnings from years of disrupting myself:üëâ Question the status-quo. üëâ Don‚Äôt get addicted to be right. Think pragmatically and see your ideas as an experiment. Changing your mind is a moment of growth.üëâ Cultivate a diverse network and ask for advice. Consult your critics, too! Yes, it means to be vulnerable. But their input will propel you forward. üëâ Step out of your comfort zone. Stay curious, engage with new opportunities to learn, and grow. üëâ Don‚Äôt be afraid to fail. Success comes with failure when you learn from your mistakes. üëâ As a leader, foster curiosity, learning and collaboration in your teams. Promote a growth mindset.Last but not least: We need trust for this to happen! Do you have tips on how to disrupt oneself? I look forward to your comments. hashtag#TogetherTalanxhashtag#PerformanceCulturehashtag#Transparencyhashtag#Engagementhashtag#Collaboration

Tim tests European Championship stadium: our technical tactics in check¬†The European Championship starts in a few days. And millions of fans want to be there live in the stadium or in front of the TV. That's why Deutsche Telekom is needed! We are the official national partner of UEFA Euro 2024! That's why hundreds of colleagues have been working for months. Many thanks to all colleagues involved for their hard work!We have laid kilometer after kilometer of fiber optic cable through the stadium. All TV images flow through these cables. To ensure that the live signal doesn't lag, stable networks are needed. We secure the stability with two redundant, physically separated cable lines. Better safe than sorry! Of course, soccer fans also want high-speed 5G. It's a good thing I'm not afraid of heights, otherwise I wouldn't have been able to take such a close look at the antennas at a height of around 30 meters. üòâ Thanks to 5G, the thousands of fans in the stadium can share every selfie and every goal celebration instantly! By the way, our mobile customers will receive unlimited data during the European Championship. I took a closer look at all of this in the D√ºsseldorf stadium - because the truth is known to be on the field! üòâ Have fun with this new edition of my "Tim tests" series.P.S.: By the way, we produce the Tim tests videos without an agency. From the script to the filming and editing. Thanks to the whole team!

It‚Äôs amazing to be back in Orlando for this year‚Äôs #SAPSapphire, with so many great customers and partners on stage! But it's worth putting all our efforts into it.The European Union is forged through the experiences, opinions, dreams and wishes of millions of people. Floods, wildfires, record temperatures ‚Äì the effects of hashtag#climatechange are already apparent. That's why we all need to take action to stop this change now. This applies to politics, science, the financial sector, and us in the industry. With challenges on such a global scale, collaboration and exchange are key to success. Last week, Cetin Nazikkol and I had such an opportunity at the Freiburg Energy Talks 2024 organized by Fraunhofer-Institut f√ºr Solare Energiesysteme ISE. Together with other leaders and strategists, we discussed an international roadmap for the success of the hashtag#energytransition.At thyssenkrupp, we also have various key technologies to enable the hashtag#greentransformation, primarily bundled in our Decarbon Technologies segment. In addition to reducing emissions in the hashtag#cement industry and producing slewing bearings as a core element for hashtag#windturbines, we are also a supplier of electrolyzers for the production of hashtag#greenhydrogen and a plant manufacturer for relevant chemicals such as hashtag#ammonia and methanol to drive the energy transition.Thank you for the invitation and the great insights, Daria Nochevnik and Prof. Dr. Christopher Hebling. Also a special thanks to Alicia Eastman and Cornelius Matthes. Looking forward to future exchanges!And a quick reminder: if we want to successfully tackle climate change together, we need politicians in decision-making positions who take it seriously and are actively involved in finding solutions. To ensure this remains the case and that we do not leave the field to fake news and populists, I ask you: Put your vote to work in the hashtag#EuropeanElections, June 06-09.

payzy: FinTech with cashbackDeutsche Telekom wants to make the world more digital. We want to be part of our customers' digital lives. Payment is an essential part of this. How about you? Are you perhaps one of the 13 percent of consumers in Germany who pay by cell phone? The figure shows how much Germany is lagging behind here. By comparison, 67 percent of the population in China use mobile payment. To make payments more digital, we have launched a new app: the digital wallet payzy. What makes it special: Unlike comparable payment products, payzy offers one percent direct #cashback on every transaction. You can use it to pay anywhere, in stores, restaurants and of course online. The app also makes it easier to settle accounts with friends. The payzy wallet is easy to top up by EC card, credit card or SEPA transfer. I myself have been a payzy fan from the very beginning and use it to pay in our Telekom canteens, for example (currently ten percent cashback ...). I am convinced that together we can easily make our lives more digital. Especially in Germany.PS: You can download the app from www.payzy.de.#mobilepayment #telekom #deutschetelekom

Kunst im √ñffentlichen Raum: Eine Bereicherung f√ºr die GesellschaftAm vergangenen Wochenende war es wieder soweit: Unter der Leitung von Walter Smerling  hat die Stiftung f√ºr Kunst und Kultur in Bonn ein neues Kunstwerk im √∂ffentlichen Raum vorgestellt. Diesmal handelt es sich um den eine Skulptur des Weltstars Jaume Plensa, der seine "Laurelle" vor dem Bahnhof in Bad Godesberg enth√ºllt hat.Kunst und Demokratie: Ein starkes DuoDemokratie bedeutet nicht nur politische Teilhabe, sondern auch Zugang zu Bildung und Kultur f√ºr alle Menschen. Gerade in Zeiten, in denen der √∂ffentliche Raum oft unter Sparzw√§ngen leidet, ist es umso wichtiger, dass Kunst und Kultur frei zug√§nglich ist. Projekte wie das von Walter Smerling und seiner Stiftung tragen ma√ügeblich dazu bei, diesen Zugang zu gew√§hrleisten.Ich bewundere Menschen wie ihn, die sich nicht von Kritik und oft nicht nachvollziehbaren Widerst√§nden¬†¬†entmutigen lassen. Stattdessen gehen sie ihren Weg unbeirrt weiter und organisieren privates Geld, um Kunstwerke im √∂ffentlichen Raum zu realisieren. Diese Beharrlichkeit und das Engagement sind inspirierend und verdienen meine h√∂chste Anerkennung. Es ist ermutigend zu wissen, dass es weiterhin Menschen gibt, die sich unerm√ºdlich f√ºr die Verbreitung von Kunst und Kultur einsetzen. Solche Initiativen sind essenziell f√ºr eine lebendige und offene Gesellschaft.Ein Beitrag zur kulturellen VielfaltDie Enth√ºllung der "Laurelle" ist bereits das f√ºnfte Kunstwerk, das von der Stiftung im √∂ffentlichen Raum pr√§sentiert wurde. Jedes dieser Werke tr√§gt zur kulturellen Vielfalt und Bereicherung unseres st√§dtischen Umfelds bei. Es ist eine Freude zu sehen, wie Kunstwerke in den Alltag der Menschen integriert werden und somit ein breites Publikum erreichen. Ich freue mich bereits auf die n√§chsten Projekte.Kunst im √∂ffentlichen Raum ist mehr als nur Dekoration; sie ist ein Ausdruck unserer gemeinsamen Werte und eine Einladung zur Reflexion und zum Dialog. üôè Danke! Lokal- und Verfassungspatriotismus üòäBonn ist Heimat. F√ºr mich pers√∂nlich. F√ºr die Deutsche Telekom. Und ‚Äì wenn man so will ‚Äì auch f√ºr das Grundgesetz, das heute vor 75 Jahren in Kraft getreten ist.Das Grundgesetz hat uns stark gemacht. Wirtschaftlich und gesellschaftlich. Es hat Freiheit geschaffen; auch, weil es Grenzen gesetzt hat, die unser Zusammenleben definieren. Grenzen vor allem auch im Verh√§ltnis des Staates gegen√ºber dem Individuum. Etwa in Artikel 10, der das Fernmeldegeheimnis festlegt, und f√ºr ein Unternehmen wie die Telekom darum bis heute Auftrag und Verpflichtung ist.Weil uns das Grundgesetz stark gemacht hat, ist es wichtig, dass wir uns f√ºr das Grundgesetz stark machen. Und dass wir es feiern und w√ºrdigen. Ich freue mich, dass das in Bonn passiert. Etwa mit einer Ausstellung im Museum K√∂nig, die ich allen ans Herz legen m√∂chte: ‚ÄûGemalte Demokratie mit Werken von Markus L√ºpertz.‚Äú ¬†Oder mit einem B√ºrgerfest im ehemaligen Regierungsviertel an diesem Wochenende. Das Grundgesetz ist ‚Äì wenn man so will ‚Äì eine ernste Angelegenheit. Aber gerade darum verdient es auch Leichtigkeit, Freude und Spa√ü. Denn auch das erm√∂glicht es uns. Danke, liebes Grundgesetz!#demokratieliebe #grundgesetz #bonn

Wir alle verfolgen ein gemeinsames Ziel: thyssenkrupp bestm√∂glich aufzustellen und fit f√ºr die Zukunft zu machen. An excellent illustration of how #chemistry is woven into our daily lives.This fun periodic table shows that chemistry, other than some might think, isn't just an academic discipline taught in classrooms or confined to chemical parks. It's an essential part of our everyday lives, which is exactly why I find it so fascinating.During my studies at RWTH Aachen University in the 90s, I developed a deep appreciation for the sheer endless possibilities that chemistry offers in making our lives more comfortable and sustainable. This brings me to another point: the graphic also shows how important clear explanations and practical examples are to convey complex subjects. As scientists, it's our duty to do just that. ‚ò∫Kudos to Keith Enevoldsen and elements.wlonk.com for the brilliant graphic!

If you‚Äôve been on my page for a while, I hope you‚Äôre also on the same page as me: the energy transition is happening in the distribution grids. ¬†Now we have European numbers to show for it: Eurelectric‚Äôs Grids for Speed study reveals we need twice the investments annually by 2050 to get to a carbon-free, independent energy system. We are at 36 and need to get to 67bn annually in capital deployment. If it sounds daunting, think of it as a downpayment for our energy security. You may also be surprised to know it‚Äôs in the same ballpark as road 64bn EUR/year and rail investment volumes 49bn EUR/year. ¬†But bullish investment figures are not the whole story. We took a long, hard look at how we can lower the costs and ensure they can be bearable for consumers. If we pull all available levers, we can save 12bn EUR annually. By strategically upsizing our assets ‚Äì what we call anticipatory investments ‚Äì we can save 7bn/year. Another 5bn/year can be shaved off if we tap into grid-friendly flexibility, meaning not synchronising consumers to create peaks. And another 1bn/year can be saved by increasing the performance of the assets. ¬†To get this done, we first need lots of low-cost capital to flow our way and so DSOs need to offer attractive returns to investors. We rely on political leaders, regulators and financial actors to be our partners here. ¬†Thank you to Eurelectric, EY and all colleagues involved in a Grids for Speed study done well in record time. The power sector, and E.ON, are working hard to deliver. It‚Äôs on us!

Diese Fragen spielen in Daniel Kehlmanns "Lichtspiel" eine zentrale Rolle. Der Roman taucht in das Leben von Georg Wilhelm Pabst ein, einem in der Weimarer Republik gefeierten Regisseur, dessen k√ºnstlerische Ambitionen und Ideale nach dem Machtantritt der Nationalsozialisten in Konflikt mit den Zw√§ngen des Regimes geraten. Aus wechselnder Perspektive skizziert Kehlmann die inneren Widerspr√ºche und Auseinandersetzungen auf tiefgr√ºndige Art und Weise; hier und da f√ºhlt man sich an Klaus Manns Roman "Mephisto" erinnert."Lichtspiel" geht √ºber eine Auseinandersetzung mit einem d√ºsteren Kapitel unserer Geschichte hinaus; es ist eine Einladung, √ºber die Tragweite individueller Entscheidungen und Handlungen nachzudenken. Wie reagieren wir, wenn fundamentale Werte wie Toleranz, Offenheit und Mitgef√ºhl nicht mehr selbstverst√§ndlich sind? Kehlmann betont in "Lichtspiel" die Verantwortung des Einzelnen, f√ºr die Prinzipien einer gerechten und solidarischen Gesellschaft einzutreten; er h√§tte keinen passenderen Zeitpunkt f√ºr das Erscheinen des Romans w√§hlen k√∂nnen. üìö

Die Kunststoff-Debatte wird leider h√§ufig etwas einseitig gef√ºhrt: Viele sind der Meinung, #Kunststoffe m√ºssen ganz verschwinden, denn sie schaden der Umwelt und uns Menschen.¬†Dabei kommt der immense Mehrwert, den Kunststoffe seit Jahrzehnten schaffen, oft zu kurz. K√ºhlschr√§nke, Windr√§der, Fotovoltaik-Anlagen, E-Auto-Batterien ‚Äì ohne Kunststoffe w√ºrde es nichts davon geben. Auch im Verpackungsbereich erh√∂hen sie die Haltbarkeit und Sicherheit von Lebensmitteln und wirken so der Verschwendung entgegen.¬†Es ist menschlich, dass wir an erster Stelle die Probleme sehen. Dinge fallen uns vor allem dann ins Auge, wenn sie richtig schieflaufen. Zum Beispiel, wenn Kunststoffe als M√ºll in der Umwelt enden. Diesen Problemen m√ºssen wir uns gemeinsam stellen. Die Chemie- und Kunststoffindustrie tut das seit Jahren.¬†Wir denken Kunststoffe neu, halten sie so lange wie m√∂glich im Kreislauf, entwickeln Recyclingtechnologien und setzen alternative Rohstoffe in der Produktion ein. Ganz wichtig: Die Produkte von Anfang an so konzipieren, dass sie lange halten, gut reparierbar sind und am Ende einfach recycelt werden k√∂nnen.¬†Die Transformation der Kunststoffe und der dahinterliegenden Wertsch√∂pfungsketten (Rohstoffe, Produktion, Konsum, Entsorgungswirtschaft) hin zur #Kreislaufwirtschaft muss unser Fokus sein. Und sie braucht jetzt den R√ºckenwind von Politik und Gesellschaft. Denn nur dann wird sie uns gelingen, und Kunststoffe k√∂nnen ihrer essenziellen Rolle in unser aller nachhaltigen Zukunft gerecht werden.¬†Mehr zu meiner Position in meinem Interview mit der Frankfurter Rundschau:¬†https://lnkd.in/eiaFN2VH#Recycling #FullyCircular

Too often today we see conflict arise from fear of the unknown, especially cultural differences. In our daily lives, particularly at the workplace, we can counter this trend by establishing habits of understanding that embrace diversity and inclusion. At Allianz, cultivating workforce diversity is a long-term investment in strengthening our organization, futureproofing it for demographic and societal shifts, and ensuring our continued resilience around the globe. A culture of inclusion and belonging enriches our organization with perspectives, experiences, and talents, enhancing innovation, problem-solving and competitiveness. Our approach values unity, authenticity and compassion and spans gender, generation, nationalities/ethnicities, disability, and LGBTQ. The work is ongoing, but we take pride in our progress, including being recognized by Great Place to Work certifications across 43 units in 26 countries in 2023.Now is no time to rest or resist progress. By 2025, millennials will comprise 75% of the global workforce. According to Deloitte research, this generation has a unique perspective on diversity. While older generations tend to view diversity through the lenses of race, demographics, equality and representation, millennials see diversity as a melding of varying experiences, backgrounds, and viewpoints. They view the ideal workplace as a supportive environment that honors varying perspectives on a given issue. I am looking forward to watching how Allianz and the world progress along this path. ¬† How is your organization embracing diversity? Share your insights via the poll.#InclusionAtAllianz #WorldDayforCulturalDiversity #Allianz

After years of dedicated service and leadership, SAP‚Äôs co-founder Hasso Plattner formally retired from his role as chairman of the Supervisory Board this week. In 1972, Hasso co-founded SAP, and remained a central figure in the company for over half a century, firmly establishing SAP as the market leader for enterprise application software. hashtag#Climate change is affecting the world, and the consequences will be felt by us all. It is evident that collective efforts are vital to our success. At thyssenkrupp, we are committed to leading the charge in transforming the entire industry ‚Äî an ambitious task that we will master, thanks to our outstanding hashtag#GENERATIONTK. To this end, we have consolidated some of our most cutting-edge technologies within the thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies segment. This enables us to fully leverage the potential of our innovative products and services to achieve climate targets ‚Äì for us, for our partners, and for our society at large. Today I want to share with you another one of our groundbreaking solutions: the polysius¬Æ pure oxyfuel process, developed by thyssenkrupp Polysius. As a key player in the hashtag#cement industry, Polysius leads the charge toward sustainability, addressing the urgent need for greener solutions. With the cement industry alone responsible for 7% of global hashtag#CO2 emissions, our polysius¬Æ pure oxyfuel process offers a sustainable alternative, meeting both hashtag#environmental and hashtag#economic requirements. What sets our polysius¬Æ pure oxyfuel process apart is its ability to separate, concentrate, and utilize the CO2 effectively within a kiln. With Carbon Capture technology, we can capture nearly 100% of CO2 emissions ‚Äî a huge advancement for both the environment and the construction industry! Looking ahead, hashtag#thyssenkrupp Polysius aims to further process captured CO2 into climate-neutral hashtag#syntheticfuels, such as kerosene for air travel, helping to transform the cement industry from hashtag#grey2green. Last month marked a significant milestone as construction began on one of the world's first carbon-neutral cement plants in L√§gerdorf, Schleswig-Holstein. Congratulations to the remarkable teams from thyssenkrupp Polysius, Linde Europe, Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Climate Action and Holcim Germany on this great achievement! Through projects like this, we demonstrate our power and show: thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies is committed to cutting-edge solutions like polysius¬Æ pure oxyfuel. We're proud to transition from being part of the climate change problem to being an integral part of the solution. We are thrilled to be part of this transformative journey.  Cetin Nazikkol, Carolin Nadilo, Michael H√∂llermann, Pablo Hofelich, Frank Ruoss, Dr. Alexander Just

Preparation and productivity are the foundation of intelligent growth. Our strong results this quarter are attributable to the consistent execution and determined hard work of our people around the world. Their expertise and diverse skills rank among Allianz‚Äôs most valuable competitive advantages, and together, they have delivered an excellent start to the year:¬†Our total business volume reached 48.4 billion euros, representing solid growth of 5.3%, and our operating profit advanced by 6.8% to 4.0 billion euros. The net income to shareholders surged to 2.5 billion euros, an outstanding increase of 21.8%. ¬†All segments contributed to this excellent performance, and this places us on a clear path to achieve our ambitions for the full year. Further, this strong start affords us the opportunity to invest in our own future so that we can secure the future of others. We do so in two ways: productivity and preparation. We focus on productivity at Allianz because it helps us to be competitive in the prices we offer to customers and in the value we deliver for shareholders. Where we realize efficiencies, particularly through new technologies, we invest these gains into new ways of learning, working, and serving our customers. Meanwhile, the theme of preparation comes to life for us through our sponsorship of the Olympic and Paralympic Games. We are proud to associate our brand with a global movement that promotes human achievement and unity. And, we love being inspired by the athletic feats of the Games, which is the highest expression of preparation in the form of daily acts of physical and mental training. While Olympic records may be out of reach for most of us, we can still apply the cumulative power of small, consistent daily acts of excellence and continual improvement in everything we do. Thank you for your contributions to Allianz‚Äôs community and to our success.#Q1 #FinancialResults #AllianzFinancialResults #GetReadyForTheBest #Olympics #ReadyParisGo #Allianz

Our colleagues in Oxfordshire, England have played a key role in advancing medical #imaging time and again. Together, we announced today the construction of a new facility that will become the global center for our low-helium magnets. This marks the beginning of a new era as we drive the democratization of #MRI technologies for people all over the world.¬†Our DryCool magnets reduce the amount of helium required in an MRI scanner from 1,500 liters to under a single liter, allowing us to help conserve this precious resource. MRI scanners with these next generation magnets are more #sustainable, more lightweight, and smaller in size, allowing for easier ‚Äì and less expensive ‚Äì installation in places that once lacked access to this powerful diagnostic tool. This is one tangible way we are pioneering breakthroughs in #healthcare for everyone, everywhere, sustainably.¬†Today's ceremony was made even more special by the presence of UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and Chancellor of Exchequer Jeremy Hunt. We were honored they could join us in celebrating the local economic impacts of the new center, which will support 1,300 skilled jobs and bolster our commitment to manufacturing in the UK. We are excited for what the future will bring, and I applaud all those on #TeamHealthineers who are making this possible!

Thank you, Bill Gates and Robert Habeck, for visiting our hydrogen center in Berlin this week. Grateful that you could join the Energy Resilience Leadership Group‚Äôs discussion on moving energy projects from lab to large scale with a diverse group of climate tech entrepreneurs. There are systemic challenges in getting cleantech solutions scaled up as it carries risk, requiring entrepreneurial courage. For instance, while thousands of hydrogen projects have been announced globally, the latest IEA data indicates that only 7% of planned renewable-based hydrogen capacity is projected to be operational by 2030. This is a real issue. Addressing it requires a business case and joint efforts from industrial players, policy-makers, and financial institutions. That is why discussion rounds like these, committed to action on de-risking and implementation, are so important.  Very glad that Anne-Laure de Chammard could showcase our electrolyzer factory unlocking hydrogen‚Äôs potential and thank you, Ann Mettler for guiding us all through the day.  #climatetech #energytransition #innovationSiemens Energy Breakthrough Energy  BMW Foundation Herbert Quandt UnternehmerTUM Pictures: Thomas Lobenwein

Together with more than 30 other German companies, we are sending a strong message against extremism and racism. Under the name "We Stand for Values," we have formed an alliance, calling on our approximately 1.7 million colleagues to participate in the European elections and upcoming regional elections in the fall.This broad alliance from the German business sector advocates for the core values that define our democracy: diversity, openness, and tolerance. These values are not only of moral relevance but are also critical to the strength and success of our country's economy.Extremists and racists challenge these values while offering seemingly simple solutions to the complex issues of our time. By doing so, they divide our society, harm our country, and jeopardize our prosperity. We will not allow this. It is crucial that we now take a united stand.  #WeStandForValues #TeamSiemensMore: www.westandforvalues.comSiemens

Trust pays off. Today for our shareholders.I often rightly thank my colleagues and our customers. However, today is all about our shareholders.Thank you for the good discussion today at our Annual General Meeting and for your trust.We have repaid it with a strong performance.- We achieved a record result in 2023: 1.581 million euros. This shows that our focussed and ambitious strategy is successful.- The shareholders have followed our dividend proposal: we are increasing the dividend per share by 35 cents or around 18% to 2.35 euros.- The share price reflects the result: it rose by 46 % last year - 5 times more than the competition.- We have successfully increased the free float and the tradability of the share with a capital increase and further strengthened its position in equity indices.- We have made a good start to the year with an increase in quarterly earnings of 35 % compared to the previous year to 572 million euros. This has increased our confidence that we will be able to significantly exceed our consolidated net profit target of more than 1.7 billion euros.- For 2024, we are aiming for a dividend of 2.50 euros if business develops as planned.The decisive factor for us is: A promise is a promise. We provide good reasons to continue to trust us. Let us continue on our common path.hashtag#Together hashtag#PerformanceCulture

In today‚Äôs complex world, we are all confronted with several challenges. This applies not only to us as an economy, but also to politics, science, and society. These challenges all have one thing in common: we are more successful when we work as a unit. The hashtag#EuropeanUnion is a living example of this kind of teamwork. Whether it is climate protection, security, or social policy - together we are stronger. Even if Europe and its decisions sometimes feel far away, we feel the effects directly in all our lives. This is particularly true for our economy. Access to the hashtag#EU's vast internal market boosts trade, enhances competitiveness, and fosters innovation and growth opportunities. As thyssenkrupp is an internationally operating group, we benefit directly from the strength of the Union. However, beyond the economic benefits, it's also about our values and unity. We must not allow hatred and racism to prevail. As a community, we must advocate for tolerance, diversity, and solidarity. This is crucial for us as society. At the same time, these values are central to a properly performing economy. To make a contribution, it is essential that everyone can be themselves. This is also true for our more than 70,000 employees in Europe: diversity isn't just a buzzword for the hashtag#GENERATIONTK ‚Äì it's the core of our corporate culture which we actively live every day. Together with over 30 others, hashtag#thyssenkrupp has joined the alliance "We stand for values". Together, we are calling on you to make your vote count in the 2024 European Elections from June 6 to 9, for the democratic values that strengthen us and against populism that divides. Together, we can shape a sustainable and economically successful future for hashtag#Europe, where everyone can thrive.

Our newly formed and now co-determined supervisory board gathered for the first time at the Kemnath, Germany location of Siemens Healthineers. In addition to discussing business development and important company matters, we had the pleasure to get acquainted with each other while experiencing one of our largest #technology and production sites in the world. The site in Kemnath has become a Center of Competence for #Mechatronics and plays an important role in supporting the future growth, scale, and resilience of our company. Having fully integrated the production of radiotherapy devices following our combination with Varian, the team there now develops and produces technology for all our business areas: #Imaging, #Diagnostics, #AdvancedTherapies, and #Varian. We had the opportunity to see some of the amazing technology up close. I think we all walked away with fresh insights and a renewed appreciation for the #innovation and #craftmanship that goes into each of our products. Thank you to our #TeamHealthineers in Kemnath for being such gracious hosts and for your excellent work and dedication. And a special thanks to the supervisory board members for your engagement and commitment to our company‚Äôs success.

Together, we are responsible to shape a sustainable future!According to the World Economic Forum‚Äôs latest "Global Risks Report", environmental concerns dominate the top risks for the next decade. It is therefore crucial that sustainability is firmly embedded in our Talanx Group strategy and is a key component of our business model.Here are some highlights from our newly published hashtag#SustainabilityReport:üëâ Carbon intensity in our liquid investment portfolio reduced by 34% since 2019, sustainable investments expanded to EUR 11.3 billion.üëâ Updated investment exclusions, including oil production and transport, the fracking of shale gas and/or oil, and sharpened thermal coal exclusion for investments.üëâ Partnering in the energy transformation by insuring renewable energies and vital infrastructure.üëâ Exclusions in underwriting also extended:¬†exit from oil sands accelerated to the end of 2025 and commitment to respect the rights of indigenous peoples üëâ Conducted a comprehensive risk analysis of our global supplier base to address human rights and environmental concerns.üëâ Strengthened sustainability governance across our Group, with now three ESG experts on the Supervisory Board.Together, we can drive meaningful change towards a sustainable future. I look forward to seeing more of it! Special thanks to our dedicated hashtag#sustainability team for their efforts this year. What's your take on sustainability? hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#SustainableFinance hashtag#NetZero

During my recent visit to Copenhagen, I had the pleasure of congratulating our long-standing customer Herlev og Gentofte Hospital for being the first site worldwide to upgrade its two Ethos #radiotherapy systems with HyperSight. Herlev Hospital and #TeamHealthineers share the ambition of being a leader in redefining #healthcare, committed to #innovation, excellence, and a healthier future. Fit f√ºr den digitalen Wandel im Gesundheitswesen¬†Vergangene Woche hatten wir mit G√ºnter W√§ltermann und Ulrich Arnold  von der AOK Rheinland/Hamburg - Die Gesundheitskasse und der gkv informatik zu Besuch bei uns. Die Deutsche Telekom und die AOK blicken auf ein langes, partnerschaftliches Verh√§ltnis zur√ºck. Unser Erfolgsrezept: Lokale N√§he und immer f√ºreinander da sein. Bei unserem Workshop ging es um die innovative Co-Kreation von digitalen L√∂sungen f√ºr die Gesundheit von morgen. Dazu z√§hlen das digitale Kundenmanagement, moderne Cloudlandschaften und nat√ºrlich #K√ºnstlicheIntelligenz.Ich freue mich besonders, dass wir die L√∂sungen, die wir f√ºr uns selber entwickelt und perfektioniert haben, nun erfolgreich bei unseren Partnern einsetzen k√∂nnen. Allen voran unser KI-gesteuerter Telekom Chatbot oder das digitale Identit√§ts-Management. Ich nenne das: ‚Äûeat your own dogfood‚Äú. Dieser Ansatz erlaubt uns allen schnell und pragmatisch, aber zugleich 100 Prozent sicher und datenschutzkonform agieren zu k√∂nnen. Dabei ist es uns wichtig, dass wir digitale L√∂sungen anbieten und kreieren, die den besonders strengen Datenschutzanforderungen des #Gesundheitswesens entsprechen.Unsere Unternehmen k√∂nnen hier gut voneinander lernen, denn die #Digitalisierung des Gesundheitswesens in Deutschland steckt noch in den Kinderschuhen. Es gibt aber ein starkes √ñkosystem, das voranschreitet und neue digitale L√∂sungen umsetzt. Denn am Ende soll das Geld der Patientinnen und Patienten nicht in die Verwaltung und Prozesse gesteht werden, sondern nur in eins: die #Gesundheit. #telekom #deutschetelekom Dr. Ferri Abolhassan Dr. Gottfried Ludewig Oliver Hoppmann Dirk Borchardt

What everyone can learn from the biggest tech companies on the planet.Recently, my colleagues on the Talanx Board and I had the opportunity to visit four of the six most valuable companies in the world: Microsoft, Apple, Amazon and Google. We took a look at some of the most valuable start-ups such as OpenAI, the creators of hashtag#ChatGPT, Stripe and Waymo. And we visited LinkedIn and venture capital firm Andreessen Horowitz.The objective of the trip in two questions: What opportunities are there to scale GenAI in our industry? And how do these very successful companies stay hungry?What impressed me was their focus. And that is what continues to make them successful today.- It's their emphasis on performance culture and results that is breathed throughout the entire company- Their drive for excellence by putting the customer at the center of everything they do - In this way they constantly push the boundaries of what is possibleTake hashtag#AI: US companies are pushing the technology and it is already a game changer. This is still often underestimated in Europe. Success means adapting quickly to changing realities.A performance-orientated corporate culture lays the foundation. I expect people to consistently live our corporate values of hashtag#transparency, hashtag#engagement and hashtag#collaboration based on hashtag#trust.Many thanks to my colleagues for this exciting journey hashtag#together, Jean-Jacques Henchoz, Wilm Langenbach, Edgar Puls, Caroline Schlienkamp, Jens Warkentin, Jan Wicke. Health and safety are non-negotiables. Yet every day, countless people across the globe face health and safety hazards, including at work. Many of those risks, such as UV radiation or excessive heat, will increase with the effects of climate change, highlighting the need for a transition to renewables.At Siemens Gamesa, health and safety are paramount. Even the smallest oversight, the tiniest shortcut, can carry serious consequences. That‚Äôs why safety must be a priority in everything we do, at all times. Safety is the only way home. hashtag#WorldDayforSafetyAndHealthAtWork hashtag#TeamPurple hashtag#ZeroHarm

Today is World Day for Safety and Health at Work, and yes, this year it falls on a Sunday. Does that make it any less relevant? Of course not! We at Siemens Energy are duty-bound to make a difference on this matter because the reality is that bringing electricity to homes and businesses does not come without risk.Whether it‚Äôs the manual handling of heavy loads, working with high voltages, or operating in challenging environments such as out at sea or at heights, the responsibility falls on each and every one of our employees to ensure that everyone returns home safely at the end of a day‚Äôs work. That is why we have used this week ‚Äì leading up to today ‚Äì to review our internal Zero Harm Programs, share personal safety experiences with colleagues, conduct safety walks and talks, and conduct around 1,000 trainings to enhance our lifesaving skills. Safety is not just a priority. It‚Äôs a mindset that must be ingrained in our culture.No matter where you might be reading this from, please stay safe and take care of each other ‚Äì not just today, but every day. #healthandsafety #safeday #zeroharm

Yesterday, at the 100th anniversary of the World Energy Council, Eurelectric organized a private roundtable to preview the results of the Grids for Speed Study ‚Äì a look at the investments needed for Europe‚Äôs power distribution grids. ¬†It was a privilege to have had the chance to sound out the preliminary findings with Energy Commissioner Kadri Simson, fellow CEOs from transmission and distribution operators, technology providers and with our knowledge partner EY. ¬†My key takeaway is that affordability is our absolute North Star and we must work hard to improve the outlook for consumers by employing all the available optimisation strategies, flexibility and technologies. Not to gainsay this vote and without picking sides: when the rushing of emergency war supplies by the world‚Äôs strongest nation is characterised as a ‚Äúgood day for world peace‚Äù, it‚Äôs time to worry about where humanity is headed.

Beyond the hype As always, the hype cycle applies: After the hype surrounding large language models, we soon will enter a phase of AI frustration. But then, there will be substance! At the ‚ÄúBankentag‚Äù, a summit of the Bundesverband deutscher Banken, I outlined what I think is important in the current phase: - Fewer laws:More laws do not immediately create more legal certainty. It is difficult for legislation to anticipate what will happen in the area of artificial intelligence. Rather, companies need the freedom to experiment with AI. We use data to improve. It's hard to live with scissors in our heads when all we're concerned about is whether we're allowed to do something or not, while our competitors use all this data to optimize their services. However, that doesn't mean that there are no rules needed at all. - Equal opportunities:Large language models arise where there is data. And they are in the cloud. America and Asia currently have a location advantage. Also because of higher energy costs in Europe. Nevertheless, we want our own solutions. Telekom relies on partners. For example, we cooperate with SingTel and SK Telekom. And we create specific language models. - Try more:As Telekom, we are already using AI. In over 400 projects. And our employees get AI training. Because every area can use artificial intelligence. To offer our customers innovative products to become more productive and faster. I see it as a clear task of a CEO to create an environment in which employees can try out and use AI. Thanks to Mercedes Bunz  Mark Branson  Michael Hanisch  Marion H√∂llinger  and Christian Sewing  for the exchange!

KI: Weniger = mehr Wie immer gilt der Hype-Cycle: Nach dem Hype rund um Large Language Models biegen wir absehbar in die Phase der KI-Frustration ein. Aber dann entsteht Substanz! Beim Bankentag des Bundesverband Deutscher Banken habe ich skizziert, was aktuell aus meiner Sicht wichtig ist:   Weniger Gesetze:Mehr Gesetze schaffen nicht unmittelbar mehr Rechtssicherheit. Gesetzgebung kann nur schwer antizipieren, was sich im Bereich K√ºnstliche Intelligenz noch alles tun wird. Vielmehr brauchen Unternehmen den Freiraum, mit KI zu experimentieren. Wir setzen Daten ein, um besser zu werden. Es lebt sich schlecht mit einer Schere im Kopf, wenn uns immer nur umtreibt, ob wir dies oder jenes d√ºrfen, w√§hrend unsere Wettbewerber kontinuierlich alle diese Daten nutzen, um ihre Dienstleistungen zu optimieren. Das hei√üt gleichwohl nicht, dass es √ºberhaupt keine Regeln braucht. = Chancen:Gro√üe Sprachmodelle entstehen dort, wo Daten sind. Und die sind in der Cloud. Da haben Nordamerika und Asien aktuell einen Standortvorteil. Auch wegen h√∂herer Energiekosten in Europa. Trotzdem wollen wir eigene L√∂sungen. Die Telekom setzt auf Partner. Wir kooperieren zum Beispiel mit SingTel und SK Telekom. Und schaffen spezifische Sprachmodelle. Mehr probieren:Als Telekom setzen wir KI bereits ein. In √ºber 400 Projekten. Und unsere Besch√§ftigten durchlaufen KI-Schulungen. Denn jeder Bereich kann k√ºnstliche Intelligenz einsetzen. Um unseren Kunden innovative Produkte anzubieten, um produktiver zu werden und schneller zu sein. Ich sehe es als klare CEO-Aufgabe, ein Umfeld zu schaffen, in dem die Besch√§ftigten KI ausprobieren und einsetzen. Danke an Mercedes Bunz  Mark Branson  Michael Hanisch  Marion H√∂llinger  und Christian Sewing  f√ºr den Austausch!

Infrastructure for #competitiveness has been the headline of the week in Brussels and main topic of both Eurelectric‚Äôs letter to EU Ministers and ERT‚Äôs paper on energy infrastructure. ¬†On Tuesday, at the end of the informal Energy Council, Executive Vice President Maro≈° ≈†efƒçoviƒç remarked that the European grid is the best in the world. I could not agree more. And I take this as a compliment for our work done so far in the past, although I also emphasize once again how important further expansion is. Now we need to grow and digitalise our critical infrastructure to gear up for a more electrified, thus more autonomous and stronger Energy Union, because as recently emphasized by the Commission in taking stock of the fruitful Clean Transition Dialogues, ‚Äúa modern network infrastructure is the backbone for industry‚Äù.¬†Last week I wrote to all 27 EU Energy Ministers calling on them to empower Europe‚Äôs electricity grids in particular at distribution level. We know we have a historical investment task ahead of us, but we also have to acknowledge that non-investment comes with its own steep price tag. ¬†As we pointed out in the recent Energy Infrastructure report by ERT, it is fundamental that the next EU legislature and industry leaders lock arms in efforts to fast-track European grid development and foster a regulatory environment that supports both our Green Deal ambitions as well as the growth of European companies. We need faster permitting, we need to cut red tape but above all we need a breeding ground for necessary investments. ¬†Let‚Äôs get on with the job!¬†- Eurelectric letter: https://lnkd.in/e4ttj4bu - ERT report on energy infrastructure: https://lnkd.in/ejwRsaHt - Clean Transition Dialogue conclusions: https://lnkd.in/eChGGKV5

Our Annual Shareholders‚Äô Meeting has just concluded. Siemens Healthineers looked back on a successful fiscal year 2023, where we once more adopted ambitious targets ‚Äì and achieved them. The countdown to the Olympic Games Paris 2024 begins today, we are 100 days ahead of the opening ceremony. We are filled with excitement and looking forward to the start of the Olympics. At Allianz, we live and breathe sports. Since 2021, we've proudly served as the Worldwide Insurance Partner of the Olympic and Paralympic Movements, building on a collaboration with the Paralympic Movement since 2006. This reflects our ongoing commitment to helping individuals embrace active and healthy lifestyles. ¬†As we gear up for Paris 2024, our #MoveNow initiative has inspired over 10,000 young people worldwide to get active by providing opportunities to incorporate movement into their daily routines and build social connections through sport. MoveNow is rooted in the idea the sports can improve overall well-being, by reducing stress, improving fitness, boosting immunity and confidence, and, importantly, building community spirit.¬†Sport also has the power to foster inclusivity, a principle deeply ingrained in Allianz‚Äôs values. Our partnership with the International Paralympic Committee is dedicated to promoting physical activity and inclusivity through initiatives like the MoveNow series designed to encourage wellbeing and community for young people with disabilities. I greatly admire individuals who strive to be the best in sport, which is what the Olympic and Paralympic Games celebrate. At Allianz, we are proud to support more than 120 Olympians, Paralympians and hopefuls as brand ambassadors. Our support includes insurance, mentoring, career pathways, and health initiatives, ensuring they are equipped for success both on and off the field.The life skills learned through sports are invaluable. As we eagerly await the Olympics as the Worldwide Insurance Partner of the International Olympic and Paralympic Movements, we invite you to join us in celebrating the transformative power of sport and get to know more about our MoveNow initiative here: https://lnkd.in/ddaAnWXu¬†International Olympic Committee ‚Äì IOC International Paralympic Committee#GetReadyForTheBest #RoadtoParis2024 #WorldwideInsurancePartner #TeamAllianz¬†#Allianz

Departing from China always leaves me with a sense of nostalgia. I'm convinced that polymers are essential for a sustainable future and that our vision to become #FullyCircular is more relevant than ever.By relentlessly pursuing it around the world ‚Äì including in Germany and China ‚Äì we can make a significant impact. After all, enhanced collaboration among governments, exemplified by partnerships like Germany and China, could also inject much-needed stability and certainty into the turbulent world.What are your hopes for a Sino-German partnership?
