The successful partnership between the United States and Germany is indispensable to many of the most important areas of our lives: upholding freedom and democracy at home and abroad, promoting free and fair trade, fostering inclusive prosperity & mitigating the global threat of climate change. The partnership is also foundational to Allianz‚Äô business.The pursuit of trust and understanding, particularly when it comes to protecting freedom and democracy, are core values of Allianz. That is why we have underwritten a survey examining the state of trust in the US-German partnership. Jointly commissioned by Allianz, Atlantik-Br√ºcke e.V. and the American Council on Germany and conducted by Edelman DXI, this survey research initiated in May 2022.¬†This year‚Äôs results are a sobering wake-up call. Public trust in the German-American relationship is lower today than it was two years ago, driven by mutually shared concerns about a growing lack of society‚Äôs willingness and skill to reach compromise and consensus. People on both sides of the Atlantic are concerned about the rise of extremism and are discouraged by issues that threaten socio-economic stability.¬†These findings are disheartening but not surprising. People are skeptical when misinformation degrades truth & accountability. People are frustrated with a lack of compromise & consensus domestically and globally. They are tired of seeing leaders that put ideology before pragmatic solutions, even as they work harder than ever to make ends meet & yet still seem to be ill-prepared for an uncertain future.¬†The purpose of this survey is not to add to a cycle of gloom but to listen and learn. Gaining data-driven insight into the perceptions and expectations of Americans & Germans helps all avoid taking the relationship for granted and stay alert to risks that weaken the bonds between us.¬†The report‚Äôs findings show that business has the responsibility, & the mandate, to strengthen the ties connecting our countries as two of the world‚Äôs largest, most vibrant economies and trading partners. Businesses & governments must join forces to inspire people with reasons to believe that democracies deliver, to underscore the privileges that free & open societies like ours offer, & to demonstrate that co-operation is the basis for tackling the common issues we face.Through co-operation, we have the power to reconcile differences and regain trust. I invite my fellow business leaders at companies with operations, trade, investments, & friendships across the US & Germany to respond to the high expectations people have for our business. Let us capture the opportunity to demonstrate what compromise, consensus, & collaborative public/private action can look like, for the sake of global security & our German & American employees, customers, partners, shareholders & friends. https://lnkd.in/eppYzJp6

My favourite passage from War and Peace, which I first read exactly 30 years ago:It is natural for a man who does not understand the workings of a machine to imagine that a shaving that has fallen into it by chance and is interfering with its action and tossing about in it is its most important part. The man who does not understand the construction of the machine cannot conceive that the small connecting cogwheel which revolves quietly is one of the most essential parts of the machine, and not the shaving which merely harms and hinders the working.

At E.ON we take on that responsibility, as the #playmaker of the transition we will increase our investments across Europe to ‚Ç¨42 billion between 2024-2028.¬†But secondly, as the #energytransition enters this crucial phase we must also focus on the acceptance of society, not take it for granted. Everyone should participate because they see the benefits, not just out of obligation ‚Äì this will be the responsibility both of the next European legislature and national governments but also companies such as ourselves: we embrace that challenge. Finally, I would end with one clear message: vote for democracy! Cyber security¬†is more than just a compliance concern for corporate technology leaders. It‚Äôs a widespread challenge that impacts individuals, small businesses, and corporates alike, putting all stakeholders at risk, consumers to investors. In today‚Äôs digitally interconnected world, cyber security demands active management.¬†¬†The year 2023 saw an unprecedented surge in cyber-attacks and IT outages, resulting in record losses, mainly due to ransomware and extortion. With these threats rising in frequency, sophistication, and severity, it is no surprise that the Allianz Risk Barometer 2024 report identified cyber security as the top global business risk. Key concerns among respondents include data breaches (59%), and attacks on critical infrastructure and physical assets (53%), often resulting in business interruption or liability issues and impacting an organization‚Äôs financial performance. ¬†As cyberattacks become more sophisticated, individuals are also becoming more vulnerable to various consequences such as financial loss, identity theft, emotional distress, and damage to their reputations. What often goes unnoticed are the mental health costs associated with these data breaches. According to the 2024 Edelman Trust Barometer, globally, nearly 73% express worry about data privacy, and over 70% are concerned about cybersecurity. ¬†While it‚Äôs essential for individuals to improve their security awareness, organizations must also foster a cyber security conscious culture to maintain the trust of their stakeholders. The insurance industry plays a vital role in improving overall cyber resilience. Insurers can help transfer risk and promote efforts to mitigate risks. Insurers are at the forefront of cyber security, continuously assessing and adapting risks factors, such as the quality of digital skills, innovative solutions, and collaborative partnerships. At Allianz, we‚Äôre constantly enhancing our technical expertise and leveraging technologies like AI to predict threats and assess risks. Our efforts go beyond addressing losses and actively prioritize prevention, preparedness, and risk education. While Cyber Insurance doesn‚Äôt replace strong cyber risk management, when combined, it strengthens customers against cyber-attacks. Our industry-leading partnerships further reinforce our comprehensive cyber security and cyber care protections. Additionally, our Cyber Centre of Competence ensures coordinated support globally, offering tailored solutions such as data breach liability coverage, network security protection, and crisis management. ¬†The insurance industry has always risen to meet the challenge of emerging and evolving risks. Cyber is no exception. Insurers like Allianz are essential partners in navigating the evolving risk landscape with resilience and confidence. ¬†#Cybersecurity #Cyberrisk #Securityawareness #Allianz

hashtag#Climate change is affecting the world, and the consequences will be felt by us all. One thing is clear: we can only succeed together. To make the construction of new hydrogen plants as flexible and cost-effective as possible, thyssenkrupp nucera offers electrolyzers in prefabricated standard modules that can be easily interconnected and scaled up unit by unit. Through the establishment of thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies, our hashtag#green industrial powerhouse, featuring cutting-edge technologies like scalum¬Æ by thyssenkrupp nucera, we transition from being contributors to the climate change problem to integral components of the solution. Schwung f√ºr die Zukunft!Morgen ist Hauptversammlung der Telekom im World Conference Center in Bonn. Ich freue mich, Sie dort pers√∂nlich zu treffen. Meine Rede √ºbertragen wir aber auch hier auf LinkedIn live ab ca. 10.15 Uhr.In diesem Jahr spreche ich √ºber die Zukunft. Was braucht es f√ºr eine erfolgreiche Zukunft? Was macht die Telekom in Zukunft stark?1. Zukunft braucht Wachstum. Daf√ºr zeige ich bei der Hauptversammlung unser - Vorsicht Spoiler - "Schwungrad". Es zeigt, wie wir wachsen. Wir investieren mehr als der Wettbewerb. In beste Netze und den besten Service. Damit √ºberzeugen wir neue Kunden. Wir werden effizienter, weil wir den Vorteil unserer Gr√∂√üe nutzen. Dann folgt das Ergebnis; damit investieren wir weiter.2. Zukunft braucht Infrastruktur. Sie ist der Kern der Deutschen Telekom. Aber dieser Kern steht immer unter Druck. Darum achten wir darauf, mit unseren Netzen immer f√ºhrend zu sein.3. Zukunft braucht Sicherheit. Gerade in Zeiten, die unsicherer werden. Die Telekom hat daf√ºr eine eigene Einheit. Bei der Hauptversammlung werde ich zeigen, wie wir K√ºnstliche Intelligenz f√ºr uns selbst aber auch unsere Kundinnen und Kunden einsetzen. 5. Zukunft braucht Menschen. Die Telekom ist inklusiv. The #EU has been a beacon of political stability and peace.But what can the EU do better?The European Union's political stability and peace are fundamental prerequisites for #progress and #sustainability ‚Äì this was also the result of my recent LinkedIn survey. Now, we must pull the right strings to ensure Europe remains stable, resilient, and competitive.One area that requires our attention is fostering a #factbased worldview. In a world where misinformation and polarization are on the rise, we need to strengthen our commitment to fact-based dialogue. This is not just a matter of principle, but a necessity for democratic discourse and social unity.#Education is a key tool in our arsenal to achieve it. We need to make education more accessible and future oriented. By promoting digital literacy and natural sciences we can ensure future generations are well equipped to conquer the challenges of our time.This brings me to another important pillar: a robust industrial basis.#Industry and business account for 66% of all R&D expenditure. This significant investment makes them a pivotal force in technological innovation. Consequently, bolstering Europe's industrial base is imperative for sustaining its leading role in the global sustainability transformation, while also securing its competitive edge and resilience.I'm eager to hear your thoughts on this. What can the EU do better?

Last week, I spent several days in China, meeting customers, partners, and policymakers as well as participating in the Boao Forum for Asia annual conference. Two decades ago, what was once a small fishing village has now become the first near-zero-carbon island in China, showcasing the country's fast-paced energy transition.¬†Asia's energy demand will double by 2030, propelled by the ongoing urbanization and industrialization across the region, where fossil fuels remain a primary component of the energy mix. Numerous governments in the region have also established ambitious decarbonization targets. Together with company leaders, I could discuss the challenges ahead and the way forward to a resilient and secure energy system. The call is loud and clear here: we need cross-country, cross-sector and cross-culture cooperation more than ever before. The potential for initiating energy transition is enormous -¬†time to take action. #energytransition #china

‚ÄúNo pain, no gain.‚ÄùThat's what I have learnt in my childhood. In my professional career hard work paid off. I have learned a lot more lessons when I worked hard for the results. The success was also more satisfying.In the last couple of years, I have often read that hard work is outdated. Smart work would unlock my full potential. No doubt, working smart is truly a smart idea.But for me, the real game changer is: The synergy of hard work and smart work. There are three main reasons why this powerful combination leads to high performance:üëâEffective achievement of strategic goals: Hard work helps you set ambitious goals, and smart work helps you breaking them down to manageable tasks and setting up a structured schedule that transforms aspirations into reality.üëâHigher efficiency: Hard work provides dedication, while smart work ensures you're optimizing your efforts. üëâGreater innovative power: Hard work involves putting in the hours to master your craft. Smart work fosters innovation and adaptability to change.Apart from hard work and smart work, there are two more crucial secrets to high performance: The people you work with and the culture within the organisation. That‚Äôs why for us at Talanx Group culture is strategy! Our people living our TEC values hashtag#Transparency, hashtag#Engagement and hashtag#Collaboration based on trust help each other to grow and to outperform our peers.What are your thoughts or experiences on how to achieve high performance? I‚Äôm looking forward to your comments. hashtag#PerformanceCulturehashtag#TogetherTalanx

This year's hashtag#China Development Forum in Beijing was a great platform for exchanging ideas with other leaders from international organizations, renowned scientists from all over the word, and officials from the Chinese government. The fruitful panel discussion not only allowed me to gain interesting insights, but also to share how thyssenkrupp is shaping the hashtag#greentransformation. For us, this is irrefutable: the green transformation is not just a choice, but a necessity. Despite considerable challenges, there are immense potentials and opportunities. That‚Äôs why we've consolidated our key technologies to drive the transformation in our Decarbon Technologies segment, our hashtag#green industrial powerhouse: pioneering products and innovative services for the climate-neutral transformation of the hashtag#cement production, the construction of hashtag#windturbines, and the hashtag#electrolysis as well as the transportation of green hashtag#hydrogen with hashtag#ammonia. At the same time, we are vigorously driving technological innovation across all our businesses to meet the necessary hashtag#climate targets. For us. Our customers. And society. Equally important is a stronger cooperation along the hashtag#industrial value chain. This needs collaboration among various stakeholders ‚Äì spanning industries, scientific disciplines, and national borders. Immediately before this thrilling event, I participated in the International Business Leaders Advisory Council (hashtag#IBLAC) for the Mayor of Beijing. As newly appointed advisor to the city, I shared insights from a company‚Äôs perspective, including enhancing synchronized development in city cluster, recommendations for attracting talents, and strengthening the leadership role in the green transformation. I firmly believe that such meaningful exchanges are crucial to fostering understanding and strengthening cooperation towards a greener hashtag#future. For us. And for upcoming generations.

The fabric of our society often appears to be unravelling. Fear is fueling division, which leads to polarization, even extremism. Various factors contribute to these fears: war, political unrest, economic volatility, climate change, natural catastrophes, demographic shifts, and the unknown implications of technological advancements. All this undermines trust in institutions and is challenging people‚Äôs sense of a common purpose built on shared values. ¬†We stand at a critical crossroads, particularly in a year when elections will be held in 64 countries, representing about half of the world‚Äôs population. This disconnect creates a dangerous environment for those leaders who thrive on easy promises and ‚Äòus versus them‚Äô divisions.¬†At Allianz, we understand that we have a leading role to play in these challenging times ‚Äì as an economic ‚Äòshock absorber‚Äô and ‚Äòsocial stabilizer‚Äô, but also as a bridge builder. Our employee-led network, GRACE (Global Race and Cultural Ethnicity Network), reflects our commitment to creating an inclusive and discrimination-free workplace. It offers a platform for sharing insights and fostering a workplace where diversity is celebrated and everyone is welcome, regardless of cultural ethnicity, nationality, gender, or age. We take pride in our diverse workforce, which includes individuals from 176 nationalities, with 5 nationalities represented on our SE Board.¬†Nevertheless, advancing inclusivity isn‚Äôt something we can tackle alone; it requires collaboration across all sectors of society. Collaboration among the public and private sectors, civil society, and all generations. This joint effort is crucial for championing diversity and inclusion while fighting against racism. The International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination serves as an important reminder of our commitment to this cause. Every day, individuals face racist remarks, attitudes, and prejudices. We must stand up against racism every single day of the year, denying its presence in society ‚Äì addressing not only in obvious situations but also instances of conscious or unconscious bias that lead to racist behavior.¬†We believe that rooting discrimination and extremism is not just a moral obligation but also a business imperative. Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion aren‚Äôt just superficial checkboxes; they are deeply embedded into our ethos and business strategy. DEI serves as the driving engine behind employee engagement, customer satisfaction, and stakeholder confidence. Trust guides our actions, inclusion shapes our principles. By effectively mitigating risk, Allianz doesn‚Äôt just help people navigate uncertainty; we empower them to thrive in it. Through our business initiatives, we have the opportunity to strengthen our social fabric by supporting individuals and communities in building a brighter, shared future.¬†Together, we must stand up against polarization and overcome the fears standing in the way of progress toward free and open societies.

Energy remains the lifeblood of national economies, and massive financing is required to drive the energy transition. That is why it was important to me to participate in the discussion here at CERAWeek on how we can fund the energy transition. It is not only about transforming an existing energy infrastructure but also about satisfying the growth of electricity consumption seen in many regions of the world, driven by new demands.Investments will need a business case, meaning business models and financial instruments must evolve to allow massive deployment of private capital. More funds must also be channeled towards clean technologies. Funding all the necessary energy projects across industries will, therefore, require a shift in mindset. And that is also what many discussions with industry experts, partners, and political representatives have been about here this week in Houston. #CERAWeek #energytransition #sustainablefinance

We have the map, and we have the keys. Now is the time to unlock the doors and set free the enormous value that wind energy holds for Europe.  This week hashtag#WindEurope2024 is bringing more than 12,000 wind aficionados to Bilbao: from manufacturers like Siemens Gamesa to our customers and suppliers; from policymakers to investors and senior leaders from all walks of wind-energy life.  The good news for 2024: We have a map to get to our goals ‚Äì the hashtag#EuropeanWindPowerActionPlan, the hashtag#NetZeroIndustryAct, and unprecedented pledges to promote wind energy, including the Spanish Wind Energy Charter, which was signed today at WindEurope.  Our success now hinges on the details and their well-coordinated, accelerated implementation across Europe. ‚ÄúUnlocking the value of wind,‚Äù our theme in today‚Äôs panel discussion, addressed exactly that: volume visibility; faster permitting; pre-qualification criteria in auctions; instruments to fund clean technologies; mechanisms to adjust for inflation; grid expansion; and more.  Thank you to WindEurope, my fellow event ambassadors, and hashtag#TeamPurple for organizing this indispensable, first-class annual event.  Siemens Energyhashtag#RenewableEnergy hashtag#MoreWindNow

Plastics Europe published an update of their Circular Economy for #Plastics Report. 5 findings that have caught my eye and that I would like to highlight: 1. For the first time, more post-consumer plastic waste is being recycled (26.9%) than put in landfill (23.5%)2. Post-consumer recycled content in new products increased by 70% since 2018 while the proportion of plastics from bio-based feedstock in converted plastics remains low (0.9%)3. The demand for recycled plastics content can be increased through appropriate policy measures and investments in e.g., different recycling technologies4. The growing competitiveness gap between Europe and the rest of the world could hinder the region's ability to invest in and lead on circularity initiatives as Europe may become increasingly dependent on imports which do not necessarily meet EU sustainability standards5. A circular economy for plastics can only be achieved through close collaboration between all actors within the European polymer value chain, including policymakers and regulators (this one is not new but cannot be emphasized often enough) So, we're seeing continuous progress towards a #CircularEconomy for plastics in Europe, but we need all hands on deck to accelerate this transition.  Industry, politics, and society must continue to chip in and make their contribution within their respective area.

Dauerflaute in Deutschlands drittgr√∂√üter Branche. Der anhaltende Auftragsmangel gepaart mit hohen Produktionskosten belastete die chemisch-pharmazeutische Industrie auch 2023 geh√∂rig. (VCI) heute in seinem Abschlussbericht f√ºr 2023. Aus dem erhofften Sprint aus der Talfahrt wird ein kr√§ftezehrender Marathon.¬†Unser Land braucht aber eine starke #Chemie. Die ihrer Rolle als Pfeiler von Wertsch√∂pfung und Wachstum und Motor der Transformation in eine nachhaltige Zukunft weiterhin gerecht werden kann. Daf√ºr brauchen wir eine starke Kommission und ein starkes Parlament. Bei der Europawahl im Juni haben alle B√ºrgerinnen und B√ºrger es in der Hand, daf√ºr zu sorgen.

This week, I spent a few days with our Team Purple, government officials, and our customers in Dammam and Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. In line with the country's ambitious Vision 2030 goals, it is transforming fast in various sectors, particularly in the energy field. Aside from being a crucial player in the oil and gas market, it plans to generate 50 percent of its electricity from renewables by 2030 and shift toward cleaner gas-burning for its energy production. A transition we are supporting through multiple projects, including solar PV, improving the electrical grid's structure, and developing highly efficient gas turbine technologies that could later be used for hydrogen.In 2016, our Dammam factory produced the first-ever made-in-Saudi Arabia gas turbine. This facility has since undergone an incredible transformation, continuously expanding its portfolio and becoming our manufacturing hub in the region. Here, we are servicing the entire energy value chain under one roof and training young Saudis to co-develop resilient energy technologies for the future in collaboration with our customers. A vital step towards ensuring a resilient energy supply, which forms the foundation of all social development and, in turn, progress and prosperity for all.Thank you to the entire team who joined us in person and virtually. It was a pleasure to spend time together with you during the holy month of Ramadan. To all our colleagues, customers, and partners celebrating: Ramadan Kareem.Maria Ferraro Karim Amin Dietmar Siersdorfer Mahmoud Sulaimani Aymen Alkuraihi#energytransition #innovation #energyresilience

Many years ago, when colleagues asked me about my opinion on a subject, I‚Äôve felt the urge to contribute it. As a result, I primed the discussion with my input and not all valuable perspectives were put on the table. Because I‚Äôm genuinely curious about people and I truly value their opinions, I have learned to practice active listening and to ask the right questions. This is how decisions can be made based on transparent facts. In today's VUCA world, success is not solely determined by a star in the team but by a star team. Active listening leads to effective communication, collaboration and trustful relationships in teams. This is the cornerstone for high performance.Here is how I practice active listening:üëâI give my full attention to the speaker. I don‚Äôt look at my phone or think about what I‚Äôm going to say next.üëâ I show that I am listening via nonverbal cues.üëâI provide feedback by paraphrasing or summarizing what the speaker has said to ensure a mutual understanding. üëâI ask questions to encourage the speaker to elaborate further.üëâI avoid judgements. I don‚Äôt interrupt the speaker with counterarguments. üëâI respond in an open and honest way and assert my opinions respectfully. Practicing active listening is one key to the success of high-performance teams. What experiences or insights do you have about active listening? I look forward to your comments. hashtag#TogetherTalanxhashtag#PerformanceCulturehashtag#Collaborationhashtag#Trust

Gewerkschaften und Arbeitgeber ‚Äì eine komplexe Beziehung, die nicht immer von Harmonie gepr√§gt ist.¬†Im Fall der Industriegewerkschaft IGBCE und Covestro verfolgen wir jedoch ein gro√ües gemeinsames Ziel: Den Erhalt unseres Industriestandorts und das Erm√∂glichen einer guten, nachhaltigen Zukunft.¬†Um es zu erreichen, ist eine offene und l√∂sungsorientierte Debattenkultur von zentraler Bedeutung. Mit Michael Vassiliadis und der IGBCE haben wir einen kritischen Partner, der aber stets f√ºr sachliche Argumente zug√§nglich bleibt.¬†Eine solche Debattenkultur f√∂rdert nicht nur Kreativit√§t und damit Innovationen, sondern st√§rkt das Vertrauen und die Zusammenarbeit. Indem wir unterschiedliche Perspektiven einbringen und zulassen, k√∂nnen wir fundiertere Entscheidungen treffen. Und f√ºr alle Beteiligten ‚Äì Mitarbeitende, Unternehmen und letztlich den gesamten Industriestandort ‚Äì das bestm√∂gliche Ergebnis erzielen.¬†In diesem Zusammenhang m√∂chte ich die Gelegenheit nutzen und Michael Vassiliadis ganz herzlich zu seinem 60. Geburtstag gratulieren. Michael, Dein Engagement und Dein Beitrag sind unverzichtbar¬†f√ºr den Erhalt eines starken Industriestandorts. Alle guten W√ºnsche und weiterhin viel Energie und Erfolg!

Our 2023 Sustainability and our annual report have been published and I take particular pride in this year‚Äôs reporting cycle. This is because we have included major elements of the future Corporate Sustainability Directive (CSRD) reporting into this year‚Äôs Annual Report -- one year ahead of time. Our report is also supplemented by an easy-to-read summary.¬†Sustainability is core to our company and our business model. Allianz was formed 134 years ago on the premise of sustainability - to manage risk for customers, employees, communities, and society, to enable their resilience and long-term growth, and in turn, the long-term growth of our business. ¬†One particularly challenging global risk that overshadowed our customers lives and businesses in 2023 was inflation. We responded quickly by focusing on providing the highest value to our customers and partners, enabling their resiliency through this period of rising costs of living and operating. At the same time, as highlighted in our annual report, we navigated our business and managed our capital position effectively, to ensure exceptional performance for all our stakeholders. ¬†Likewise, the actions outlined in our sustainability reporting demonstrate our ability to work on even the most daunting global challenges, particularly the environment. Climate change‚Äôs impact on individuals and businesses is profound: it threatens people‚Äôs incomes, homes, and health. It puts companies‚Äô physical assets and business continuity at risk. A highlight of our work is the net-zero transition plan, published in 2023. The plan details our long-term strategic climate commitment to achieve net-zero emissions in insurance, proprietary investments and own operations and outlines intermediate targets by 2030. The plan is based on science and in line with the Paris Agreement to limit global warming to 1.5¬∞C. ¬†A big thank you to all involved in developing these two reports, as well as to our employees and partners for their daily contributions towards shaping a more stable, resilient and sustainable world ‚Äì for our customers and for society as a whole. ¬†Learn more here: https://lnkd.in/dQX-E4gN #Sustainability #NetZero #ClimateAction #ClimateChange #AllianzOnClimate #Allianz

Europe stands at a point of no return in our energy transition and our pathway to become energy secure. Massive sums of investments are needed whilst our competitiveness faces challenges from abroad that we must rise to meet. The premise is a simple geological reality: we do not sit on abundant energy reserves as other geographies do. I was pleased to discuss these issues with Commissioner @Vestager Wednesday in Brussels, alongside my fellow @Eurelectric Presidency team @MarkusRauramo and @GiorgiosStassis.The financeability of homegrown electricity is crucial. We must unlock the means to deliver the necessary investments in our transition by putting today‚Äôs idle capital to work. Completing the Capital Market Union is a must to provide new and wider choices of funding at lower costs. We also need to adopt the right de-risking tools, such as Capacity Markets that are open to all technologies that can make power supply more reliable.This can all work within the framework of the internal electricity market and with the right sized electricity infrastructure. Deepening the unity, efficiency and interconnectedness between EU countries should remain a top priority. ¬†This also means the 25% bureaucracy reduction target is not aspirational, it‚Äôs a necessity. So, now before elections, it‚Äôs a good time to call on the next legislature to reflect about its raison d‚Äô√™tre. In my view, this means not least to produce less bureaucracy and streamline more the regulation if we want Europe to remain ‚Äúthe place to be‚Äù for business.

Today is International Women's Day. A day where I wanted to take the opportunity to highlight an issue very important to me through two stories from our Team Purple at Siemens Energy. The first comes from Sophie Ash who takes care of the operations of one of our offshore wind projects in North Wales. She faced a problem many women face in the industry, namely that when she started, there was no immersion suit small enough to fit her ‚Äì a suit that is required in emergencies for our colleagues who work out on tumultuous seas. This comes down to the fact that a lot of Personal Protective Equipment ‚Äì or PPE for short ‚Äì is modeled on the standard male height and size and simply does not fit where it needs to for many women. Subsequently, Sophie became the driving force behind the creation of a working group that looked into bringing more diversity into our industry and ensuring that irrespective of gender, shape, or size, every employee has access to the correct PPE that will keep them safe at work. The second story comes from Taiana Rodrigues in Brazil. She found that the welding bench she was using was uncomfortably high and therefore impacting her work. This observation sparked a collaborative effort, leading to an adjustable welding device every employee can set to match their height. See the short clip below. These stories ‚Äì just two of many ‚Äì showcase that no matter if we are talking about industrial tools, machinery, or PPE, one size does not fit all. Creating awareness for inclusive PPE also creates awareness of the need for more women in the energy industry. As we simply cannot afford to lose anyone, regardless of gender, who can help bring about the energy transition. There is still a lot that needs to happen, but it starts with people like Sophie and Taiana, who challenge the status quo and pave the way for more inclusivity and diversity in our workplace.#IWD2024 #diversity #inclusion

When we gender-stereotype jobs, we risk health and safety. Sophie Ash and Matt Scaum, colleagues of mine at Siemens Gamesa, have addressed this issue head-on.  While completing an offshore training, Sophie discovered that personal protective equipment (PPE) is generally only available in larger sizes. Sizes that would typically be suitable for men. When looking at the photo of Sophie standing alongside our colleague Gareth Brandrick, it‚Äôs clear that PPE is not a one size fits all. Determined to address the lack of suitable PPE, especially for women, Sophie approached Matt, her procurement colleague. And together they raised the issue with our PPE providers. As a result of their initiative, a dozen of providers committed to inclusivity. In addition, we‚Äôve amended our contracts to ensure that at least two of the smallest and largest sizes of PPE will be available at trainings. These are important steps in the right direction. And we are grateful for Sophie‚Äôs and Matt‚Äôs valuable contributions to inclusivity and gender equity.  This hashtag#IWD2024 is a reminder that we should not lose sight of the long way that‚Äôs still ahead of us to make gender equity become reality.hashtag#IWD hashtag#InternationalWomensDay

International Women‚Äôs Day is coming up and it is an opportunity to celebrate the remarkable contributions of women to our communities, economies, and societies. But it represents more than just a date on the calendar or a trending hashtag. It‚Äôs a call to action that reminds us to consider the importance, and the benefits, of gender balance and equality every day of the year. Although we‚Äôve seen great progress, persistent challenges faced by women worldwide require our ongoing attention. ¬†An upcoming Allianz research report will aim to shine a light on these issues. This comprehensive study will cover 37 countries and examine the well-being of women across various areas such as life and health, education and skills, labor and financial inclusion, participation in decision-making, and retirement security. While women have made significant progress in education and political representation, there is more opportunity for progressing in achieving equal pay for equal work, safeguarding health, and promoting female labor participation.  The soon-to-be released study also highlights a decrease in governance-related official development assistance (ODA) that has historically served as a crucial lifeline for women‚Äôs rights organizations and movements. Financial backing for such initiatives ensures sustained progress towards helping women, and all people, reach their full potential. Allianz has a long history of championing the leadership of women in our company, not only globally, but around the world. Nearly 100 years ago, we were the first company in Colombia to hire a female employee. Today, more than 50% of our employees are women, over 40% of our Board of Management of Allianz SE are women, and 30% of our operating profit is under the leadership of women. And women everywhere who are working to make the future better for others have 100% of our support. ¬†#IWD #IWD2024¬†#Allianz

No, we can't do it alone. That‚Äôs true for most areas of life. And it‚Äôs definitely true for the energy transition, for the expansion of renewables, the rapid buildout of wind turbines across Europe. I talked about that today at the M√ºnchner Management Kolloquium, Germany‚Äôs largest business congress. Unprecedented installation targets, a steep increase in raw material prices, and a wind industry that is both adjusting its own operations while advocating a level playing field that makes for a sustainable business model ‚Äì it‚Äôs this multitude of simultaneous challenges that calls for the deepening of strategic partnerships and the creation of resilient ecosystems.  We at Siemens Gamesa are dedicated to building a system, in which our customers and suppliers, investors, policymakers, the people of hashtag#TeamPurple, and society at large pull in the same direction: toward clean energy for generations to come.  A big thank you to the organizers of the hashtag#MMK24. Looking forward to returning in 2025. hashtag#MoreWindNow hashtag#Partnerships hashtag#WindEnergy

Nur mit Optimismus und Zuversichtlichkeit gewinnen wir die Zukunft. Gut zu erfahren, dass es Pl√§tze gibt, an denen diese Haltungen eine B√ºhne bekommen: Herzlichen Dank Prof. Dr. Dr. h. c. mult. Horst Wildemann und Team f√ºr die Einladung zum M√ºnchner Management Kolloquium an der Technical University of Munich! A recent study by the German Chamber of Commerce & Industry showed that the number of enterprises in Germany that use or plan to use #AI or machine learning in their organization rose by 24% in 2023 compared with 2022. A similar¬†study from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce published last year found that small businesses using AI have a 12-point increase over non-AI users in their likelihood to see an increase in profit.The potential of AI for businesses is enormous and it‚Äôs exciting to see the impact it‚Äôs having on enterprises of all sizes and across all industries. #Productivity gains are an obvious win ‚Äì with AI tools helping employees learn new skills, complete tasks in seconds as opposed to hours, and focus on human interactions rather than administrative tasks. AI can also help companies build more robust and transparent supply chains through, for example, improved demand forecasting, risk assessment and mitigation, as well as optimal routing. By using AI embedded within their planning processes, businesses can accelerate forecasting in operational and demand planning significantly, freeing planners from time-consuming, repetitive tasks.¬†But one area I am particularly excited to see benefit from AI is #sustainability. Energy optimization, smart resource management, and sustainable manufacturing are all great examples of how AI capabilities are changing the way businesses run to become more sustainable. ¬†Knowing its enormous potential to make a difference, it‚Äôs more critical than ever for organizations to make sure their people and their businesses are equipped to take advantage of this technology.

Moderne Aktienkultur¬†Wir sch√§tzen das Feedback unserer Anlegerinnen und Anleger! Darum gehen wir gerne in den Austausch Wir nehmen die Sichtweise anderer ernst; nutzen aber auch gern die Gelegenheit, unsere Strategie zu erl√§utern und auch unsere Sichtweise als Unternehmen darzulegen. In Zeiten der Informationsflut lohnt sich eine solche ‚Äûradikale Transparenz‚Äú. Denn dort, wo ohnehin fast alles offen liegt, lohnt es zu erkl√§ren und einzuordnen und aus vielen Teilinformationen das Gro√üe Ganze herauszuarbeiten. Dazu braucht es eine moderne Aktienkultur. Das gilt f√ºr institutionelle Anleger, aber es gilt auch f√ºr Privatanlegerinnen und -anleger. Diese sind aus meiner Sicht viel zu sehr aus dem Fokus der Unternehmen getreten. Und es ist wohl gerade auch die Verantwortungen der Telekom nach den Erfahrungen mit der "Volksaktie" und dem Absturz des "neuen Marktes", aus Fehlern zu lernen und mit Transparenz f√ºr Vertrauen zu werben.¬†Was geh√∂rt dazu? F√ºr mich zum Beispiel, dass wir unsere Hauptversammlung in Pr√§senz abhalten. Der Dialog mit den Aktion√§rinnen und Aktion√§ren wird dadurch im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes lebendiger. Es geh√∂rt aber auch dazu, dass wir neben klassischen Formaten wie Pressekonferenzen oder Investorencalls soziale Medien f√ºr die Kapitalmarktkommunikation nutzen. Ungefiltert und direkt. Wie sehr sich das lohnt, habe ich gestern in einem Webcast mit unseren Privatanlegern festgestellt. 1,5 Stunden lang habe ich dort mit Christoph Greitemann √ºber unsere Strategie und Vision gesprochen und Fragen beantwortet. Wie sagte einer der Teilnehmer im Anschluss so sch√∂n: ‚ÄûDie Telekom ist fassbar.‚Äú Ich finde das gut, denn Wegducken gilt nicht. ¬†Ein weiterer wichtiger Punkt: Soziale Medien sind tats√§chlich Medien. Sondern es gibt im Internet viele Expertinnen und Experten, die in Blogs und Videos √ºber Aktien und Finanzanlagen sprechen, kritische Fragen stellen, Analysen bieten und damit ein Publikum erreichen, das sich bislang weniger oder gar nicht f√ºr diese Themen interessiert hat. Did you know the biggest lever to reduce greenhouse gas emissions in the chemical industry lies NOT in the manufacturing process? Instead, the raw materials we use, particularly fossil fuels like crude oil, have the most substantial impact.¬†These so-called #Scope3_emissions present us with complex challenges ‚Äì from the definition of realistic reduction targets to the detailed planning and implementation of specific measures. The complexity stems from the inherent uncertainties and inter dependencies, which necessitate numerous assumptions: What will recycling rates look like in the future? What quantity of bio-based raw materials will be available at what time?¬†To effectively reduce Scope 3 emissions, we need a clear vision, commitment, and a willingness to rethink existing processes across the entire value chain. This endeavor demands close cooperation with our suppliers and customers, as our ultimate goal is to make the entire value chain more sustainable.¬†At Covestro, we understand that achieving climate targets is not a brief excursion. It's a journey that requires constant adjustments to our planning and presents us with challenges that allow us to grow. Through innovation, collaboration, and the courage to break new ground, we are making our contribution to reducing global greenhouse gas emissions.¬†A holistic overview of Covestro's climate targets:¬†https://lnkd.in/e6NDSid6

Transitioning through challenge. That was the title of my discussion with Mark Dooley at yesterday‚Äôs Green Energy Conference of the Macquarie Group in London. How to transition through challenge is particularly fitting for the times we‚Äôre in. The global push for clean energy is clear. Countries are raising their wind energy targets to meet ambitious climate goals. Yet, there‚Äôs still a lot we have to do for a future energy system that is both secure and sustainable.  Stable supply chains play a key role in getting there. At Siemens Gamesa we‚Äôre reducing reliance on single markets through multiple-supplier sourcing and by encouraging our suppliers to improve their own resilience. This approach mitigates supply chain challenges arising from interdependencies, especially in the face of geopolitical uncertainties.  The wind industry must strike the balance between global supply chains and developing local capacities. Governments can support these efforts by entering into commodity partnerships and trade agreements, particularly with respect to raw materials.  hashtag#GEC hashtag#GEC24 hashtag#GreenEnergyConference hashtag#MoreWindNow hashtag#SupplyChain

I was live on CNBC this morning to speak about the development of Covestro's business in a still weak economy and the untapped potential of the EU. My key takeaways:¬†The automotive industry, especially the Electric Vehicle (EV) business, was our silver lining in 2023 and will continue to play an important role in 2024 with its demand for our material solutions. We are also seeing a stabilization in the furniture and the electronics market while the construction market remains weak.¬†Lack of predictability and instead overregulation and restriction by German and EU politics are hindering both Germany and the EU to unfold their potential and succeed with their #green transformation. We have great ambitions and the EU can be a global superpower if the politics finally set the right levers in motion ‚Äì these include e.g. tax reductions and faster approval processes.¬†Thanks Karen and Steve for having me on the show!¬†#CovestroResults

Is generative AI creating a tipping point for your industry?I believe, yes. For every industry. For our customers, it offers enormous potential for productivity gains and new business models without requiring specialized skills. For us at Siemens, it creates new growth opportunities because we know how to apply it. With more than 1,500 AI experts and decades of experience, we are now, together with our customers and partners, bringing this technology to factories, power grids, hospitals, and trains on a large scale.For example, we are using Siemens Industrial Copilot, created in collaboration with Microsoft, to drive efficiency for our customers. We are making GenAI available to everyone, whether they are programmers or not, through a collaboration between Mendix and AWS. Thanks to my colleagues Jan Patt, Armin Hadzalic, Jethro Borsje, Sylvia Endres, Mark Buckley ‚Äì #TeamSiemens - and Matt Wood from AWS, for a rich conversation last week about how AI is transforming our markets and our company.¬†#GenAI #ThrowbackThursday¬†#Townhall #AI #CopilotsMatt Wood Jethro Borsje Sylvia Endres, PhD Mark Buckley Jan-Patrik Patt Armin Hadzalic Thomas Luister

It is a shame that the terrible war in Ukraine has been going on for two years now. The effects of the Russian war of aggression are devastating. According to the World Bank, the direct damage caused by the war in Ukraine amounts to $ 150 billion. The destruction of buildings and transport infrastructure is gigantic. It is estimated that 10% of all flats and houses are affected, 8,400 km of roads and motorways and 300 bridges were destroyed or damaged. The estimated reconstruction costs are estimated around $ 500 billion, of which $ 50 billion is for the energy infrastructure alone. These figures give a feeling of the terrible extent of the destruction and the enormous capital requirements after the war. At the end, figures have no faces. Behind all numbers are human beeings who suffer for two years now. I have the utmost respect for the great will of the Ukrainian people to fight for their freedom and independence even at a huge personal sacrifice. An inspiration for Europe and a reminder that others need to fight for things we take for granted!

Ein neuer Deal f√ºr Europa¬†Europa braucht eine starke Infrastruktur. Daf√ºr investieren wir. Wir zielen auf Klimaneutralit√§t. Und wir kooperieren; auch bei Innovationen. Aber: Die Telekommunikationsunternehmen stehen unter Druck. Viele kleinere Betreiber sind nicht einmal in der Lage, ihre Kapitalkosten zu erwirtschaften. Die Telekom hat dabei eine Ausnahmestellung in Europa. Denn wir stehen auf zwei Beinen. In Europa und in den USA.¬†Auf der #MWC2024 haben sich darum die gro√üen europ√§ischen Telkos auf einem Panel zusammengetan. Gemeinsam mit Margherita Della Valle von der Vodafone Group, Christel Heydemann von Orange und Jos√© Mar√≠a √Ålvarez-Pallete von Telef√≥nica schlagen wir einen "New Deal" f√ºr Europa vor. Es geht nicht um ein einzelnes Unternehmen. Sondern um die Rahmenbedingungen der gesamten Branche.¬†Hier ist unser gemeinsamer Vorschlag dazu, was die EU jetzt tun sollte:¬†1. Schaffung eines echten digitalen Binnenmarktes Europa. Dazu z√§hlt auch eine Reform des Kartellrechts. Gr√∂√üe muss m√∂glich sein, denn wir brauchen sie. Das gilt ausdr√ºcklich auch f√ºr andere Branchen. Wir m√ºssen aufpassen, dass Europa sich nicht selbst ‚Äûverzwergt‚Äú. 2. Das bedeutet: Marktkonsolidierung. In der EU gibt es mehrere Dutzend Anbieter. In Asien oder Nordamerika jeweils nur drei oder vier f√ºr hunderte Millionen Menschen. Kein Wunder, dass dort die Investitionen pro Kopf auch h√∂her sind. Wir leben in einer √ñkonomie der Plattformen. Und hier geht es um eins: Skaleneffekte. Und von denen profitieren am Ende die Kundinnen und Kunden.3. Fair Share: Wenige Unternehmen produzieren 50 Prozent des gesamten Datenverkehrs und er steigt j√§hrlich um 30 Prozent und mehr. Es gibt keinen √∂konomischen Anreiz, diesen Verkehr zu reduzieren oder zu optimieren. Das ist nicht verbraucherfreundlich. Zumal es keine faire Beteiligung an den Investitionen in Infrastruktur gibt, √ºber die diese Daten laufen.4. Reform der Frequenzpolitik: L√§ngere Laufzeiten f√ºr Mobilfunkfrequenzen und weniger Versteigerungen k√∂nnen Stabilit√§t f√ºr Investitionen und Innovation schaffen.5. Anerkennung von Kommunikationsnetzen in der EU-Taxonomie: Der Telekommunikationssektor spielt eine entscheidende Rolle bei der Erm√∂glichung von Emissionssenkungen und sollte entsprechend anerkannt werden.6. KI ist gekommen, um zu bleiben: Europa darf bei der Entwicklung und Anwendung von KI nicht ins Hintertreffen geraten und muss sein industrielles Know-how als Wettbewerbsvorteil nutzen. Regulierung ist wichtig. Aber bitte nicht das Kind mit dem Bade aussch√ºtten.¬†Kurz und gut: Wir brauchen einen New Deal in Europa mit weniger Regulierung und gleichen Wettbewerbsbedingungen im √ñkosystem. #wewontstop#MWC2024 #MWC24 #Infrastruktur #5G #FTTH

A new deal for Europe¬†Europe needs strong infrastructure. As telcos, we are ready to commit our part. We invest. We strive for net-zero emissions. We cooperate, also in innovation. But: Telcos are under pressure. Many smaller operators are not even able to earn back their capital costs. Telekom has a special position in Europe. Because we stand on two legs. Europe and the USA.¬†At #MWC2024 together with Margherita Della Valle from Vodafone Group, Christel Heydemann from Orange, and Jos√© Mar√≠a √Ålvarez-Pallete from Telef√≥nica we suggested a ‚Äúnew deal‚Äù for the best digital infrastructure. ¬†Here's our joined take on what the EU should do now:¬†1. Building a real single market for telcos in Europe: Removing national barriers and promoting cross-border. But to truly scale up, we need an EU competition policy reform for greater competitiveness & resilience, also beyond the telco sector.2. Allowing for more scale through in-market consolidation: With over dozens of operators in the EU, we need to rethink merger regulations to strengthen competition while allowing for network improvements and consumer benefits.3. Deregulating the sector: Time to adapt regulations to reflect new market realities, while fostering competitiveness without sacrificing innovation.4. Fairness in the connectivity ecosystem: Reaching a level-playing field between telcos and large content providers is essential for sustainable growth and investment in infrastructure. Same rules need to apply to same services.5. Reforming spectrum policy: Longer license periods and fewer auctions can provide stability for investment and innovation.6. Recognizing communication networks in the EU Taxonomy: The telco sector plays a crucial role in enabling emission reductions and should be acknowledged accordingly.7. Embracing the AI revolution: Europe must not fall behind in AI development and application, leveraging its industrial expertise for competitive advantage.¬†In a nutshell: We need a new deal in Europe with less regulation and a level playing field in the ecosystem.#MWC2024 #MWC24 #Infrastructure #5G #FTTH

Amidst the blocked roads and parked tractors as farmers descended to Brussels in protest once again, I participated yesterday in another interesting and timely Clean Transition Dialogue with Executive Vice President Maro≈° ≈†efƒçoviƒç - this time on Green Deal Infrastructure.¬†I was pleased to hear the EVP‚Äôs announcement to create an Alliance of grid operators earlier this year: industry and politicians must work together in this common endeavour and place grids right at the top of the agenda. Without the proper infrastructure in place, especially for electricity grids where the growth is unprecedented, there will be no transition.¬†So how do we get there? There are certainly changes needed to Europe‚Äôs regulatory environment to unleash the capital we require for the expansion of grids. Eurelectric has estimated that up to ‚Ç¨65 billion a year needs to be invested in distribution grids until 2050 ‚Äì an increase of 84% from today‚Äôs levels. Trying political and social times like today are a stark reminder we must ensure the transition is well managed, including a development of the power system that takes a look at system costs. ¬†We have called for an EU Power Infrastructure Deal, creating regulatory simplicity and carving in capital. Such a deal should legislate for anticipatory investments, set clear mandates for NRA‚Äôs and give an explicit political signal that grids are in the spotlight to encourage investment. The Grid Action Plan was a welcome step in that direction, now let‚Äôs move to the next stage and really drive the change.¬†I thank EVP Sefcovic for this first dialogue dedicated to energy infrastructure and look forward to what we can achieve if we keep the work going!

üöÄ AI ist gekommen, um zu bleiben: muchos saludos vom Mobile World Congress in Barcelona! ü§ñK√ºnstliche Intelligenz ver√§ndert uns und Unternehmen. Bei der Deutschen Telekom nutzen wir bereits KI. Dar√ºber habe ich auch in meiner Keynote gesprochen. Anbei einige Punkte daraus:ü§ñ KI ist nicht unfehlbar; sie kann sogar ‚Äûhalluzinieren‚Äú. Deshalb m√ºssen wir uns diese Technologie zu eigen machen und dabei gleichzeitig ihre Grenzen verstehen.ü§ñ Die Deutsche Telekom ist voll dabei: Wir haben √ºber 400 KI-Projekte, um die Produktivit√§t, die Energieeffizienz, die Netzstabilit√§t und die Servicequalit√§t zu verbessern. Wir legen Wert auf Datenqualit√§t, Datenschutz und ethische Governance, um unserer Verantwortung gerecht zu werden und Vertrauen zu schaffen.Ich habe auch unseren Prototyp des KI-T-Phones vorgestellt. Es ist ein erster Schritt in die "Post-App-√Ñra". Mehr dar√ºber k√∂nnen Sie an unserem Stand in Barcelona erfahren. #AI #FutureTech #DigitaleTransformation #MWC2024 #MWC24

üöÄ AI has come to stay: Insights from Mobile World Congress! ü§ñ¬†At this year's Mobile World Congress in Barcelona, I had the opportunity to delve into the transformative potential of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and its implications for our future at Deutsche Telekom. Here's a brief recap of my keynote:¬†ü§ñ Understanding AI's Imperfections: AI isn't infallible; it can make mistakes and even hallucinate. However, the quality of its responses improves with better training. We must embrace this technology's capabilities while understanding its limitations.¬†ü§ñ Deutsche Telekom is all on it. We have embarked on over 400 AI projects aimed at enhancing productivity, energy efficiency, network stability, and service quality. From predictive maintenance to personalized customer interactions, AI is reshaping our operations. For that, we have established an internal AI Competence Center which supports all departments e.g. when it comes to licences, IT development, consulting... ¬†ü§ñ The Role of Leadership: AI is something the CEO has to drive.   It's essential to own the vision, make strategic decisions on AI adoption, and prioritize ethics, security, and talent development.¬†ü§ñ Multi-Layered AI Strategy: We're adopting a multi-LLM (Large Language Models) strategy, encompassing taker, shaper, maker, and facilitator roles, depending on specific business needs. This approach ensures that AI becomes a competitive differentiator for us. At the MWC we signed the ‚ÄúGlobal Telco Alliance‚Äù. Together with SK Telecom and other partners we will develop a Telco specific LLM which understands our industry and ‚Äúspeaks our language‚Äù. ¬†ü§ñ Empowering Talent: Upskilling our workforce for AI readiness is paramount. We're investing in training programs and fostering a culture of innovation to empower our team members to leverage AI effectively.¬†ü§ñ Data Sovereignty and Governance: Centralizing and mastering our data is crucial for AI success. We prioritize data quality, privacy, and ethical governance to ensure accountability and trustworthiness.¬†ü§ñ As we navigate the AI-driven future, let's remain committed to harnessing this technology responsibly and ethically, driving positive change for our customers, employees, and society as a whole. Together, we'll continue to lead the way in shaping the future of telecommunications with AI.I also introduced our prototype of the AI T-Phone which is one small step into the "post-app-era". You can find out more about it at our booth in Barcelona. #AI #FutureTech #DigitalTransformation #MWC2024 #MWC24

Das Bundesministerium f√ºr Wirtschaft und Klimaschutz zeigt sich pragmatisch und legt Eckpunkte einer Carbon Management Strategie vor ‚Äì ein wichtiges Signal an die energieintensiven Industrien, auf das ein klarer Action Plan folgen muss.¬†Mit der Vorlage der Eckpunkte erkennt Robert Habeck an, dass #CCU und #CCS essenziell f√ºr die Erreichung unserer Klimaziele und den Erhalt unserer Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit sind ‚Äì denn viele andere Industriel√§nder setzen bereits auf die Technologie. Dabei ist klar: Die Vermeidung von CO2 Emissionen, Energieeffizienzverbesserungen und der Ausbau der Erneuerbaren m√ºssen weiter an oberster Stelle stehen. Wo diese Hebel nicht greifen, m√ºssen wir durch den gezielten Einsatz von CCU und CCS eine Emissionsminderung erwirken k√∂nnen.¬†Ich begr√º√üe diesen pragmatischen Schritt des BMWK. Den Pragmatismus m√ºssen wir bei der weiteren Ausgestaltung und Umsetzung der Carbon Management Strategie beibehalten.¬†¬†Denn die Kernfragen sind noch offen, so z.B.: Welche Investitionsmittel stehen welchen Bereichen zu welchem Zeitpunkt zur Verf√ºgung? Das sollte f√ºr das n√§chste Jahrzehnt festgelegt sein, um Planbarkeit f√ºr Unternehmen zu schaffen. Au√üerdem muss die F√∂rderung f√ºr CCS auch f√ºr Kraftwerke f√ºr industrielle Prozessw√§rme ‚Äì wie hocheffiziente KWK-Anlagen ‚Äì gelten, ansonsten k√∂nnten viele wichtige Industrieprozesse durchs Raster fallen.¬†Insgesamt mangelt es an einigen Stellen an konkreten Ausgestaltungen. Wie die aussehen k√∂nnen, werden wir in den n√§chsten Wochen von Seiten der Industrie an die Politik herantragen.¬†Letztlich gilt wie immer: Es ist die Umsetzung, die z√§hlt.¬†Und daf√ºr brauchen wir den Schulterschluss mit der #EU. Wir brauchen schnelle und praxistaugliche L√∂sungen und einen Fokus auf die Kernfragen. Transformation funktioniert nur als Business Case ‚Äì √ºber Wahlen und Legislaturperioden hinaus.

Gestern war ich gemeinsam mit Kerstin Andreae, Andreas Jung und Simon Gabriel M√ºller bei den 167. Energiegespr√§chen am Reichstag und habe deutlich adressiert, dass die Kraftwerkstrategie nur der erste Schritt sein kann. Gefragt ist jetzt, m√∂glichst schnell einen m√∂glichst liquiden Kapazit√§tsmarkt zu entwickeln. Dieser sollte nicht nur gesicherte Leistung anreizen, sondern auch Flexibilit√§ten wie Speicher und Lastverschiebung. E.ON wird sich hier konstruktiv einbringen. It‚Äôs on us.

I recently (re)discovered and recommended Alexander von Humboldt's "Cosmos Lectures of 1827/28." What fascinates me so much about this 200-year-old book? Alexander von Humboldt was one of the first scientists to understand nature as a system. A system in which everything is interconnected with everything else‚Ä¶in which there is a subtle and fascinating balance between the very large and the very small.   üìö Dave Goulson's book "Silent Earth" is about the world of the very small. He focuses on how insects are impacted ‚Äì sometimes dramatically ‚Äì by climate change, our consumption habits and our use of resources in general. And in turn, what consequences this impact will have on the world of the big ones (i.e. us humans). In the five chapters: "Why Insects Matter," "Insect Declines," "Causes of Insect Declines," "Where We Are Headed?" and "What Can We Do?," Dave shows how we unknowingly at first, but then more and more despite scientific findings, are endangering the balance between large and small ‚Äì and what we can do better. As a physicist and CEO of a MedTech company, I don't feel particularly competent in the world of insects and ecosystems, but I would like to draw your attention to this book. People who are familiar with it are sensitized to it already, but for those unfamiliar with the topic, it‚Äôs important to become aware of it now. #BookRecommendation #Sustainability #Environment

I am excited to share that we have just signed the #AntwerpDeclaration for a European Industrial Deal together with 72 industry leaders from almost 20 industrial sectors.¬†The #IndustrialDeal is a blueprint for a resilient Europe that is not only a hub of industrial innovation but also a powerhouse of industrial production.¬†Ursula von der Leyen once said: ‚ÄúAs we enter the next phase of the European #GreenDeal, one thing will never change‚Ä¶..We will keep supporting European Industry throughout this transition.‚Äù¬†I see this as a two-way street: industry needs a strong Europe and Europe needs a strong industry. We must¬†support each other, and the Industrial Deal is our proposal for a strong and resilient Europe with a thriving industry at its core.¬†It aims to foster international competitiveness, simplify legislation and regulations, and encourage investments in Europe. This aligns with the push for Europe to become a globally competitive provider of electricity which can drive the transition towards a more sustainable and self-sufficient economy. By adjusting framework conditions, we can ensure that innovations for net-zero, low carbon and circular products find their way into the market and that these products can finally compete with low-cost alternatives.¬†This is the #Europe we are striving for ‚Äì a Europe that leverages its outstanding innovation and production capabilities to deliver the climate solutions Europe needs. By putting the Industrial Deal at the core of the new European Strategic Agenda, we can make it work.

The Munich Security Conference concluded yesterday. My key take-away: European nations have never been clearer about the need to step up their own defense capacities, as well as the need to work together more closely towards that goal.At the conference, I argued that digital collaboration is a powerful, but still underused, lever. Digital collaboration ‚Äì enabled by the hashtag#cloud, data ecosystems, and other proven technologies ‚Äì can reduce costs, accelerate product development, enhance decision-making, and bolster hashtag#cybersecurity in the defense sector. It could, in short, play a key role in helping Europe navigate an increasingly challenging geopolitical environment. To unlock this potential, European nations have to harmonize regulations and standards in coordination with NATO and their transatlantic allies. But that‚Äôs something that can be done ‚Äì and will bring great benefits for the future of our continent. hashtag#MSC2024

I‚Äôll be honest, heading straight from the Munich Security Conference to our Abu Dhabi offices didn‚Äôt leave much room for rest. But seeing our Team Purple here this morning was instantly energizing. Especially because today, we inaugurated our Global Innovation Center, located within Khalifa University in Abu Dhabi. Bridging continents and cultures, this is the fourth hub for global collaboration, joining our other Innovation Centers in Berlin, Orlando, and Shenzhen.Our vision for this Innovation Center is to be a hub for knowledge transfer, co-creation, and robust collaborations that will speed up our journey toward a net-zero future. Zero is the number worth highlighting here. Because by 2050, the United Arab Emirates aims to achieve net-zero emissions, making the Emirates the first Middle East and North Africa nation to do so.Achieving this ambitious goal will require a lot of smart ideas. Because 35% of the technologies needed to achieve net zero are not yet market-ready. And this is where the Abu Dhabi Innovation Center comes in. It is exactly the right place to shape the zero-emission future and help innovative technologies break through.I am very grateful that we have been able to attract strong partners such as the Abu Dhabi Investment Office and the Khalifa University to further strengthen our Innovation Center, as we are talking about nothing less than shaping the global energy transition. And therefore, one of the most important issues facing humanity. #innovation #partnership #abudhabi

Security is more than just defense ‚Äì it encompasses energy too. And without a successful energy transition, there can be no true energy security. That is a premise the Munich Security Conference, where I had valuable conversations with leaders from all kinds of fields, has been increasingly focused on in recent years. The conference is a reminder of why the energy transition is the key to security in Europe. And why we need to build on the positive developments we‚Äôve seen in recent months, among them the European Wind Power Action Plan, which¬†sets out immediate measures to support the expansion of wind energy in Europe. And the Net Zero Industry Act, which was agreed on by the European Parliament and the Council as a basis for promoting net-zero tech manufacturing in the EU. As leaders from across politics, finance, and business come together at this year‚Äôs Munich Security Conference, it‚Äôs crucial that we build on this momentum. Because secure and sustainable energy depends on one factor and one factor only: our ability to collaborate and embrace collective agency.  hashtag#MSC2024 hashtag#MoreWindNow hashtag#EnergySecurity hashtag#EnergyTransition

One year ago, at the Munich Security Conference we kicked-off the Energy Resilience Leadership Group with the aim of strengthening Europe's energy resilience by rapidly bringing climate technologies to scale.Today, one year later, we regrouped again in Munich having brought together high-level representatives from politics, finance and business. In that time we have supported eight major cleantech projects in industry, power and buildings that will reduce Europe's gas consumption. But still: We see huge challenges in two areas: securing Europe‚Äôs energy infrastructure and expanding future technologies by overcoming the current political, financial and economic hurdles. That is what we discussed here today and will continue to do so over the weekend. I will share more on the matter in form of an article in the coming days. Thank you to the prime minister of Belgium, Alexander De Croo and of Norway, Jonas Gahr St√∏re, and German Vice Chancellor Robert Habeck for your presence today. Thank you Ann Mettler for the great organization and bringing us together.  Hashtag#MSC2024 Hashtag#energyresilience Hashtag#europe

#Europa kann mehr!¬†üá™üá∫Eine gr√ºne, smarte, gerechte Welt ‚Äì das muss keine Utopie bleiben. Dazu braucht es ein starkes Europa mit einer starken Industrie.Wie kommen wir dahin? Was ist nach der Europawahl im Juni zu tun? Dar√ºber diskutierte ich gestern in Br√ºssel mit Michael Vassiliadis (IGBCE), Matthias Ecke (SPD), Rasmus Andresen (Gr√ºne Europa) und Markus Ferber, MdEP (EVP-Fraktion).Ich sehe jeden Tag, wie wichtig eine starke Industrie f√ºr die #Zukunft Europas ist. Sie ist nicht nur der Motor f√ºr wirtschaftlichen Erfolg und nachhaltige Wertsch√∂pfung, sondern auch der Wegbereiter f√ºr den Wandel zu einer umfassend nachhaltigen Welt.Dazu hat Europa immenses Potenzial. Um es voll auszusch√∂pfen, braucht die Industrie aber mehr R√ºckenwind. Deshalb fordern wir als Verband der Chemischen Industrie e.V. (VCI) ein Vier-Punkte-Programm: Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit st√§rken,¬†Innovationskr√§fte¬†freisetzen, Partnerschaften ausbauen ‚Äì und einen neuen Politikstil einf√ºhren.Ein Programm, das den #GreenDeal mit einem soliden Business Case untermauert, technologische L√∂sungen wie chemisches Recycling erm√∂glicht und durch Anreize statt √úberregulierung effizientere Ergebnisse erzielt.Deswegen gilt mein Augenmerk jetzt dem k√ºnftigen Parlament und der neuen Kommission. I like complexity. It motivates me. The more complex a problem is, the more motivated I am to tackle it. And obviously many people at Deutsche Telekom feel the same way. This became clear today at the presentation of our Telekom Team Award, with which we honor particularly successful projects. Almost 200 teams from Deutsche Telekom entered the competition. At theaward ceremony, we voted live for the three winning teams. They all have one thing in common: they solve complex problems. And make the world a little easier.  My Management Board colleague Birgit Bohle and I were delighted with their projects. The winning team "Critic Contas AI" from T-Systems International in Spain has developed an AI-supported tool for the care of intensive care patients. Based on patient data, algorithms help doctors to make clinical decisions and identify risks.The projects in second and third place are equally innovative: the "Micro Container", for example, is a "mobile phone mast to go". It is easy to transport, quick to set up and provides additional capacity where it is needed quickly in special cases. The winning team "T IoT" stands for a platform that makes global connectivity for the Internet of Things easily available. Particularly interesting for the production of the future and our business customers.What makes me particularly happy is that the teams are donating their winnings to a charitable organization of their choice. Because beyond the products, they want to contribute to a good society.  I would like to thank everyone who took part in this competition. It was creative, committed and fits in with our aspiration to be a leader in everything we do. hashtag#wewontstop

Keep society on board! That‚Äôs indeed the main message I would like to share when reading the headlines of the new package that the EU Commission published last week on the 2040 climate targets.Even though I am not a fan of ‚Äúintermediate targets‚Äù, I appreciate that the EU holds the line. Just few months ahead of elections where criticism of the EU Green Deal is part of political positioning, this is an important signal to the public, industries and investors. No doubt that the future is decarbonized, with massive electrification powered by renewables. Nevertheless, we still have to stretch to even reach 2030 targets. So, priority should always be to maximize effort for getting things done rather than setting new goals. Complementing renewables by reliable back-up generation and flexibility. Enabling such electrification with modernized and digitized power grids. And with a forward-looking strategy for carbon management in the hardest-to-abate sectors. In my view the receipt for progress and getting society on board is actually the same: Far less bureaucracy and regulatory burdens for everyone, citizens and enterprises, SMEs and large enterprises. Avoiding unnecessary costs. Making sure ‚Äì also at National level ‚Äì that we have the regulatory conditions to invest.

This is a significant milestone for Covestro and a testament to our commitment to keep the wheels of sustainable innovation turning ‚Äì despite challenging times.¬†Bio-#Aniline is a key component in many chemical products and traditionally, it is derived from non-renewable resources. With this pilot plant, we are taking a bold step towards a #CircularEconomy by using renewable resources to produce Bio-Aniline. In the long term, this not only reduces our dependency on fossil fuels but also significantly reduces our carbon footprint.¬†Our success in this venture is not just a result of our internal efforts, but also the result of close collaboration with industry and science partners. I'm incredibly proud of the team that made this possible. Their hard work and dedication have brought us one big step closer to our #FullyCircular vision. I'm excited about the innovative solutions that are yet to come.More info on our pilot plant: https://lnkd.in/e2gBc--F

Dieser Artikel und die darin enthaltenen Zitate aus der Energiebranche regen zum Nachdenken an.¬†Es ist besorgniserregend, dass mittlerweile auch Energieexperten wie Markus Krebber die Realisierbarkeit des Kohleausstiegs bis 2030 in Frage stellen. Dies unterstreicht die Komplexit√§t und die Vielzahl der offenen Fragen, die das Thema noch immer mit sich bringt.¬†Die Herausforderungen reichen vom Ausbau der Netzinfrastruktur bis hin zur Finanzierung und zeitigen Bereitstellung gesicherter Leistung. Es herrscht weiterhin eine gro√üe Unsicherheit, w√§hrend die Zeit unerbittlich voranschreitet.Die Netzentgeltsystematik und #Kraftwerksstrategie sind nur einige Aspekte mit Blick auf die Realisierung eines klimaneutralen und bezahlbaren Stromsystems.¬†Die erfolgreiche Umsetzung der Kraftwerksstrategie erfordert gro√üe Anstrengungen, eine gute Zusammenarbeit zwischen Bund und L√§ndern und eine Beschleunigung der Genehmigungsverfahren, wie beispielsweise bei den Fl√ºssiggas-Importterminals.¬†Doch dieses Thema ist nur die Spitze des Eisbergs.¬†Warum konzentrieren wir uns immer nur auf die Symptome, statt das Problem an der Wurzel zu packen? Denn diese Wurzel hat viele Verzweigungen ‚Äì strukturelle Defizite, √úberregulierung, B√ºrokratie und Richtungslosigkeit, um nur einige zu nennen ‚Äì aus denen st√§ndig neue Probleme und zwangsweise Attentismus erwachsen.¬†F√ºr eine nachhaltige Verbesserung, die √ºber eine symptomatische Behandlung hinausgeht, ben√∂tigen wir eine eindeutige Richtungsentscheidung und¬†einen anderen Politikstil.¬†Einen, der Anreize schafft, statt auf Verbote und √úberregulierungen zu setzen. Einen, der leidenschaftlich f√ºr die Chancen der #Energiewende und der gr√ºnen Transformation eintritt, statt Angst vor Ver√§nderungen zu sch√ºren. Einen, der die #Innovationskraft Deutschlands wieder entfesselt. Als Industrie arbeiten wir intensiv daran und wir brauchen R√ºcken- statt Gegenwind.

Today, on the International Day of Women and Girls in #Science, I'd like to shine a spotlight on the remarkable contributions of some exceptional female scientists I've had the privilege to know.The world of science still lacks the presence of women, and it is our responsibility to encourage and nurture young and dedicated individuals, regardless of their gender, to bring their unique perspectives to the table and advance their scientific careers on a level playing field.Firstly, I would like to highlight the work of Melanie Maas-Brunner, my former classmate at RWTH Aachen University, who is diligently exploring how chemistry can facilitate the massive shift towards a sustainable and climate-neutral future. Last year, I presented her with the Aachener #Ingenieurpreis (Aachen Engineering Award) for her remarkable efforts. Her belief that innovations must be scalable at an industrial level is something I deeply admire.Lina-Henriette Schwering, one of only few women in engineering at RWTH Aachen University, is another shining example. As a promising young talent, she has already led Team Sonnenwagen Aachen to win the iLumen European Solar Challenge - iESC. While the project primarily focuses on innovation in sustainable mobility, Lina also demonstrates something else: importance of team performance and individual commitment, factors that can make all the difference in a race ‚Äì and in developing sustainable solutions. Her passion is truly inspiring.Mai Thi Nguyen-Kim, with her own German TV show "MAITHINK X" ‚Äì and for many year also successful YouTube channel ‚Äì has shown us how to engage a wider audience, especially the youth, and spark their interest in science and chemistry. She as well has been awarded the Aachen Engineering Award (yes, also as a chemist üòâ). I look forward to more insightful content from her.These three women are just a few of the many who are propelling us forward in science and industry. I work with many more brilliant women at Covestro, and today, we celebrate all of you. I encourage everyone to use this platform to amplify the voices of #WomenInScience and shine a spotlight on their achievements.Also: I am always eager to learn about more inspiring individuals in the field. Feel free to link them in the comments.

Offen diskutieren, dann geschlossen handelnWenn man gegenw√§rtig auf andere Unternehmen blickt, kann man den Eindruck gewinnen, dass hashtag#Sozialpartnerschaft und Zusammenarbeit zwischen Arbeitgeber- und Arbeitnehmervertreter*innen derzeit nur mit Krawall und Konfrontationen funktioniert. Ich finde: Bei der Deutsche Telekom ist das nicht der Fall.Daran wurde ich in dieser Woche nochmal erinnert, als ich den langj√§hrigen ver.di-Bundesvorstand Lothar Schr√∂der traf. Er hat im November 2023 nach 17 Jahren im Aufsichtsrat ‚Äì davon 14 Jahre als stellvertretender Vorsitzender ‚Äì unser Gremium verlassen. In dieser Zeit hat Lothar Schr√∂der drei Vorstandsvorsitzende und vier Aufsichtsratsvorsitzende begleitet und wurde von allen als wichtiger Botschafter f√ºr die Interessen der Arbeitnehmer*innen gesch√§tzt. In den vielen Jahren unserer Zusammenarbeit konnten wir zahlreiche wichtige Themen wie z. B. die Gr√ºndung unserer Servicegesellschaften, den Sprint-Merger in den USA und die Gr√ºndung des Datenschutzbeirats umsetzen. Er war auch immer am Fortschritt von Technik und Innovation interessiert, zuletzt diskutierten wir oft wie wir KI bei der hashtag#Telekom schnell an den Start bringen.Lothar Schr√∂der hat sich dabei durch Verl√§sslichkeit und Gestaltungswillen ausgezeichnet. Er hat die Interessen der Arbeitnehmer*innen stets nachdr√ºcklich vertreten, dabei offen agiert und fair verhandelt. Wir haben uns wei√ü Gott gefetzt, aber immer eine pragmatische L√∂sung f√ºr das Unternehmen und seine vielen Interessensgruppen gefunden. Dazu geh√∂rte auch, die diskutierten L√∂sungen jeweils bei seinen Anspruchsgruppen im Nachgang zu vertreten. Ganz im Sinne eines unserer Kultur-Leits√§tze: ‚ÄûOffen diskutieren, dann geschlossen handeln‚Äú.Nach 375 (!) Sitzungen als Aufsichtsratsmitglied und unz√§hligen internen Meetings wird er sich nun anderen Aufgaben widmen ‚Äì er geht unter die Unternehmer, wird noch mehr B√ºcher schreiben und bleibt uns als Vorsitzender des Datenschutzbeirats erhalten. Respekt! Ich w√ºnsche ihm weiterhin eine gl√ºckliche Hand und gutes Gelingen!

K√ºnstliche Intelligenz (#KI) ist kein Ph√§nomen, vor dem wir uns wegducken k√∂nnen, in der Hoffnung, dass es einfach vorbeizieht. Dies gilt f√ºr jeden Einzelnen und f√ºr Unternehmen gleicherma√üen.¬†KI hat das Potenzial, unsere Arbeitsweise radikal zu transformieren. W√§hrend einige diese Ver√§nderung als Chance betrachten, macht sie anderen Angst. Das ist absolut menschlich ‚Äì etablierte und funktionierende Prozesse und Gewohnheiten zu durchbrechen, ist ein echter Kraftakt f√ºr den es Offenheit, Kreativit√§t und Energie bedarf.¬†Nichtsdestotrotz ist die Implementierung von KI im Unternehmen unvermeidlich. Sie hilft, Prozesse effizienter und effektiver zu gestalten und bietet so #Innovationen n√∂tigen Raum zur Entfaltung. Kurz gesagt: ohne KI wird es k√ºnftig nicht mehr gehen.¬†Deshalb ist es von entscheidender Bedeutung, dass Unternehmen ihre Mitarbeitenden in den KI-Implementierungsprozess einbeziehen und sie auf die Ver√§nderungen vorbereiten, die KI mit sich bringt. Bei Covestro haben wir deshalb ein engagiertes Team, das sich um die Integration von KI im Unternehmen k√ºmmert und eng mit unseren Kolleginnen und Kollegen zusammenarbeitet.¬†Unsere Mitarbeitenden sind das Herzst√ºck unseres Unternehmens. Sie kennen die bestehenden Prozesse am besten und k√∂nnen gemeinsam mit dem KI-Team wichtige Stellschrauben identifizieren. Gleicherma√üen m√ºssen sie die M√∂glichkeiten und Herausforderungen der KI-L√∂sungen verstehen und in der Lage sein, die Technologie k√ºnftig effektiv zu nutzen.¬†Letztendlich ist KI kein Trend, den man einfach ignorieren kann. Sie ist eine Realit√§t, der wir uns stellen m√ºssen. With E.ON we walk the talk! I did not only agree with the CEO Alliance on a policy paper arguing for a twin transformation of decarbonisation and digitalisation.
