Unlocking success through transparency. Here are my experiences on how to do it. Once a month, I take part in coffee mornings with colleagues from different departments and different hierarchical levels. We engage in an open dialogue about our goals, our strategy, our corporate culture, or topics that affect us on a day-to-day basis. Thanks to all participants so far for your open words and your trust!I love this format because it creates transparency. Transparency is not just a buzzword! It‚Äôs a cornerstone of our culture, it empowers us to grow personally, thrive as a team and to drive our company‚Äôs performance.In addition to the example above, there are other ways how to encourage transparency:üëâ Establishing open dialogue formats and fostering an environment for speak up: Share information with your team, ask questions, listen actively, and provide feedback freely. üëâ Leading by example: Share information when appropriate and encourage others to do the same.üëâ Embracing vulnerability: Transparency often involves being open about challenges, uncertainties, and setbacks. Don‚Äôt be afraid to share them, they create opportunities for continuous growth. üëâ Creating a culture based on trust and a positive culture of error is a prerequisite for transparency. Therefore, let‚Äôs stay transparent and outperform ‚Äì together!Do you have examples on how transparency unlocks success? I look forward to your comments. hashtag#TalanxTogetherhashtag#PerformanceCulture

Plastic packaging ‚Äì do we even need it?Plastic packaging is essential for the preservation and protection of food and other products. It extends the shelf life of products and reduces food waste. At the same time, it contributes significantly to environmental pollution if not disposed of properly.A new regulation proposed by the European Parliament aims to help. It proposes reducing plastic packaging waste by 20 percent by 2040 and making all packaging recyclable by 2030. Reusable containers are to become a plausible alternative, but present new challenges such as logistics and cleaning.It is crucial that this push for reusable packaging goes hand in hand with the advancement of recycling. We must explore a variety of solutions to achieve a #CircularEconomy. This includes further incentivizing the development of recycling solutions ‚Äì also for packaging. We have already made progress in this field which needs further advancement.Covestro, for example, collaborates with SABIC to improve the recyclability of plastic packaging. By combining our heat-resistant coating with SABIC's mono-material Polyethylene, we created a high-performing packaging solution fit for mechanical recycling.I am convinced that eliminating plastic packaging is not the solution. Instead, we must continue to innovate and find sustainable solutions to the challenges it presents. This includes advancing #recycling, improving waste management, and transitioning towards a #FullyCircular economy.

COP28 UAE is just around the corner and the expectations are higher than ever. The objective is clear: to create a hashtag#sustainable future for all. Above all, the pace is crucial. Together with some of thyssenkrupp's top executives and experts, I am in Dubai to exchange expertise and share insights. We have tremendous potential here and are ready to tackle these huge challenges with our hashtag#innovative solutions. How? Find out more in my article.

Today I greeted the employees at our Town Hall Meeting in different languages perfectly and without an accent. Languages that I don't speak. How is that possible? A deceptively real avatar from our partner start-up @go AVA (#TechBoost) has impressively demonstrated what is already possible today in the field of Artificial Intelligence (AI).AI has come to stay. At Telekom, AI is increasingly being integrated into work in all areas: in our processes, networks, and also in the service. Therefore, it is important to me that all colleagues engage with the topic. The Town Hall Meeting was about showing tangible examples like the AI Pin from #Humane. A kind of AI "lapel pin" that wants to compete against apps and smartphones.I also spoke with our experts Tatjana Wittig, Jonathan G√∂√ümann, and Paul Bauriegel from the #AI Competence Center about #LLM, #GenAI, and the ethical components. We want to understand, learn, and shape AI. Our new #AI Competence Center helps us with this, as does our engagement in the #GlobalTelcoAIAlliance. Because the transformative power of AI requires an exchange at all levels, from apprentices to CEOs - and also with people outside our Telekom.

Feedback is an important building block for high performance. But you have to be well prepared.Feedback takes us to the next level. Every individual, the team and the company. Teams can only achieve high performance if they create transparency. And that includes open feedback.However, in my experience, we need to move from superficial feedback to hashtag#EducatedFeedback.How to achieve this: üëâ Educated feedback is not a matter of chance. Both parties must prepare intensively for it.üëâ I value feedback as a challenge to an idea or own suggestions. What doesn't work are open questions that shift responsibility away. For example: What should we do now?üëâ When I give specific feedback on a person, I want to prepare myself. And that means, for example: We agree on a period of time or a particular situation so that I can observe the other person's behaviour more closely. Then my feedback will really help. Feedback is a gift for both sides ‚Äì if it relates specifically to a situation. This is how we can improve our hashtag#together.I see at Talanx that people really enjoy working in such a productive environment. Because we can make decisions quickly, implement things and grow personally as a result.Therefore, continue to invest energy in feedbacks!What is important to you in feedback discussions?hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#PerformanceCulture hashtag#Transparency hashtag#Engagement hashtag#Collaboration

Should this graphic make us worry?¬†The graphic implicates two things: firstly, the rising demand for #plastics is a testament to their versatility and utility in various sectors. Secondly, it underscores the urgent need for a sustainable shift in the plastics industry.¬†The plastics industry is one of the largest GHG producers, with plastics accounting for ca. 3.4% of global emissions. With the expected rise in plastics demand comes an expected increase in global oil consumption as carbon from crude oil currently forms the basis of most plastics. On top of that, plastic pollution remains a pressing issue as global recycling rates are still extremely low. If we continue this trajectory, resource depletion and pollution will continue to rise as plastics production increases.¬†At the same time, we must keep in mind that plastics are essential in various applications of our modern life. Plastics drive climate action in core areas like energy, mobility, and construction. They secure nutrition and improve health, contributing to the well-being and living standards of billions of people. So, the challenge is not to eliminate plastics, but to transform the way we produce and use them.¬†The #CircularEconomy must become our global guiding principle. By keeping carbon in the loop, we can reduce pollution and resource depletion while still supplying vital industries with versatile plastics. This comprehensive transformation is a joint effort that includes various aspects such as designing for circularity, exploring alternative raw materials, accelerating recycling, and using renewable energy in production.¬†In conclusion, this graphic should not be a cause for alarm, but rather a catalyst for action. It should ignite our determination to tirelessly work on solutions for a #FullyCircular economy. And for this we need all hands on deck: an industry committed to circularity, politics establishing the right frameworks, and a society that manages plastics responsibly. Let's work together and ensure that this growth does not come at the cost of our planet.¬†Curious about your conclusion and thoughts.¬†Graphic credit: Our World in Data
To all colleagues, customers, and partners who are celebrating today ‚Äì¬†happy #Thanksgiving to you and your loved ones!

‚ÄûKing Coal is vorbei ‚Äì Solar is the Queen‚Äú, so fasste IEA-Chef Fatih Birol den World Energy Outlook 2023 zusammen (Link: https://lnkd.in/eGzxkpxd). Demnach steigt bis 2030 weltweit die Zahl der E-Autos und W√§rmepumpen massiv; auch der Anteil der Erneuerbaren im Strommix w√§chst auf fast 50 Prozent. Das bietet Chancen f√ºr mehr Wachstum und mehr Arbeitspl√§tze und auch f√ºr ein besseres Klima. Gut so! Der Bericht der Internationalen Energiebeh√∂rde (Link: https://www.iea.org/) mahnt aber auch weitere Anstrengungen zum Erreichen des 1,5-Grad-Ziels an: Halten die Regierungen ‚Äûnur‚Äú an ihren Ma√ünahmen zum Klimaschutz fest und steigern sie ihre Ambitionen nicht, bleibt der Anteil der fossilen Brennstoffe dennoch zu hoch und die globalen Durchschnittstemperaturen steigen bis zum Ende des Jahrhunderts um etwa 2,4 Grad. Wir m√ºssen also schneller werden!Das Tempo, mit dem wir unsere Klimaziele erreichen, h√§ngt nach meiner Einsch√§tzung in besonderem Ma√üe davon ab, ob und wie wir in der Lage sind, die (Netz-)Infrastruktur f√ºr ein nachhaltiges Energiesystem zu finanzieren ‚Äì siehe auch mein gestriger Post zur Hashtag#COP28. Das ist ein Thema, das auch die Entwicklung in Deutschland mehr und mehr beeinflusst. Dabei geht es nicht nur um staatliche Ausgaben¬†(Link: https://lnkd.in/eKaCXa3Z) Es geht insbesondere um das immer komplexere Finanzierungsumfeld mit steigenden Zinsen, ¬†immer mehr Regulierung und B√ºrokratie, aber beispielsweise auch wachsende Abh√§ngigkeiten von Rohstofflieferanten. Denn das alles erschwert es, PRIVATES Kapital f√ºr die Energiewende zu mobilisieren ‚Äì insbesondere f√ºr den Ausbau der Energieinfrastruktur.Hinzu kommt: Die Herausforderungen werden gr√∂√üer mit Blick auf die Sicherheit der Energieversorgung, die nicht erst mit den j√ºngsten Entwicklungen im Nahen Osten schlagartig an Bedeutung gewonnen hat. Es liegt daher auf der Hand: Uns bleibt wenig Zeit.- ¬≠ Doch wenn wir erfolgreich sind, hei√üt es zuk√ºnftig: ‚ÄûSolar ist Queen and Grid is the new king‚Äú Hashtag#Energiewende

We have just wrapped up our Capital Market Day, during which we shared a strategic outlook with analysts and investors. I am pleased that the strategy we implemented last year has yielded positive results for the majority of our businesses. Today, we highlighted three primary objectives for fiscal year 2024 aimed at delivering value to our shareholders:1.  Deliver on Profitable Growth2.  Fix the Wind Business3.  Maintain our solid Financial FoundationMarket trends, such as the increasing demand for electricity, the shift toward low CO2 power generation, and the necessity for substantial grid investment and energy efficiency, underscore the global need for a resilient energy technology company like Siemens Energy. Next week the #COP28 starts. Once again there will be a hard fight for financial compensation for climate change impacts between states. Once again aspiration levels will be discussed. And again, there isn‚Äôt much hope for a quick progress in either question. So, is it wrong to talk about money and aspirations? No! But to reduce the future need of compensating for loss and damage we should concentrate much more on just doing the next step rather then only talking about it. We should be investing more now to avoid new damage. We should massively invest in energy infrastructure. We should mobilize capital by providing secure and profitable investment environments. We should scale innovations and technologies quickly and across borders. And states should first and foremost remove (national) barriers to climate protection and the flow of capital into climate technologies.
Worth a read!

Gr√ºne EngelAls ‚Äûgr√ºnen Engel‚Äú hat mich aktuell das Manager Magazin bezeichnet, weil kein Unternehmen seine CO2-Reduktion so konsequent umsetzt wie die Deutsche Telekom. Aber eigentlich geb√ºhrt dieser Titel unseren ‚ÄûGreen Pioneers‚Äú. Seit 2018 engagieren sie sich √ºberall im Unternehmen zum Thema Umweltschutz. 300 sind es inzwischen; und sie legen den Finger in die Wunde. Denn Umweltschutz ist nicht nur ein Thema der gro√üen Zahlen und Ziele. Sondern es ist die Summe auch vieler Einzelma√ünahmen, die wir mit Hilfe und Dank unserer ‚ÄûPioneers‚Äú umsetzen. Die Umstellung auf ein Pfandsystem und ‚Äûdas gute alte Porzellan‚Äú hat zum Beispiel dazu gef√ºhrt, dass wir in Summe 2,3 Millionen Einwegbecher gespart haben. Dank der Einf√ºhrung von Textilcontainern wurden 21 Tonnen ausgedienter Arbeitskleidung und Jeans recycelt. Diese Container sind √ºbrigens ans Internet der Dinge angeschlossen. Ein Sensor meldet, wenn sie voll sind. Nur dann m√ºssen sie geleert werden. Eine L√∂sung, die unsere T-Systems auch anderen Unternehmen anbietet. Und Dank der Pioneers nutzen viele TelekomerInnen inzwischen die Suchmaschine Ecosia.Unsere gr√ºnen Pioniere¬†zeigen Haltung und st√§rken die Community. Sie sind Idealisten. Sie sind Vorreiter. Und sie erf√ºllen eine Vorbildfunktion. Danke, liebe Kolleginnen und Kollegen, f√ºr Euren Einsatz und Euren Beitrag f√ºr unsere ambitionierten Klimaziele: Klimaneutral bis 2025. Klimaneutralit√§t entlang unserer gesamten Wertsch√∂pfungskette bis 2040. Hier ziehen wir mit unseren Lieferanten an einem Strang. Wir haben bereits viel geschafft. Aber unser Weg geht weiter. Manchmal w√ºnschte ich mir mehr Transparenz. Diskutieren wir eigentlich ehrlich dar√ºber, was die notwendige Transformation in Richtung Klimaneutralit√§t f√ºr Auswirkungen auf unsere Unternehmen hat? Und wie wir das bew√§ltigen wollen? Unsere Antwort ist klar: Wir k√∂nnen noch viele Dinge in der Produktion und im Verbrauch digitaler machen. Und dadurch Energie sparen ‚Äì siehe Internet der Dinge. Aber auch unser Glasfaserausbau ist ein gutes Beispiel. Glasfaser verbraucht weniger Energie als andere Technologien, die wir irgendwann ersetzen k√∂nnen. Und ich bin sicher: Unsere Pioneers werden noch weitere Beispiele finden, die wir dann umsetzen.¬†#nachhaltigkeit #esg #telekom Melanie Kubin-Hardewig Michael Hagspihl Myriam Quiskamp Patrick K√∂hler

As President of Eurelectric I gave several interviews to Brussels based media last week to position our industry in the ongoing trilogues on the electricity market design reform and in the discussion of the EU Grid Action Plan scheduled for release on 29 November. I made crystal clear: The electricity market design reform must ensure a clear, stable and technology-neutral regulatory environment to foster the urgent roll-out of renewables and greater investments in the power distribution system which supports them. At stake is our success in delivering the 2030 targets. We have no time to loose: We need to double investments in the grids in the next 6 years. In particular in distribution grids, investments should increase to at least ‚Ç¨36 billion per year until 2030 and, on average, up to ‚Ç¨65 billion per year until 2050. We all know, that the incremental approach to build infrastructure does not work anymore. If we want the grid to be ready for the rapidly growing production of renewable energy, we need to re-build the capacity reserves that we have eaten through. We need ‚Äúanticipatory investments‚Äù. Eurelectric and its member companies are ready to invest in that! #energytransition

Wrapping up another two full days in Brussels, topped up by excellent discussions with Executive Vice President Maro≈° ≈†efƒçoviƒç, CLIMA Director General Kurt Vandenberghe, MEP Morten Helveg Petersen and my fellow Eurelectric Board colleagues.We tackled a number of issues that are at the basis of our competitive economic transformation, like power market design, the 2040 framework and of course power infrastructure, as we are inching closer to the adoption of the Grids Action Plan by the EU Commission. For some time now we focused on expanding clean generation capacity, a most important goal especially as we have had to not only replace, but also displace volumes of imported gas. But while one foot was on the gas pedal on the RES expansion, one foot on the brake prevented the network capacity from growing. We need acceleration and anticipation, and the regulatory de-risking of the investments we make based on forecast. The massive scale of investment in the power grids, estimated between 584bn to 1 trillion by 2030 EUR depending on the source, in itself is truly impressive. But at least equally impressive is how fast we will have to be able to deploy: the capital, the technicians, the permits, the equipment and the flexibility. It‚Äôs a massive collective task that must be done in anticipation of generation projects, new consumers, not after the fact. I look forward to the Action Plan and I hope it puts forward a brave and meaningful way in which we have to look at these things, with grid in the lead.

Healthy legs run faster!That's why we carried out an organisational health check.Over 21,000 colleagues worldwide - nearly 90 per cent of our employees - gave us their feedback on how satisfied they are with our goals, our strategy, our culture, or our working atmosphere. Many thanks to all participants for your trust! The results show that it is great fun to work at Talanx Group! We had even more fun this year than last year üòäThis result isn‚Äôt random. We have implemented many measures to improve our culture based on trust, our leadership, and the empowerment of our people. All these important issues contribute to the success of our company. Because for us, culture is strategy! Or to put it more metaphorically: healthy legs run faster. One topic is close to my heart: An employee satisfaction survey alone is not enough to constantly improve our organisational health. Continuous feedback and a speak-up culture are crucial for healthy high-performance teams.Trust is the basis for this! One of the many reasons that I love my job is that institutional investing and insurance is naturally oriented toward the future. Our long-term obligations and need to safeguard our portfolios for future generations makes us futurists, always focused on emerging risks and opportunities, and those that lay far ahead. For this reason, many insurers and institutional investors have been out in front of the climate crisis, foreseeing the dangers of global warming and investing in innovative solutions to mitigate it. We have learned much through investing in renewable energy technologies and green transformations. One structuring approach is blended finance ‚Äì a model in which projects are financed out of both catalytic funding from public or philanthropic sources and private sector capital. Blended finance has great potential to mobilize a brave and rapid economic transformation, helping us achieve our ambitious climate goals faster. At Allianz, we see blended finance structures already making a positive impact in Africa. And we‚Äôre confident that its innovative approach can unlock public/private investment in the European Union and beyond.  I was recently asked to contribute a chapter for ‚ÄúGermany 2030 ‚Äì Decade of Decision,‚Äù a new book about how to accelerate an intelligent, sustainable transformation while also strengthening Germany and Europe as a global, competitive, and efficient location for industry and tech. In it, I argue that we need to dare to do more blended finance, if we want to protect Europe from the worst scenarios of climate change. I outline specific steps that governments and regulators can take to scale the power of blended finance at the necessary pace. We‚Äôre living in a pivotal decade of environmental, social, and economic transformation, requiring creative thinking, foresight, and courage. ‚ÄúThe Decade of Decision 2030,‚Äù edited by Christian Lindner, Federal Minister of Finance for Germany,¬†Robert Habeck, Federal Minister of Economics and Climate Protection for Germany, and¬†Stefan B. Wintels, Chairman of the Executive Board of KfW, is an impressive collection of pioneering thinkers from many sectors. I am honored to be included amongst them. While focused on Germany and the European Union, the book‚Äôs forward-looking solutions are timely and relevant around the globe. ¬†Read more here: https://lnkd.in/eG_3mAxm ¬†#BlendedFinance #Allianz

The global economy is only 7.2% circular, with around one third of municipal waste worldwide not being disposed of properly. We urgently need to advance recycling ‚Äì and why not with the help of #AI?A The Wall Street Journal article I read offers a promising perspective on how AI can make recycling more economically feasible and transform the waste management industry.Efficiency and speed of waste sorting are a critical bottleneck in the #recycling process. AI-powered robots and optical sorters can help optimize this ‚Äì they do the jobs that people are not eager to do and they do it more effectively and for longer hours. The adoption of AI aligns with the industry's call to promote innovative technologies and expand its waste management infrastructure. But it also brings new challenges: Upfront costs, maintenance, and upgrades are significant barriers.I believe, while AI is not a silver bullet, it can be a powerful tool to improve recycling and accelerate our journey towards a #CircularEconomy. At Covestro, for example, we use AI in our research for new recycling technologies for plastics. However, the adoption and effectiveness of AI will depend on various factors, including funding availability, the regulatory environment, and the industry's willingness to embrace new technologies.I'm curious about your thoughts on this.Access the full article here:¬†https://lnkd.in/g9fNeZrF#aiadoption #artificialintelligence #FullyCircular

Und letztlich war die Bek√§mpfung der Pandemie ‚Äì wie √ºbrigens jede Herausforderung in den Gesundheitswesen ‚Äì¬†eine Menschheitsaufgabe √ºber Nationen, Kulturen und Religionen hinweg, denn weder Viren noch Krebs interessieren sich f√ºr Landesgrenzen. Ich bin sehr zuversichtlich, dass wir diese Erfahrungen heute nutzen k√∂nnen, um die Welt ges√ºnder zu machen ‚Äì vor allem f√ºr die drei von acht Milliarden Menschen, die heute noch keinen Zugang zu angemessener medizinischer Versorgung haben. Today, we took another step forward in securing a #GreenHydrogen supply chain, which is crucial for the green transformation of our industry. Thank you for the engaging discussions in Gladbeck, Germany, King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands¬†and Hendrik W√ºst.The transition to climate neutrality in energy-intensive industries like ours heavily depends on green hydrogen. Es hat in Deutschland eine Zeit gegeben, da wurde vorausschauend an #Infrastruktur gebaut. Klingt wie ein M√§rchen? Nein, das war Realit√§t und wurde weltweit bewundert. Dokumentiert hat dies Mark Twain, Autor von Tom Sawyer und Huckleberry Finn, der seinerzeit vor allem auch als Reiseschriftsteller bekannt war. In seinem ‚ÄûBummel durch Deutschland‚Äú von 1880 gibt er diese bewundernde Beschreibung des Baus von Bahnh√∂fen, bevor Schienen fertig sind und der Verkehr beginnt:‚Äû√úberall am Fluss entlang sahen wie in der N√§he eines jeden Dorfes kleine Bahnh√∂fe f√ºr die zuk√ºnftige Eisenbahn. Sie waren bereits fertig und warteten nur noch auf die Schienen und den Verkehr. Sie sahen so Schmuck und niedlich und h√ºbsch aus, wie man sie sich nur immer w√ºnschen konnte. Stets waren sie aus Ziegeln oder Bruchsteinen gebaut und von anmutigem √Ñu√üeren; sie wurden schon jetzt von Reben und Blumen am Rand, und um See her war das Gras frisch und gr√ºn, und man sah, dass es liebevoll gepflegt wurde. Die Bahnh√∂fe waren alles andere als ein √Ñrgernis, sie waren eine Zierde der sch√∂nen Landschaft. [‚Ä¶] Ein Land so wundersch√∂n in Stand zu halten, wie Deutschland es tut, hat √ºber dies noch eine kluge, praktische Seite: Tausende von Menschen haben Arbeit und Brot, die sonst m√º√üig gehen und Unheil stiften w√ºrden.‚Äú Wie w√§re es ‚Äì verwegener Gedanke ‚Äì wenn wir hier uns beim Ausbau der Energieinfrastruktur hieran ein Beispiel n√§hmen?

As we navigate the path towards sustainability, the need for innovative solutions is rising and #plastics are at the heart of this transition. At China International Import Expo, I had the opportunity to witness their potential impact on three key industries: construction, automotive, and renewable energy.Buildings are responsible for over half of China's emissions, making "ultra-low energy buildings" a significant factor in the country's journey to net-zero. Polyurethanes, initially used in refrigeration, have immense potential to boost energy efficiency in #construction without sacrificing aesthetics. Our partnerships with property developers PDG Group and Shanghai Lujiazui Development (Group) Company Limited are accelerating the adoption of such sustainable construction practices in China, helping to meet the country's climate targets.Similarly, the #automotive industry is making intensive efforts in decarbonization, aiming to create lighter, smarter, and safer vehicles. Plastics manufacturers, including Covestro, can contribute to this transition by providing circular, low-carbon materials such as polycarbonates for electric vehicles. Through partnerships like the one we have with Chinese premium EV brand HiPhi, we are driving the commercialization of such low-carbon solutions, enabling even more car manufacturers to use these materials in the future.China is reforming its #energy sector, increasingly focusing on clean energy, especially solar power. With this shift comes a rising demand for PV modules. Plastics with their unique properties help making PV modules lighter, more durable, efficient, and sustainable. A new innovation platform we created with five partners in China's PV value chain aims to further advance sustainability within the sector.¬†The numerous conversations I had at #CIIE2023 confirmed that innovative materials like plastics are needed more than ever to drive progress towards a truly #SustainableFuture. At the same time, my visit reassured me that we depend on robust #partnerships for their potential to unfold. Such partnerships ensure the adoption and commercialization of our innovative solutions, allowing them to truly make an impact where they're needed ‚Äì in China and beyond.#FullyCircular #PlasticsInnovation

The 1.5¬∞C target is slipping out of reach.Achieving it requires an annual global emissions reduction of 7% until 2030. But the current trend is a 1.5% annual increase. Ahead of hashtag#COP28, the World Economic Forum Alliance of CEO Climate Leaders‚Äô latest report underscores the urgent need for rapid global action to counter this trend. These are some of the near-term priorities my fellow CEO Alliance members and I included in the report:  üîπ step up national commitments and actions with shorter-term targets that warrant the achievability of 1.5¬∞C in time;üîπ set bold decarbonization targets across all sectors in line with the Science Based Targets initiative;üîπ remove obstacles to renewable deployment, e.g., through fast-tracking permitting, massively scaling key green technologies, building out the necessary infrastructure, upskilling of the workforce, and supporting investments to de-risk access to raw materials;üîπ set incentives for companies to implement decarbonization measures; and üîπ raise financing to fight climate change and to support mitigation of and adaption to its impact. Every fraction of a degree matters. That‚Äôs why countries, companies across all industries, and other stakeholders must take actions with large-scale impact at a much higher pace now. Join us in our sustained efforts. hashtag#MoreWindNow hashtag#RenewableEnergy hashtag#EnergyPolicy hashtag#ClimateChange hashtag#NetZero

#Br√ºckenstrompreis ‚Äì eine Investition in die Zukunftsf√§higkeit Deutschlands?¬†Meine Meinung zu Subventionen ist unver√§ndert: Sie m√ºssen immer das letzte Mittel sein und immer befristet. Dieses befristete Mittel brauchen wir jetzt, damit Deutschland auch k√ºnftig von einer starken Industrie profitieren kann.¬†Die energieintensive Industrie liefert j√§hrlich etwa 240 Milliarden Euro an Bruttowertsch√∂pfung und stellt 2,4 Millionen Arbeitspl√§tze. Sie ist ein wichtiges Bindeglied in Wertsch√∂pfungsketten und produziert essenzielle Produkte f√ºr die #Energiewende und f√ºr unser t√§gliches Leben. Letzteres m√∂chte ich am Beispiel von Covestro verdeutlichen. Covestro stellt Hochleistungskunststoffe f√ºr diverse Industrien her. Darunter Polycarbonate und Polyurethane bzw. Polyurethan-Vorprodukte f√ºr energieeffiziente Geb√§uded√§mmung, Windr√§der und E-Mobilit√§t.¬†Wenn wir diese Materialien in Deutschland k√ºnftig nicht mehr produzieren k√∂nnen, verlieren wir Innovationskraft und Produktionskapazit√§ten, die wir f√ºr unsere klimaneutrale Transformation dringend ben√∂tigen. Aktuelle geopolitische Verwerfungen und vergangene Krisen wie die COVID-Pandemie zeigen, wie fragil Lieferketten sind. Es wird daher immer wichtiger, dass wir Produktionskapazit√§ten und Knowhow im Inland halten und #Resilienz aufbauen ‚Äì und zwar ganzheitlich. Mit anderen Worten: es ist erfreulich, wenn wieder Solarpaneele in Deutschland gefertigt werden. Wenn aber der daf√ºr notwendige chemische Rohstoff noch immer aus dem Ausland kommen muss, sind wir genauso abh√§ngig wie zuvor.¬†Wenn man mich fragt, sage ich: ja, der #Br√ºckenstrompreis ist eine Investition in die Zukunftsf√§higkeit unseres Landes. Denn indem wir die Industrie in Deutschland halten und florieren lassen, sichern wir Arbeitspl√§tze, Wertsch√∂pfung, Resilienz und f√ºr unsere klimaneutrale #Transformation essenzielle Innovationskraft.

Let's fight the breeding ground of mistrust.Mistrust leads to cynicism. And cynicism leads to resignation. With dramatic consequences for the success of companies. That's why we have to fight any breeding ground of mistrust. I spoke with Stanford professor Jamil Zaki in my video series hashtag#ExpectTheUnexpected. Two questions concern me: How do companies counter a downward spiral of negative attitudes? And what is the role of leaders in this context? We consistently follow the path of a culture of trust. Because it leads us to high performance. These five ingredients are crucial for me:üëâ  Establish clear leadership values. For us, these are: Transparency, Engagement, Collaboration.üëâ Make sure that responsibility and accountability always go together.üëâ As a leader, model trust and thus give cynicism no chance.üëâ We focus on leadership skills that promote a culture of trust: empathy, active listening, curiosity, creation of psychological safety.üëâ Be consequent to preserve a culture of trust. What additional things strengthen a culture of trust? hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#Trust

thyssenkrupp is ready to tackle the hashtag#greentransformation. Warum ist eine #Kreislaufwirtschaft notwendig und wie kann sie funktionieren? Erkl√§rt am Beispiel von Covestro¬†Die Chemie- und Kunststoffindustrie ist ein bedeutender Faktor beim weltweiten Aussto√ü von Treibhausgasen und beim globalen Erd√∂lverbrauch. Gleichzeitig sind Kunststoffe unverzichtbar in unserem Alltag und auf unserem Weg hin zur #Klimaneutralit√§t. Ohne #Kunststoffe gibt es kein Smartphone, keinen K√ºhlschrank, dreht sich kein Windrad und f√§hrt auch kein Elektroauto. Kurzum: Wir sind nicht nur Teil des Problems, sondern auch ein entscheidender Teil der L√∂sung.¬†Wie also gelingt es Chemie- und Kunststoffunternehmen eine Kreislaufwirtschaft konkret umzusetzen? Bei Covestro konzentrieren wir uns auf vier S√§ulen, die als Katalysatoren f√ºr den historischen Wandel dienen:¬†1. Einsatz erneuerbarer #Rohstoffe anstelle von Erd√∂l: Wir setzen verst√§rkt auf Rohstoffe, die auf Biomasse und Bioabf√§llen basieren, und forschen an weiteren erneuerbaren Rohstoffen.¬†2. Betrieb unserer Anlagen mit erneuerbarer #Energie: Wir stellen unsere Standorte weltweit schrittweise auf erneuerbare Energien um und setzen dabei auf langfristige Gro√üliefervertr√§ge mit Energieanbietern.¬†3. Entwicklung innovativer #Recyclingverfahren: Wir treiben die Entwicklung von chemischen Recyclingverfahren voran, um Kunststoffabfall im gro√üen Stil als Rohstoff nutzen zu k√∂nnen.¬†4. F√∂rderung von #Partnerschaften: Wir setzen auf Kooperationen, um neue Technologien und Gesch√§ftsmodelle zu entwickeln und den Kreislauf vollst√§ndig zu schlie√üen.¬†Der Weg in die Kreislaufwirtschaft ist nicht einfach, aber richtig. Und wir sind entschlossen, ihn zu gehen. Denn wir glauben, dass eine nachhaltige Welt keine Utopie bleiben muss. Sie ist m√∂glich, wenn wir im Schulterschluss die Kreislaufwirtschaft zum globalen Leitprinzip machen.¬†Ich freue mich auf Ihre Gedanken und Meinungen dazu.¬†#FullyCircular

For the last two days, the Handelsblatt Auto-Gipfel 2023 took place at our headquarters in Essen. It was a valuable time for discussions among experts about the automotive sector's present and future. We are all focused on the hashtag#decarbonization of traffic and transportation, and the question of how we as a German hashtag#industry can maintain our strong position in times of geopolitical tensions. Electrifying vehicles is essential, as is greening materials, systems, and their sourcing and manufacturing. At the same time, we need to find answers to how we will be successful in a world where hashtag#digitization and big data are playing an increasingly important role. At this point, hashtag#autonomous driving is a crucial discipline.We don't have all the answers yet, but we are tackling the challenges ‚Äì with our innovative products and our motivated hashtag#GENERATIONTK team. At hashtag#thyssenkrupp we cover various key areas of the hashtag#automotive value chain like almost no other company. We have a unique position. thyssenkrupp Steel is leading the way in decarbonizing steel and promoting Europe's hashtag#hydrogen economy. Thanks to new processes we will produce climate neutrally in the future, for example for the automotive industry.As a diversified series supplier, our thyssenkrupp Automotive segment supplies our customers worldwide with hashtag#components, systems and services which are needed in all vehicles regardless of their driving system.And our materials trader thyssenkrupp Materials Services Services also contributes to the decarbonization of supply chains worldwide through digitalizing them, obtaining the energy they need exclusively from renewable resources and consistent hashtag#recyclingmanagement. Solid partnerships with car makers form the foundation for powerful future collaboration. We are determined to support manufacturers with our innovative strength and shape the hashtag#mobility of tomorrow together. For this, we need open discussions with all key parties and a well-planned industry policy that's executed with determination. Politics, business, science, and society must join forces. All sectors must collaborate for lasting global success. We are ready! hashtag#hbauto Copyright: Handelsblatt Auto-Gipfel/Photo Vogt

Progress in motion ‚Äì and no time to lose. The European Wind Power Action Plan unveiled today addresses many of the issues we are facing in the European wind industry.The European Commission wants to in particular: üîπ increase the visibility of auction schedules; üîπ put greater emphasis on non-price criteria in auctions;üîπ speed up permitting; üîπ increase funding for the wind industry‚Äôs supply chain;üîπ provide access to de-risking tools as well as to guarantees from the European Investment Bank;üîπ help with inflation-related cost increases; üîπ provide for a level playing field that ensures fair competition; andüîπ improve access to foreign markets and resources.  All of this is highly encouraging. But what Ursula von der Leyen said last year still holds true: ‚ÄúWe do not have the luxury of time.‚Äù The EU and its member states must implement these measures now to enable a resilient European wind industry, to realize the hashtag#EuropeanGreenDeal, and to ensure energy sovereignty in the EU.  I want to thank everyone at Siemens Gamesa and Siemens Energy who‚Äôs been working tirelessly to make hashtag#MoreWindNow a reality. We know we have a long way ahead of us. But if today has shown one thing, it is this: We will get there. hashtag#EuropeanWindPowerPackage hashtag#WindPowerActionPlan hashtag#WindIndustry hashtag#TeamSiemensGamesa hashtag#TeamPurple

Important signal coming out of the EU today. With the unveiling of the European Wind Power Action Plan, the necessary foundation is being provided to build a European wind industry that is resilient and globally competitive ‚Äì something we urgently need to navigate the perfect storm currently affecting the wind industry. In a nutshell, the plan addresses five key points:‚û°Ô∏è¬†Acceleration of permitting processes‚û°Ô∏è¬†Inclusion of mandatory qualitative criteria¬†in auction designs both as pre-qualification and award stages‚û°Ô∏è¬†Introduction of inflation compensation and stopping the impact of negative bidding‚û°Ô∏è¬†On Finance, more targeted funding for the wind supply chain and access to de-risking tools are equally important as the access to counter-guarantees from the European Investment Bank‚û°Ô∏è¬†Creation of a level playing field in the¬†European Single MarketThe decisiveness with which the European Commission has acted demonstrates that the EU can deliver a more prosperous Europe. But this is only just the beginning. It is now up to the EU, its Member States, and the whole wind power sector to work together to commit and implement the proposed measures of the action plan. A healthy wind industry is fundamental for Europe to achieve its climate targets¬†and build a resilient energy system. Time is of the essence. #windenergy #europe #energytransition #cleantech #europeangreendeal

Die Anerkennung der Notwendigkeit eines Br√ºckenstrompreises und die Fortsetzung des Spitzenausgleichs bei der Stromsteuer ist daher √§u√üerst erfreulich.¬†¬†Es gibt nach wie vor Punkte, die die Strategie nicht oder nicht ausreichend beleuchtet und die nachgebessert werden m√ºssen, darunter das europ√§ische B√ºrokratiemonster. These divisions, while not tangible as brick and mortar walls, are equally capable of hindering our shared progress, unity, and our path towards a sustainable future.¬†The antidote to this global fragmentation is our commitment to a fact-based and unbiased education system. As our societies become increasingly polarized, it is imperative that our education is rooted in facts, equipping individuals with the critical thinking skills necessary to navigate these complexities.¬†This is not just crucial for societal unity, but also for addressing the pressing climate crisis that our world is facing.¬†¬†This kind of education goes beyond the conventional curriculum. It calls on us as individuals to question biases, recognize our fallibilities, confront uncomfortable truths, and tirelessly strive to distinguish fact from narrative. In this exhausting process, we must always bear in mind that our unity does not lie in echoing similar thoughts. It lies in appreciating diverse perspectives, united by the indisputable truth of facts.¬†¬†From this unity, we can mitigate the far-reaching impact of societal disruptions, and foster a peaceful and diverse global society that is able to build a flourishing sustainable future.

To achieve hashtag#decarbonization in hashtag#industry, green hydrogen is essential. Have the courage to speak up and to trust!We live in a data-driven world where we often rely on data alone. We make arguments when they can be proven by data. The bigger and smarter, the better. On the other hand, we often leave out qualitative, ambiguous, or intuitive signals. The fear of not being taken seriously if ‚Äòweak signals‚Äô are involved is too great.I say: Have the courage to speak up! Here‚Äôs why:üëâ In a complex VUCA world, we can no longer rely solely on conventional predictions based on big and smart data. üëâ Weak signals such as qualitative, ambiguous, and intuitive information are therefore becoming increasingly important. üëâ It is crucial that we recognise weak signals, communicate them, and take them into account in our decision-making processes.üëâ For such a speak-up mentality, psychological safety in trusting relationships is indispensable. üëâ Leaders play a crucial role in establishing a culture of hashtag#transparency, hashtag#engagement and hashtag#collaboration based on trust. Weak signals can help to stay ahead of the competition and to outperform. Therefore, have the courage to speak up and to trust! hashtag#TogetherTalanx

hashtag#COP28 President-Designate, Dr. Sultan Al Jaber, convened a special meeting of industry leaders from the oil & gas, cement, steel, aluminum sectors, and heavy transportation to work together to drive global hashtag#decarbonization efforts.  The symposium saw the presence of notable personalities including HH Sheikh Hamed bin Zayed Al Nahyan, a member of the Abu Dhabi Executive Council, and John Kerry, the U.S. Special Presidential Envoy for Climate. The conversations were adeptly moderated by Dr. Daniel Yergin, Vice Chairman of S&P Global. John Kerry addressed the assembly, advocating for initiatives to eradicate methane emissions from the energy sector within this crucial decade and urging heightened commitment in response to the pressing challenges. It was great to be part of this pivotal event, which allowed me to exchange¬†thoughts and perspectives with my fellow CEO colleagues.¬†This assembly served as a forum for discussion and as a platform for innovative thinking and strategy development regarding hashtag#climatechange and renewable energies. Numerous solutions and innovative ideas were presented that could transform not only the hashtag#energy and industrial sectors but also have substantial impacts on global efforts to combat climate change. The discussions were characterized by a mutual understanding of the necessity to combat global warming and to accelerate the transition to more sustainable energy sources. Participants discussed how hydrogen holds the greatest promise for a fuel that will enable steel, cement and aluminum plants around the world to eliminate their hashtag#greenhouse gas emissions but needs support to dramatically scale up. The event highlighted the critical necessity for an integrative and collective approach involving all sectors and industries to meet the established climate goals and forge a sustainable and resource-efficient future. The emphasis was undeniably on the urgent need for decisive actions in renewable energies and climate adaptation.  hashtag#Greentransformation is an imperative: And we, at hashtag#thyssenkrupp, will make a significant contribution to this. With our innovative technologies, which cover the entire hashtag#hydrogen value chain.

Today, we took a big leap towards a greener future. Together with his Majesty King Willem-Alexander of the Netherlands, Helene Bistr√∂m, and Dr. Martin Bruderm√ºller, I had the honor of officially inaugurating Hollandse Kust Zuid 1-4, the world‚Äôs first subsidy-free offshore wind farm. ¬†Located in the North Sea, Hollandse Kust Zuid 1-4 is expected to supply energy equivalent to powering 1.5 million households annually. This landmark project is a testament to the Dutch government‚Äôs mission to combat climate change and secure the Netherlands with renewable energy for the next generation. At Allianz, we are delighted with the collaborative partnership with BASF and Vattenfall that made this project a reality.Hollandse Kust Zuid 1-4 represents a milestone achievement for Allianz, as it is our first direct offshore wind farm investment. We are committed to driving the green energy transition by decarbonizing our own operations. Allianz also invests policyholder funds in renewable energy and owns more than 100 wind and solar farms.We cannot mitigate climate change unless we work together to accelerate the global transition to renewable energy. This project demonstrates the power that partnerships have in slashing carbon emissions and fostering sustainable economic growth. ¬†Congratulations to all involved in Hollandse Kust Zuid 1-4. At Allianz, we look forward to partnering with others on more projects that steer our economy towards a sustainable, resilient, and prosperous future, powered by clean energy. ¬†Find more information here: https://lnkd.in/di5APq4c#AllianzOnClimate #NetZero #ClimateChange #EnergyTransition #Allianz¬†Photo credits: Photo 1 Jorrit Lousberg/Light at Work Photography, Photo 2 and 3 Matthias Ibeler

How do you bid farewell to a legend? Well, that‚Äôs an easy one: You can‚Äôt. A legend is a legend ‚Äì a legend is ‚Äúingoodbyeable‚Äù‚Ä¶ üòä Accordingly, I‚Äôm writing just a few thoughts on Thomas Flohr here ‚Äì no more, no less. To claim that Thomas played a pivotal role in defining and shaping #ComputedTomography (CT) at Siemens Healthineers would be equally blatant and inaccurate. As a matter of fact, without him, the history of CT ‚Äì at least at Siemens Healthineers, perhaps even overall ‚Äì would have taken a very different course. After all, he is one of THE key persons to whom we owe our global #innovation and market #leadership in CT.Whether it is spiral CT, multi-slice CT, cardio CT, 3D post-processing applications, dual-source CT, or photon counting CT ‚Äì Thomas has been one of the driving forces behind these pioneering breakthroughs, that provide crucial diagnostic information to hundreds of thousands of patients worldwide, every day. Ever more precise. Ever faster. Ever patient friendlier. Around 200 patents and awards, such as the Siemens Innovator of the Year and three times finalist for the Deutscher Zukunftspreis of the German Federal President, seem almost secondary compared to his legendary reputation among customers and research partners. Thomas adds weight to a discussion simply by attending ‚Äì everyone knows, he only deals with the essentials.You won‚Äôt hear anything half-baked from him ‚Äì when he speaks up, it‚Äôs important! I learned that many years ago and have never forgotten it. When I took over the leadership of our CT business in 2004, we ‚Äì literally ‚Äì exchanged ideas intensively, meaning: I went into the discussion with MY opinion and came out of the discussion with HIS opinion. This seemed quite normal to me, thanks to Thomas‚Äô amazing talent for simplifying complex matters. Usually, you only recognize that the discussion had been around tricky topics, when you try to put into your own words what you have learned and fail ‚Äì ‚Äúwhat did he say again??‚ÄùThroughout his career at #SiemensHealthineers, Thomas Flohr has embodied what we summed up two years ago as the purpose of our company: We pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare ‚Äì for everyone, everywhere. With his retirement, the legend and the dialogue partner remain.

Be courageous, be authentic, take ownership! This was one of our core messages at the closing event of the Talanx Leadership Journey. Over the last three years of our journey, we have developed a common understanding of leadership in our different business units around the globe. Our common principles are hashtag#transparency, hashtag#engagement and hashtag#collaboration based on hashtag#trust.  Now it's important to move forward with the lessons learned. The moment of truth is out there on the pitch. Kudos to Ludovic Subran and his team of experts at Allianz Economic Research for today‚Äôs launch of the 2023 Allianz Global Wealth Report. Their work provides important insight into the factors impacting wealth formation around the globe. This year‚Äôs report explores wealth in the context of geopolitical, environmental, and economic transition. It shows how inflation and geopolitical tensions are generally dampening wealth growth but also spotlights how individual savings practices and investing strategies in certain markets help many avoid stagnation. ¬†These macro insights inform how we at Allianz work with our customers across our 70 different global markets, helping them navigate economic headwinds to optimize growth. As the report makes clear, there is much work still to do. Globally, wealth remains concentrated in too few hands. Reversing this trajectory and literally ‚Äúspreading the wealth‚Äù requires new ways of thinking and operating, including leveraging the massive growth opportunities in decarbonization and digitalization. It also requires a broadening of fundamental financial literacy, which the report spotlights as a key driver in long-term individual wealth formation. ¬†¬†To learn more about other key findings from the Allianz Global Wealth Report, check out the full report here: https://lnkd.in/ewkWTJtz¬†#FinancialLiteracy #AllianzGlobalWealthReport #Allianz

The 70th anniversary of Polycarbonates takes me on a trip down memory lane.From the outset of my career as a chemist, I was immediately captivated by the boundless versatility and immense potential of #Polycarbonates. Logically, I was incredibly proud when I was given the opportunity to lead the Polycarbonates division at Bayer MaterialScience, which later became Covestro. Together with my colleagues, we wrote a defining chapter in the ongoing story of Polycarbonates.Zooming out to the broader historical context, Polycarbonates have been engineered to shield, protect, and simplify our modern lives. Their impact is widespread, from improving safety through helmets and protective glasses, to revolutionizing data storage via CDs and DVDs. They are enhancing our vision as spectacle lenses and have become a key material in the automotive industry for cutting down CO‚ÇÇ emissions without sacrificing safety.As we venture into the next chapter, our objective is clear: to prepare Polycarbonates for a #CircularEconomy. Through collaborative efforts, we create and enhance solutions across the value chain that make Polycarbonates future-proof. In doing so, we ensure that they continue to positively influence our lives and those of future generations. I'm excited and proud to be a part of this chapter, too.#70YearsOfPolycarbonates #FullyCircular

I‚Äôm often asked what will make the biggest difference to tackling climate change: policy, investment, innovation, or political leadership? My response is always ‚Äúpeople that are committed to change‚Äù. And I‚Äôm reminded of this every day in the conversations I have with my colleagues of hashtag#TeamSiemensGamesa. That‚Äôs why we at Siemens Gamesa have worked together with the Sustainable Development Solutions Network to organize the ‚ÄúUniversities for SDG13‚Äù competition to encourage and promote young talent in the fight against climate change. To mark hashtag#ZeroEmissionsDay, I‚Äôd like to congratulate the students of Case Western Reserve University for their project ‚ÄúE-Gora: The Energy Marketplace‚Äù. It seeks to bridge the gap between different players in the energy marketplace by providing a platform that allows users to swiftly and easily find information about nearby renewable energy projects that they can participate in.It‚Äôs this creativity and dedication to climate action that will help us on our way to net zero. Thank you to all the mentors from across Siemens Gamesa, as well as the teaching staff, who have supported participants in the last few months. hashtag#MoreWindNow hashtag#RenewableEnergy hashtag#ZEDay23 hashtag#SDG hashtag#ClimateWeekNYC

I was honored to represent Allianz at the 2023 UN Climate Ambition Summit in New York yesterday. When UN Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres launched this summit, he warned that ‚Äúthe price of entry is non-negotiable ‚Äì credible, serious and new climate action and nature-based solutions that move the needle forward and respond to the urgency of the climate crisis." He created the Summit to accelerate action by governments, business, finance, local authorities, and civil society, and hear from ‚Äúfirst movers and doers.‚Äù I am grateful to our employees who work tirelessly to put Allianz in the ‚Äúfirst movers and doers‚Äù category. Mitigating climate change is a huge growth opportunity that requires a global transformation. Individuals and companies cannot achieve this alone and yet we must all take a stand and lead by example. This is what Allianz did when we published our net zero transition plan a few day ago, in line with UN-backed credibility criteria. And, what we did in 2019, when Allianz joined with other investors to launch the UN convened Net Zero Asset Owner Alliance (NZAOA), which we chair. Today, the NZAOA‚Äôs 86 members include insurers, pension funds, foundations, and endowments -- all committed to moving their investment portfolios to net zero by 2050. The NZAOA truly is leading the way. The majority of its members, including Allianz, have already set credible intermediate net-zero targets for 2025 or 2030. But the world has profoundly changed since 2019. The era of geopolitical stability, robust economic growth and low inflation has been eroded by uncertainty, volatility, and war. The resulting polarization and conflict are the enemies of a carbon neutral world. They distract us from making bold changes and developing the cross-disciplinary, multi-lateral solutions needed to achieve a net zero planet. My message today at the United Nations was clear. We cannot allow polarization to breed distrust that prevents effective climate partnerships. Organizing resources around our common goal is the only way to solve a problem as systemic as climate change, and this requires a united global community. To avert climate disaster, we need to unify. We also need to be honest and transparent about costs and trade-offs. 2050 targets for a ‚Äúsustainable future‚Äù is an abstract message for those struggling to put food on the table today. Policymakers must focus on pragmatic, market-based solutions that reflect economic realities and deliver tangible benefits. Our net-zero journey will be challenging, but we are committed to act through transparent and tangible transition plans. The UN-convened Net Zero Asset Owner Alliance is an invaluable partner for driving the transition. I invite others to join us as members, supporters, doers, and first-movers.#AllianzOnClimate #ClimateAction #ClimateActionSummit #Allianz

Die Messe zeigt: Die Telekom stellt gemeinsam mit vielen Partnern ein digitales √ñkosystem f√ºr die Unternehmen in Deutschland bereit. Anders gesagt: Es gibt f√ºr alles eine L√∂sung. Und inzwischen gibt es f√ºr alles auch digitale L√∂sungen ‚Äì made, configured or hosted in Germany. Von der DigitalX geht also ein wichtiger Impuls aus. Bei der #Digitalisierung d√ºrfen wir nicht aus dem Fenster schauen. Da f√§hrt die Digitalisierung an uns vorbei. Sondern wir m√ºssen in den Spiegel schauen. Dann passiert sie bei uns. Machen wir uns also auf den Weg. Bei der DigitalX geht es um konkrete L√∂sungen. Es geht um Vernetzung. Nicht nur virtuell, sondern auch ganz pers√∂nlich. Bj√∂rn Ulvaeus hat am Beispiel Musik anschaulich √ºber das Verh√§ltnis von Mensch und KI berichtet ‚Äì und sieht sie als Helfer im kreativen Prozess, die selbst ihm ‚Äûneue k√ºnstlerische Welten‚Äú erschlie√üt. Eine positive Sicht also.George Clooney sprach von der wichtigen Arbeit der Clooney Foundation for Justice. Die Stiftung nutzt KI um Instagram, X und andere Plattformen systematisch zu scannen und Beweismaterial f√ºr Menschenrechtsverletzungen zu sammeln, um T√§ter zur Verantwortung zu ziehen.Sehr bewegend war der Auftritt von Dr. Wladimir Klitschko und Tatjana Kiel, die von den Verschleppungen von Kindern in der Ukraine berichtet haben. Was einmal mehr zeigt, wie wichtig unsere Solidarit√§t und unsere Unterst√ºtzung f√ºr die #Ukraine ist. Wir d√ºrfen nicht nachlassen. Danke an alle, die die DigitalX in diesem Jahr auf die Beine gestellt haben. Insbesondere unseren vielen Speakerinnen und Speakern, die wertvolle Impulse gesetzt haben. Bei all den wichtigen und ernsten Themen kam mit Barbara Sch√∂neberger als Moderatorin auch der Humor nicht zu kurz. Wie sagte sie so treffend: In K√∂ln gilt die DigitalX inzwischen als die sechste Jahreszeit. Bei ganz viel gef√ºhltem ‚ÄûAschermittwoch‚Äú im Land tut so ein Digitalisierungs-Aufbruch sicher gut!

"Let us come together for the common good". With these words, Secretary-General Ant√≥nio Guterres concluded his address to the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) in New York this week. The common good we at Siemens Healthineers are working for is access to hashtag#healthcare ‚Äì globally. The hashtag#Concordia23 Annual Summit, from which I have just returned, was running parallel to the hashtag#UNGA. And much like the UNGA, the Concordia Summit was also dominated by the hashtag#SustainableDevelopmentGoals. I truly enjoyed the fireside chat on "Innovation to Achieve Healthcare Accessibility"¬†with Dr. John N. Nkengasong, Ambassador-At-Large, U.S. Global AIDS Coordinator, and Special Representative for Global Health Diplomacy, whom I had the honor to interview on stage. Couldn‚Äôt agree more with his thoughts and ideas on structural hashtag#innovation for hashtag#healthequity on regional, national, and global levels ‚Äì medtech is global, healthcare is local! It was inspiring to meet Nigeria's president Bola Ahmed Tinubu, and to feel the momentum of the country and how he has put healthcare next to education at the center of his presidency. I was humbled by how much time President Jo√£o Louren√ßo of Angola took to discuss the way forward to fight the NCDs (non-communicable diseases) like cancer together.¬†In the conversation with the Minister of Health of Uzbekistan, his Excellency¬†Amrillo Inoyatov, we intensively discussed our Access-to-Care strategy against the backdrop of the needs of his country, and I was very impressed by his vision of collaboration.¬†And talking about tackling healthcare challenges in Europe, the open exchange with Will Quince, Minister of State at the Department of Health and Social Care of the United Kingdom, showed how much we can contribute: as an employer of more than 3,000 Healthineers in the UK, as a research partner for the leading academic medical centers, and most importantly as a long-term partner of more and more NHS trusts.  Finally, I am very proud that we have entered into a very concrete agreement with the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) to support low- and middle-income countries with diagnosing and fighting cancer. All in all, great and encouraging discussions, exchanges, and encounters which underscore once again that our company purpose is spot on: We pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare ‚Äì for everyone, everywhere.

At SAP, we're focused on unlocking the potential of technology for our customers, and it was a privilege to talk about this topic in more detail at this year's German-speaking SAP User Group (DSAG e.V.)¬†in Bremen. When it comes to responding with agility and speed to changing market conditions, cloud is key. Being able to quickly transform a business model requires systems and processes that can rapidly adopt new innovations ‚Äì and that's exactly what the cloud enables. In the cloud, companies consume software #innovation quickly and easily, ensuring they can stay competitive in their industry.Taking #AI as an example: We want to make sure that our AI capabilities offer the highest value to our customers, delivered in a way that is #relevant, #reliable, and #responsible. An on-premise architecture simply doesn't have what it takes to do this: small data sets, data silos, lack of data governance all lead to poor AI quality. Effective, high-quality AI needs high-quality data ‚Äì in real time, in high volumes, with high levels of security, data science expertise, data governance, and harmonized data models ‚Äì something that can only be provided via a cloud architecture. With #RISEwithSAP and #GROWwithSAP, we're helping our customers on their journey to the cloud and the many benefits it offers. And at the same time, we remain fully committed to serving our on-premise customers who chose to run their SAP S/4HANA on premise, with maintenance that will continue to 2040. We'll keep delivering continuous improvements and innovations to these customers, safeguarding their investments to ensure no one is left behind on this journey. A huge thank you to my special guest Ben M. Windhorst and of course to everyone at DSAG for a great event ‚Äì I look forward to continuing this important work with you! #DSAGJK23

Seit fast zwei Jahren bricht die Produktion der energieintensiven Industrien in Deutschland ein ‚Äì hohe Energiekosten machen die Produktion wichtiger Industrieprodukte unwirtschaftlich.¬†Die Konsequenz fehlender Weitsicht, die wir jetzt unbedingt brauchen.¬†Wir haben es vers√§umt, rechtzeitig in eine resiliente Energieversorgung zu investieren, und zahlen nun den Preis daf√ºr. Unsere zu einseitige Abh√§ngigkeit von einzelnen Energiequellen, insbesondere russischem Gas, und die Verz√∂gerungen beim Ausbau erneuerbarer Energien zeigen, wie kritisch es ist, vorausschauend zu planen und dabei #Resilienz zu priorisieren.¬†Dieser Fehler darf uns nicht erneut passieren. Besonders nicht in einem Sektor, der f√ºr den Wirtschaftsstandort Deutschland von so zentraler Bedeutung ist: der energieintensiven Industrie. Sie steht am Anfang etlicher Wertsch√∂pfungsketten und stellt essenzielle Vorprodukte f√ºr viele andere Industrien her. Dieses starke Fundament d√ºrfen wir nicht leichtfertig aufs Spiel setzen. Es muss verteidigt und gen√§hrt werden, vor allem in einer globalisierten Welt, in der Lieferketten komplexer und fragiler werden.¬†Jetzt ist die Zeit, Weitsicht zu zeigen und den¬†Abw√§rtstrend umzukehren. So vermeiden wir neue Abh√§ngigkeiten und erhalten essenzielle Innovationskraft und Wertsch√∂pfung, die wir f√ºr unsere klimaneutrale Transformation brauchen.

Commission President Ursula von der Leyen clearly backed the European Green Deal at her "State of the Union" last week. That is a good thing. She also stressed, "We will keep supporting European industry throughout this transition." That, too, is a good thing. She also stressed the need to reduce bureaucracy by 25%. This is a promising step. But (only) in the context for SMEs. Here is where President von der Leyen lost me, because excessive #bureaucracy is a problem for all businesses ‚Äì big or small. The chart shows the various legal requirements for ESG reporting that will be mandatory for companies like mine starting next year. Don't understand? Don't worry, you're not alone there, only experts can understand. Looks like a lot of bureaucracy? Indeed, especially because there is no sign that the frameworks will be harmonized for at least the next two years. Is a job creation program for consultants and auditors? Absolutely, because a medium-sized company cannot afford such a great specialist department as I have. Nevertheless, the reporting of numerous different KPIs also leads to avoidable costs for us and certainly does not make us any faster in the energy transition.So: reducing bureaucracy is more than just digitizing the residents' registration office. In the end, the reduction of bureaucracy must also be measured by the fact that legislation reduces administrative regulations instead of creating new ones. Then the Green Deal can also be delivered at speed.

We can speed up the sustainability transition through digitalization and technology. The extreme weather we‚Äôre experiencing around the world shows we urgently need to act. This is also the conclusion of our new research report: progress on decarbonization is too slow and acceleration has to be a top priority. No single organization has all the answers. But together, we have the technology and the know-how to become greener across energy systems, mobility and buildings. https://sie.ag/65h1v8#Digitalization #Sustainability #Decarbonization

When leading people, create an environment of psychological safety. This is one of my key messages during my conversation with Wolfgang Jenewein, Professor at University St. Gallen and Founder of JENEWEIN, on his podcast ‚ÄúMoving Mindsets‚Äù. Thanks for the invitation! Wolfgang asked me to give advice to aspiring leaders.I would like to share my recommendations with you:üëâ Give people energy,üëâ Trust people,üëâ Empower people,üëâ Create an environment of psychological safety where people feel safe to speak up,üëâ Actively listen to people to solve conflicts or to create something new with them,üëâ Celebrate success with people.What do you think about these topics? I'm really looking forward to your comments!hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#Transparencyhashtag#Engagementhashtag#Collaboration

European wind turbine manufacturers, including us at Siemens Gamesa, know how difficult progress can be. But no matter how hard: We know what an important contribution we can make in the fight against hashtag#ClimateChange. And while the window for meaningful progress is narrowing, the only choice for us is to move forward and act collectively ‚Äì in Europe and across the globe.  Today is the start of hashtag#ClimateWeekNYC. It‚Äôs an opportunity for the global climate community of policymakers, industry, and leaders from civil society to come together and address the challenge of climate action. Because we need all stakeholders, across societies and across borders, to pull together to speed up the hashtag#EnergyTransition. We have no time to lose.  Just in the last few days, however, the European hashtag#WindIndustry has received conflicting messages, proving that progress does not follow a straight line.  In a powerful State of the Union address, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen committed to a hashtag#EuropeanWindPowerPackage to fast-track permitting, improve the auction system, and focus on skills, access to finance, and stabilizing the supply chain. It was a welcome message to all of us committed to building a resilient, globally competitive European wind industry.  On the other hand, the UK government missed a significant opportunity in its latest round of the Contracts for Difference scheme. Despite its leadership position in hashtag#offshore wind, the UK risks falling behind on implementation by removing certainty and stability that Contracts for Difference have provided.  This is why Climate Week NYC matters. While climate change continues its consistent path, we must work together to become more consistent ourselves and act to accelerate the transition to hashtag#CleanEnergy. Because we know what we need to do. We know the solutions that exist to reach hashtag#NetZero by 2050. And we know that we must scale implementation, urgently.  I wish all my colleagues from Siemens Gamesa and Siemens Energy, and delegates from around the world, a productive week in New York City.  hashtag#TeamSiemensGamesa hashtag#MoreWindNow hashtag#RenewableEnergy hashtag#EnergyPolicy

Our annual Covestro clean-up event in Dormagen, Germany holds a special place on my agenda. This year, it wasn‚Äôt easy to defend this tradition on my calendar, but I‚Äôm glad I was successful. Here's why I think it was worth every minute of my time.¬†Covered in sand and surrounded by like-minded people digging out old car tires and barrels I had many meaningful conversations about both work-related and personal matters, the kind of discussions that often get sidelined during busy workweeks. The more waste we retrieved from the area, the more colleagues I got to speak with and learn from, all while collectively contributing to a cleaner environment.¬†This year's clean-up reminded me once again about the need to address waste pollution ‚Äì we mustn‚Äôt allow the crises we‚Äôve been dealing with in the past years to distract us from this important issue. We must go beyond surface-level actions and change our fundamental thinking to avoid creating another crisis to deal with in the future.¬†Transitioning from the traditional linear to the emerging #CircularEconomy requires dedication and collaboration across the entire value chain. This involves educating ourselves and our stakeholders about responsible consumption, designing for recycling, improving waste management and recycling methods, and, ultimately, creating profitable markets for #recycled and #renewable materials.¬†As the clean-up event in Dormagen was coming to an end, we lined up to take a group picture with all the waste we had collected. It‚Äôs one of my favorite clean-up moments when we realize what we had achieved together, and that by just picking it up from the beach we managed to give waste a chance to become a valuable raw material for new useful products.¬†To my colleagues participating in clean-ups worldwide: Thank you for your commitment and action for a cleaner environment ‚Äî at work and at the clean-ups.¬†#WorldCleanupDay #FullyCircular #cleanupday

T√ºrkiye has always played a pivotal role in geopolitics and global business. My visit to T√ºrkiye this week has been meaningful to me on many levels. Through valuable in-person interactions with the teams at Allianz T√ºrkiye, I was able to see firsthand the energy and optimism of the Turkish people ‚Äîespecially against the backdrop of significant macroeconomic hardship and tragic natural disaster. Yesterday in Istanbul, Tolga G√ºrkan, Sirma Boshnakova and I participated in a townhall meeting celebrating the 100th anniversary of Allianz T√ºrkiye.An important message I shared with our people, is that these moments of crisis serve as a reminder of our strength. Allianz T√ºrkiye‚Äôs achievements in employee motivation, technology advancements and loyalty scores is key to our overall Group success.At Allianz, our primary goal is to secure the future and serve as a trusted partner in safeguarding our customers' most valuable assets, especially in the face of unexpected events. I find inspiration in the resilience of the Turkish people and am proud of the many Allianz employees who were essential in the company‚Äôs ‚Ç¨6 million relief efforts.I want to express my gratitude to the teams at Allianz T√ºrkiye for their commitment to our mission and their continued openness to embrace innovative thinking. These qualities have contributed to Allianz T√ºrkiye‚Äôs success.Thank you for all that you do. Here‚Äôs to the next 100 years. ¬†#AllianzTurkiye #TurkiyeEarthquake #Allianz Allianz Trade Allianz Partners

Der Konsens w√§chst: Deutschland braucht eine starke Industrie und muss jetzt handeln, um sie zu erhalten. Danke an Nathanael Liminski und Frank Hyldmar f√ºr den konstruktiven Austausch diese Woche bei der Currenta GmbH & Co. OHG. We at Siemens Gamesa know what tough feels like. We‚Äôre in the middle of tough ‚Äì and we are determined to get through it because we know how much is at stake. More generally, this is also true for Europe and its hashtag#WindIndustry, and it is true for Europe‚Äôs biggest economy, Germany, where HUSUM WIND took place this week with over 600 exhibitors (and 15,000 visitors) dedicated to advancing the energy transition. As Robert Habeck, Germany‚Äôs Minister for Economic Affairs and Climate Action, said in his opening speech in Husum: ‚ÄúWithin eight years, we need to double the capacity of wind turbines we‚Äôve built in the last more than twenty years. Within eight years, we need to more than triple the capacity of hashtag#offshore turbines. That means that with the existing practice of permitting, planning, zoning, and political gridlock, we're not going to achieve that goal.‚Äù  So ‚Äúquo vadis?‚Äù Where is the expansion of Germany‚Äôs and Europe‚Äôs wind energy headed? What about us manufacturers who bear the greatest risk in the value chain? And what is the role of hashtag#IndustrialPolicy at this pivotal moment?  These were some of the questions we discussed at the hashtag#HusumWind2023 panel of VDMA, the largest network organization for the machinery and equipment manufacturing industry in Germany and Europe. My take on what Europe‚Äôs wind industry needs right now:  üîπ Speedy hashtag#PermittingProcesses ‚Äì European wind power projects with a capacity of 80 gigawatts are currently awaiting approval. üîπ¬†Mechanisms to compensate for inflation, and no additional bid payments in auctions for hashtag#WindPowerProjects. üîπ¬†Sufficient financing which includes guarantees to strengthen the industry and supply chains and, ultimately, Europe‚Äôs competitiveness.üîπ Qualitative auction criteria that recognize the value of the European renewables supply chain.üîπ¬†Fair competition, a hashtag#LevelPlayingField among all global manufacturers, and supportive trade agreements to protect the climate and ensure access to key global supply chains. We at Siemens Gamesa are in a difficult moment. And we are working tirelessly to get through it. Because we know that if policymakers continue to adjust the framework conditions we need, manufacturers like Siemens Gamesa will play an important role in transforming our energy systems. As I shared here a couple of days ago, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced a hashtag#EuropeanWindPower package to address the points above by ‚Äúworking closely with industry and member states.‚Äù This is a promising step forward. And it is motivation enough for us to live up to our own ambitions.

Yesterday, our top 150 leaders at thyssenkrupp came together to discuss how to unleash our full potential. One thing is clear to all of us: the biggest challenge confronting our society is the fight against climate change. For us, and the economy, this means the green hashtag#transformation of an entire hashtag#industry.Over recent years, our focus has been on embracing innovative technologies. The reports of my colleagues yesterday have highlighted that this foresight enables us to exploit the enormous opportunities of the green transformation ‚Äì for us and for our customers. At thyssenkrupp, we are in the unique position to cover the entire hashtag#hydrogen value chain. To leverage these synergies and strengthen our performance, we are uniting our key technologies for green transformation with in a new segment: thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies.With our hashtag#slewingbearings from thyssenkrupp rothe erde, we are paving the way for the energy transition. As global number 1, our products are used by almost all well-known manufacturers of wind turbines. The global expansion plans for onshore and offshore wind farms are gigantic ‚Äì and so are the growth opportunities for thyssenkrupp rothe erde.Without renewable energy, there can be no green hydrogen. A critical need for the industry. thyssenkrupp nucera, a world leading supplier of hashtag#electrolysis plants for the production of green hydrogen on a large scale. The successful hashtag#IPO and quick listing in SDAX have once again shown the enormous potential.In the future, green hydrogen will be produced mainly where renewable energy is available at low cost. To transport it to the places where it‚Äôs needed, a transport medium is required: hashtag#ammonia. thyssenkrupp Uhde is one of the global technology leaders in ammonia cracking and the construction of green ammonia plants.Besides other industries, hashtag#cement production is one of the biggest levers for reducing emissions. With their innovative technologies thyssenkrupp Polysius is one of the pioneers for the climate-neutral transformation of the cement industry. Also because there is still a long way to go, the potential here is tremendous.In this process, we close the segments Multi Tracks and Industrial Components. thyssenkrupp Automation Engineering, thyssenkrupp Springs & Stabilizers and thyssenkrupp Forged Technologies will merge under thyssenkrupp Automotive. I am looking forward to tackling the additional task as CEO of the new segment with our outstanding team. With this reorganization to our own ‚Äúgreen industrial powerhouse‚Äù, we are focusing even more on the opportunities of the future. Green transformation becomes the heart of our strategy ‚Äì not only at thyssenkrupp Decarbon Technologies, but also at our other segments. At the same time, our performance program is enabling all our businesses to maximize the potential of the green transformation and other market opportunities. This is how we become the technology leader in the field of hashtag#sustainability!

Mistrust destroys culture and success ‚Äì this example shows how it happens. Cynicism trap is a term coined by Stanford professor Jamil Zaki. A self-reinforcing downward spiral of mistrust in the company. Which brings out the bad side in people. In the third video of our hashtag#ExpectTheUnexpected series with him, Jamil describes a particularly impressive case in which the destructive power of mistrust becomes clear. To put it bluntly: Mistrust is never a good way for people to get trust in you. üëâ Trust is the sum of experiences. One bad experience can destroy everything.üëâ Mistrust leads to cynicism. And the cynicism trap leads to resignation.üëâ Therefore, mistrust weakens corporate culture and successüëâ Leaders need to build trusting relationships through emotional intelligence, active listening and humbleness.  When was the last time you experienced the power of trust?hashtag#Together hashtag#Trust

We cannot power a competitive European economy without power grids! We all have a sense by now that the investment challenge is tremendous. But the CAPEX story is not the whole story. It‚Äôs also an OPEX challenge to secure the digital solutions, equipment and workforce we sorely need. I can speak from personal experience: at E.ON alone we will need to make 1 connection every 7 seconds of every working hour by 2030. This calls for new approaches in regulation, but also in planning, permitting, cooperation and engagement with local communities.¬†¬†This was the central message I gave as Eurelectric President at yesterday‚Äôs High Level Grids Conference organized by ENTSO-E in Brussels, which brought together industry, regulators and policymakers from across Europe to help forge the way forward.¬†¬†From my perspective there are three key actions that the EU can now take forward:- A bold European political drive: a new European project to supercharge investment in electricity grids must be agreed at high level by European political leaders. Commissioner Simson and Vicepresident Ribera‚Äôs strong show of commitment yesterday was a brilliant start. It‚Äôs time to build on this momentum. - New regulatory approaches are a must. For grid assets to be built ahead of new generation or demand, we need more clarity and certainty about the treatment of anticipatory investments. When it comes to operational expenses, like for digitalization and personnel, we must be allowed to adapt more flexibly to the massive task. And obviously regulation must reflect realities of financial markets and provide adequate returns.- Reframe the ‚Äútoothpaste‚Äù discussion. It‚Äôs not flexibility versus expansion, but flexibility AND expansion. Yes, we need to squeeze out the most capacity out of existing grids (like a tube of toothpaste, obviously), but we also just need to buy more tubes of toothpaste. In remote areas, where there‚Äôs virtually no consumption but a lot of RES injection, we will have to completely transform the grid.¬†¬†Time is running already. Grid capacity is not an issue of the future but is prevalent now and critical to hitting our 2030 targets.¬†At E.ON and in Eurelectric we continue working to deliver this positive agenda.
