Strategy meeting with the Supervisory BoardThe T is hanging! Our Greek subsidiary OTE has taken the first step toward our Magenta brand. A strong sign of belonging on the occasion of our Supervisory Board retreat in Athens. Perhaps OTE will soon belong not only to the Telekom family, but also to the family of the world's most valuable telco brand. The T! Thank you, dear colleagues, for your hospitality.How can we continue to be successful in the current geopolitical environment, with inflation, rising interest rates and energy costs, higher construction costs, high competition, more regulation and substitution risks? We discuss this and our way forward once a year with our Supervisory Board under the leadership of Frank Appel.We have not changed our strategy. We want to continue to grow with the best networks, the best service, digital solutions for business customers. But we have become more concrete and have given ourselves very specific tasks ("missions") for each area. For me, the most important thing is to gain and leverage synergies. For example, through standardized software that we use throughout the Group and digital solutions based on it that we offer to our (business) customers. But also by being able to offer routers or our T-Phone in all markets, for example, which gives us economies of scale. We want our business to continue to be sustainable. This means: Future-proof and efficient. Environmentally friendly and socially responsible. A good social partnership also contributes to this. It is good to see the high level at which Telekom's Supervisory Board discusses new technologies and our business challenges.With confidence and a rainbow over the Acropolis, we are now moving on to implementation. #wewontstop Michael Tsamaz

Ein gro√üer Schritt in Richtung #Kreislaufwirtschaft f√ºr Kunststoffe¬†Der BDE Bundesverband der Deutschen Entsorgungs-, Wasser- und Kreislaufwirtschaft e. V., PlasticsEurope Deutschland e. It's not only the idea that counts, but the person presenting it! Below is a list of 5 tips how to convince a C-level executive.Yesterday, I had the opportunity to speak at the kick-off event of our International Management Development Programme. 23 leaders from eleven countries and several continents will participate in this programme for nine months. They will study management theory, but also work on joint projects across different time zones. One of the theoretical topics of the programme is how to convince C-level executives of an idea. During my presentation, I was asked to reveal what inspires me as a CEO the most.My key message was: It's not only the idea that counts, but the person presenting it! I pay attention to the following points:üëâ Is the idea backed up with meaningful facts?üëâ Does the person believe in it?üëâ Does the body language support what is being said?üëâ Does the person seem competent, consequent in the implementation, and friendly, so that he or she can also inspire other people for an idea and its realisation? üëâ Does the person seem to match our values hashtag#transparency, hashtag#engagement and hashtag#collaboration based on hashtag#trust?In my decision-making process one thing is very important to me: I know my personal biases and I eliminate them as much as possible when making decisions. I look forward to hearing great ideas from great leaders! I wish all participants a lot of fun and success for this year's International Management Development Programme!When are you inspired by an idea or a person? I look forward to your comments!

By my estimation, it takes over 500 trees to offset the carbon generated by a typical air conditioner. If correct, it argues for keeping the AC on for as little as possible.My calculation:The ACs at my home are 1.5 tons, which (coincidentally) run at about 1.5 kilowatt of energy. That‚Äôs 1.5 kilowatt hour every hour, of course.The amount of CO2 per kilowatt hour depends on how green the electricity production and transmission is but varies between 0.4-1 kg CO2. In India, it is closer to 1. So let‚Äôs say a 1.5 kWh AC usage generates 1.5 kg CO2 every hour.A grown tree absorbs 70 grams of CO2 in a day, by some estimates.The AC running all day is generating 1.5x24=36 kilos of CO2 in a day.So you need 36,000/70 or over 500 fully grown trees to support your AC habit!And that‚Äôs just one AC.hashtag#ClimateEmergency

Leading by weak signals is the art of tackling the challenges of a VUCA world!But how can leaders master this art? And what are weak signals? Yesterday, I had the opportunity to answer these questions in my keynote speech on the Berlin campus of the ESCP Business School. Talent management is key for Talanx and HDI Group. Therefore, thanks to Veronique Tran for the opportunity to exchange ideas with executive MBA and master students! What I wish to pass on to the aspiring leaders: üëâ We live in a very dynamic VUCA environment. One cannot rely only on conventional predictions based on strong signals from big or smart data.üëâ Weak signals are becoming more and more important. Weak signals are qualitative, ambiguous, and intuitive signals. They are early signs of possible changes that may become significant later and trigger a meaningful trend.üëâ As leaders, we need a broad picture to make the right decisions. A culture of hashtag#transparency, hashtag#engagement, hashtag#collaboration based on hashtag#trust encourages employees to speak up and put forward arguments based on weak signals.üëâ A decentralised organisation and a focus on relative performance also help companies to identify weak signals and outperform in a complex VUCA world.Thanks to all students for the exchange. I wish you much success for your studies!   hashtag#TogetherTalanxSven Scheid Charlotte Hillig

Last month I was interviewed by David Weston, Editor-in-Chief of the very intelligent ‚ÄúENERGY ENABLERS‚Äù PODCAST, which has just recently been published (https://lnkd.in/e6_GGABJ). In our conversation we covered the most important topics of European energy policy. I made clear once again that last year Europe navigated successfully through an energy crisis of historical proportions, but now faces tectonic shifts: new geopolitics, trade tensions and aggressive industrial policies, all with huge implications for the power sector. Therefore, as President of Eurelectric, I will focus my mandate on three key priorities: - Re-think security of supply, with large scale electrification at the core. Security of supply is a complex puzzle to future-proof Europe‚Äôs energy system against external shocks.¬†- Deliver grids for speed. It‚Äôs welcome that transmission and distribution lines are higher on the agenda in Brussels.¬†- Foster a market framework rooted in fairness. We will need a new set of long-term market mechanisms and de-risking instruments. The risks and benefits need to be equitably shared between investors, consumers and ‚Äì where needed ‚Äì member states. Generally, we need an aggressive delivery agenda across the EU. Investors must see some stability, simplicity and uniform implementation in national legislation. The health of our single market depends on this.
Nations across the globe are striving for a more #sustainable future. But changing policies and advancing technologies alone can't master the most complex #transformation of our time.

Der #Industriestrompreis ist ein Must-have, um die #Deindustrialisierung zu stoppen.

Many of the challenges currently facing our world are not new but we have evolved in how we address them. Mental health is a case in point. ¬†Science and society have made great progress in understanding and treating mental health. Socially, what was once a taboo subject is increasingly approached with understanding and transparency. More people today can feel free to seek mental health help without risking their education, job, or social status. This is progress. ¬†But mental health, or lack of it, continues to negatively impact all areas of society, from family and relationships to school and work. The emotional and financial toll is enormous. According to the World Health Organization, two of the most common mental health conditions, depression and anxiety, cost the global economy US$1 trillion each year. Employers have an economic reason to focus on mental health and the workplace is naturally integral in helping to address it. An Edelman¬†Trust Barometer Special Report ‚ÄúTrust and Health,‚Äù found that 91% of people surveyed consider mental health a crucial part of overall health, and 79% expect their employer to play a significant role in ensuring their overall well-being.¬†The report reveals that employers are the only non-health institutions trusted with health, among those surveyed. In short, companies are seen as necessary to their employees‚Äô well-being, and they‚Äôre stepping up. ¬†The workplace has the power to be transformative in how society addresses mental health, helping to remove stigma, create safe environments, and offer supportive resources. Allianz recognizes the importance of a healthy workforce, not only for individual well-being but also for business success. We‚Äôve introduced a range of new programs and initiatives aimed at supporting the mental, physical, social, and communal aspects of health for our employees, so that we can navigate life‚Äôs challenges and thrive. We don‚Äôt have all the answers and we‚Äôre still learning. Just acknowledging how mental health impacts our personal and collective well-being and productivity is a good start to making our homes, workplaces, and communities stronger.¬†¬†#Allianz¬†#MentalHealthAwarenessWeek¬†#AllianzCares

F√ºr seine Absage an den #Industriestrompreis bekommt der Bundeskanzler ordentlich Gegenwind. Meine 2 Cents zur Debatte.¬†Ohne einen Industriestrompreis wird die Industrie den Standort Deutschland nicht halten k√∂nnen. Die Energiekosten sind in Deutschland um ein Vielfaches h√∂her als in anderen Industriel√§ndern. Die Produktion ist schlichtweg unwirtschaftlich. Bricht die Industrie in Deutschland weg, verliert Deutschland seinen √ºber Jahrhunderte optimierten Innovationsmotor und gleichzeitig essenzielle Wirtschaftsleistung.¬†Aber warum setzen wir nicht alles auf den Ausbau der Erneuerbaren, um die Strompreise langfristig zu dr√ºcken und die Industrie zu halten? Fakt ist: Es gibt kein Entweder-Oder. Wir brauchen beides: #Industriestrompreis und Ausbau der #Erneuerbaren. F√ºr die Transformation zu einer klimaneutralen Produktion ben√∂tigt die Industrie zuk√ºnftig enorme Mengen an gr√ºnem Strom. Deshalb muss der Ausbau der Erneuerbaren mit viel h√∂herem Tempo vorankommen. Es wird aber noch Jahre dauern, bis die Erneuerbaren in ausreichender Menge verf√ºgbar sind, um die energieintensive Industrie zu bedienen. So lange kann die Industrie nicht warten, das Haus brennt bereits.¬†Deshalb brauchen wir dringend den Industriestrompreis als L√∂schwasser. Damit die vorhandene gute Substanz erhalten bleibt und wir mit voller Kraft die √∂kologische #Transformation angehen k√∂nnen. Wir wollen in Zukunft ein runderneuertes Haus pr√§sentieren und keine Ruine beklagen.

This marks a significant stride forward on Covestro's journey towards a #FullyCircular economy for plastics.¬†Our experts have developed a #ChemicalRecycling process for polycarbonates that are used in car headlights and other high-performance applications. This achievement expands our set of different recycling solutions and is a critical advancement for Covestro and our customers and partners towards a #CircularEconomy.¬†The new chemical recycling process converts polycarbonates into their foundational monomers. These monomers can then be used as alternative raw materials, reducing waste and resource depletion.¬†We have now initiated the technical implementation of the process on a pilot scale¬†with a long-term goal of industrial-scale application.¬†Congratulations to the entire team involved in the development! This milestone underscores how we are merging scientific acumen with pragmatic solutions to create a #CircularEconomy where plastics are reclaimed and recycled.

Deutsche Telekom is digging what the excavator can give. For more fiberglass. We are modernizing our #network and focusing on fiber to the home (FTTH) as a sustainable technology. Our fiber optic network already covers 700,000 kilometers. Laid end to end along the equator, that would mean around 17.5 circumnavigations of the earth. üòä Six million households in Germany can already surf via #fiberglass. And the network continues to grow. This year, it is our goal to offer #FTTH to three million new households. ¬†I spent a day on site in Bonn helping to roll out FTTH. What I did on the fly doesn't normally happen in a single day. Because the rollout is complex. Precise planning of the routes is needed before the first excavators start rolling. The cables usually have to be buried to a depth of 60 to 90 cm. That is time-consuming. It's expensive and involves bureaucracy and approval processes. But the effort is worth it! See for yourself. üòâ ¬†Whether in the city or in the country - our technical teams are there. We have already recruited an additional 1,000 technicians for the FTTH rollout. More will follow, also for civil engineering. #telekom #timtestet #fiber

Here are my thoughts on the matter ‚¨áÔ∏è¬†#energytransition #cop28 #cop28uae #climatechange

Cynicism in the company? Don‚Äòt disregard these warnings signs. I discussed with Stanford professor Jamil Zaki when cynicism takes control in a company. Jamil Zaki is one of the most distinguished management thinkers on this subject. He explores the question, why cynicism is such a threat to corporate culture. That's why I invited him to my "Expect the Unexpected" format. In my view, four things are early warning signs:üëâ Micromanagement and complex structures. They are incentives for people to behave politically in order to get ahead.üëâ People stop sharing their knowledge.üëâ Colleagues no longer support each other. They put their own well-being above that of the company.üëâ Leaders lack empathy and emotional intelligence. The echo from their teams is cynicism. I firmly believe that cynicism has a hard time in the company if we set the right course:üëâ Leaders must model trust and thus give cynicism no chance: a culture of trust is crucial. üëâ It starts at the top: the board must be a team. We have a common target for the board.üëâ Success is only possible as a team and accordingly we must incentivize team performance.üëâ Create transparency about your cultural development.üëâ Recognize the early warning signs. I have many one-to-one meetings to detect the weak signals in the company for this very reason. What is important about this topic from your perspective?hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#Trust hashtag#NewWork

Das Haus brennt. Die Wettbewerbsf√§higkeit unserer Industrie in Deutschland h√§ngt davon ab, wie schnell wir bezahlbare Energie bekommen.¬†Ich habe meine Meinung zu Subventionen bereits ge√§u√üert. Sie m√ºssen immer das letzte Mittel sein und immer befristet. Ein #Industriestrompreis ist genau das: eine Br√ºcke in die Zukunft, bis wir gen√ºgend bezahlbare Energie aus Erneuerbaren haben. Um den hohen Bedarf an Erneuerbaren zu decken und deren Ausbau zu beschleunigen, schlie√üen einige energieintensive Unternehmen, wie auch Covestro, Power Purchase Agreements (PPAs) ab. Diese langfristigen Liefervertr√§ge sind wichtige Investitionen in eine nachhaltige Zukunft, k√∂nnen den Brand aber nicht l√∂schen. Deshalb brauchen wir kurzfristig den Industriestrompreis als L√∂schwasser.

Heart wrenching images of ravaging wildfires have reached us from Hawaii in recent days, particularly from Maui, the second largest Hawaiian island, causing devastating environmental, economic, and social damage. Sadly, we have also witnessed a series of disastrous wildfires in various countries across the globe in recent weeks causing widespread damage and sorrow. ¬†An initial ‚Äúback of the envelope‚Äù estimate of the economic impact by Allianz Research indicates that the recent heatwaves across the United States, Southern Europe, and China might have incurred a 0.6pp reduction in the GDP for 2023. Initial conclusions unveil that a single day of extreme heat with temperatures exceeding 32 degrees is equivalent to half a day of strike. You can delve into the full report here: https://lnkd.in/eGzMS3gF ¬†While many wildfires occur naturally, the escalating dryness and unprecedented heat are causing them to happen more frequently and inflict greater destruction. As scientists have long predicted, these fires directly stem from climate change, and are driven by the global reliance on carbon-producing fossil fuels. Water stress is another consequence of climate change that scientists warned about, in the form of both water scarcity and dangerous abundance. Droughts and severe floods are now simultaneously more common, frequent, and devastating. More communities see their wells run dry, while others witness their towns float away, as experienced just recently in Slovenia. The scientific evidence is clear and points to the need for action on multiple fronts. Whether it‚Äôs fighting wildfires or managing water resources, the energy sector holds the key to mitigating the worst impacts of climate change. Replacing polluting coal, gas, and oil-fired power sources with renewal energy options significantly reduces carbon emissions.¬†¬†At Allianz, we express our confidence in a safer and healthier tomorrow through action. Our expertise, partnerships, and investment approach actively drive decarbonization and climate resilience around the world. A recent example is our investment in Norwegian green ammonia production plants with Fuella. This investment demonstrates our confidence in green ammonia as a crucial contributor to the transition from fossil fuels to renewable energy. Everyone has a role to play in this transition. But as one of the world‚Äôs biggest insurer, asset manager and investor, Allianz has a distinct responsibility to lead the way, both in our operations and in supporting our customers on their own journey towards sustainability. ¬†As global leaders convene for the upcoming G20 summit and COP28 conference, I am eager to see the dialogue be matched with tangible action towards a more sustainable, resilient, and prosperous future. ¬†#Allianz #EnergyTransition #COP28 #AllianzOnClimate

In recent months, we have proved that hashtag#thyssenkrupp is a pioneer and architect of the hashtag#greentransformation. At the beginning of July, thyssenkrupp nucera was listed in Frankfurt in a still challenging capital market environment. They will use 526 million of the gross proceeds from the IPO to expand their leading market position in the production of green hydrogen to shape the new era. Just two weeks ago, we reached another significant milestone as the EU Commission approved funding for the hashtag#decarbonization project "tkH2Steel", and thyssenkrupp Steel received the expected funding of the German federal government and the state government of North Rhine-Westphalia for hashtag#climateneutral hashtag#steelproduction.Besides this significant progress in the company‚Äôs transformation, thyssenkrupp has once again demonstrated resilience in the third quarter thanks to the measures that have been initiated and implemented. Mainly due to the normalization of prices in the materials business and lower spot market prices, our order intake is ‚Ç¨9.4 billion, sales are ‚Ç¨9.6 billion, and adjusted EBIT is ‚Ç¨347 million ‚Äî all lower than in the prior year. However, I'm pleased to share that our free cash flow before M&A has greatly improved, now standing at a significantly positive ‚Ç¨347 million. We've refined our adjusted EBIT forecast for the current fiscal year upwards, and it's the only adjustment we've made. Our primary focus is now enhancing our hashtag#performance. This morning, we published our third-quarter financial figures and provided further information on the situation in our wind business. Before I go into detail, however, I want to start with a heartfelt thank you to the joint Team Purple of Siemens Energy and Siemens Gamesa. The hard work and dedication of our people I have seen firsthand over the recent weeks and months are truly inspiring and motivating. Within our Gas Services, Grid Technologies, and Transformation of Industries businesses, we have seen important orders, significant growth in revenue, impressive margin improvements and strong cash flow. For more specifics, see the post of our CFO Maria Ferraro: https://lnkd.in/dKVpF3Vy These rock-solid performances tell the story of a turnaround many would not have believed possible just three years ago. Positive market developments give us further confidence that these businesses will continue to develop even more favorably.  Despite this, we also had a bitter pill to swallow this quarter. The detected quality issues in parts of the installed onshore platforms as well as increased product costs and ramp-up challenges in the offshore business of Siemens Gamesa are a severe setback for us. As a result, we have initiated remediation actions and took substantial charges this quarter.  Our main priority is now fixing these issues in our wind subsidiary. Given the strong performance of our other businesses and our strong balance sheet, we are convinced that a turnaround is not only doable, but above all things, necessary, as it is very clear that making the energy transition a reality for people and the planet is impossible without wind. #energytransition #siemensenergy #siemensgamesa

‚ÄûOhne florierende Wirtschaft fehlt f√ºr alles andere das Geld.‚ÄúDer ZEIT ONLINE-Artikel beschreibt sehr treffend, wie es um Deutschland und Europa steht. Das #Klumpenrisiko aus hohen Energiepreisen und Unternehmenssteuern, schlechter Infrastruktur, Fachkr√§ftemangel, Digitalisierungsstau und B√ºrokratiewahnsinn.Das Gute ist: Alle Probleme sind l√∂sbar, wenn wir uns aufs Wesentliche konzentrieren und vom Regulieren ins Machen kommen. There are many important international awareness days but one that stands out to me in particular is #EarthOvershootDay. It‚Äôs a sobering reminder that our current way of life is unsustainable. Having already used all the natural resources that our planet can regenerate for 2023, we will be borrowing from the future from today onwards. For many people around the world right now, the consequences of this feel very real. July this year was the hottest month since records have been kept. It can feel overwhelming but there are many small steps everyone can take to help move this date. For example, we could postpone Earth Overshoot Day by 29 days by making changes to the way we travel and build, heat, and light our homes. Together, it‚Äôs such changes big and small that can really #MoveTheDate.

The expression ‚Äúhealth is wealth‚Äù rings true, no matter how many times I hear it. As a CEO, knowing my employees are healthy is a priority. And yet, the rising cost of living, particularly for healthcare expenses, can make maintaining a healthy lifestyle challenging for many people today.¬†In times of financial strain and stress, companies can play a particularly critical healthcare role, supporting the well-being of employees and their families. According to the ‚ÄúTrust and Health‚Äù report from the Edelman Trust Barometer Special Report, 79% of respondents expect their employer to play a significant role in ensuring their overall health. Additionally, when making purchasing decisions, 64% of respondents consider how a company‚Äôs brand, its products, and its business practices impact people‚Äôs health. These findings validate the link between employee well-being and a company‚Äôs overall health. ¬†Prioritizing health empowers individuals and companies alike with the resilience needed to confidently face our often harsh and increasingly complex world. Mental health is foundational for both individual and societal growth and security. This is why at Allianz we emphasize health and well-being by providing resources, tools and support to our employees and customers. And the good news is that technology makes these resources more easily accessible, like with the Allianz Care Counseling videos, our Mental Wellbeing App, and our Expat Assistance Program.¬†Benefits like these, however, are only good if they are used. Even the most committed employers can‚Äôt force their employees to watch over their health and wellness. Individual motivation is also necessary for a healthy lifestyle. Leaders of both big and small organizations can motivate employees by modeling wellness behaviors themselves and making health information and useful resources accessible. Prioritizing health isn‚Äôt about perfection. It often starts with establishing one or two healthy habits, as demonstrated in this video. Even small steps can create a positive ripple effect in the workplace, which in turn fosters creativity, innovation, and collaboration. ¬†¬†How do you prioritize your health when under pressure, or short on time? What support are you providing to those around you in taking care of their well-being? I am looking forward to seeing your tips in the comments below. ¬†#AllianzCares¬†#HealthCare #Health #Allianz

#EarthOvershootDay is a striking reminder that we, as a society, need to change our ways to secure a livable future for generations to come.It is sobering to know that our consumption patterns currently exceed what the Earth can restore in a year ‚Äì we are living on credit. But amidst this challenge, we've also seen a growing awareness of the importance of sustainable resource consumption. Over the past years, we have seen a slowdown. But to turn the trend around we still have a long way to go.A fundamental advancement of our socio-economic system is necessary. We need to align economic development to sustainability goals, put resource supply on a more sustainable foundation, and strengthen the growing trend towards more ecologically sustainable lifestyles. #CircularEconomy is a guiding principle that ticks all these boxes. Implementing it on a global scale will make this graphic greener each year.

Als ich den Audimax der FAU Erlangen-N√ºrnberg im Jahr 1988 zum ersten Mal als Physikstudent betreten habe, um eine Mathematik-Vorlesung zu h√∂ren, h√§tte ich nie gedacht, eines Tages genau dort √ºber Gesundheitsversorgung und KI zu sprechen. Last week, Jean-Fran√ßois van Boxmeer, Chair of the European Round Table & Chairman, Vodafone Group and I sent a letter on behalf of the ERT to EU political leaders about the ongoing work on the EU #AIAct. There are legitimate concerns about the rapid evolution of AI capabilities and it's without doubt crucial to establish a common EU regulatory framework to address these. At the same time, however, it's also critical that the new Act does not stifle AI innovation and the key role this will play in Europe's competitiveness.¬†Building trust around AI also goes beyond pure regulation. Now is the right time to proactively embrace a global AI Code of Conduct as proposed by the EU-US Trade and Technology Council and the G7. Such a code could guide businesses and their leaders in developing responsible AI practices. I believe in the power of global collaboration and welcome and support initiatives to harmonize AI policies at a global level, reinforcing an international commitment to #EthicalAI, #transparency, and #accountability.

Financial literacy is one of the most important skills needed in life. Simply put, financial literacy is the ability to understand and effectively use personal financial skills, including budgeting, managing risk, and investing. With it comes the knowledge needed for a lifelong positive relationship with money. In what can be a stressful world, financial literacy helps reduce uncertainty and enables confidence. And, especially in today‚Äôs inflationary times, financial literacy empowers people to better manage their money so that it goes further toward improving their quality of life. ¬†Conversely, the lack of financial literacy has a negative ripple effect on individuals and families. A new Allianz report surveying more than 7,000 respondents across seven countries found that low financial literacy is costing households thousands every year. The study found that people with even basic financial literacy could earn up ‚Ç¨1,750 more per year, whereas people with strong financial literacy could achieve an extra investment income of up to ‚Ç¨5,000 per household.¬†1 in 4 survey respondents have low financial literacy, with women being more likely to exhibit low financial literacy than men. 46 % of men feel confident about their financial knowledge while only 33 % of women feel the same. ¬†These findings underscore that the opportunity and obligation to help all people, but especially women, to become more financially confident. And there‚Äôs a lot we can do to address it, and this is why I am pleased to announce our new online Financial Literacy Hub. It‚Äôs designed to help fill the financial literacy gap and build confidence for everyone. In our new Hub, people can find useful information, interactive budgeting tools, and even register for free coaching from Allianz experts. ¬†We also launched The Squared Ball, a new financial coaching program tailored to female football professionals. Why? Because our research found that women in professional football experience acute financial uncertainty. With The Squared Ball program, we‚Äôre shining a light on these challenges and offering tools to overcome them. ¬†Financial literacy is not a luxury for the few, but a necessity for all of us.¬†Each financially literate person is an empowered individual with the capabilities to make better financial decisions, which in turn often positively impact others in their families and communities. It strengthens their contribution to the economy, and in turn, supports economic growth and financial stability. Learn more about what Allianz is doing to promote financial education so that we can all face the future with confidence:¬†https://lnkd.in/d4fKtcjR¬†#FinancialLiteracy¬†#GenderGap¬†#TheSquaredBall #Allianz

In our rapidly evolving world, understanding technology is essential for policymakers to drive progress. Without speaking the same language, innovation becomes difficult and decisive opportunities are missed. Currently, there is a lack of coherence in the discussion. This prevents policymakers from understanding the rapid pace of technology and its implications. Misunderstanding key technologies can lead to surprises, confusion, and strained relationships. Against this backdrop, the Security and Innovation Board of the Munich Security Conference (MSC), led by Christoph Heusgen and myself, decided to launch the MSC Summer School. The goal: to bridge the gap by bringing together policymakers and industry experts, fostering relationships and improving exchange. The start is done: For three days in our innovation center in Berlin, a team of exceptional talents discussed with experts from industry, science, business, and the German Federal Armed Forces what concrete steps are needed to overcome the silence. Next stop: Brussels. At the beginning of September, the team will present its findings to the Innovation Board. Many thanks to the great team from Accenture Europe, McKinsey, Google, Munich Security Conference, Westnetz, Silverado Policy Accelerator, Lockheed Martin, adarga ai, and Siemens Energy for their willingness to take on this important task. I am almost tempted to say: if this group cannot provide us with such a concept, who can? I will keep you posted about the next steps. Stay tuned. #collaboration #technology #innovation

Today marks a milestone. For hashtag#thyssenkrupp and for the climate-friendly hashtag#transformation of German hashtag#industry. thyssenkrupp, Duisburg, North Rhine-Westphalia, and Germany are becoming a pioneer for climate-neutral hashtag#steel production. And with this pioneering role, we are strengthening our technological leadership: for the production of steel in general and hashtag#green steel in particular.Speaking on behalf of all our employees, I would like to thank the German federal government and state government for their determined support for the hashtag#greentransformation of our steel production. The climate-friendly transformation of our economy can only succeed through effective teamwork of politics and business. Together, we are setting an example for this today.Our competencies for hashtag#climate protection are by no means limited to hashtag#directreduction processes for steel production. Instead, we have numerous additional potentials for building green value chains: electrolyzers for green hydrogen production from thyssenkrupp nucera, slewing bearings as key components for expanding wind energy, thyssenkrupp Uhde's systems for ammonia production, and much more. This offers enormous opportunities. Technologically for efficient decarbonization and the replacement of fossil fuels, as well as for economic growth. We will definitely seize these opportunities. In the interest of climate protection and sustainable value-creation processes. And in the interest of Germany's industrial location.We definitely want to do that at thyssenkrupp. Today's achievements make an important contribution towards that goal. Thank you for your visit, Robert Habeck and Mona Neubaur.

After 23 years at Siemens Healthineers and 15 years at Siemens before that, we bid farewell to Dr. Wolfgang Heimsch as he retires at the end of July. After graduating in Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Wolfgang started his career in Siemens in 1986 at Corporate Technology. In the 90s, he worked on a technology that revolutionized our communication options: being reachable from any location ‚Äì with the mobile phone. "Handys" from Siemens, as they are called in Denglish, were very successful at the time; Wolfgang was Head of the development department. When I got my first mobile phone, Wolfgang was already CEO of the Industry Business of Siemens Nixdorf (1997-2001). Almost a quarter of a century ago, he joined #SiemensHealthineers, and there are not many managers who shaped and impacted the company as much as he did. His method: passion, persistence, and pioneering spirit. With these three, he managed what normally is deemed impossible: he led and shaped our Customer Services team for incredible 23 years! With a contagious passion to serve customers ‚Äì 24/7, worldwide, onsite and online, to ensure that medical equipment is up and running and that medical staff has up-to-date knowledge. With persistence: Wolfgang never deviated from his principles of what a great service organization looks like and from his core beliefs of good management. He made his point consistently, and step by step created a world-class service team advocating for their needs in a culture in which often the leading innovators or the best sales guys get the credit ‚Äì and the funding. And with a pioneering spirit: Wolfgang kept pushing, reinventing, questioning the status quo as if he had just taken over the role from someone else.Dear Wolfgang, I am in awe of your achievement. Thank you for all you have done for our customers and for Siemens Healthineers. Thank you for your passion, your persistence, and your pioneering spirit. And also for your objections! I wish you all the best for the future and the very best of health!

The countdown to the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris has begun! We kickstarted the Road to Paris one year ago with our #MoveNow program. The aim is to empower and support young people by offering opportunities to lead active and healthy lives. ¬†Over 10,000 young people worldwide have come together to move through a series of sport activations, including youth camps, festivals, and digital events. Our mission is simple: prepare the next generation for a promising future by moving their body, mind, and soul. ¬†In the next steps of our journey to Paris, we‚Äôll celebrate the societal value of sports and their importance in Allianz. Research confirms that engaging in sport reduces stress and improves fitness and overall immunity. Sports literally shapes lives and communities, helping millions of people boost their self-esteem and confidence. In schools, sports convey the skills and values that students will use throughout their lives, not just for academic success but also to help steer their careers. ¬†¬†At Allianz, we believe in the power of sports. We also believe that sports are for everyone, and that their positive impact extends far beyond the athletic field. Not just because of their unique ability to transcend social and cultural barriers, but because of the inclusive environment they create. We are honored to be the Worldwide Insurance Partner of the Olympic and Paralympic Movements since 2018, supporting more than 70 Olympians and Paralympians. Join us for the count down for the next 365 days! ¬†To learn more about Allianz's support for the world of sports, visit https://lnkd.in/easdE2EW.

√úber George Orwells Buch 1984 bin ich zuletzt am Flughafen gestolpert und habe es dann einfach wieder gelesen. Immer lohnenswert! Es hat mich aber auch nachdenklich zur√ºckgelassen. Denn die technischen M√∂glichkeiten von heute gehen weit √ºber das hinaus, was sich Orwell vorstellen konnte. Und die Selbstzensur im Kopf, was man denken, aussprechen oder diskutieren darf, haben wir auch ohne Wahrheitsministerium perfektioniert. The 40th anniversary of our #MAGNETOM commemorates a milestone in the history of Siemens Healthineers and the entire #medtech industry. This success story began in the late 1970s in a wooden hut at Siemens in Erlangen, which was built without any iron nails to avoid interference with the magnetic field during the first experiments. Despite many challenges and setbacks, the pioneers in this hut never lost their determination to push the boundaries of research. Although they were a small part of a big corporation, they kept a mindset like a start-up and were able to act like one. They are not only to thank for one of our most successful businesses, but also for one of the most vivid examples of our purpose: We pioneer breakthroughs in #healthcare, for everyone, everywhere. Finally, the team pioneered by introducing MAGNETOM GBS 1, our first commercial MRI system and a breakthrough in medical imaging. The system began operation at the Mallinckrodt Institute of Radiology in St. Louis in August 1983.I'd like to thank all colleagues and partners who have contributed to the success story of our MAGNETOM family in the past 40 years and all our customers for their #trust and feedback. Without them, we would not have been able to develop this technology further ‚Äì for the benefit of patients. I‚Äôm grateful to have played a small part in this. (In one of the pictures below, we are jointly fine-tuning our MAGNETOM presentation for RSNA 2001 in a hotel room late at night; it went quite successfully.)Congrats, Andreas Schneck! Your team and you have a big reason to celebrate.
Congratulations Michael Reichle and Innomotics! Such a great company with a great future! üí™üí™üí™

Diese Landkarte mag f√ºr manche wie eine gew√∂hnliche Seite aus dem Schulatlas aussehen, aber f√ºr die #Wasserstoffwirtschaft ist sie ein entscheidender Wendepunkt.¬†Mit dem Entwurf f√ºr ein Wasserstoff Kernnetz legt der FNB Gas e.V. den Grundstein f√ºr den Hochlauf der Wasserstoffwirtschaft in Deutschland und ebnet den Weg f√ºr die gr√ºne Transformation wichtiger Industriebranchen.¬†Eisen, Stahl, Keramik, Glas, Chemie ‚Äì alle setzen auf #Wasserstoff, um ihre industriellen Prozesse nachhaltiger zu gestalten. Die Nachfrage wird sich also in den kommenden Jahren vervielfachen. Die Chemie allein braucht bis zu 283 TWh Wasserstoff, um klimaneutral zu werden ‚Äì also k√ºnftig etwa achtmal so viel wie heute.¬†Damit klimaneutraler Wasserstoff da ankommt, wo er gebraucht wird, braucht es neben ausreichend Produktionskapazit√§ten in Form von gr√ºnem Strom f√ºr die Elektrolyse auch eine funktionierende Infrastruktur. Diese entsteht nicht von heute auf morgen, denn Wasserstoff ist, bedingt durch seine Eigenschaften, nur in speziellen Tanks und Pipelines transportierbar.¬†Mich erfreut es also besonders, dass das Federal Ministry for Economics and Climate Action und der FNB Gas e.V. bereits jetzt mit dem Aufbau des Wasserstoffnetzes beginnen ‚Äì noch bevor ausreichend erneuerbare Energien f√ºr die gr√ºne Wasserstoffproduktion verf√ºgbar sind.Das BMWK hat gut vorgelegt, jetzt hei√üt es dranbleiben!

Cynicism is explosive for every corporate culture.This is the core of a guest article by Stanford professor Jamil Zaki, published in the German magazine Harvard Business manager. He says: A cynical approach in a company destroys trust and thus endangers all strategic goals.Very inspiring! That's why I invited Jamil to bring theory and practice together in a conversation on this topic. In the new hashtag#ExpectTheUnexpected, we talk about how cynicism arises in companies, what early warning signs there are and - crucially - what companies can do to prevent a cynical culture from arising in the first place.I would like to share the results with you in four videos. Today, we start with the first: What is cynicism? In my view, you can recognize a cynical corporate culture by the following things:üëâPeople are joking about others. Irony is the direct path to cynicism.üëâWhen people lack emotional intelligence, it is difficult for them to build strong trusting relationships.üëâComplex company structures, many committees and centralization foster cynicism.üëâMicropolitics is an expression of a toxic culture of mistrust.üëâYou will always find a politically acting person at the top of the company. In your view, how can you recognize cynicism in a company? hashtag#TogetherTalanxhashtag#Trust hashtag#Culture hashtag#NewWork

Earlier in June, at the Eurelectric Power summit, I was delighted to have the opportunity to speak with Laurent Segalen and Gerard Reid on their üéôRedefining Energy podcast.¬†Over the course of an hour or so we had the opportunity to cover a number of topics crucial to the energy sector and Europe‚Äôs path to Net Zero. At the heart of this was the need for speed we require to start meeting our ambitious targets, as well as a relentless focus on delivering change, not just talking about it.¬†During the discussion I once again confirmed the commitments I have made for the tenure of my Presidency at Eurelectric: strengthening security of supply through large-scale electrification, driving the expansion and digitalisation of electricity grids and fostering a fair distribution of risks and benefits. All three are prerequisites for an integrated, independent and green European energy system.¬†You can listen to our discussion on both Apple Podcasts and Spotify, links below:Apple Podcasts: https://lnkd.in/eiYnrvQR Spotify: https://lnkd.in/eBDh7GE4 #energytransition

My bosses inspired me when they had three important qualities.The bosses who impressed me the most were those who were courageous, consequent in the implementation and humble. From them I learned that narcissistic traits are not successful in the long run and that CEOs are there to serve the company. Courage in the matter and humbleness in the person: these are the keys to personal growth and success. Humbleness means being free of pride and arrogance. It is often confused with a lack of self-confidence. In fact, however, the opposite is true. Humble people recognise their strengths as well as their weaknesses. Inner confidence is the reason why a humble person is not afraid to ask questions - because that is part of growing.There are different ways to work on a humble mindset and to grow:üëâ Be honest with yourself. Admitting your weaknesses will show you where you can still grow. üëâ Don't put yourself first. A star team is more important than a star in the team.üëâ Listen actively. Ask for feedback , listen actively and without bias to what others are saying. üëâ Ask for help if you need it. Don't be afraid to say, "I don't know." We live in a complex VUCA world. You can‚Äôt know everything. hashtag#Together with others, you can elaborate a broader perspective. üëâ Get comfortable with uncertainty. You can make intelligent projections of the future, but you are no fortune teller. You can‚Äôt be always right. What are your experiences with humbleness? I look forward to your thoughts in the comments.hashtag#TogetherTalanxhashtag#Transparencyhashtag#Engagementhashtag#Collaboration

For the last two days I had the pleasure of being in Lincolnshire in the United Kingdom, visiting our sites, aswell as a project that is a true model for the energy transition. For over 70 years, Keadby provided electricity into the grid using coal.¬†Today with Keadby 2, we officially opened the most efficient gas-fired power station in the world, producing almost two and a half times more electricity than its predecessor. By being able to ramp up in just 30 minutes, it can provide the UK's power system with the flexibility it requires. Keadby 2 generates enough electricity to power 840,000 homes while reducing CO2 emissions by 63,000 tonnes annually. That is nearly three times the carbon footprint of Lincolnshire or the equivalent of five million trees. The entire project was only possible thanks to a strong partnership with our partner SSE plc. I look forward to the next milestone projects we will tackle together. #energytransition #decarbonization #innovation

The ability to navigate uncertainty is a critical life skill. Our world has always been unpredictable, and it remains so today. We face two simultaneous global emergencies ‚Äì climate change and the refugee crisis ‚Äì plus geopolitical and economic instability, social polarization, and racial and gender inequalities. Not all these challenges are new. Some have been part of our lives for a long time, and we can learn from past mistakes and lessons. What is new is how these challenges are merging to test the strength of our social fabric. ¬†The world desperately needs a new generation of problem solvers and fresh thinkers ‚Äì and this is where new graduates come in and can play a differentiating role. The good news is that the graduates entering today‚Äôs workforce aren‚Äôt settling for the status quo. With all the world‚Äôs challenges, it‚Äôs also an exciting time, full of opportunities to make a positive impact. ¬†Today‚Äôs younger generation has already demonstrated a profound understanding of the importance of taking action to secure the future. 70% of Gen Z is actively involved in social or political causes, according to a recent Edelman study. They refuse to sit on the sidelines, instead mobilizing people around the issues that matter to them. They view a successful career path as one that makes a positive impact on the world.¬†Gen Z‚Äôs concern for humanity and sense of responsibility for the planet fills me with hope. If I can offer one piece of advice, it would be to encourage these young people to embrace uncertainty and see challenges as unlocked opportunities. Having spent my own career in insurance and risk management, I am trained to look at challenges as opportunities. In our business, we don‚Äôt run away from risks, we manage them as opportunities. I love this about our industry. It has helped me to develop a growth mindset and become comfortable with the uncomfortable. ¬†¬†Graduating and entering the workforce is always a time of uncertainty. But one thing is certain: the world needs you. The world needs experts, makers, and storytellers with new ways of looking at our old problems. ¬†We need innovators, resilience builders and healthcare providers. Most of all we need people with a growth mindset, who aren‚Äôt seeking perfection but can clearly see an opportunity in every challenge. ¬†Whatever you choose, remember that the world needs your skills and new perspectives. I invite you to explore the opportunities available at Allianz as you choose your path and look for a way to make a positive difference in the world: we will cheer you on.¬†#Graduates #BetterTogether #Allianz

Ist die Chemie ein Teufelswerk oder eine L√∂sungsindustrie?¬†Klar ist: Die Chemie ist unerl√§sslich f√ºr unsere nachhaltige Zukunft und muss dringend nachhaltig transformiert werden. Diese gigantische Transformation ist bereits in vollem Gange und erfordert die Mitwirkung aller, ob sie nun A, B, C oder D gew√§hlt haben. Der Schl√ºssel zu dieser Zusammenarbeit liegt darin, dass wir alle die objektive Realit√§t und nicht die subjektiven Wahrnehmungen als Grundlage f√ºr Entscheidungen und Handlungen w√§hlen.¬†Und hier kommt den Menschen aus der Chemie eine besondere Rolle zu. Sie sind gefordert, diese Realit√§t zu verdeutlichen und mit Fakten, Daten und einpr√§gsamen Beispielen zu illustrieren, was wir in der Chemie tun und wie wir es tun. Gemeinsam k√∂nnen wir so ein realistisches Bild der Chemie zeichnen und den Weg f√ºr unsere gr√∂√üte gesamtgesellschaftliche Herausforderung ebnen: eine nachhaltige Zukunft.#ChemicalIndustry #Transformation #FullyCircular

This is a day, many of you have been waiting for a long time. Our teams have been working extremely hard over the last couple of months to make this happen. So today is a day to celebrate and to say thank you. It‚Äôs a day to celebrate, because this is a historic moment for thyssenkrupp: It‚Äôs the first hashtag#IPO of a hashtag#thyssenkrupp business ever ‚Äì a ‚Äúmoon landing moment‚Äù, as Werner Ponikwar described it in his speech. The IPO not only enlarges the financial flexibility of thyssenkrupp nucera. It also strengthens thyssenkrupp‚Äôs profile as a leading player in the fields of the green hydrogen industry.thyssenkrupp is active in all areas of the hydrogen value chain: The supply side with thyssenkrupp nucera, the demand side with our ambitious green steel projects and the infrastructure side with our plant engineers at Uhde, Bearings, and Polysius.The IPO of thyssenkrupp nucera is also a strong proof point for our strategy: It shows that thyssenkrupp offers world-leading technological capabilities and is able to create hashtag#sustainable value out of it. Only a few years ago, the chlorine-alkali electrolysis was kind of an ‚Äúenchanted princess‚Äù ‚Äì barely anybody in the group saw the potential of this technology. We are lucky, some did. And we gave them the entrepreneurial freedom to build something strong. And today this is a multi-billion-euro business. The ‚Äúenchanted princess‚Äù became a ‚Äúunicorn‚Äù ‚Äì and thyssenkrupp nucera the latest addition to the thyssenkrupp family. What a great story, what a great reason to celebrate! That‚Äôs why today is also a moment to say thank you. Thanks to all colleagues involved. Thanks to all advisors. Thanks to all employees at thyssenkrupp nucera, who are doing an outstanding job. This is just the beginning of a great journey.  We will continue to be at your side and to pave the way for thyssenkrupp nucera to strengthen its position as one of the world‚Äôs leading hydrogen players. thyssenkrupp AG is committed to remaining a long-term shareholder of thyssenkrupp nucera and further accompanying its growth strategy. I am delighted to celebrate this special day with you and continue our growth path together!

As such, we‚Äôre excited to share our financial expertise toward removing gender-based financial obstacles and helping to create a level playing field for male and female footballers. I‚Äôm thrilled to announce the launch of the Squared Ball campaign‚Äîan initiative that raises awareness of the financial barriers, pay gaps, and opportunity inequalities faced by female athletes. We‚Äôre empowering young female athletes with information and tools needed to navigate financial decisions with confidence.¬†Learn more about the Squared Ball campaign and how you can be part of the change by visiting our hub here: https://lnkd.in/e3jJGmc3¬†Together, we have the power to rewrite the narrative and create a future where every woman has an equal opportunity to succeed.¬†#TheSquaredBall #Football #FinancialLiteracy #Allianz

For me, curiosity is the engine of achievement, the number one future skill. This is the reason: Many years ago, I was offered a position as a CEO in Slovakia. I could have worked either from an office located in Vienna or directly from the Headquarters in Bratislava. Vienna was less then an hour away from Bratislava, but it wouldn‚Äôt have been an interesting change. Because we were curious about the people and the culture in Bratislava, my family and I decided to move there. The following years were an enriching challenge. Our curiosity was worthwhile ‚Äì for our personal growth and for the success of the company.My personal story is only one small example for curiosity being the number one future skill. Companies face nowadays an ever-changing complex VUCA world. They can only adapt by constantly innovating and challenging the status quo. This is possible if employees stay curious, grow personally, and help the company to grow. Leaders play a crucial role in a culture of curiosity within an organisation. Here are some tips how to nurture curiosity:üëâ As a leader be a role model for curiosity and stay open to change.üëâ Ask smart, strategic, thoughtful, and targeted questions.üëâ Listen actively and build trusting relationships with employees.üëâ Empower employees to share own ideas and perspectives and reward creativity. üëâ Let employees explore and broaden their interests.üëâ Hire for a curious mindset.Kudos to Bernard Marr for highlighting the importance of curiosity for success in his best-selling book on future skills. Which personal experiences do you have with curiosity? How do you nurture curiosity?

It's been a good 40 years since a revolutionary technology in communication found its way into offices all over the world ‚Äì the fax machine! It was the time when Bon Jovi and Depeche Mode filled the stadiums, when Roger Moore, alias James Bond, defended the good guys against the bad in Octopussy. I wasn't allowed to watch the film in the cinema ‚Äì I was in the 8th grade at the grammar school in Ottobrunn. At that time, in 1983, Ragavan Dhandapany began his professional career in the medical division of Siemens AG UB Med ‚Äì as Siemens Healthineers was then called. Step by step, his career progressed until he finally took overall responsibility for our business in India in 2005. It was during this year that we met in person for the first time ‚Äì and immediately realized that we had different opinions:Ragavan: "ùêåùê´. ùêåùê®ùêßùê≠ùêöùê†, ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê¨ùê©ùêûùêûùêù ùê®ùêü ùê≤ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùê≠ùêûùêöùê¶'ùê¨ ùê¢ùêßùêßùê®ùêØùêöùê≠ùê¢ùê®ùêß ùê¢ùê¨ ùêö ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêõùê•ùêûùê¶ ùêüùê®ùê´ ùê®ùêÆùê´ ùêúùêÆùê¨ùê≠ùê®ùê¶ùêûùê´ùê¨". Me, then the new head of CT: ‚Äúùêåùê´. ùêëùêöùê†ùêöùêØùêöùêß, ùê≠ùê°ùêû ùê≠ùêûùêöùê¶ ùê¢ùê¨ ùêúùê®ùê¶ùê¶ùê¢ùê≠ùê≠ùêûùêù ùê≠ùê°ùêöùê≠ ùê≠ùê°ùê¢ùê¨ ùê©ùê´ùê®ùêõùê•ùêûùê¶ ùêúùê®ùêßùê≠ùê¢ùêßùêÆùêûùê¨".¬†What seemed to me to be a particularly smart reply quickly emerged as complete ignorance of the situation on site, which he explained to me ‚Äì typical Ragavan ‚Äì objectively, calmly and without yielding an inch. He made it clear that our pace of innovation could quickly devalue clients' investments, potentially turning one of our key strengths into a problem. The message behind it: there are neither one-dimensional problems nor one-dimensional solutions. If you are sure of something, take a moment to doubt it. Ragavan opened my eyes to seeing the challenges of different healthcare systems from the customer's point of view. And he has never stopped. I am very grateful for that!¬†I am grateful that he is a combative spirit in the best sense of the word, who is never concerned with clumsy dogmatism, but always with the matter at hand and the better, clearer argument. I admire him for constantly reinventing himself in his various roles. After nine years as head of our business in India, he moved to Germany as head of global sales for CT. Today he is responsible for our global CRM activities. He remains curious and always brings a fresh perspective. He always asks the right (tricky) questions and manages to match the customer's external perspective with our internal perspective and to come up with solutions. I have great respect for his deep spirituality as a devout Hindu. I remember many a philosophical conversation.¬†Me: "ùêáùê®ùê∞ ùêùùê® ùê≤ùê®ùêÆ ùêúùê®ùê¶ùêõùê¢ùêßùêû 'ùêÉùêûùê¨ùê¢ùê´ùêûùê•ùêûùê¨ùê¨ùêßùêûùê¨ùê¨' ùê∞ùê¢ùê≠ùê° ùêöùê¢ùê¶ùê¢ùêßùê† ùê≠ùê® ùê´ùêûùêöùêúùê° ùê¨ùêöùê•ùêûùê¨ ùê≠ùêöùê´ùê†ùêûùê≠ùê¨?" Ragavan: "ùêàùê≠'ùê¨ ùê•ùê¢ùê§ùêû ùêö ùêùùê´ùê®ùê© ùê®ùêü ùê∞ùêöùê≠ùêûùê´ ùê®ùêß ùêö ùê•ùê®ùê≠ùêÆùê¨ ùê•ùêûùêöùêü - ùê¢ùê≠ ùê≠ùê®ùêÆùêúùê°ùêûùê¨ ùê¢ùê≠ ùêõùêÆùê≠ ùêùùê®ùêûùê¨ùêß'ùê≠ ùê©ùêûùêßùêûùê≠ùê´ùêöùê≠ùêû."Ragavan ‚Äì thank you for four decades of passion and loyalty, for advice and action, for experiences and results at and for Siemens Healthineers ‚Äì and for me.

Homo ludens vs. homo homini lupus? When I talk about innovations, I sometimes end up with this image. On the one hand, the "playing human being". Who is curious about new things. And who playfully opens up new worlds. Tries things out. Experiments. And in the end: becomes creative. But: also gives the "game" rules. I often experience this when I meet startups. Or in countries where these startups are successful. This is made possible by a vision of humanity that gives companies and their founders the freedom to operate as "homo ludens".In contrast, there is an image of man in which man is a wolf to man. With the consequence of wanting to "contain" and "civilize" people accordingly. By regulation. One anticipates all possible risks in advance and tries to minimize them. With the side effect that the creative gets lost. Or is created elsewhere. Unfortunately, this often happens to us in Europe.We are currently experiencing this with the topic of #AI. We all know: AI holds incredible opportunities. And yes, there are risks, too. The EU wants to address these with planned legislation. I think the idea is right. But maybe it's the wrong way to go about it? Because what will happen? We will disadvantage local companies that are active in the AI environment. In the end, their compliance department may have to be larger than the actual development department, because various regulations have to be met and checked. What will these companies do? They will look for a new home where they can operate as "homo ludens".Now I am not a friend of organized or unorganized irresponsibility. Recently, in a lecture, I heard the sentence: Everything that can be weaponized, will be weaponized. That is true.So I think the right way is for Europe not to create anticipatory regulation, but to enter into a community of responsibility with those whose values we share. That is, our partners like the United States. We need to create a transatlantic framework when it comes to AI. And with that, a level playing field there and here in Europe. A competition that is there for the people. And one that protects the cohesion of our society(s).That's why I was happy to sign a letter together with several entrepreneurs and companies asking the EU to revise its planned AI legislation. Thanks to Jeannette zu F√ºrstenberg and Ren√© Obermann for this initiative.

The top 150 executives came together to engage in open and constructive discussions, focusing on the most pressing topics to achieve our shared goal: unleashing the full potential of thyssenkrupp. Still, I am inspired by the passion and dedication I see in our leadership team.¬†The Leadership Forum served as a platform for fostering transparent dialogue and deep conversations. I also had the opportunity to share insights about my talk with capital markets and our investors. Because it is necessary to pay close attention to their perspective and their thoughts. To become a more successful company, we not only need to listen to our investors, but we also need to act accordingly. hashtag#thyssenkrupp is an Eldorado for technology. However, to fully realize our potential, we must prioritize performance ‚Äì both at the business level and as a group! We must raise our level of ambition. And we will. In response to my question as to whether anything has changed fundamentally in recent years, there was a lot of agreement at Bitkom's hub.berlin yesterday. Now, we can always view changes as risks. Or we can face them with optimism. Whereby: Actually, we can do both. See risks AND remain optimistic.Wouldn't it be better to talk about good conditions for investment and innovation than about the fact that we (supposedly) no longer need growth? Wouldn't it be better to talk about how we put young people in charge and encourage them to get involved in our companies than to go on and on about the pros and cons of the home office? And wouldn't it make sense to reward performance? Wouldn't it be right to reward investments in digital and "analog" infrastructure because they are the foundation of our economy? Wouldn't it make sense to actively address sustainability instead of always having fundamental debates about long-settled climate change issues? And to use AI in a human-centric way instead of always starting the same technology debates all over again?I see the questions of our time as challenges that we can actively address. For instance, by truly creating a Europe, rather than being on the road with 27 Europes that don't form a digital single market. For example, by reducing bureaucracy and transferring the "German speed" of LNG terminals to other areas such as mobile phone masts. For example, by introducing new technologies in our companies and taking the people who work for us with us?We have many smart people in Europe and here in Germany who are leaders in their fields. I have met many of them in recent weeks, such as Ursel Fantz, leading expert in the field of nuclear fusion reactors. Jan Wurzbacher, whose company "filters" CO2 from the atmosphere. Jonas Andrulis, who shows that we in Europe can also "do" AI. Hendrik Dietz, who uses nano-DNA to develop new drugs, for example. Or Daniel Kalisch, freshly crowned German champion in programming, who works at Telekom.So we have the full potential. So for us as a society, it is certainly also a question of the attitude with which we face our challenges. There are many small countries that are successful with their attitude. South Korea calls it "Bali Bali," Norway "Dugnad," Finland "Sisu..." I am encouraged by this!

I was pleased to see over 200 votes on my recent poll about #MassBalancing, a clear proof of your knowledge and eagerness to dive deeper. However, the silence from the almost ten thousand who viewed but did not participate in the poll caught my attention.¬†Was it unfamiliarity, hesitation, or maybe a perceived lack of relevance that held you back? I understand that the mass balancing approach may seem distant or irrelevant to some. But it's a principle that holds the key to our #FullyCircular future.¬†Mass balancing is not just a distant promise ‚Äì it's an immediate, tangible step towards sustainability, one that doesn't require waiting for extensive availability of alternative raw materials or entirely new production sites.¬†As leaders in our fields, we must challenge misinformation and oversimplification with respect, fact-based dialogue, and understanding. If you're already familiar with mass balancing, I invite you to help make it more accessible to those who aren't.¬†Our journey towards a #CircularEconomy needs every voice, every perspective. Let's ensure that effective solutions that help us moving forward on this journey are not just known, but understood and implemented.

The topic of AI has gained significant attention in the last years. I recently sat down with Sebastian Matthes and Christof Kerkmann from Handelsblatt to talk about SAP‚Äôs AI strategy.¬†The best #AITechnology in the world is only as good as the data it is trained with and the application context in which it operates. SAP builds the bridge from AI technology to business, enabling #responsible, secure, and value-added applications. We are enriching cutting-edge AI technologies with our industry data and deep business process expertise by tailoring the technology to the needs of our customers across their entire value chain. All built on leading ethics and data privacy standards. We call it #BusinessAI. In other words: If AI is the material, SAP is the tailor.¬†Business AI will completely change the way companies interact with our software, revolutionizing the business world. Today, users pull reports on finances, suppliers, materials, employees, and sustainability. As AI advances, people will be able to ask their systems questions such as "how can I reduce my company's carbon footprint in the next few years while also maintaining the same level of profit?" Similarly, the system will be able to make smart recommendations on how to become more productive and efficient and drive its own automation and configuration.¬†In short, at SAP, we firmly believe that generative AI will fundamentally change the way people and software work together and we're excited about the opportunities this brings.https://lnkd.in/esWEVmF9 (German)

Every time the national football team plays in the World Cup, a saying circulates in Germany: There are 80 million head coaches in the country. And during the pandemic, some said, there were 80 million virologists. Of course, these are all tongue-in-cheek exaggerations, but there‚Äôs a bit of truth to them: The pandemic raised our #curiosity to learn more about how the world of viruses and bacteria works, how hygiene protects us from infection ‚Äì and what happens in our bodies when they must defend themselves against outside invaders. I was very happy when I came across this (audio) book by Philipp Dettmer: In ‚ÄúImmune: A Journey into the Mysterious System That Keeps You Alive‚Äù Dettmer explains in a very entertaining and fascinating way how our highly complex immune system functions, and which highly specialized players come into action ‚Äì both on ‚Äúour‚Äù side and on the enemy‚Äôs side.‚ÄúImmunology meets the masses,‚Äù writes the renowned Science Magazine about the #book. I gladly subscribe to this review, because I learned a lot about #immunology, which is a constant matter in everyone‚Äôs life. The most fascinating fact is how our body can balance swiftly fighting off infections and being appropriately aggressive to avoid harming ourselves. Reading Dettmer‚Äôs book inspired me to pay more attention to my body‚Äôs needs and be more mindful of its workings. It taught me to appreciate the small but fascinating moments of #biology that often go unnoticed. Although we may not all be experts in coaching or virology, we are all responsible and concerned caretakers of our bodies.

One of my main objectives as Allianz CEO is to help create a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusivity, and fosters a corporate culture that values and respects the diverse backgrounds of all employees so that they can deliver their best every day. I am proud of the commitment shown by #Allianz in creating an open and diverse culture that nurtures our talent and provides an environment free from discrimination. However, there is still much progress to be made on a global scale. As Pride Month and Christopher Street Day (CSD) are celebrated worldwide, it is important to pause and reflect on the importance of recognizing and supporting the LGBTQ+ community. In many regions, this community faces challenges to their freedoms. It is crucial to protect and reinforce the right to live freely without fear, and with equality under the law. This is a fundamental human right. Pride Month and CSD parades serve as reminders of importance of safety and equality for the LGBTQ+ community. These events also provide an opportunity to celebrate the accomplishments of LGBTQ+ individuals and their contributions to our society as a whole. At Allianz, our aim is to embrace equality every day by creating an inclusive environment where all employees are valued, treated with dignity, enjoy their work, and can freely express their authentic selves. We have an active and growing LGBTQ+ community, which includes our Allianz Pride employee network, consisting of 27 local chapters all around the world. As signatories of the UN Free & Equal LGBTI Standards of Conduct, we pledge our support for an inclusive environment for our customers, employees, and communities. Additionally, we actively encourage and celebrate LGBTQ+ representation in leadership positions. I‚Äôm proud of Marie-Helene Tyack, Chair of the Allianz Global Pride Board, who was recently recognized as the 2023 Inspirational Role Model of the Year in The Bank of London Rainbow Honours. Each of us has a vital role to play in rejecting discrimination and developing a workplace where everyone feels valued and respected. Let us carry the spirit of Pride Month throughout the year, because it takes all of us, every day, to defend freedom of self-expression and to call out and resolve injustices when they occur. As we encourage inclusive ways of working and empower all colleagues to succeed as their authentic selves, we each help create an environment where all employees can thrive. This positions us for success to serve our customers in an ever-evolving world.Learn more about our commitment to LGBTQ+ inclusion here: https://lnkd.in/e6ERpTqM#AllianzPride #GetReadyForTheBest #CSD #Pride¬†#DiversityShinesBright #InclusiveWorkplace

The¬†dynamic developments in the¬†#GenerativeAI¬†space have made it very clear that we¬†urgently need international rules and guidelines for AI. This is¬†a belief shared by politicians, scientists, developers, and users alike.¬†Governments and companies worldwide have the responsibility to minimize risks.¬†While¬†Europe is well-positioned to take on a pioneering role in this area with the EU AI Act, one¬†critical question remains:¬†The development and implementation of AI regulation takes a long time¬†‚Äì and in the light of the fast-paced developments in this area, time is something we don‚Äôt have. So how¬†can we bridge this gap?¬†The answer lies in self-regulation.¬†At SAP, we¬†were one of the first European companies¬†to¬†define #AIEthics guiding principles and created an AI ethics steering committee in 2018. We also assembled an advisory panel of external experts from academia, politics, and industry to help us chart our course and monitor our approach. And back in January 2022, we rolled out the SAP Global AI Ethics Policy¬†to¬†clarify how SAP‚Äôs ethical guiding principles¬†are¬†applied¬†to¬†our daily work.¬†As companies accelerate¬†their adoption of¬†AI technology, it is crucial to commit to ethical practices and self-regulation until comprehensive international AI regulations are put into place. By doing so, we can ensure a safer, fairer, and more #responsible AI-driven future for all.¬†And experiences gathered¬†by doing so¬†could¬†also¬†provide useful input for governments when preparing actual AI legislation that is fit for purpose.

Multiple crises present us with massive challenges. One thing is clear, we will only manage them if we stay confident and open to dialogue.The Federation of German Industries (BDI) organised a congress ‚Äì hashtag#TDI23 ‚Äì in Berlin on the state of the German industry and its options for action. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg shared their perspectives.I had the honour to participate yesterday on a panel discussion, hosted by Isabelle K√∂rner on the subject "Race for transformation - Is the Industrial Country fit for Purpose?" together with Friedrich Merz, Patrick Wendeler and Catherine L. The open dialogue between industry and politics is particularly important for us as one of the large industrial insurers. hashtag#deglobalisation, hashtag#decarbonization, hashtag#demography and hashtag#digitalization are challenging all of us. How can insurers cope with them?This central question was discussed by scientists and experts from the insurance industry at an Aon Deutschland conference hosted by Marc Surminski last week.I had the honour of giving the keynote speech on New Work @Talanx and participating in a panel discussion with Peter Bofinger, Martin Klaffke, Prof. Thomas R. Koehler, Dr. Christoph Lamby, Jan-Oliver Thofern and Henning Voepel.Many thanks to the organisers for the invitation!I would like to share my key messages with you: üëâ We experience various structural ruptures. They take place simultaneously and intensify. Forecasts are becoming more and more difficult as a result. üëâ Smart data based on big data are no longer sufficient as strong signals for steering mechanisms in complex systems such as companies. üëâ In the New Normal, leading by "weak signals" is therefore becoming more and more important. üëâ Weak signals are qualitative, ambiguous, and intuitive signals. They are early signs of possible but unconfirmed changes that may become more significant later.üëâ To detect weak signals, above all a hashtag#culture of hashtag#trust is crucial. Employees feel that they are in a safe space to argue with weak signals.üëâ A decentralized structure with clear responsibilities, an empowered staff, and a focus on a relative performance to the market play important roles as well. In this perspective, we at hashtag#Talanx Group have laid the right foundation for leading by weak signals. hashtag#TogetherTalanx

Full house today at Telekom headquarters: We celebrate the TelekomBaskets for a fantastic season! As the main sponsor, we welcomed the Telekom Baskets Bonn team with our employees as well as families and friends and thanked them for their great season performance. Bonn and Telekom are proud of this team.The Baskets have won the Champions League and thus clinched the first title in their club history! And even if it wasn't quite enough for the German championship title in the finals, the team and coaching staff have done a great job! We saw a team full of passion that, for all its individual class, performed above all as a collective. They represented the T in an outstanding way. In every game, they all played for one and one for all. The past season was the best advertisement for German basketball and our shared hometown #Bonn and the Telekom Dome!I am delighted that we are increasing our #Telekom commitment for the 2023/24 season and will continue to partner the Baskets. This ensures that the club remains competitive at the top level. We are also working on developing a new sponsorship concept together with the club to attract more sponsors for the Baskets and thus secure professional basketball in Bonn in the long term. #team #engagement

Today I have officially taken over the reins of Eurelectric, the trade body representing the European electricity industry in Brussels. Having been acting president for eight months, I am honored to continue the mission for the next two years and would like to thank the board for the trust placed in me to carry out this office at such a crucial time for European energy supply.Joined by my Vice Presidents Markus Rauramo ‚Äì CEO of Fortum ‚Äì and Georgios Stassis ‚Äì CEO of PPC ‚Äì I made a strong call to put in place the necessary enablers for a radical ramp up of electrification, at a time when Europe needs to accelerate its decarbonisation and ensure its energy sovereignty. Strengthening electricity grids, rethinking Europe‚Äôs security of supply, and ensuring proper investment conditions will be our three top priorities. A key focus in this regard will be on the expansion and digitalisation of the electricity infrastructure. We must urgently prioritise the growth and digitalisation of our infrastructure to enable consumers to reap the benefits of their own flexibility and ensure access to clean, reliable electricity. Policymakers and regulators need to supercharge the green agenda and support electrification. Just focusing on cost-efficiency control is no longer an option, and Eurelectric will be carrying this message loud and clear. In Brussels and beyond.More here: https://lnkd.in/eJapdMQh #PowerSummit23 #BalanceOfPower copyright photos: David Plas

Last week RWE announced that of the 72 wind turbines we‚Äôre installing at their Thor offshore wind power plant, 40 of them will be equipped with the hashtag#RecyclableBlade and 36 of them with the hashtag#GreenerTower. That, of course, is a good reason to celebrate. Both pioneering solutions are setting a new standard for the entire wind industry. But there‚Äôs another aspect to the story that I‚Äôd like to highlight: the importance of partnerships. We also held our annual Siemens Gamesa Leadership Conference in Madrid last week, and I was delighted to invite Katja W√ºnschel to be our guest speaker. A female leader and RWE‚Äôs CEO for Onshore Wind and PV for Europe and Australia, she has a unique perspective not just on leadership, but on what it means to deepen partnerships to the greatest effect. And I can only reiterate what she said during her keynote: empower. Empower your people, empower your suppliers, empower your customers.  The market for wind hasn‚Äôt yet reached the level of maturity that it needs to achieve government build-out targets. But by empowering stakeholders throughout the value chain, we can push for greater market maturity. If we can create integrated value chains, we‚Äôll be able to accelerate the rate at which projects like the Thor offshore wind power plant are installed.  Thank you again, Katja, for speaking at our conference. And of course a big thank you also to Sven Uterm√∂hlen and team for choosing us to work on the Thor offshore project. I can say, on behalf of all of hashtag#TeamSiemensGamesa, that it‚Äôs a pleasure working with all of you at hashtag#TeamRWE. https://lnkd.in/dF8zKgBS
