We won't stop until everyone is #connected! Deutsche Telekom stands for the participation of all people in society. That is why our commitment as a premium partner of the Special Olympics World Games Berlin 2023 is a matter close to our heart. #Inclusion is anchored in our guiding principles, but it is also crucial that we actively live inclusion! At #Telekom, 7.5% of the workforce has a disability.Our first 50 volunteer places for #Berlin2023 were immediately taken, so we directly increased to 100 places and they were also found immediately. The fact that so many Telekom employees from all over Germany are volunteering at the World Games makes us proud. Of course, we are also focusing on digital participation. To ensure that the competitions run smoothly, we are providing support in the form of fiber-optic, fixed-network and mobile connections, and we are making all our World Games content available on #MagentaTV, completely barrier-free. Together we can strengthen the social participation of people with disabilities - communication is the key! #TogetherUnbeatable.Inclusion is an entrepreneurial task. Sometimes inclusion also thrives on the commitment of individuals, like my colleague Judith Braun . She has set herself the goal of ensuring that Telekom makes even more content available in simple language on its corporate website. And of course she is one of the many volunteers at the Special Olympics. Thank you and everyone who is volonteering! #engagement #specialolympics Birgit Bohle Michael Hagspihl

Trade is one of the main arteries for maintaining and expanding global prosperity. And who would be better to feel the pulse of these arteries than Allianz Trade, the world leader in Trade Credit Insurance? To gain insights into the current state of global trade today, the recently published 2023 Allianz Trade Global Survey surveyed about 3,000 companies in seven countries: France, Germany, Italy, Poland, Spain, the UK, and the US. In general, exporters maintain a cautious sense of optimism, with around 70% of businesses expecting an increase in export generated turnover in 2023. However, challenges and risks, including non-payment concerns, continue to dominate priorities. As a result, ESG initiatives have taken a backseat, with 80% of respondents prioritizing business continuity over ESG commitments this year. Fortunately, it‚Äôs not a binary choice. Organizations can prioritize both business continuity and ESG goals without facing inherent conflicts. This is evident by the fact that 85% of respondents are actively dedicated to a long-term energy transition. This raises the question: How can we foster robust trade, which plays a vital role in the global economy, while minimizing environmental impact and achieving emissions targets outlined in the Paris Agreement?The new report provides insights into addressing this question. Personally, I find it encouraging that an overwhelming majority of respondents support a long-term energy transition, validating that we don‚Äôt have to make a choice between economic growth, sustainable development, and social welfare. Trade has long played a significant role in our society, and it can be a valuable tool for creating a more prosperous, resilient, and equitable world.Explore the full report here: https://lnkd.in/e2-UUQR4 #AllianzTradeGlobalSurvey2023 #Trade #SustainableDevelopment #ESG #Allianz

There are many things I admire about #Japan: its rich culture, the friendly modesty of the people, and, finally, the impressive life expectancy which is among the highest in the world. This is not only attributed to healthy lifestyle but also to Japan's advanced #healthcare system. Nevertheless, Japan faces the same challenges as many other industrialized nations: aging population, increase in chronic illnesses, and shortage of medical and nursing professionals. It‚Äôs just admirable how Japan embraces #technology and #innovation to tackle these challenges.¬†During the past three days, I had the great pleasure and honor to talk with many Japanese customers and partners about these exact questions. What can Siemens Healthineers contribute to making healthcare in Japan more accurate, efficient, and accessible? ¬†I was especially happy about seeing Dr. Yoshiaki Sagara again, Chairman of Sagara Hospital, our long-standing partner and one of the leading hospitals pioneering the future of women‚Äôs health in Japan. Nine years after our first meeting when he presented his vision it was so impressive to see how his hospitals have developed and how they grow and stand out ‚Äì but I also smiled when I thought about how we have developed as a company and partner at the same time. Long-term relationships like this are very fulfilling and it is so nice to see them flourish.¬†And of course, I also took the opportunity to visit our team in Tokyo ‚Äì and to do a (partially virtual) town hall meeting. Many thanks for your spirit and for your thoughtful questions and ideas! #TeamHealthineers

Studying the past often provides solutions for the future. Hydrogen, the power source behind the first internal combustion engine in the 1860s, is now being rediscovered as an alternative fuel in the face of climate change.There is great potential for hydrogen to fuel long-haul trucks and ships using fuel cells, as well as supporting electrical power grids to meet the energy demands of homes and industries on a large scale. The decreasing costs of renewable electricity has sparked interest in producing hydrogen through electrolyzers, which are devices that utilize electricity to split water into oxygen and hydrogen. When renewable sources power this electricity process, the resulting hydrogen is considered ‚Äògreen‚Äô since it produces harmless water vapor instead of greenhouse gases (GHGs). How much does this have to do with the insurance sector and Allianz? I am proud to say quite a bit actually. Investments made by the insurance industry can play a pivotal role in achieving a green hydro-based economy. As asset owners, insurance companies possess the long-term investment horizon that makes them an ideal source of infrastructure financing. At Allianz, we are actively developing both parts needed to produce green hydrogen, renewable energy and electrolyzers. For nearly two decades, Allianz has been investing in renewable energy sources like solar PV and wind farms. We have recently made direct investments in Ren-Gas, a Finnish green hydrogen and power-to-gas developer. Additionally, three years ago, Allianz, together with other institutional investors, acquired a 75% stake in the gas distribution operator Floene, which supports the national energy transition plan of Portugal.In addition to investing as asset owners, insurers also provide the necessary insurance coverage needed for hydrogen and renewable energy projects. As long-term risk managers, insurers are a natural fit for supporting the transition away from fossil fuel dependency and towards clean, renewable energy. These are exciting times for our industry. Working with our partners in government, insurers are playing a major role in transitioning our global society towards an energy system that is more environmentally clean, healthy, affordable and secure. To learn more about why hydrogen is gaining attention as an essential element of our carbon-free future, visit the following link:https://lnkd.in/eCfPVJX4#Allianz #Sustainability #ImpactInvesting #EnergyTransition

In a week in which research by climate scientists has found that it is now too late to save Arctic summer sea ice, #WorldOceansDay and knowing how we can all make a difference becomes more important than ever. There are little things we can all do, such as avoiding #SingleUsePlastics or eating sustainable seafood. #Technology can also play a key role in helping to protect the oceans and the diversity of life within them. For example, researchers in Germany are using #AI to explore ways to tackle the ca. 10 million tons of #PlasticWaste that finds its way into our oceans every year, and around the world, the public and private sectors are working together on solutions to support the circular economy and ocean data collection and analysis. While there are many reasons to feel overwhelmed by the challenges we face in protecting our planet, I'm also optimistic that the tide is changing and awareness and action are increasing. https://lnkd.in/emBNuKjt

Business environments are changing rapidly. In this fast-paced era, more complex challenges need simpler, more intelligent solutions. Companies are increasingly looking for efficient solutions tailored to industry-specific business needs. And that‚Äôs the approach SAP has taken with #IntelligentCX. A great example of a customer that is transforming its business model with the help of SAP is Goodyear Proactive Solutions, part of Goodyear Dunlop Tires Europe B.V.. Goodyear Proactive Solutions needed to ensure it could meet its service level agreements and support its rapid growth by responding quickly and efficiently to customer inquiries, streamlining handover between teams, and transparently monitoring and tracking issue resolution.With SAP CX solutions, Goodyear achieved a unified, cloud-based service management solution with an integrated knowledge base. This allowed them to gain a 360-degree view of their customers‚Äô service interactions, more streamlined processes, and the ability to integrate #AI and #MachineLearning into workflows for even greater efficiency. Industries and Customer Experience are an integral part of SAP's portfolio. With our combination of 50 years of industry expertise and intelligent #CX technologies, we can accelerate value to customers by enabling end-to-end, integrated business processes, connecting operational and contextual data to engage the right customers, at the right moment, wherever they are. Goodyear is just one example of how we're very proud to help companies worldwide drive exceptional customer experiences and business outcomes and transform their business models with intelligent, industry-tailored CX solutions.SAP Customer Experience

Tag f√ºr Tag bauen wir f√ºr das beste #Netz, auf dem Land und in den St√§dten, denn unsere Netze sind die digitalen Lebensadern der Gesellschaft. Heute bauen wir aber auch Pflanzen an f√ºr die Umwelt, denn Flora und Fauna sind die Lebensadern unserer Natur. Mit dem Projekt "Magenta Blossom" √ºbernimmt die Deutsche Telekom eine Naturpatenschaft. Es ist ein kleiner Beitrag im gro√üen Format f√ºr den Schutz und die F√∂rderung von biologischer Vielfalt. Somit st√§rkt Magenta Blossom auch den Kreislauf in der Landwirtschaft.Konkret schaffen wir gemeinsam mit dem M√ºnchner Start-up GEOXIP AG einen einzigartigen Raum f√ºr Bienen, Insekten und Schmetterlinge. 21,7 Millionen Blumensamen werden so zur Hochbl√ºte im August unser ‚ÄûT‚Äú in Magenta und den Schriftzug #GreenMagenta zeigen. The expansion of renewable energies is the way to a hashtag#NetZero future. And so is collaboration.  Whether it‚Äôs governments working together to agree on climate targets and on measures to reach them, businesses joining forces on the path to a greener future, or people sticking their heads together to drive innovation and ideas on how to get there ‚Äì we should never underestimate the power of human connection.  And human connection is lived and experienced most when people come together in person. This is why I strongly support having our colleagues at Siemens Gamesa return to our offices. We are more likely to share experiences, exchange perspectives and learn from others when we are working together in one location. This enhances productivity, boosts innovation, and fosters teamwork. And ultimately, it also benefits our well-being. As to the latter, let‚Äôs not forget that staying active is crucial for a healthy work-life balance as well. I recently enjoyed a beautiful bike ride around Munich. It re-energized me and allowed for some fresh inspiration. Plus, choosing sustainable means of transportation comes with the additional benefit of reducing carbon emissions, thereby supporting us on our journey to a net-zero world.  Where will you go cycling next? üö¥‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏èhashtag#WorldBicycleDay

Today is my first day as CEO of thyssenkrupp, and from the very beginning I had the privilege of meeting employees from various sectors of our company. What better way to familiarize myself with the business than by engaging in dialogues with our employees? One common attribute I observed in all of them: their high level of motivation. And that is precisely the basis for continuing to establish our businesses as pioneers in the green industry. Our goal for hashtag#thyssenkrupp is clear: to play a key role in shaping the hashtag#greentransformation. Our technologies offer enormous potential for this. I am well aware that the past years of change have demanded a lot from our employees. Nevertheless, now is the time to take it to the next level. hashtag#thyssenkrupp has created opportunities, fostered resilience, and built strength. It is time for us to score goals, or as they say in the "hashtag#Ruhrgebiet": "Entscheidend is' auf'm Platz!" (What matters is on the field!) I can‚Äôt single-handedly shoot the ball into the goal. However, together with you I believe we can extract the best from our team and the company as a whole. History has demonstrated that the success of thyssenkrupp relies on the people who embody the spirit of the company - our hashtag#employees. I am excited about the journey ahead and to work hashtag#together with forward thinkers, tacklers, enablers and hard workers. We will encourage open dialogue, where ideas are shared, and constructive feedback is valued. Let us unlock new opportunities and drive sustainable growth. Together, we will shape an even stronger future, building upon our unique tradition.

Happy Pride!This month we celebrate the LGBTQIA+ community. That is why at Siemens Gamesa we actively champion policies that support equality and equity for all ‚Äì throughout the year. We foster an inclusive culture, where everyone feels safe and valued, regardless of sexual orientation, gender identity, ethnicity, religion, age, or disability. But achieving this depends on the diverse perspectives, knowledge, and experience of everyone in our workforce, especially those who have been historically underrepresented. We all deserve to feel the sense of belonging that lets us engage our full potential and tackle the planet‚Äôs energy challenges.I‚Äôm proud to be part of a team that promotes rather than discourages diversity. We will continue to build a workplace where everyone feels empowered, so that we can lead the energy transition together.hashtag#PrideMonth hashtag#MoreWindNow

Business macht Spa√ü, insbesondere durch die spontanen Momente: Die Taufe der Boeing 787 auf den Namen Wiesbaden.Inmitten eines erfolgreichen Gesch√§ftstermins mit den Chefs der #Lufthansa, mit der wir bei Netzwerken, IT und vielen anderen Themen erfolgreich zusammenarbeiten, hatte ich das Privileg, auf Einladung von Carsten Spohr, dem CEO der Lufthansa, an der Taufe eines Flugzeugs teilzunehmen. Diese besondere Zeremonie markierte die Benennung einer Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner als "Wiesbaden". "Ich bin bereits so viel mit der Lufthansa um die Welt geflogen, da wollte ich einfach dabei sein. F√ºr mich ist der Kranich irgendwie auch ein Symbol f√ºr Weltoffenheit und Freiheit.Anwesend waren neben Carsten Spohr, der CEO der Lufthansa, Boris Rhein, der Ministerpr√§sident von Hessen sowie der Oberb√ºrgermeister von Wiesbaden Gert-Uwe Mende, aber vor allem sogenannte HON Mitglieder. Das sind die Kundinnen und Kunden, die mindestens 600.000 Meilen in zwei aufeinanderfolgenden Kalenderjahren fliegen. Die #Boeing 787 ist zweifellos ein au√üergew√∂hnliches Flugzeug. Mit 60 Prozent weniger Treibstoffverbrauch als seine Vorg√§nger, einer verbesserten Aerodynamik und einer deutlich leichteren Bauweise bietet sie nicht nur eine √∂kologischere Reiseoption, sondern auch mehr Platz, insbesondere in der Economy Class. Dar√ºber hinaus ist sie leiser und sorgt f√ºr eine bessere Luftqualit√§t an Bord.Ich bin ja auch ein Vielflieger, aber so gro√üartig die Flugzeuge auch sind, am Ende z√§hlen diejenigen, die die Maschine sicher warten, die Pilot*innen, die uns sicher zum Ziel bringen, und vor allem die Service-Mitarbeitenden, die mich vor, w√§hrend und nach dem Flug immer ausgezeichnet betreuen. Danke einmal an die gro√üartigen Lufthansa-Crews. Ich f√ºhle mich immer sofort zuhause, sobald ich irgendwo auf der Welt in einen Lufthansa-Flieger einsteige. Danke auch an unseren #Gesch√§ftspartner Lufthansa und besonders Carsten Spohr, der nicht nur die Lufthansa wieder erfolgreich gemacht hat, sondern auch daf√ºr gesorgt hat, dass er meine gewohnte Routine durchbrochen hat. Abschlie√üend w√ºnschte er der Boeing 787 "Always a happy landing".

Talanx becomes one of the three top insurers in Latin America! I am very happy to announce that our Retail International division, HDI International, has signed a purchase agreement to acquire the Liberty Seguros personal and small commercial business in Brazil, Chile, Colombia and Ecuador. The acquisition fits well in our Talanx Strategy 2025: üëâ Latin America is alongside Europe one of our core regions in the retail business. üëâ Our goal is to achieve a market-leading position in our core markets through organic and inorganic growth. üëâ The acquisition will improve our Group net income and our return on equity already in the first year after the expected closing in 2024. üëâ It will increase HDI International‚Äôs gross written premiums (IFRS 4) in Latin America by around EUR 1.7 billion. üëâ It will strengthen the diversification of our group. Congratulations, Wilm Langenbach, Nicolas Masjuan and all Talanx and HDI International teams for enhancing our business in Latin America. When I was nearly 30 years old, I had two alternative job offers: The first offer came with clear tasks, a title, and a good salary. The second offer promised none of that but a big challenge. I opted for the second alternative. Why? Because the job gave me the freedom to shape the future of the company and to develop my skills. The jump into the deep end had triggered a huge amount of energy. Had I done things wrong along the way? Yes! But for me, that was part of the learning process. I was soon given a new challenging task where I could continue to grow. This experience had a lasting effect on my professional career.Psychologist Carol Dweck argues in her groundbreaking book "Mindset: The New Psychology of Success" that success is not due to hashtag#intelligence, hashtag#talent or hashtag#education, but to a hashtag#growthmindset. People with a growth mindset believe that success comes from constant personal development and hard work. They are hashtag#curious and accept challenges easily. This contrasts with people with a fixed mindset, who believe that they are limited by fixed, innate talents that cannot be changed or improved. They fear challenges. The good news is that a growth mindset can be learned!Here is how you can cultivate a growth mindset:üëâ Discover where you currently are on the spectrum between growth mindset and fixed mindset.üëâ Stay curious. Try to see challenges and failures as opportunities for self-development. üëâ Reward yourself for hard work. üëâ Embrace the power of "YET", such as "I don't know how to do this YET". üëâ Be mindful of how you think about others' work. Instead of saying, "She's talented," you could say, "She worked hard to develop this skill." üëâ Be patient. Getting there is part of the journey.In line with our hashtag#Talanx purpose `Together we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship`, an entrepreneurial growth mindset is part of our DNA. Accordingly, people development is an essential part of our corporate strategy. Especially in a challenging VUCA-world we need an absolute growth mindset! Do you have more tips on how to achieve a growth mindset?hashtag#TogetherTalanx

The past days in #China have been very enlightening, exciting, and encouraging for me. After not being able to visit the country for more than three years, I was more than impressed and truly proud to feel the spirit of our Chinese team, which has grown to 7,500 passionate Healthineers, therein more than 1,000 in R&D: a strong Chinese team being supported by and supporting a strong global team! #Healthcare and especially #innovation in healthcare is a team sport and requires an ecosystem of like-minded organizations and experts ‚Äì sharing the same goal and contributing different strengths. I was very happy to see how such an ecosystem is developing for healthcare in China and how we are growing deeper and deeper roots: with our center for open innovation in Shanghai, with our numerous clinical collaborations, with our first MedTech Pioneer Innovation Forum for startups, and with the joint education program for hospital presidents. Siemens Healthineers is humbled and proud to partner with Tsinghua University and the National Health Commission, pioneering a new model of education to support ‚ÄúHealthy China‚Äù. Thanks to our global network, our local partners, customers, and their patients will benefit from expertise from other parts of the world. This spirit of #collaboration is something I have felt in all the encounters I have had over the past few days. While I know many of my Chinese fellow Healthineers for more than 20 years and it was great to finally see them again, it was a special joy for me to get to know our Varian team in person for the first time: #thankyou for an impressive tour through your site in Beijing and for the inspiring discussion! #TeamHealthineers

Wo kein Rohstoff, da kein Kreislauf ‚Äì Chemie und Entsorgungswirtschaft im Schulterschluss¬†Bei der Mitgliederversammlung des BDE Bundesverband der Deutschen Entsorgungs-, Wasser- und Kreislaufwirtschaft e. V. diskutierte ich mit Vertreterinnen und Vertretern aus der Entsorgungswirtschaft und Politik √ºber unsere nationale Kreislaufwirtschaftsstrategie. Trotz unserer unterschiedlichen Branchen haben wir doch ein gemeinsames Ziel: Deutschland als attraktiven, nachhaltigen und zukunftsf√§higen Industriestandort etablieren, und zwar durch die Schaffung einer #Kreislaufwirtschaft.¬†Dieses gemeinsame Ziel kann und muss uns n√§herbringen. Denn die weltweit steigende Nachfrage nach Kunststoffen passt derzeit nicht zu den gerade einmal neun Prozent der Kunststoffabf√§lle, die recycelt werden. In Deutschland sind es immerhin 30 Prozent, doch die Luft nach oben ist ersichtlich.¬†Dieser scheinbare Widerspruch kann in Wirklichkeit eine Chance sein. Durch den Einsatz recycelter Rohstoffe zur Deckung der Kunststoffnachfrage k√∂nnen wir sowohl unser Rohstoffproblem als auch unser Abfallproblem l√∂sen. Daf√ºr sind vor allem zwei Dinge entscheidend:¬†- Innovationen beim Design und Recycling von Kunststoffen- Unterst√ºtzung durch politische und regulatorische Rahmenbedingungen¬†An Ideen, Innovationen und dem n√∂tigen Know-How fehlt es uns nicht. An schnell umsetzbaren, aufeinander abgestimmten Ma√ünahmen m√ºssen wir dagegen noch schwer arbeiten. Keine leichte Aufgabe, aber auch kein Grund, sie auf die lange Bank zu schieben. Die gemeinsame Begeisterung auf der BDE-Mitgliederversammlung st√§rkt meinen Optimismus, dass wir das schaffen k√∂nnen.¬†Ich freue mich darauf, unsere gemeinsame Arbeit dort fortzusetzen, wo unsere Diskussion aufgeh√∂rt hat, Steffi Lemke, Ingbert Liebing und Peter Kurth.

#Rezession in Deutschland. Was nun?In den vergangenen Monaten gab es kontroverse Diskussionen √ºber die Lage der deutschen Wirtschaft ‚Äì von optimistischen Stimmen bis hin zu d√ºsteren Prognosen.Nun haben wir es schwarz auf wei√ü: Das statistische Bundesamt korrigiert seine Sch√§tzung der Wirtschaftsleistung in Q1 auf -0,3 Prozent. Deutschland befindet sich in einer Rezession, vor der die Industrie seit Monaten gewarnt hat.Entscheidend ist jetzt, dass wir der Realit√§t ins Auge sehen und aus den Fehlern der Vergangenheit lernen. Das gilt besonders f√ºr den #Industriestrompreis. Der muss kommen, schnell und unb√ºrokratisch. Der Weg aus der Rezession gelingt nur, wenn wir die deutsche Industrie st√§rken und ihren Weg zur Klimaneutralit√§t ebnen.Die wichtigste Lehre: Ideologien bremsen und spalten. Daher m√ºssen wir gemeinsam mit allen Stakeholdern¬†entschlossen die Fakten anerkennen und mutig handeln. Dann k√∂nnen wir auch diese Herausforderung bew√§ltigen und den Kurs in Richtung nachhaltiger und resilienterer #Kreislaufwirtschaft fortsetzen.

What industry are we actually talking about with these keywords? From product-centric to global platforms. From tangible product to software. From old technology to new technology. From data producers to data users. From closed systems to open interfaces. From multi-year model cycles to weekly updates.¬†Certainly around the telco industry. But also the #automotive industry. Thank you for the invitation, Hildegard M√ºller and Arndt G. Kirchhoff, to the SME Day of the German Association of the Automotive Industry (VDA) e.V. in Bonn. It was not only instructive, it was also fun to exchange ideas with so many innovative and successful entrepreneurs.Both industries need to continue to transform in order to remain successful. I was able to talk about this yesterday. There are many points to this, here are just a few:1. #Digitization and data use must be prioritized and scaled in all companies. This includes AI, it's the only way to manage "Big Data". API must be part of the DNA.2. technological sovereignty through own #KI like ADAS, battery production, chips.3. evolution from silos to partnerships. Learned OEM logic is sometimes too hierarchical.And the most important point: high competitive culture and "winner mentality". Don't get infected by defeatism. Instead, implement things with a clear focus. To do this, it is important to leave your own comfort zone. Because only beyond the comfort zone do we train ourselves and become more resilient, which in turn helps us to master problems and challenges. For me, this also includes the principle: "Stay happy as a person". A bird can only fly with two wings. And happy people are always more successful.#technology #software #bigdata

We also explored the impact of changing interest rates on Allianz‚Äôs financial performance and discussed potential models for the future success of Germany‚Äôs economy.Many thanks to Michael Rasch and Ren√© H√∂ltschi for such a thought-provoking conversation. Let‚Äôs continue to create an environment that brings together wind aficionad@s from around the world.  hashtag#TeamSiemensGamesa hashtag#diversity hashtag#belonging hashtag#DEI hashtag#DEIB

I missed our togetherness! My life until 2020 was characterised by personal encounters. During the COVID-19 pandemic, we distanced ourselves socially. Even though I met many people virtually, I missed the emotional qualities of face-to-face communication. I have also learned that personal interactions improve work results enormously. When COVID-19 restrictions were loosening, I could feel our togetherness again and the great energy that comes from it. Today, not a day goes by that I am not engaging face-to-face with colleagues or business partners.Because of this personal experience, I am touched by a recent advisory published by US Surgeon General Vivek Murthy on the topic of hashtag#loneliness. In his opinion, a public health crisis is looming in the US due to the lack of social connection. Several studies show that this also applies to other societies.Loneliness is not just about a lack of connections in personal relationships. America‚Äôs top doctor observed that the relational spaces in companies are very important as well. Supportive and inclusive relationships at work are associated with higher job satisfaction, higher innovative power, and better health.People are social beings. They need to be AND to feel connected to other people. To create a sense of hashtag#belonging, hashtag#trust and psychological safety, we need not only the big, but also the small conversations.I truly believe that companies must create opportunities for people to meet up in person and to enjoy their togetherness. Our social glue is crucial for our health, our well-being and for our company.I‚Äôm looking forward to your thoughts about this topic. The picture below was taken at our hashtag#backtogether party in the summer 2022. hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#TogetherNotLonely

Foresight is a key characteristic of a responsible insurance company. The recently released Allianz Global Insurance Report 2023 reveals that the global insurance industry has applied our skills for foresight to successfully navigate through challenging inflationary times and help our customers be more resilient. And yet, as outlined in the report, inflation continues to impact companies and customers alike. Price increases cause claims payments by insurers to rise sharply, tempering premium growth. Inflation has also led to a decline in real incomes forcing households to reduce their saving efforts ‚Äì slowing life insurance market growth. ¬†I share the viewpoint of my Allianz Research colleagues, who believe that structural drivers will determine inflation in the coming years. In this environment, insurers play a crucial role by acting as an economic shock absorber. Although the insurance industry cannot undo inflation, insurers can mitigate its impacts by safeguarding the assets of their customers and ensuring uninterrupted business operations.¬†Insurers have the opportunity to strengthen our value proposition in this context. We can use our foresight to anticipate a shift in focus from merely covering risk to assisting customers in avoiding risk altogether. This is one of the reasons why we at Allianz are deeply committed to the transition toward a #netzero future. By addressing the effects of climate change, we help mitigate some of the most significant risks that our society, economy, and customers currently face. Leading the way towards a more sustainable and resilient economy is how we secure the future of our customers and the stability of our business.¬†Learn more about the role that insurance plays in inflationary environments and gain insights into the forthcoming implications by reading the full report: https://lnkd.in/ePdxwguG¬†#Allianz #Inflation #SustainableFinance #InsuranceReport2023

Netto-null bis 2035* ‚Äì damit hat sich Covestro ein besonders ambitioniertes Klimaziel gesetztMit einem neuen Aktionsplan f√ºr unsere NRW-Standorte gehen wir nun einen wichtigen Schritt in diese Richtung.Wie viele andere Chemieunternehmen brauchen wir f√ºr den Betrieb unserer Anlagen gro√üe Mengen Energie. Um unsere anspruchsvollen Ziele zu erreichen, m√ºssen wir auch unkonventionelle Wege gehen und brauchen ausreichend Spielraum und #Technologieoffenheit.Ich bin √ºberzeugt, dass Nachhaltigkeit und Wachstum Hand in Hand gehen. Gestern durfte ich meine rotarischen Freundinnen und Freunde des #Rotary Clubs Bonn S√ºd-Bad Godesberg und die Mitglieder des Rotaract Clubs Bonn in unserer Telekom Design Gallery begr√º√üen. Der Abend und unsere Diskussionen standen dabei ganz im Zeichen des von Club-Pr√§sident Otto Niederhofer ausgerufenen Jahresmottos ‚ÄûLebensfreude mit Sinn‚Äú. Ein Motto, welches gerade in diesen Zeiten aktueller denn je ist. Wir sehen uns gegenw√§rtig mit einer nie dagewesenen Anzahl und Dynamik an folgenschweren Entwicklungen, sogenannter schwarzer Schw√§ne, konfrontiert. Die Klimakrise, geopolitische Konflikte, technologische Revolutionen wie KI oder Cyberangriffe ‚Äì um nur einige schwarze Schw√§ne zu nennen ‚Äì stellen uns im Beruf und im gesellschaftlichen Alltag vor gro√üe Herausforderungen. Diskussionen wie gestern k√∂nnen dabei helfen, konkrete L√∂sungen zu diskutieren und die Lebensfreude als Teil einer Gemeinschaft beizubehalten. Denn im Umgang mit schwarzen Schw√§nen bedarf es konsequenter Ma√ünahmen und der richtigen Haltung: Flexibilit√§t, Resilienz, Anpassungsf√§higkeit und eine Kultur gemeinsamer Werte. Bei der Deutsche Telekom erlebe ich dies t√§glich in den Interaktionen mit unseren vielen Mitarbeitenden. Die Lebensfreude zeigt sich in der Identifikation mit unserer Marke und einer ordentlichen Portion #werkstolz. Den Sinn geben uns dabei unsere Unternehmenswerte, die Guiding Principles und unser Purpose: Wir verbinden Menschen und wir geben uns erst zufrieden, wenn alle #dabei sind. Vielen Dank an die Rotary-Mitglieder und die jungen Erwachsenen des Rotaract Clubs sowie das Design-Gallery Team f√ºr einen kurzweiligen Abend und die guten Diskussionen.

From my own experience I can say: politics draws energy from companies.In my first job I was part of a project. I didn't like it because I didn't agree with the way the project leader wanted it to go. I didn't feel that we were making things work that way.I talked to my teammates that I totally disagree with what we were doing. One day my boss spoke to me about it. I was embarrassed. He said: "I was listening to somebody who told me that you are against my project. I don't like members in the team who don't speak up, who talk about each other negatively. So, you are out."Today, I can say that the project did indeed fail. But it was also me who chose the wrong path to communicate my concerns. From that moment on it was clear to me: Never ever would I talk badly behind the curtain. To change a situation, we must speak up directly. A company is only successful if there is no politics.What I learned from that:üëâYou must make it easy for people to disagree.üëâTo achieve this, people must be invited to give open feedback.üëâThis is only possible in trusting relationships. What are your experiences on this topic?hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#Leadership

After three long years, I finally had the chance to visit China, one of Covestro‚Äôs largest markets worldwide ‚Äì and what an eye-opening experience it was.¬†My visit reaffirmed how much our global transformation towards a sustainable future relies on local progress. As a result, our largest Chinese production site in Shanghai has got an important global certification for the use of sustainable raw materials (#ISCCPlus). And it operates to an increasing extent on renewable energy, enabling also our customers to achieve their own sustainability goals.¬†We are eager to learn from each other beyond politics and borders, adapt best practices to local contexts, and understand how every step taken ‚Äì no matter how small ‚Äì brings us closer to our goal: a prosperous world, flourishing in a #CircularEconomy.¬†It was truly a pleasure to reconnect with my dear colleagues, our partners and media representatives in China. Thank you Covestro China, China Petroleum and Chemical Industry Federation, Shanghai Municipal Government, Shanghai Chemical Industry Park, and Tongji University for the engaging and insightful exchange!

Und auf Anfrage an das Stra√üenverkehrsamt, ob man wegen der Baustelle eine Ampel tempor√§r abschalten k√∂nnte, bekommt man den Vorschlag, dass das in 4-5 Monaten vielleicht m√∂glich w√§re. #EinfachMalMachen #energiewende

There is one epeiric sea on the European continental shelf that is set to become the foundation of Europe‚Äôs green energy transition: the North Sea. Nine European countries pledged to increase offshore wind farm capacity in the North Sea by eight times the current levels, this was announced at a summit on offshore wind this April, in Ostend, Belgium. The aim is to boost their combined capacity to 120GW by 2030 and 300GW by 2050 and turn the North Sea into the ‚Äúpowerhouse of Europe‚Äù. ¬†This pledge highlights the urgent need for renewable energy sources and the importance of collaboration between policymakers and the business community to accelerate investment in renewables and green energy infrastructure.¬†Allianz takes great pride in playing a key role regarding investments in Europe‚Äôs renewable energy industry, which has developed into a well-established and sustainable business over the past 25 years. Allianz has long recognized wind power as a good, long-term value investment, and a source of stable, long-term cash yield profile with low risks. Our investment portfolio includes more than 100 wind farms and solar park projects in Europe, and the US, including some of the largest offshore wind farms in the world such as He Dreiht in Germany and Hollandse Kust Zuid in the Netherlands. These investments in wind and solar energy projects are instrumental in advancing the share of renewable energy in Europe, reinforcing our goal of achieving a carbon-neutral portfolio by 2050.¬†The offshore wind ambitions of Europe are massive and meeting them requires substantial investments. At Allianz, we remain keen to support the transition to renewables, whether it‚Äôs through investment impact, or through partnerships such as the United Nations convened Net-Zero Asset Owner Alliance, where we champion ambitious decarbonization strategies that can be effectively implemented at scale. And a successful renewable energy transition requires diverse forms of collaboration between governments, industry, organizations, and individuals. That‚Äôs why this new pledge holds a great deal of promise. As the old saying goes, ‚ÄúIf you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, go together.‚Äù¬†¬†#Allianz¬†#Sustainability¬†#EnergyTransition¬†#ImpactInvesting ACP | Allianz Capital Partners

Today on Europe Day, we commemorate the Declaration of Robert Schuman, the French foreign minister, who - on 9 May 1950 - proposed the creation of the European Coal and Steel Community, laying the ground to what we know today as the European Union. Already 73 years ago it was clear that energy and securing of supply would be foundational, unifying components of the modern European society.In the 1990s, EU Member States have been striving to create a common internal energy market. After last year‚Äôs crisis, we can say that the internal energy market delivered security of supply to all Europeans despite two tremendous supply shocks in gas and power. We can hardly imagine whether and how Europe could have withstood the crisis without such integration. These very days, we are discussing again about electricity market design and EU integration. Let me be clear: the internal energy market should be non-negotiable. Reverting to public interventions in setting prices, preferential access for some customers or other forms of fragmentation are not the right premise of a united, cohesive Union.Renewables and grids are today the fuel of the Europe of tomorrow. We need simple and smart rules to invest massively on them, to invest our way out of the crisis. #europeday #energy

Together with other European business leaders, we¬†have written to President Von Der Leyen, Executive Vice-President Vestager, Commissioner Breton, and the Swedish Presidency, urging them to pause and rethink the #DataAct.Our three major concerns are:‚ñ∂ Under the business-to-business data-sharing chapter, there are still not enough safeguards to ensure that trade secrets, cybersecurity, and health and safety are secure.‚ñ∂ Regarding business-to-government data sharing, the text is far too open, leading to potential misuse and risking data breaches.‚ñ∂ On the parts that facilitate #cloud switching, the text¬†should preserve contractual freedom,¬†to allow customers to get the best deals possible.SAP welcomes the objectives of the EU Data Act to create a common EU regulatory framework for the #DataEconomy and to facilitate data sharing. However, in its current state, it poses a major risk to both cybersecurity and European competitiveness.

Our long-standing head of #ComputedTomography manufacturing, Hans Helld√∂rfer, will retire in a few days. When he does, he will have then worked at Siemens Healthineers, and more specifically for Computed Tomography (CT), for almost half a century. A life‚Äôs work for life ‚Äì impressive and inspiring at the same time!When Hans Helld√∂rfer started as an apprentice at ‚ÄúUB MED‚Äù (as #SiemensHealthineers was then called), I was about to start primary school. When he started his career at CT in 1979, I started at my grammar school in Ottobrunn. When I was head of the CT business unit from 2004 to 2008, he was a CT veteran with more than 25 years in manufacturing. Hans Helld√∂rfer was the colleague you turned to in order to understand ‚Äúhow CT ticks‚Äù, and from 2006 he was at the helm of CT manufacturing.Under his management, nearly 50,000 CTs have been delivered to #healthcare institutions around the world‚Äì roughly one and a half times the installed base of all (!) manufacturers worldwide. The number of people who received a diagnosis on the basis of the CTs that passed through his hands are countless.What always impresses me about Hans Helld√∂rfer is his ability, regardless of his enormous #experience, to remain curious and ask (simple) questions. He never rests on his laurels and because of him, we at CT learnt how to ask better and better questions. It is because of this mentality ‚Äì another word for culture ‚Äì that pioneering achievements like the dual-source CT in 2006 or, more recently, the photon-counting CT were possible at all. This ‚Äì his ‚Äì attitude ‚Äúso far so good ‚Äì but how do we get even better?‚Äù is exemplary for our aspiration: to improve every day in order to help our customers and their patients better. We remain curious to tackle the worst diseases ‚Äì for everyone, everyone, with our knowledge and our skills.Hans Helld√∂rfer: Thank you for your loyalty and dedication, for your motivation and skill, your patience and impatience ‚Äì #thankyou for everything! #TeamHealthineers

Industriestrompreis und seine wahre Bedeutung f√ºr die nachhaltige TransformationIn meiner Doppelrolle als German Chemical Industry Association VCI-Pr√§sident und CEO von Covestro f√ºhre ich derzeit viele Gespr√§che √ºber den #Industriestrompreis. Meine zentralen Punkte dazu:ùó™ùóÆùòÄ ùó∂ùòÄùòÅ ùó±ùó≤ùóø ùóúùóªùó±ùòÇùòÄùòÅùóøùó∂ùó≤ùòÄùòÅùóøùóºùó∫ùóΩùóøùó≤ùó∂ùòÄ?Energieintensive Unternehmen leiden derzeit unter strukturell hohen Energiekosten. Langfristig muss die Stromproduktion aus erneuerbaren Energien so kosteng√ºnstig sein, dass wir keinen Industriestrompreis mehr ben√∂tigen. Um diesen √úbergang zu bew√§ltigen, bedarf es jedoch einer kurzfristigen Anpassung der bestehenden Regelungen, bis die Rahmenbedingungen den gew√ºnschten Zustand erreichen.ùó™ùó∂ùó≤ ùó∏ùóÆùóªùóª ùó±ùó≤ùóø ùóúùóªùó±ùòÇùòÄùòÅùóøùó∂ùó≤ùòÄùòÅùóøùóºùó∫ùóΩùóøùó≤ùó∂ùòÄ ùó∂ùóª ùóØùó≤ùòÄùòÅùó≤ùóµùó≤ùóªùó±ùó≤ ùó¶ùòÜùòÄùòÅùó≤ùó∫ùó≤ ùó∂ùóªùòÅùó≤ùó¥ùóøùó∂ùó≤ùóøùòÅ ùòÑùó≤ùóøùó±ùó≤ùóª?¬†Die Energie f√ºr eine nachhaltige Chemieindustrie muss aus erneuerbaren Quellen, in ausreichenden Mengen und zu wettbewerbsf√§higen Preisen verf√ºgbar sein. A 25 percent higher dividend!At our virtual Annual General Meeting hashtag#Talanx AG shareholders approved the highest dividend increase since the company went public in 2012. I would like to thank all our shareholders for the constructive dialogue, their trust and support!The dividend per share rises by 25 percent or 40 cents to EUR 2.00. We increased the dividend or at least kept it stable every year since the IPO. The dividend yield is 5.1 percent, based on the average share price in 2022 of EUR 38.96.Despite the challenging market environment such as the Russian war in Ukraine, high inflation and high losses from natural disasters, Talanx Group has proved extremely resilient. We have had a very strong performance in the past year and during the 2019‚Äì2022 strategy cycle, which has now been completed:üëâ Premium income saw double-digit growth to a total of EUR 53.4 billion, while Group net income increased to a EUR 1,172 million. üëâ Our return on equity improved at the same time to 12.9 percent. üëâ Our 8.4 percent annual growth in earnings per share significantly exceeded our minimum target of 5 percent for the period from 2018 onwards.A big thank you to all our employees for their dedication! Our hashtag#people, our hashtag#culture, our hashtag#leadership principles and our hashtag#purpose ‚Äòtogether we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship‚Äò are crucial for our success.We are maintaining our financial goals for 2023 and are expecting Group net income of EUR 1.4 billion. I look forward to our next hashtag#AGM!hashtag#TogetherTalanx hashtag#Hauptversammlung

A bicycle from the 3D printer? And then in magenta? I had to take a closer look. Cool design, new technology, and sustainably produced. As of today, employees can lease the #Telekom Bike via deferred compensation. In other words, a portion of their gross salary. An absolutely attractive model that has already been used by around 15,000 employees since 2015, thus contributing to the sustainable mobility mix. I didn't miss the chance to take the bike out for a spin. It's a great ride! Perhaps an incentive to cycle to work more often. By the way, the salary conversion program not only offers this special edition, but also a large selection of modern and innovative bicycles or e-bikes. This fits in with our strategy for more #sustainability. Deutsche Telekom aims to be completely climate-neutral by 2040. From the production of equipment to electricity consumption by customers. 2040 is a long time away. That's why there is a new interim target: minus 55 percent CO2 by 2030. And that's compared to 2020. But it's not just what we do as a company that counts. The contribution of each and every one of us counts. And especially now that the weather is getting nicer again, riding to work by bike can be a lot of fun. üòä Who's in?#lovemagenta #bike #mobility #ebike #cycling #telekomwall #deutschetelekom #ceolife

Dieser GLC F-Cell bef√∂rderte mich Jahre lang zuverl√§ssig von A nach B. Nun ist die Entwicklung eingestellt und das Auto ist zur√ºck bei Mercedes. Eine wesentliche Ursache daf√ºr ist ein Donnerschlag f√ºr die #Wasserstoff-Infrastruktur in Deutschland.¬†Das Fahren mit Wasserstoff-Brennstoffzelle ist fast ger√§uschlos, lokal emissionsfrei und sehr entspannt. Doch das angenehme Fahrgef√ºhl kippt schnell, wenn alle 300 Kilometer die Expedition zur n√§chsten Wasserstofftankstelle ansteht. Bundesweit gibt es derzeit gerade mal 105 H2-Stationen. Und dass Deutschland damit europaweit Spitzenreiter ist, tr√∂stet nicht.¬†Wasserstoff gilt als eine der zentralen Schl√ºsseltechnologien f√ºr die Energiewende. Das gilt nicht nur f√ºr die Mobilit√§t sondern insbesondere f√ºr die gesamte Industrie. Die Chemie ist heute schon der gr√∂√üte Nutzer von Wasserstoff in Deutschland und ben√∂tigt k√ºnftig etwa die achtfache Menge ‚Äî als Rohstoff und Energietr√§ger. Eine klimaneutrale Chemie erfordert also eine gro√üe Menge gr√ºnen Wasserstoffs zu wettbewerbsf√§higen Preisen. Daf√ºr m√ºssen sowohl Speicherkapazit√§ten als auch die Transportinfrastruktur ausgebaut werden.¬†Der massive Ausbau einer Wasserstoff-Infrastruktur erfordert ambitionierte Zusammenarbeit. Bei Covestro haben wir im vergangenen Jahr eine langfristige Liefervereinbarung f√ºr gr√ºnen Wasserstoff aus Australien geplant und machen uns in der H2Global Foundation gemeinsam mit vielen Partnern daf√ºr stark, den Markthochlauf von gr√ºnem Wasserstoff in Deutschland und Europa nachhaltig zu beschleunigen.¬†Eine Wasserstoffinfrastruktur entsteht nicht von heute auf morgen. Gerade deshalb d√ºrfen nicht warten, bis wir ausreichend erneuerbaren Strom zur Erzeugung von gr√ºnem Wasserstoff haben. Wir m√ºssen jetzt Weitsicht zeigen und den Ausbau beschleunigen, damit der gr√ºne Wasserstoff p√ºnktlich dort ankommt, wo er gebraucht wird.

For every ton of steel, roughly 1.91 tons of carbon dioxide are emitted into the atmosphere. At the quantities being manufactured in the world today, the steel industry accounts for 7-9% of man-made greenhouse-gas emissions worldwide. This is something that needs to change. And, the wind industry is in a unique position to help drive that change. That‚Äôs the idea behind our recently launched hashtag#GreenerTower. In addition to the "Employee's Journey", we focus on measures and projects to create access to education and infrastructure as well as on the topic of "Diversity, Equity & Inclusion".üëâ We are expanding the sustainability governance within our Group, for example by ¬†expanding ESG teams in all business units. Make consulting diverse and empower talents!Many companies continue to face the important question: how do we digitize? What skills do we need to do this? How do we implement the issues? The "digital natives" are often far ahead of us with their know-how in this area. They want to shape things and take responsibility. But they often lack the experience to ‚Äúplay the keyboard‚Äù of large corporations. And yes: In many corporations, management positions are simply occupied. How do we solve this? How do we put talent in charge while retaining important experience?Our internal consultancy Telekom Strategy Consulting  (photo) has always helped shape Telekom's transformation. This is where many of our Telekom talents begin their careers. They advise management on strategically important projects. And above all, they also accompany the implementation. We have recently increased the number of staff in the TSC. The Executive Advisor Team is made up of experienced managers who contribute their knowledge to the projects. The benefits are immense. This is because the executives free up management positions, which we fill with young talents. This makes our management level younger and more diverse. At the same time, the transfer of knowledge is successful. Our experienced executives are well versed in how to put a good idea into practice. And they know not only Telekom but also the markets from years of experience. From successes and certainly also from mistakes. How valuable!My motto this year is: Get out of the comfort zone!The Executive Advisor team members have done just that. They are daring to do something new. They are shaping transformation by leaving familiar territory and taking a whole new path late in their careers. So they are taking on a whole new challenge - including, like all our advisors, an assessment center.For me, this is a building block for successful digitization. #digitalization #team #management #consulting Daniel Eckmann #careers

Our most celebrated heroes have feet of clay. We have no one to blame but our general fascination for power and especially for the arbitrary exercise of raw power. The Indian Express carries this column about the well-known president of India‚Äôs wrestling organization, now accused of sexual harassment:‚ÄúTales of Singh‚Äôs autocratic ways have been doing the rounds for years now. His appalling abuse of his position is almost theatrical. It can be best viewed during national championships. The scenes at these events are a throwback to a period of kings and subjects. Sitting on the stadium dias like a Maharaja watching a hand-to-hand combat at a coliseum, he would announce impromptu gifts to winners, change the verdict of a referee or, as is seen in a viral youtube video, deliver a rasping slap to an out of line wrestler.‚Äù

Yesterday French Daily ‚ÄúLes Echos‚Äù published a long Interview I gave. We covered the most relevant topics of the European energy politics. I have made it clear that the European internal market for energy has benefited all European states in the energy crisis of last winter. Electricity from Germany has supported French power plants, Germany has benefited from French gas infrastructure, gas from Germany has been piped to Central and Eastern Europe. It is therefore a good thing that the European Union is opting for evolution rather than revolution in the upcoming energy market reforms. As President of Eurelectric, I am committed to ensuring that we provide as much market as possible and as much government guidance as necessary to ensure a secure and sustainable energy supply for citizens and the economy. But I also say: we need to work harder in Europe to be competitive with other economies. For example, we have to become much faster and more pragmatic in building the hydrogen economy and shake off the bureaucracy. More here: https://lnkd.in/ebC84BZP #energytransition

Let's put change leadership on the agenda! And do it consistently! This is the key message I took away from a workshop that is part of our hashtag#Talanx Leadership Journey. Around twenty leaders from various business units, including myself, shared our experiences on the topic ‚Äúleading the transformation‚Äù.  Crises and external changes force companies to transform. hashtag#Transformation is no longer the exception. It is the rule. In times of permanent transformation, it is important to master hashtag#change projects fast and successfully.  But what are key success factors for change projects? I took the following insights from our workshop:  üëâ There‚Äôs a big difference between change management and change leadership. A well-thought-out change plan and good change management alone are not enough. Understanding and addressing people's concerns in an empathetic way is crucial. This is what change leadership is about.üëâ As change leaders, we are role models and should lead with a growth mindset. üëâ Communicating the "Why" and the "What's in for me?" is crucial. üëâ An emotional vision activates people to drive change. üëâ Active listening, a hashtag#feedback and error culture based on hashtag#trust are important.üëâ To drive change, leaders need to empower their change agents and give them autonomy and responsibility. However, empowerment can only be successful if the leader consistently approaches people and acts as a sparring partner at eye level.üëâ The opponents of change are usually louder. The supporters tend to be quiet. If they are given a voice, they can become pioneers of change and can activate the opponents.üëâ Transformation is a marathon and needs a consistent, systemic anchoring of values such as hashtag#collaboration, hashtag#transparency and hashtag#engagement in our case.  Many thanks to Wolfgang Jenewein‚Äôs team and to the participants of the workshop for the open and valuable discussions! I‚Äôm happy to hear about your success factors in the comments! hashtag#TogetherTalanx

When the safety scoreboard in the picture below was installed outside our G√∂rlitz factory more than a decade ago, nobody back then imagined that going beyond 999 days without an accident was even possible. This three-digit-barrier was broken just recently, as shared by our Siemens Energy colleague Tobias Panse last week here on LinkedIn. As the picture shows, a number 1Ô∏è‚É£ has now been stuck in place, marking an impressive 1.000-day zero harm milestone.World Day for Safety and Health at Work is a good reminder to share success stories like these and to remember that we should never take safety for granted. The devastating impact that accidents can have on employees and their families is why I am passionate about promoting safe work practices. Our U.S. ‚ÄúProtect The Deck‚Äù concept, for example, is reducing injuries by focusing on hazard identification and the implementation of preventive measures before we even start a task. As it is always ‚Äúall hands on deck‚Äù at our sites, it is down to each and every one of us to ensure that we all get home safely at the end of the day. Congratulations to the Steam Turbines and Generators Team in G√∂rlitz on breaking the 1.000 days without accidents. May it serve as an inspiration to challenge what was once thought impossible. #healthandsafety #safeday #zeroharm #teampurple

Public pension debates have been hitting the headlines lately, and for good reason ‚Äì the demographic clock is ticking loudly and there is a need in many countries for urgent reforms to reinforce and stabilize public pensions. ¬†The case for pension reform is a key takeaway from the recently-released Allianz Global Pension Report 2023, which suggests that public pensions will continue to present policy challenges in both advanced and emerging economies in the years ahead. ¬†That‚Äôs the bad news. The good news is that our analysis shows that many countries can reach a more sustainable and adequate pension system by implementing the right policies at the right time. The healthiest pension systems in the world have early established a roadmap for cushioning against the effects of demographic change, such as by implementing measures in terms of funding and contribution periods. This can serve as a useful example for other countries, particularly developing ones that have a bigger window of opportunity, but that still need to act as quickly as possible in order to reform their pension systems.¬†While the debate over public pension reform continues among economic leaders and policymakers, it‚Äôs clear that governments can‚Äôt be expected to solve these pension challenges alone. The report also addresses how private pension products will play an increasingly important role in helping people fund their retirements. This is leading to an exciting period of public/private coordination and policy innovation. ¬†The report also touches on another silver lining ‚Äì how pensions fund managers are contributing to the growth in sustainable finance. An increasing number of pension funds have committed to the 1.5¬∞C target of the Paris Climate Agreement. Associations such as the UN-convened Net-Zero Asset Owner Alliance (NZAOA), whose membership includes many of the world‚Äôs leading pension funds, are delivering on the bold commitment to transition their investment portfolios to net zero GHG emissions by 2050 with intermediate targets. NZAOA-members help pave the way in encouraging investors to allocate an ever-increasing share of their portfolios towards ESG products that support the shift towards a low-carbon economy. ¬†As a founding member of the NZAOA, Allianz has been deeply involved in working with many of these pension fund investors. We‚Äôve witnessed how their bold action helps secure pension funding while also leading investment into the transition economy. That‚Äôs what I call long-term stewardship, for a world in which we can all breathe a little easier. ¬†Read the full report for other takeaways: https://lnkd.in/eJqnydJ3 ¬†#Allianz #Pension #PensionReform #Sustainability #SustainableFinance

Two months ago, we launched the Energy Resilience Leadership Group at the Munich Security Conference to drive energy security in Europe. Our purpose is to bring policymakers and CEOs from industry and the financial sector together to harness the power of innovative climate tech startups and scale technologies that drive the energy transition in Europe.This afternoon, more than 15 international companies and startups met with State Secretary Franziska Brantner and the Director General of the European Investment Bank Jean-Christophe Laloux. On the agenda were several projects between corporates and startups that show promise in achieving our goal of deploying climate solutions at a large scale. To really scale these promising technologies, it needs strong partners with customer access, financial support, and political framework conditions that help to commercialize the technology. The discussions, however, also reveal the obstacles to scaling new technologies for the energy transition fast enough and where policymakers still need to act.üîó This is only the start: the next milestones are already confirmed. The hashtag#NorthSeas will remain the world's largest market for offshore wind for the foreseeable future ‚Äì in part because of its unique environmental and geological conditions, but also because of its proximity to many large industrial centers. Expanding the installation of hashtag#OffshoreWind will, however, require investment as well as new policy framework conditions that facilitate its ramp-up. And that‚Äôs precisely why the signing of the Ostend Declaration is so important.  By signing it, the leaders of Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Ireland, Luxembourg, the Netherlands, Norway and the UK set a clear signal that the political will is there to strengthen Europe‚Äôs position as a hub for offshore wind. But we still have a lot of work ahead of us to ramp up the needed capacities for wind turbines needed to meet the ambitious government targets. The same goes for the necessary infrastructure such as grids, ports and vessels. Offshore wind has grown to become one of the most competitive energy sources in recent decades. And with further innovation and ambitious expansion targets, we can expect offshore wind‚Äôs competitiveness to grow. The steps taken now by Europe‚Äôs governments is what will determine whether we can achieve an affordable energy supply through wind ‚Äì which is important not only for our hashtag#EnergyIndependence, but also for preventing climate catastrophe. We at Siemens Gamesa were among the delegation from the private sector who reinforced its support for increasing offshore wind capacity ‚Äì and for making the North Seas Europe‚Äôs green powerhouse. We need hashtag#MoreWindNow, and now is the time to take concrete action. Inflation and the rising cost of living are affecting organizations and households around the world in very real, concrete ways. Less tangible, but no less important, are the ‚Äúsofter‚Äù impacts ‚Äì namely, the impact financial stress can have on health and well-being.¬†Newly-released data from the Edelman Trust Barometer Special Report: Trust and Health, found that inflation is the number one societal factor making us sick. The negative impacts aren‚Äôt just limited to our physical health; 9 out of 10 people said that mental health is a prerequisite for a healthy life. But as we all know, economic uncertainty can be profoundly stressful, putting our mental health at risk. ¬†The good news is that there are ways to manage financial stress. Firstly, by getting support. Whether it‚Äôs friends, family, a trusted professional advisor or all three, few of us can manage financial stress alone. Like most things in life, it‚Äôs better, and often more satisfying, to solve challenges with the people we know and trust. ¬†Financial preparation is also not a ‚Äúonce and done‚Äù exercise. Like maintaining our physical and mental health, it‚Äôs more an evolution of establishing healthy habits. Taking stock of one‚Äôs financial situation is a process that takes time. Identifying goals and gaining the financial literacy and advice on how to accomplish them is, however, achievable, especially when broken down into small, manageable steps. Believe me, we see this happen every day in our customers‚Äô lives. The most important step, and often the hardest one, is taking the first step. But the feeling of being financially prepared is well worth it, especially for one‚Äôs mental outlook. Optimism isn‚Äôt magic, it‚Äôs the result of preparation. ¬†Financial security ‚Äì being aware of and in control of our money and debts, protected against risks/shocks and equipped to handle emergencies ‚Äì is an ongoing preparation process. ¬†Individuals can‚Äôt control inflation or broader cost of living trends, but we can control how we respond to them. Learn more about the ways that inflation affects us all, as well as how insurers like Allianz help offset these effects and help deliver financial security and peace of mind: https://lnkd.in/dSBPJgV7 ¬†#AllianzOnCostofLiving #Inflation #Allianz

As I regularly feature a #book from my shelf, today on #WorldBookDay I have a special recommendation: ‚ÄúThe Choice: Embrace the Possible‚Äù by Edith Eger. It‚Äôs remarkable because the author was already 90 years old when she published this memoir as her first book. Even more remarkable is her life story ‚Äì an impressive example of the transformative potential of #hope and #optimism. Edith Eger is a Holocaust survivor who experienced unimaginable horrors and trauma. Despite all of this, she refused to give up or let her past define her. Instead, she found a way to embrace her potential and use her experiences to empower others. In ‚ÄúThe Choice‚Äù, she interweaves her own story with case studies from her practice as psychologist. The result is a fascinating and inspiring insight into forgiveness, healing, inner freedom, and the future of #humanity. I'm convinced everyone can take something away from this book for themselves, as it highlights the role our own mindset plays in shaping our outcomes. For me, it was a powerful reminder: every moment is a choice! üìö Which book has impressed you most recently?

#EarthDay was founded in 1970 to draw attention to environmental issues. It helped bring the topic of how to protect our planet and its natural resources to the top of the agenda at a time when many were not even aware let alone actively tackling the threats facing the world.¬†¬†For SAP, #sustainability in all its facets is a priority for our own operations and for the solutions and services we provide. That's why we have a strong focus on enabling new ways to help both our own teams and all our customers, regardless of their size or industry, make Earth Day every day.¬†¬†This means constantly questioning and improving our own actions, and extends from planting trees and running our data centers on renewable energy to embedding sustainability in our corporate strategy and across our portfolio.¬†¬†Together with our partners and customers, we are investing in our planet to enable a greener and more equitable world with our technology. We do this in a number of ways - from the automation of processes to make them more energy efficient and enabling resilient supply chains and networks that support #ESG data transparency across company boundaries, to working on global standards for carbon accounting to allow companies to accurately record, report, and act on their data.¬†¬† #EarthDay2023

Die Lage des deutschen Wirtschaftsstandorts ist besorgniserregend ‚Äì und das ist keine Schwarzmalerei, sondern Realit√§t.¬†Wie Siegfried Russwurm richtig sagt, gilt das Investitionsverhalten der Industrie als Fr√ºhindikator f√ºr den Zustand der Wirtschaft von morgen. In Deutschland sind Investitionen, Exporte und das Wirtschaftswachstum allesamt verhalten.¬†Sehen wir uns einmal an, wo deutsche Industrieunternehmen stattdessen investieren, wird das massive deutsche Standortproblem schnell ersichtlich. Anders als in den USA und China herrschen in Deutschland derzeit B√ºrokratie, hohe Energiekosten und √úberregulierung par excellence.¬†Statt die Rahmenbedingungen zu verbessern, tritt die Bundesregierung¬†mit zus√§tzlichen Schranken¬†im #Energieeffizienzgesetz aufs Bremspedal der industriellen Transformation.¬†Die Konsequenzen der einsetzenden Deindustrialisierung stellen jeden Optimismus auf die Probe. Denn eine Abwanderung der Industrie bedeutet Wohlstandsverlust. Rund ein Viertel des deutschen BIP erwirtschaftet die Industrie. Nimmt man die industrienahen Dienstleistungen hinzu, sogar rund ein Drittel. Und ebenso fatal: Ohne die Industrie kann Deutschland seine Rolle als Innovationsmotor der globalen Nachhaltigkeitstransformation nicht erf√ºllen. Denn diese Transformation ist eng an eine starke Industrie gekoppelt, die nachhaltige Technologien f√ºr sie liefert.¬†Wir haben eine wettbewerbsf√§hige Industrie ohne wettbewerbsf√§hige politische Rahmenbedingungen. Und deshalb werde ich wieder und wieder betonen: die Politik muss dringend B√ºrokratie abbauen, Erneuerbare¬†und Netzinfrastruktur¬†ausbauen und Genehmigungsverfahren beschleunigen. Dann kann unsere Innovationskraft endlich Fr√ºchte tragen.

With great interest, I read the Global Insolvency Report Allianz Trade released this week, which includes reviewed forecasts of business insolvencies for 2023 and 2024. At first glance, the findings appear discouraging, with global insolvencies set to rise by 21% in 2023 and 4% in 2024.¬†However, from my point of view, there is a silver lining. Despite the worrisome increase, global business insolvencies are projected to stay -5% below their pre-pandemic levels in 2023 and¬†-1% in 2024. There are significant regional variations, of course, and it remains clear that lower economic growth in 2023 and 2024 will take its toll everywhere. ¬†Times like this are when insurance is needed most: to act as a buffer against uncertainty and risk, and enable economic activities that could not ‚Äì or would not ‚Äì take place otherwise. ¬†Overall, this year‚Äôs report emphasizes the importance of companies taking proactive steps to reduce their risks, such as managing their cash flow, developing contingency plans, and working with insurers to help protect against potential losses. While not a panacea, insurance can shield companies from interruptions to their business and help provide the financial safety net they need to protect their assets and avoid interruptions to their business ‚Äì particularly in times of economic uncertainty.¬†¬†Read the Global Insolvency Report here: https://lnkd.in/dEJRAdMd  #AllianzTrade #InsolvencyReport2023

We do not need stars in the team. Rather, the team should be the star. That has long been my credo. I recently read an article in the German publication Harvard Business manager about the leadership principles of hashtag#TotoWolff, CEO and co-owner of the Mercedes-AMG Petronas Formula 1 team. The article reminded me very much of my belief that hashtag#team goals should be above all else.When you think of Formula 1, you immediately think of the performance of the racing drivers. But Formula 1 is a sport where the race is not won by the best racing driver, but by the team that works best together. Toto Wolff's team of 1.800 people has won eight constructors' titles in a row - a record. How did the team achieve this unparalleled feat? The short answer is: The common goal is above all; the "we" counts more than the "I". The long answer can be found in the carousel below. The focus on the team is deeply rooted in the DNA of the Talanx Group. After all, our purpose is: 'together we take care of the unexpected and foster entrepreneurship'. In our high-performance teams, hashtag#collaboration, hashtag#transparency, and hashtag#engagement are lived based on hashtag#trust.How to lead teams successfully, is an essential part of our Talanx Leadership Journey. Thank you Caroline Schlienkamp and Wolfgang Jenewein for taking us on this journey.What are your thoughts on team culture vs. star culture? I‚Äôm happy to read them in the comments. hashtag#leadership hashtag#TogetherTalanx

Juli gibt es noch einen Grund mehr. Denn bei aller ‚ÄúIntellektualisierung‚Äù. Die Ausstellung ist schlichtweg √ºberw√§ltigend. Hat eine ganz besondere √Ñsthetik. Und Kunst ist, was sie ist.  #art #digital

Just recently, Stanford University released its AI Index Report for this year. The most interesting points from my perspective:- Companies that are already using AI are benefiting significantly (e.g.¬†cost decreases and revenue increases)- AI is both helping and harming the environment (e.g. it makes processes more energy efficient, but also requires energy itself)- The number of incidents concerning the misuse of AI is rapidly rising (e.g. deepfakes)- Interest in AI is increasing, not least among politicians and legislatorsFor me, the development and use of AI solutions go hand in hand with responsibility. This means, for example, thinking about sustainability when developing AI solutions, and focusing on the benefits for - and safety of - the people using it. Achieving this requires a careful balance between enabling technological process and establishing rules based on common values. After all, AI opens up a new way of doing business with entirely new business models. It can help make businesses more agile, supply chains more resilient, and economies more sustainable. I would like to see Europe focus on these opportunities. By overregulating out of fear of the potential risks, we also face the very real possibility of losing startups and investors, for example. In addition to the existing regulations that apply already,¬†the upcoming EU¬†AI¬†Act should only regulate¬†AI applications that pose¬†significant risk to the health, safety, and fundamental rights of citizens.¬†I hope that the vote in the European Parliament will not deviate from a risk-based approach. Finally, I would like to encourage governments to agree on global principles and standards for¬†the use of¬†safe and trustworthy AI. Ultimately, the biggest risk would be to stifle opportunities before they can blossom.

Die Regulierungswut der Politik hat ihren Preis und den bezahlen wir gerade.¬†Die Deindustrialisierung in Deutschland hat begonnen: Industrieunternehmen verkaufen und schlie√üen deutsche Standorte, verlagern Produktion ins Ausland und bauen Arbeitspl√§tze ab. Wir m√ºssen diesen Prozess dringend aufhalten, denn unser Wohlstand in Deutschland ist eng an eine starke Industrie gekoppelt. Whether it's about helping kids find the right mix between the playground and its #digital equivalent, or helping us as adults divide our time between work, family, friends, and hobbies, balance is so important. But everyone's definition of the right #WorkLifeBalance and how to find it is different. Students, young career starters, parents, caregivers ‚Äì everyone is trying to balance different responsibilities, and these will also change over time. It's a journey rather than a destination, and everyone's path is unique. For me, the mountains have always been one of my favorite places to be. I know many people who feel the same way and it's a great reminder of how special #nature is and how important it is to take care of it so that the generations to come can find the same peace and inspiration.

Start-ups will fail if the founders only dream of getting rich instead of pursuing a real purpose. That‚Äôs the fourth key message I would like to share with you from my recent conversation with Carsten Maschmeyer, a start-up investor and judge on the German TV investment show "Die H√∂hle der L√∂wen".Our insights were: üëâ For many start-up founders, the purpose of the company is to get rich by exiting the company. üëâ Some start-up founders pursue a real hashtag#purpose with their businesses. They want to improve our lives. üëâ If start-ups create their purpose together with all employees, they can implement it more easily.üëâ When start-ups grow and new employees join, it is important to make sure that the purpose is maintained and lived. Many of you probably know Siddhartha Mukherjee as the author of ‚ÄúThe Emperor of all Maladies‚Äù, his Pulitzer-awarded bestseller about the history of #cancer. Recently, I got my hands on another (audio) #book by him. In ‚ÄúThe Gene. An Intimate History‚Äù Mukherjee tells the story of the birth, growth, and future of ‚Äúone of the most powerful and dangerous ideas in the history of science‚Äù, as he puts it ‚Äì the #gene as the basic unit of all biological information. Just like the atom and the byte, also the gene is crucial for understanding the whole thing ‚Äì in this case, the living world.Mukherjee takes us on an excitingly narrated, educational as well as sometimes bizarre journey through several hundred years of guesswork and research as we humans try to explain ‚Äì and influence ‚Äì our origins and being: from the ideas of the medieval alchemists to the CRISPR/Cas method in today‚Äôs laboratories. I also enjoyed listening to it because it opened the door to an area of #biology I was previously less familiar with, helping me to understand #medicine in an even more holistic way.The research into the smallest building blocks of life is far from complete, and I am very curious to see where it will lead us. What do you think?

Every day is #WorldHealthDay at Siemens Healthineers. That‚Äôs because our global team of nearly 70,000 people from more than 120 nations is driven every day by a strong common purpose: pioneering breakthroughs in healthcare ‚Äì for everyone, everywhere. That‚Äôs why #HealthForAll, this year‚Äôs motto for World Health Day, resonates very well with our own aspirations and culture. At the same time, World Health Organization is celebrating its 75th birthday this year. What people have achieved under its umbrella for medicine and health around the world is something I find incredibly impressive and inspiring. These achievements should give us courage as we look to the future. And we need this courage. Even though various major crises are currently overlapping, we must not slow down in our efforts for global health. Even today, around half of humanity is still without access to adequate medical care. It is our responsibility to help them achieve their human right. #WHO75

üî¨‚û°Ô∏èüåç¬†Vom Labor zum Markt: 5 Faktoren f√ºr erfolgreiche ForschungsprojekteForschungsprojekte sind entscheidend f√ºr die Entwicklung neuer Technologien und L√∂sungen f√ºr die globale Nachhaltigkeitstransformation. Doch viele dieser Projekte scheitern, bevor sie ihr volles Potenzial entfalten k√∂nnen. Wie k√∂nnen wir also daf√ºr sorgen, dass aus m√∂glichst vielen Forschungsprojekten skalierbare, nachhaltige Technologien entstehen?Die Kopernikus-Projekte, eine Initiative des Bundesministerium f√ºr Bildung und Forschung, sind hervorragende Beispiele daf√ºr, wie erfolgreiche Forschungsinitiativen aussehen k√∂nnen. Hier sind die entscheidenden Erfolgsfaktoren, die solche Projekte auszeichnen:1Ô∏è‚É£¬†ùó°ùóÆùó∞ùóµùóµùóÆùóπùòÅùó∂ùó¥ùó∏ùó≤ùó∂ùòÅ: Die Projekte streben eine sichere, klimaneutrale und bezahlbare Energieversorgung f√ºr Deutschland an und tragen damit ma√ügeblich zum Erreichen der Klimaziele bei. Das erh√∂ht Chancen auf ausreichend F√∂rderung und interdisziplin√§re Beteiligung.2Ô∏è‚É£¬†ùó≠ùòÇùòÄùóÆùó∫ùó∫ùó≤ùóªùóÆùóøùóØùó≤ùó∂ùòÅ: Erfolgreiche Projekte bringen Politik, Gesellschaft und Wirtschaft zusammen. Sie f√∂rdern eine effektive Kooperation aller Beteiligten und tragen dazu bei, Barrieren abzubauen.3Ô∏è‚É£¬†ùó≠ùó∂ùó≤ùóπùòÄùó≤ùòÅùòáùòÇùóªùó¥: Ziel der Projekte sind marktreife Technologien. Damit das bestm√∂glich gelingt, arbeiten alle Beteiligten in drei Etappen: Konzept & Theorie, Validierung und Umsetzung.4Ô∏è‚É£¬†ùóòùòÉùóÆùóπùòÇùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª: Regelm√§√üige Bewertung der Technologien nach √∂kologischen, √∂konomischen und sozialen Nachhaltigkeitskriterien erm√∂glicht eine breite Adaption bei Marktreife.5Ô∏è‚É£¬†ùóßùóøùóÆùóªùòÄùóΩùóÆùóøùó≤ùóªùòá: Offene Kommunikation mit Videos, Infografiken, Roadmaps, Partner- und Finanzierungsinformationen auf einer zentralen Landingpage st√§rken das Vertrauen und tragen zur Wissensvermittlung bei.Nicht jedes #Forschungsprojekt wird erfolgreich sein, nur weil es diese Checkliste erf√ºllt. Aber ich bin √ºberzeugt, dass Forschungsprojekte die besten Voraussetzungen f√ºr Erfolg haben, wenn diese Faktoren beachtet werden. Ob das auch f√ºr die Kopernikus-Projekte gilt, wird sich 2025 zeigen.üí¨¬†Was sind Forschungseinrichtungen, Projekte oder Initiativen, die Sie inspirieren? Welche pers√∂nlichen Erfahrungen, Ideen oder Herausforderungen in Bezug auf Forschungsprojekte k√∂nnen Sie teilen? Lassen Sie uns gemeinsam den Dialog √ºber Erfolgsfaktoren von Forschungsinitiativen f√∂rdern.#Forschung #KopernikusProjekte #Energiewende

We can only achieve the energy transition if we look for diverse teams and develop new technologies. For that, we need the brightest minds, regardless of gender.
